Experience maintaining, updating, monitoring, troubleshooting, and repairing applications and Linux servers would be a plus. Experience working with various data and metadata formats. Awareness of the importance of open source software and FAIR data. Experience working with community-driven open source projects desirable. Good communication and team-working skills. Creativity, willingness to learn and to challenge our current working methods. Higher education (ideally in information technology), or equivalent experience. Conditions of employment Contract duration: 1 year (with the possibility of extension). Working hours: 32-40 hours per week. A salary according to the Collective Labor Agreement of the Dutch Universities, plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%. An excellent pension scheme via the ABP. The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year. Discount with health insurers. Flexible working week. Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget. Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses. Partially paid parental leave Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program. Given the current travel restrictions due to COVID-19 pandemic, prospective employees would be allowed to start their work from the current place of residence, but would be expected to relocate within a year. TU Delft (Delft University of Technology) Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context. At TU Delft we embrace diversity and aim to be as inclusive as possible (see our Code of Conduct). Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. Challenge. Change. Impact! University Corporate Office - TU Delft Library TU Delft Library is the largest technical-scientific library in the Netherlands, a physical and virtual meeting place. The Library helps to find valuable knowledge needed for education and research, and to publish and store the knowledge generated at TU Delft. We believe it is important that knowledge is easily accessible and freely available to everyone. In this way, knowledge can flow freely and TU Delft's knowledge can become valuable to others. The Library is also a place where everyone can study in peace and quiet. This fits in with our inclusive organisation. The Library has chosen three strategic themes to guide its daily activities. 1) Open Science. We make an important contribution to TU Delft's broad strategic programme "Open Science - Research and Education in the Open Era". 2) Visibility and impact. With our expertise and tools in the field of research data management, research intelligence and publishing, we increase the findability, visibility and impact of TU Delft knowledge. 3) Inspiring learning and working environment. Through stimulating programming, we show how freely available and reliable knowledge makes life richer. This makes the Library a place where you can find new ideas and insights. https://www.tudelft.nl/en/library/ Research Data Services The Library's Research Data Services are playing a leading role in promoting high-quality Research Data Management. The team offers comprehensive training for data and code management, policy advice, data management planning, and an online portal with information and guidance. TU Delft's Data Stewardship programme is coordinated by the Library and helps reach out to a wide range of researchers at the university in order to promote good data management practices over a wide range of disciplines. Key to this embedding is effective engagement with researchers across the campus, achieved through the community of Data Champions. 4TU.ResearchData TU Delft is also home to the 4TU.ResearchData. The 4TU.ResearchData is a data archive for research data in science, engineering and design, and it is run by a consortium of three partners: TU Delft, TU Eindhoven and Twente University. The archive stores research data for long-term access, according to the guidelines of the international Data Seal of Approval. Since its inception in 2010, it has collected over 9,200 datasets. All datasets are currently freely available for anyone to download and re-use; any scientist may also upload data. Around 80% of the uploads are from scientists working in the Netherlands. Additional information For more information about this position, please contact Marta Teperek at m.teperek@tudelft.nl. Application procedure To apply, please e-mail your CV (max. 2 pages) along with a letter of motivation (max. 2 pages) by 9 April to Marta Teperek, email: po.ud@tudelft.nl. Please ensure that your documents are in English. When applying for this position, please refer to vacancy number TUD00925. A pre-employment screening can be part of the application procedure. FACULTY/DEPARTMENT University Corporate Office – TU Delft Library JOB TYPE IT SCIENTIFIC FIELD not applicable HOURS PER WEEK 32-40 SALARY € 3.746,00 - € 5.127,00 DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION Higher professional education VACANCY NUMBER TUD00925

title: DATA SCIENTIST BIOINFORMATICS
summary:
As a data scientist bioinformatics you will:
In this position, you will apply your expertise in bioinformatics, machine learning, quantitative data analysis and…
description: In this position, you will apply your expertise in bioinformatics, machine learning, quantitative data analysis and leadership to develop innovative data science solutions across multiple therapeutic areas in clinical drug development, thereby thinking along in various applications of bioinformatics and data analysis tools in our in our focus areas of food safety, fermentation, protein transition and the human microbiome. To achieve this, you will scout new technologies/methods and work in a highly multidisciplinary environment with world leading clinicians, data scientists, biological experts, statisticians and IT professionals. We’d love to hear from you.  | YOUR CHALLENGES?  In this position, you will apply your expertise in bioinformatics, machine learning, quantitative data analysis and leadership to develop innovative data science solutions across multiple therapeutic areas in clinical drug development. In addition, you have a potential to collaborate with experts across diverse scientific disciplines thereby thinking along in various applications of bioinformatics and data analysis tools in our in our focus areas of food safety, fermentation, protein transition and the human microbiome. Your knowledge and input will be applied for development of new algorithms and visualizations, configuration and optimization of the data pipeline. To achieve this, you will scout new technologies/methods and work in a highly multidisciplinary environment with world leading clinicians, data scientists, biological experts, statisticians and IT professionals. As a data scientist bioinformatics you will: Develop, implement and support novel bioinformatics solutions designed to drive the interrogation of human disease biology. This includes data from signal pathway analysis, cellular characterization, integrated multi-omics technologies, and other systems biologymethods for biomarker and target discovery. Researching and developing machine learning models, forecasting and optimization methods on multi-modal data to guide decision-making about and resourcing of our drug projects. Perform expert scientific research, including establishment of scientific hypothesis that can be approached using computational methods and tools. Present or publish findings for conferences and in peer reviewed journals. Build and manage effective relationships with stakeholders to insure utilization and value of information resources and services. | WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU? You have a PhD degree in Bioinformatics, or MSc degree Bioinformatics with 4+ years of working experience within the industry. Advanced software development skills in at least one of the standard data science languages (such as R, Julia or Python) and familiarity with database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, graph), and are able to use and set up NGS pipelines Comfortable working in high performance computing or cloud environment Experience of manipulating and analysing large high dimensionality unstructured biomedical datasets, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders Demonstrated scientific knowledge of cell biology, molecular biology, immunology, or biochemistry, especially as it relates to translational science research and development Excellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills A passion to apply machine learning to solve difficult problems in drug development | WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC? TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world. At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career. As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture. | WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP? We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars: You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Is TMC a perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you. Feel Free to Contact Bram Thelen Director Data Science | Nanotechnology | Physics, Netherlands Tel: +31 (0)6 52 89 25 70

title: Data Scientist & Engineer
summary:
Manage data and meta data.
We are therefore specifically looking for a strong data scientist with engineering and consultancy skills.
On top of that, we offer:
description: Job Description: Data Scientist & Engineer Are you visionary, always hacking to craft advanced software or analytics? Are you eager to learn new languages, tools and paradigms to reach your goal? Or better: do you like to innovate? About the role Our consultancy activities are growing rapidly. We are therefore specifically looking for a strong data scientist with engineering and consultancy skills. A creative hero with a firm basis in computer science / artificial intelligence / math / neuroscience. At Orikami you work with other highly qualified specialists on solutions for complex healthcare issues. This can be in house for our own portfolio orfor clients. In the consultancy team you are an architect who is able to integrate data sources and set up robust data pipelines. You think about how much impact your data engineering delivers to this world. Your affinity with healthcare helps you to develop tools to make healthcare better, from collecting data, analyzing and recognizing patterns, to the translation into information and insights. As a Data Scientist & Engineer at Orikami you help clients to sketch a vision for how data analytics can be productized andhow this improves the patient’s care path. Your knowledge and creativity form the basis for our clients’ change processes. Your familiarity with project management supports our clients and orikami to deliver our engagements according to plan. Responsibilities You are responsible for: Preparing, sanitizing and standardizing datasets Performing exploratory analysis Developing algorithms based on statistics and/or machine learning, Deploying the algorithm, analysis and report in the cloud. Working methodologically, documenting your science-based decisions Setting up, maintaining and testing data pipelines Manage data and meta data Algorithm deployment Delivering high quality, well tested software and validated methods; you should be able to prove the quality of your work Communication with all involved parties, identifying project goals and managing expectations Presenting results and organizing commercial follow up Improving teamwork and efficiency in delivering goals About Orikami Orikami is a Dutch MedTech organization specialized in applied data science and development and implementation of digital biomarkers to enable personalized healthcare for people with chronic diseases. With a team of data scientists and researchers we are on a mission to improve 100 million lives before 2030 by access to personalized healthcare. We believe health data is underutilized. We use real world patient data to enable personalized healthcare paths for our clients to improve outcomes, quality of life and affordable healthcare. Therefore we develop digital biomarkers. Digital biomarkers are defined as objective, quantifiable physiological and behavioural data that are collected and measured by means of digital devices such as portables, wearables, implantables or digestibles. The collected data is typically used to monitor, explain, influence and/or predict health-related outcomes. Advanced analytics, machine learning, artificial intelligence: developments in the field of decision-making based on data analysis are moving fast. Data in healthcare matters! Profile and background Firstly, we think it is very important that you fit well into our team. Your motivation shows that you have a curious attitude, you are authentic, believe in craftsmanship and dare to think differently with your vision on data science in the healthcare sector. You also have the ability to quickly analyze complex issues and generate new, sharp insights and solutions. Although you already have the necessary experience, you never stop learning. You are also experienced in working in a team and you do not hesitate to take initiative. What else will you bring? We would like you to have experience with some of the following tools or languages: Machine learning Statistical analysis Scientific programming: Python Databases: SQL, MongoDB, etc Cloud Deployment Fundamentals are a pre (Docker , Kubernetes) Furthermore we want you to: Be curious, analytical higher education or university degree in data science/computer science or related field Be entrepreneurial, creative and positive Be communicative and a great teammate Be responsible for quality and deliver sustainable solutions Be commercial and customer focussed Affinity with healthcare, e-health m-health or medical devices >2 years of experience in a related function Our offer Among highly skilled colleagues, you are welcome in our ambitious and innovative working place. On top of that, we offer: Market-conform salary with attractive bonus scheme 25 vacation days with full-time employment Excellent training and development opportunities with dedicated learning time Freedom to organize your work according to your own wishes and needs Good work / life balance and the ability to work 80% Mobility budget Stock programme, SAR Attractive collective pension scheme An inspiring and stimulating work environment with enthusiastic and committed colleagues, with plenty of room for informal activities How to apply Are you motivated to work with us? We would like to meet you! Send your application to Marianne Mathijssen, HR manager before 1-3-2021 with motivation and CV. For more information you can reach us on +31 (0)24-301 0100 or visit our webpage www.orikami.nl Job Types: Full-time, Contract Experience: engineering: 5 years (Preferred) Language: Nederlands (Required) COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

title: Data Scientist
summary: Dit (agile) team bestaat uit mix van data engineers, data scientists en informatie-analisten en werkt nauw samen met diverse business-vertegenwoordigers.
description: Senior Data Scientist (ZZP is niet mogelijk) FREELANCE Schiphol Senior ongeveer 6 uur geleden 40 uur per week 6 months+ Startdatum op 31 maart DATA Voor deze specifieke opdracht zoeken we een senior data scientist die opdrachten in en met het team uitvoert maar ook het team coacht in hun ontwikkeling op het gebied van machine learning.  Kennis  Brede kennis van data science (on)mogelijkheden Kennis van optimalisatie-technieken Zeer goede communicatieve eigenschappen (Nederlands is een vereiste) Uitstekende coachings-vaardigheden Brede technische kennis en ervaring, met name Python en Azure  KLM bestaat uit meerdere bedrijfsonderdelen met elk zijn eigen team(s) op het gebied van Data Science en Operations Research. Het grootste deel van de mensen in die teams wordt geleverd door de centrale afdeling Operations Research en AI. Voor het team bij het bedrijfsonderdeel Engineering en Maintenance zoeken we momenteel extra versterking.  Dit (agile) team bestaat uit mix van data engineers, data scientists en informatie-analisten en werkt nauw samen met diverse business-vertegenwoordigers. Het team werkt enerzijds aan data science projecten op het gebied van predictive maintenance en health monitoring en anderszijds aan projecten op het gebied van optimalisatie van de onderhoudsplanning.  Screening Om de betrouwbaarheid en integriteit van kandidaten te toetsen is screening onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. Voor vragen over de screeningprocedure kunt u contact opnemen met de vermelde contactpersoon bij de betreffende vacature of interim opdracht.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
But how can you really create tangible business impact with data?
Who can create insights from huge amounts of data using advanced analytical techniques.
description: With the amount of data growing at an exponential rate, AI is one of the hottest fields of this century. Do you want to be part of this exciting field and start your career as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer? Find out what MIcompany has to offer and become a leader in AI! Everybody is talking about Big Data & AI. The overwhelming quantity and complexity of data offers a huge challenge for Data Scientists and Data Engineers. But how can you really create tangible business impact with data? To do that, a new kind of leader is needed. A leader who is on top of the newest technologies and knows how to manage complex datasets. Who can create insights from huge amounts of data using advanced analytical techniques. A leader who can define growth opportunities and has a vision on Data and AI. A leader who builds relationships and combines these skills to create impact at scale.  BECOME A LEADER IN AI Learn to create lasting breakthroughs on an international scale  Create LASTING IMPACT with AI at the strategic core of industry leaders At MIcompany you work at the strategic core of our clients. You contribute to the development of algorithmic applications that transform high impact business processes.  Learn how to change organizations using AI models in our CERTIFIED PROGRAM In our MIacademy program you learn about the newest AI techniques and how to implement them in practice. And you learn how to change organizations using AI. Our education is certified by GAIn (Global Artificial Intelligence network).  Work all over the world in a multidisciplinary and AMBITIOUS TEAM of beta talent At MIcompany you will work in an environment where you can develop yourself optimally due to a multidisciplinary team of ambitious beta talent, focus on personal development and lots of international opportunities.  Become part of a company investing in PURPOSEFUL BREAKTHROUGHS At MIcompany we invest in diversity & doing good. We believe that our experience and skills can contribute in fields like DNA, cultural sector and charities.    Who are we looking for? We are constantly looking for young analytical talent who recognize themselves in the following profile: Recently graduated (MSc) with excellent results, in Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field. Analytical, curious, and ambitious. Result-driven, pragmatic and persuasive. A passion for solving complex business challenges using advanced analytics on large amounts of data. The drive to contribute to innovative data analytics projects in a company where Data Analytics is a board priority. Focussed on personal development and eager to learn. Are you the analytical talent we are looking for? Apply now!

title: Medior Data Scientist
summary:
That you inspire the data scientist community to go where it has not gone before.
You as a data scientist will thereby be part of many different projects from…
description: Imagine… that you inspire the data scientist community to go where it has not gone before. Imagine you enable Rabobank to understand the new era of artificial intelligence and machine learning. As a medior Data Scientist, you can make the difference for Rabobank to become the large Fintech of the future.  Making a difference Fulfill a broad role in developing analytical transformation of Rabobank Be the analytical consultant and sparring partner on data science for the business Apply advanced techniques on a multitude of projects throughout Rabobank Develop and apply innovative models to assess the risk of our clients Continuously develop yourself in the area of data science and the broad spectrum of analytics With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Advanced Analytics connects data scientists across Rabobank and our subsidiaries to solve business challenges with new and innovative ways of working. We make risk-based models based on machine learning techniques for various business purposes. We are continuously looking to broaden our knowledge and look beyond the beaten path. We dare to challenge and are committed to contributing to a better Rabobank.  As Advanced Analytics, we inspire other departments to use the latest technologies within the field of data science (e.g. machine learning, big data, neural networks, natural language processing), while at the same time looking for optimal deployment of these models. We identify problems the business is facing and solve those with the best possible tools at our disposal. Our team works in an agile way, meaning that we deliver models in a short period of time. You as a data scientist will thereby be part of many different projects from start to end. These projects are throughout different departments within Rabobank, further broadening your knowledge about the different departments and your network within Rabobank.  We are looking for team players, with passion and energy. We look for somebody that fits our team and is up for a challenge. We don’t mind age and years of experience; you have talent and you get the point that seniority in data science is not relevant. You just have an open mind, continuously learn (fast), and want to get the job done. Our team is ready to welcome you onboard. We would love to hear your story!  Hao, Data Scientist “I got a lot of opportunities to grow my skills and enough trust to show my talents to the team. I have to mention, one of the best things about our team is: we work as a group of friends!” Ruben, Data Scientist “Great team, where I have the opportunity to work on innovative projects with people that help you get the most out of yourself!” With you We are looking for enthusiastic team members who are passionate about data science, dare to challenge the status quo, and inspire by driving change. Consider applying if you recognize yourself in the following skills: You love data science and you are eager to even learn more of it. You have proven experience in Python, SQL, and Git. Pyspark or Hive is a plus. You have a relevant Master’s degree and know how to solve complex puzzles. You are familiar with Azure Dev Ops, you are able to structure projects and your coding is without a doubt of high-quality standards. You are able to take team members to the next level. You operate as a self-starter, you work independently and you pro-actively look for solutions. You are not set back by internal and/or external guidelines, show determination, and take ownership to get the work done. You are well aware of your interpersonal skill set, your strengths, and your weaknesses. You are prepared to be challenged by our team and other stakeholders. In return, we expect you to do the same. You show style flexibility to adjust to different situations to reach your goals. You make data science understandable to the business and are a trusted advisor in terms of data analytics. You are fluent in English and Dutch (speaking, listening, and writing), your messages are to the point, simple, and conveying. Growing a better world together Our team actively contributes to the Rabobank Foundation and we help our partner banks across the world with our analytical expertise. But we realize as well that growing a better world together also starts with ourselves and making sure everyone feels ok. We actively monitor energy levels, have virtual knowledge sessions, and come together daily to free up our minds and do exercises. How do you see this mission translated into your daily work? Interested? We would love to hear your story! We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well. In addition, with us (based on a 36-hour working week), you can also expect: a gross yearly salary between 44.568 EUR and 63.655 EUR (scale 9), depending on your seniority a thirteenth month and holiday pay an Employee Benefit Budget of 10 percent. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash payout a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3.5%  Sounds like you? Let's meet. Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join our team as a medior Data Scientist and to make a difference to yourself, to our customers, and to society?  Then send us the following: Your CV in English highlighting your most relevant experience A write-up explaining who you are and why you are interested in the position/Rabobank Examples of your work (e.g. GitHub) We look forward to receiving your application. Good to know: Apply via the button “Apply now”. Responses will be handled in accordance with our vacancy management policy Hila Leupen-Turabaz, Recruiter would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl The application process includes a technical challenge. Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link; We want to use your talent in the broadest sense and would like to look at your response more broadly than this vacancy. Your profile will be included in the Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. If you object to this, you can indicate this by e-mail at data.analytics@rabobank.nl. The application process includes screening and reference checks. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether the new staff is reliable enough to work at Rabobank. Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Data Scientist - Finance Tech
summary:
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics and programming.
Transform large, complex data sets into pragmatic, actionable insights.
description: Booking is looking for the Data Scientist to lead the development of the next generation of data science solutions for our Finance Tech. Booking.com is the world’s leading accommodation site but boasts a small, start-up feel. Our vision is to provide the best accommodations at the best prices for all our travellers, no matter what their travel purpose or budget may be. With over 1 million room nights booked every day in over 1 million accommodations worldwide, our mission is to make travel, experience, and exploration accessible for everyone, everywhere. As our business is constantly growing, we are looking for product managers to join our team, impact our users on a daily basis and take our product to the next level. Partnering with internal stakeholders, this exciting and challenging role will provide opportunities to leverage the fields of machine learning, experimental design, and business analysis to build world class finance products and solutions for our accommodation partners. B.responsible Transform large, complex data sets into pragmatic, actionable insights Utilize ML and other statistical techniques to gain insights and develop actionable analytics Design tests for determining product value Develop key metrics for our finance products Have the capacity to enter a new area, own the quality of the data and work with product managers to develop the analytics backlog Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data and a business partner to decision makers, product managers and team leaders B.skilled Minimum 3 years of experience in a relevant role Experience solving real problems using predictive analytics with machine learning or other statistical modeling techniques Experience in supervised and unsupervised learning Experience in experimental design Experience in most parts of the Data Science product development life cycle (e.g. from problem identification to stakeholder approval/sign-off) Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics and programming. Strong working knowledge of Python, SQL, and/or R. Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders Strong commercial awareness and past experience as a developer are huge plus points Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (economics, computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, bioinformatics, etc.) B.offered We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. IT also has regular hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences. This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Passion for working with different data sets and bringing them together to solve business problems.
Understand the business reality underneath data & metrics,…
description: Job Title Data Scientist Job Description Your challenge  Amazon is quickly disrupting the retail business. It becomes increasingly challenging to navigate through myriads of business metrics and make decisions at required pace. Predictive/Prescriptive analytics and automation becomes crucial for Vendors to stay competitive on the platform and drive sustainable sales growth. The Global Amazon team at Philips is looking to hire a dedicated Data Scientist to enhance our analytics E2E value chain through building predictive/prescriptive analytics capabilities. The core remit of this role is to translate ambiguous business questions and concerns into specific quantitative questions, specify data requirements and use sound methodologies to deliver actionable insights and foresights. Your responsibilities Understand the business reality underneath data & metrics, and develop meaningful solutions comprising of analytics as well as business management Refine customer requirements into problem definitions and objectives Extract data from various sources, bring them together, and construct simple or complex analyses as required to solve the business problem Innovate by adapting new modeling techniques and procedures Communicate the analysis results to business teams in non-technical language Collaborate with EIM team (Enterprise Information Management) to translate successful prototypes into re-usable predictive and prescriptive solutions, and scale across markets and businesses Avoid bringing unnecessary complexity to the system, meaning don’t use bazooka to kill a rat Your team this role sits within the Amazon Global team at Philips Domestic Appliances, and report to Amazon Analytics Lead. The role interacts internally with business stakeholders and analytics experts. We are looking for someone with Passion for working with different data sets and bringing them together to solve business problems. Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science or Economics 4+ years' of experience with scripting languages (e.g. Python, R) and data querying languages (e.g. SQL). Working knowledge of Azure is a plus. Good working knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Pivot, Lookups, match-index etc.) 4+ years’ of hands-on experience with multiple data science methodologies to solve complex business problems (e.g. statistical analysis, machine learning techniques etc.) [Preferred] Previous experience in Data Scientist role with a retail or e-commerce company. Knowledge of Amazon Brand Analytics datasets is a plus. Good written & verbal communication skills to convey rigorous mathematical concepts to non-experts. Job grade and location Grade 60 in Amsterdam Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

title: Sr. Data Scientist - Media Analytics
summary:
Passionate about data analytics and econometric modelling?
Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation.
Sr. Data Scientist - Media Analytics - 76442.
description: Sr. Data Scientist - Media Analytics - 76442 Analytics - Netherlands Rotterdam, South Holland  Passionate about data analytics and econometric modelling? Join our team!  You work in (small) teams on challenging modeling projects using a great variety of exciting analytical skills and tools. Our clients are big well-known companies from around the world operating in many markets. You help them understand the effect of their marketing efforts and what they can do to improve this. You are equipped with knowledge and expertise in the field of quantitative techniques such as econometric modeling and simulation. You will apply your developed methods and models to different challenges in the field of media & marketing, such as the allocation of advertising budgets or campaign effectiveness analysis.  You comprehend complex problems quickly, are creative in finding solutions and you are results-oriented. You are part of a diverse team that consists of people with similar quantitative backgrounds, and experts from the concerning work field. Being part of Nielsen, you will be able to work with major clients from all around the globe and have access to huge amounts of data.  YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES Processing, analyzing and modeling data from various sources within a small project team working towards a client delivery Making decisions about data, methodology, and modeling within a project to ensure the quality of the outcomes, and discuss progress and issues with the project lead Instructing more junior project members in their tasks, and reviewing their work. Taking the (technical) lead of project teams. Initiating technical improvements of existing solutions, and contributing to the development of new analytical product offerings for (future) clients in the field of media.   YOUR PROFILE Master’s degree with an emphasis on analytics & statistics such as Econometrics, (Technical/Applied) Mathematics or a related study; 3-6 years of experience; Excellent understanding of statistics and econometric modeling; Strong communication and presentation skills, with a keen eye for detail; Strong technical skills, extensive coding experience, preferably Python; Experience with taking the technical lead in projects Knowledge of probabilistic programming or Bayesian modelling techniques is a plus; Experience with coaching and/or people management is a plus Interested in the media landscape and quantitative marketing; Good understanding of the English language, both verbally and in writing. Residing in The Netherlands or willing to relocate. #LI-MJ1 ABOUT NIELSEN We’re in tune with what the world is watching, buying, and everything in between. If you can think of it, we’re measuring it. We sift through the small stuff and piece together big pictures to provide a comprehensive understanding of what’s happening now and what’s coming next for our clients. Today’s data is tomorrow’s marketplace revelation. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 100 countries. From global industry leaders to small businesses, consumer goods to media companies, we work with them all. We’re bringing in data 24/7 and the possibilities are endless. See what’s next with us at Nielsen: careers.nielsen.com Job Type: Regular Primary Location: Rotterdam,South Holland Secondary Locations: , , , Travel: No

title: Lead Data Scientist at Transavia
summary: You have demonstrable knowledge of data science and you can stimulate craftmanship among data scientist and data analyst colleagues.
description: Come and work at Transavia and join us as a Lead Data Scientist At Transavia, we are looking for a Lead Data Scientist within our Strategy, Data & Intelligence department. Can you ensure the continued high performance development of our team? Do you also share our key values, namely friendliness, responsibility, enthusiasm and decisiveness? If so, you may well be the Lead Data Scientist we are looking for.  The central Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team is responsible for the strategy (development), leads the transformation to become more data driven, supports all departments with information and insights and develops data, business intelligence, machine learning and operations research tools for Transavia customers and employees. SDI develops information products for every department of Transavia e.g. flight operations, network planning, marketing, revenue management and sales.  The new SDI team is founded in 2020 as part of our journey to take Transavia to the next level in Data & Analytics, which offers you the chance to take a leading role in this transformation. Do you have the experience to further improve the way of working of our growing team? Do you want to be part of this journey and guide and challenge the team towards continuous delivery of state-of-the-art analytics?  What will be your responsibility? In your role as a Lead Data Scientist, you will ensure the continuous improvement of the analytics way of working and best practices. You will be the tech-sidekick of the lead of the team and the ambassador for the analytical quality of our data and analytics solutions. You will guide and support Data Scientist and Data Analyst colleagues in developing data and machine learning solutions. You will contribute to the development and execution of the Transavia Data & AI strategy.  You will be part of the Strategy, Data and Intelligence (SDI) team, consisting of the SDI Lead, Lead Data Engineer, Analytics Translators, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Business Consultants. You will maintain close contact with the team members and our colleagues from Transavia France. In this position you will report to the SDI lead.  Who are you? To start with, you have a higher education or academic level of working and thinking. You have 5-7 years of relevant work experience in a data science position and therefore thorough knowledge from both theory and practice on many data science areas like advanced analytics, simulation, machine learning, operations research, statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation etc. You have demonstrable knowledge of data science and you can stimulate craftmanship among data scientist and data analyst colleagues. You want to continuously improve your knowledge level and skill set in the field of/regarding data science. You get energy from leading, guiding and coaching people and organisations. You are able to make the AI solutions relatable and relevant for the business You are ‘versatile’, i.e. constantly open to change. This is necessary to ensure we become continuously better at what we do and evolve along with the continuously changing world around us. Having worked as a lead data scientist in a medium sized team is a huge plus. Fluent in both Dutch and English.  What can you expect from us? First of all, a nice place to work at Schiphol Oost (but now from home); The responsibility to shape your job as you see fit; Plenty of scope for personal development; Flexible working hours; Friendly and enthusiastic colleagues; Last but not least, if you are an avid flyer in your free time, our ISA scheme (excellent fares if seats are available) is absolutely for you! Based on knowledge and experience we make you an offer between € 4468,43 and € 7546,30 gross per month, based on a fulltime employment.  About Transavia Our motto is: "We make low cost feel good". We happily go the extra mile for our passengers and for each other. The atmosphere in our organisation is characterised by our passionate staff with a ‘green’ heart! Every day we work as a team to achieve a common goal: a memorable customer experience.  As an independent airline within the Air France-KLM Group, we have been operating scheduled and charter flights to more than 100 destinations, primarily in Europe and North Africa, for the past 50 years. There are about 2,500 colleagues working at Transavia: 230 in Technical Services, 600 pilots, 1,300 cabin attendants and 370 office staff.  Transavia is a dynamic organisation (never a dull moment) that continuously evolves with the changing world of aviation. Would you like to work in an environment with enthusiastic, decisive colleagues who look out for each other? Do change and innovation give you a boost of energy and do you feel right at home in an environment where you can manage your own work? Then we would like to hear from you.  Want to apply? Are you the Lead Data Scientist we are looking for and who can further enhance the power of our team? If so, apply via the button below. Any questions about this opportunity? You can contact us via recruitment@transavia.com  Your job application procedure You apply! We will assess your application within two weeks and let you know whether you will be invited for an interview. First contact: We will call you to get acquainted and to schedule an appointment. The first (digital) interview: There will be an initial interview with a leader and a team member. Is there a match? Then this is followed by an assessment consisting of a homework assignment, a presentation of your results and a technical interview. Is the match complete? Then we will plan a final interview and after that we will gladly make you an offer and your journey at Transavia can begin! You will need to go through a screening procedure first for (aviation) security requirements. Acquisition for this vacancy is not welcomed! A background check is included in the procedure.

title: Junior Data Science
summary: We connect software/data engineers, cloud engineers, and data scientists with the most interesting data-driven companies in the Netherlands.
description: Data Scientist (includes a one-year advanced-training program)  Are you ready to accelerate your data science career? Xccelerated combines advanced, hands-on training with real-world work at one of our partner companies—like Heineken, Randstad Group, Vattenfall, or Pathé. After our 13-month program, you have the opportunity to join the company directly.  Who are we? We are Xccelerated, a proud part of Xebia Group. We prepare professionals (with a minimum of one-year relevant work experience) to become authorities in their fields. We connect software/data engineers, cloud engineers, and data scientists with the most interesting data-driven companies in the Netherlands. We provide the opportunity to develop your skills further through challenging, real-world work experience and advanced, hands-on training.     Who are you? Are you a data scientist with at least one year of relevant work experience and do you know statistics and possess the programming skills to build machine learning models? Then you’ve already got a fantastic foundation for developing further and future-proofing your career.  If you have: A relevant master’s degree (e.g. artificial intelligence, business analytics, econometrics); One-year-minimum work experience as a data scientist at a company The willingness to learn and interest in working at one of our partner companies A passion for programming, preferably in Python.  Then let’s talk!  What’s the program like? The Xccelerated program kicks off with a month-long, full-time bootcamp training. Here, we focus on writing deployable code, version control, continuous integration, working with Docker and cloud computing, A/B testing, deploying model artefacts, and monitoring your models in production. Some topics may sound familiar, but we’ll go more in depth into principles and best practices to prepare you for the next step in your career.  After the bootcamp, you’ll spend a full year working on-site four days a week at one of our partner companies and returning one day a week to our Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. During these “return” days, you split your time between theory and practice—gaining project guidance and coaching from our supervising consultants to support you in the partner company’s projects, while also diving deeper into training topics not covered in the bootcamp. It’s always about continuous learning. Besides the technical aspect, we’ll focus on your personal development as well.  Interested? Great! We’d love to meet you! Please get in touch! Contact Jessie Loogman at jloogman@xccelerated.io or by phone at +31650999663.Our next Cloud engineer group starts in August 2021!  https://www.xccelerated.io

title: Data Scientist, Hailables
summary:
5+ years of industry experience working as a data scientist or similar.
Build intelligent data-driven products to provide the best user experience.
description: About the Role The Hailables team is dedicated to expanding Uber's business into a variety of exciting new markets where bringing Uber's technological advancements to "street-hail" (think standard Taxi) vehicles is the core feature of the marketplace. In major markets such as South Korea, Japan, and others this new hybrid model is the primary mode of operation for Uber, so this is a major growth bet of the company that depends on our ability to identify opportunities, build products, and iterate quickly to grow as effectively as we can. As a Data Scientist on this team, you'll be a key leader in using data to understand the complexities of each of our unique Hailables marketplaces, designing and developing algorithms and product features the improve the customer experience, and running high fidelity experiments to close the loop on new launches. What You'll Do Develop creative solutions and build prototypes to business problems using algorithms based on machine learning, statistics, and optimization, and work with engineering/product to productionize those algorithms and create impact in production. Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches. Propose and guide the framework of data analysis to drive business insight and facilitate decisions. Establish standard methodologies for data science including modeling, coding, analytics, and experimentation. Leverage data to understand product performance and to identify improvement opportunities Design product experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and impactful conclusions Communicate with senior management and multi-functional teams Provide recommendations to assist quick product ideation and feature launch decisions. Build intelligent data-driven products to provide the best user experience What You'll Need Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in, Statistics, Economics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Computer Science or other quantitative field. (If M.S. degree, a minimum of 1+ years of industry experience required and if Bachelor's degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience required) Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of statistics, machine learning, optimization, economics, and analytics Knowledge of experimental design and analysis Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development Ability to use a language like Python or R to work efficiently at scale with large data sets Proficiency in languages and tools like SQL, Hive, and Spark 5+ years of industry experience working as a data scientist or similar Tech lead experience is a plus Experience with productionizing algorithms for real-time systems Proficiency in Java, Scala, or Go Advanced experience in experimental design and analysis (e.g., A/B and market-level experiments), as well as causal inference At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

title: Lead Data Scientist
summary:
Now that’s interesting data!
How can we balance preprocessing of our video footage and data storage in the Cloud?
At MCA, our employees are our strength.
description: We are an international player in the engineering and technology consulting. With our expertise and experience of more than 30 years, we have quickly become a recognized and particularly appreciated partner by the largest French and international companies. At MCA, our employees are our strength. We are committed to supporting them throughout their career within the company: their fulfilment is our priority. Your Missions As a Lead Data Science & Analytics you are responsible to get insights from 30,000 active data systems, of which 90% are available in real time. Now that’s interesting data! In this position you will guide the data science & analytics team in our mission to create the automated and sustainable solutions for the future. As a Chapter lead you will face a big variety of meaningful challenges. You can think of following challenges: How we can make an autonomous feeding robot become more sustainable? Can we predict and optimize the influence of certain types of nutrition on milk quality? How do we set up a predictive maintenance closed loop? What is the best way to support the growth of competences of our Data Scientist? How can we balance preprocessing of our video footage and data storage in the Cloud? How can we scale and maintain our growing number of ML solutions? Apart from creating a pragmatic vision and a practical roadmap, it is your task to develop the best performing team possible. To make this happen: you lead by example, but also coach, inspire and develop your team members! Organized in a chapter and working in a Product organization, the Data Scientist and Data Analyst work on many different projects with other disciplines, including (embedded) software and mechanical engineering. Your scope is both the Data Analyst & Scientist in HQ and the work done by our partners like a dedicated Data & AI company in Prague. This partner allows us to tap in a highly trusted and top-level Data & AI group to back you up. Together with Data Analytics and Data Engineering you are part of the Data & AI Competence group. Lead, grow and develop the Data Science & Analytics teams (>16-20 specialists). End responsible for the Analytics & Science solutions. Give direction and provide input for the integrated Product roadmap. Assess and monitor project goals, architecture and setup on all projects. Build strong relationship with our partners & investigate new worldwide partnerships. Hands on coaching on DS projects & tuning the Way of Working. Keep evolving our Data & AI infrastructure (together with Data Engineering). You have experience as a Data Science lead and you know what is out there. But you would like to make a real difference and build on a shared dream in a strong innovative and family culture company which huge potential. Your profile Proven (methodological & people) leadership experience. Entrepreneurial mindset. Analytical thinking, critical mindset and results-oriented way of working; 5+ years of experience with data analysis / science and machine learning in industry; Able to switch between long term strategic thinking and short term result focus. A Quantitative background with a Master’s degree in fields such as: Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Informatics. Good communication and strong coaching skills. Programming skills and proficiency in the Python data science stack. pandas, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, scikit-learn etc. Experience with relevant modern software engineering tools and practices (Git, Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD, Cloud etc.) and general ‘technical’ affinity (can ‘think along’ with data engineering and software engineering leadership). Experience with Agile WoW. and would be great if you have... Experience with deploying models on embedded systems. Experience with Azure. Your development perspectives Our ambition is to make our teams sustainable! So our primary objective is to make you successful so that you can access the various developments we offer. Eventually, you will be able to develop on other activity sectors, but also project yourself internally on Team Manager positions for example. We can also offer you openings in our European subsidiaries if you are interested.

title: Junior Data Scientist
description: Stel je eens voor… Stel je eens voor dat met de enorme hoeveelheid data die er beschikbaar is, inzichten kunnen worden gegeven en analytics producten kunnen worden gemaakt die onze klanten en de bank écht verder helpen. Jij kan dit verschil maken door als Data Scientist complexe datasets te analyseren en trends en inzichten te genereren die meerwaarde hebben voor zowel de klant als bank. Je speelt hierbij een cruciale rol in het data science projectteam.  Impact creëren Het identificeren, analyseren en interpreteren van relevante trends of patronen in extreem grote en complexe data sets; Het presenteren van inzichten en verbeterpotentieel aan de verschillende stakeholders; Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren, schalen en automatiseren van analytical workflows; Het bouwen van statistische modellen en algoritmes; Het adviseren over de juiste data en analytics oplossingen; Met elkaar Samenwerken is de manier waarop we werken. Ons team Data Science & Business Consulting bundelt de krachten om de gehele organisatie te ondersteunen met data analytics toepassingen. Met jou erbij als Data Scientist staat de teller van het team op 45 diverse collega’s waaronder Data Scientists, Data Engineers en Business Consultants. Met jouw talenten Natuurlijk ben jij klantgericht, ben je gefocust op resultaat, kan je goed samen werken in teamverband en kijk je een outside-in naar de verschillende business puzzels. Juist die eigenschappen maken jou tot een goede Data Scientist. Daarbovenop is het belangrijk dat je alles op onderstaande checklist herkent: Relevante achtergrond in Computer Science, Econometrics, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Toegepaste Wiskunde of gerelateerde studies; Een nieuwsgierige en onderzoekende houding die gericht is op het oplossen van complexe problemen; Ervaring met statistische (regressie, clustering en classificatie), descriptieve en diagnostische methoden en kennis van voorspellende analysemethoden; Aantoonbare ervaring met algemene programmeertalen zoals Java/C/C++/Python/R; Ervaring met Hadoop (met en zonder YARN) en het MapReduce raamwerk en met tenminste een van de Hadoop gerelateerde database systemen: PySpark, Hive, Impala, Spark SQL; Ervaring met DataIku is een pré; Sterke analytische en sociale vaardigheden en de skills om data intelligence om te zetten naar waardevolle inzichten en verbeterpotentieel voor de rest van de organisatie; Beheersing van de Nederlandse en/of Engelse taal. Bij de Rabobank Dat de Rabobank een financiële dienstverlener is voor meer dan 8,5 miljoen klanten in 40 landen, wist je vast al. Weet je ook dat we met elkaar werken aan een betere wereld? Dit doen we op 101 manieren, zoals: We zetten ons elke dag in om een duurzamere leefomgeving te creëren. We stimuleren bijvoorbeeld collega’s met het openbaar vervoer naar kantoor te komen en gebruiken groene energie. We hebben een samenwerkingsverband met het Rode Kruis waardoor je een bijdrage kunt leveren aan het verbeteren van de humanitaire hulp, bijvoorbeeld door het inzetten van data analyse. Wil jij dit ook? De beste versie van jezelf worden? Wij helpen je er graag bij door jouw ontwikkeling centraal te stellen en te investeren in een omgeving waarin je blijft leren. We geven je de ruimte om te innoveren en ondernemen. Zo bieden we je volop groeikansen en helpen je verwachtingen te overtreffen en het goede buitengewoon goed te doen, zodat je kan groeien als professional.  Daarbovenop kan je bij ons (o.b.v. een 36-urige werkweek) ook rekenen op: een bruto jaarsalaris tussen 38.638 EUR en 55.035 EUR; een dertiende maand en vakantiegeld; een Employee Benefit Budget (9% van je maandinkomen). Hoe jij dit budget inzet, is aan jou. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het kopen van extra vakantiedagen, een extra storting in je pensioen of zelfs het maandelijks laten uitbetalen van dit budget; een persoonlijk budget, dat je kunt besteden aan activiteiten gericht op jouw ontwikkeling en loopbaan; flexibiliteit in werktijden en locatieonafhankelijk werken; 100% vergoeding van woon- werkverkeer als je met ov reist! Toch met auto of motor? Kies dan voor een woon- werkverkeervergoeding; een pensioenregeling waar je zelf maar 3,5% aan bijdraagt.  Laten we kennismaken Ben jij hem/haar? Onze nieuwe collega die de Rabobank wil versterken als Data Scientist? En zo het verschil wil maken voor jezelf, onze klanten én de maatschappij? We ontvangen graag jouw sollicitatie op deze vacature in Utrecht.  Handig om te weten: Hila Leupen-Turabaz, Senior Recruiter, beantwoordt met plezier vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure via mail, hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl. Screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. We toetsen op basis van de screening procedures die binnen de Rabobank gelden of nieuwe medewerkers voldoende betrouwbaar zijn om werkzaamheden bij de Rabobank te verrichten. Voor deze vacature maakt een individueel assessment deel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure. Wij willen jouw talent in de breedste zin van het woord inzetten en kijken graag breder naar jouw reactie dan deze vacature. Jouw profiel wordt meegenomen in de Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. Mocht je hier bezwaar tegen hebben dan kun je dit per mail aangeven bij Data.analytics@rabobank.nl. Jouw privacy is belangrijk voor ons. Mocht je hier meer over willen weten, klik dan deze link. Iedereen is anders, en juist de verschillen in mensen helpen ons om een nog betere bank te zijn. Daarom zijn we zijn benieuwd naar wie jíj bent! Vergeet niet aan je sollicitatie je motivatie toe te voegen en vertel in je motivatie meer over je interesse in deze functie.

title: data engineer
summary: Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, MLOps, data warehousing, data pipeline and data lake creation, preferably in the Azure data stack …
description: purpose citizenM is a global lifestyle hotel company involved in the full spectrum of the customer journey: from sourcing a potential reservation, to checking in and staying in the hotel, to the design and development of our hotels. This degree of vertical integration is unique in the industry. This gives us an incredibly rich dataset to collect, transform, and analyze in order to improve the effectiveness of the operating model and therefore guest experience. Much of this data is combined in citizenM’s data platform. As a data engineer you will have the opportunity to work citizenM’s rich data sources and bring those together in the data platform, where it will be prepared for consumption by the Business Intelligence Team and analysts across the company. This role is part of the Business Intelligence Team, where you will be working with a team of data scientists and analysts to further develop the existing platform. citizenM’s Business Intelligence team is working with all disciplines within citizenM to provide insights and analytics. Due to the nature of the role there will be close collaboration with our friends from the Tech team. key responsibilities Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for (mainly) batch processing in our Azure cloud environment; Work closely with the team’s data scientists and analysts to develop citizenM analytical infrastructure in sync with the analytical roadmap; Apply dimensional modeling to design tables and views that map business processes into an enterprise data model; Support, propose and implement enhancements to citizenM’s data architecture; Monitoring the performance of the data platform and performing incident management, to warrant consistent data completeness and quality; Optimize the database architecture by balancing low operational costs with high performance; Build and support a complex ETL infrastructure to deliver clean and reliable data to the organization; Support the development of new products and services via ingestion, processing, and transforming data for reporting and analytics; Support company-wide data initiatives, including the onboarding of new systems or platforms such as citizenM’s customer data platform; Proactively automate manual processes throughout the business for higher efficiency, robustness, and speed; Enforce production standards and governance best practices in the management of enterprise-level data, metrics, and (data quality) reports Basic knowledge of networking, firewalls and Azure security & authorisation concepts Develop citizenM’s (relational) data models so that they are optimally geared towards analytical use; Use DevOps best practices such as continuous integration, continuous delivery in the production implementation; Azure Devops knowledge is a plus; Work with business stakeholders (incl domain experts, system specialists or vendors) to onboard relevant new data or update existing sources; Prepare documentation (incl ERDs and relevant flow visuals) of the systems onboarded to citizenM’s data platform; Keep track of the latest developments in the field of expertise, including a good understanding of Microsoft’s Azure data services development roadmap to advise the team on (new) solutions and stimulate innovation qualifications / skills a genuine passion for data and the ability to combine strong data engineering and technical skills with business knowledge; a bachelor (masters preferred) degree, preferably in the field of data engineering, computer science, information technology or data science Ability to translate complex problems clearly and in nontechnical terms Advanced SQL knowledge, basic knowledge of Python at development level and affinity with Python/R as data science toolkits Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, MLOps, data warehousing, data pipeline and data lake creation, preferably in the Azure data stack (Azure certifications would be considered a plus) Knowledge of various data communication protocols (e.g. REST API, Websockets Ability to succeed in both collaborative and independent work environments Excellence in planning and execution Proven experience with repositories and version controlling Experience with an agile way of working locations / hours Voorschoten Support office. This is a full-time position. citizenM is an affordable luxury hotel chain for mobile citizens of the world. With style that will knock your socks off, we offer citizens a real home from home, plus the world’s fluffiest pillows. Our typical guest is a frequent traveler who is quality and design driven, and value conscious. We currently have hotels in the Netherlands, France, UK, Switzerland, Denmark, USA and Asia, with more to come soon. We are proud to put hospitality back into the hospitality industry, and have received numerous awards for our groundbreaking approach. We like to do things differently. This means our hotels are not traditional… and neither are our support offices. We're open-minded, with kind hearts and global minds. citizenM loves diversity. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from anyone. #MS

title: Research Assistant 'digital behavior change interventions for addictive behaviors'
summary: Our more than 2700 scientists and employees work together with all our students to solve challenges faced by global society, drawing their inspiration from the…
description: The Research Assistant will work within a group of researchers involved in the design and evaluation of digital behavior change interventions for primary and secondary prevention in the addiction field. The Research Assistant will be tasked with supporting the design, planning, execution and reporting of scientific research activities, including the set-up and execution of (part of) project plans, analysis of collected data, and drafting of research reports (in full or in part). The Research Assistant will be also involved in a large public-private collaborative project in the field of online responsible gambling and prevention of gambling problems.  The Research Assistant will have the possibility of gaining substantial research experience, including the refinement of analytical and research methods skills, critical thinking, scientific writing and intervention design, and the opportunity of collaborating with expert scientists and practitioners in the field of addictions and (digital) behavior change  Specifications  max. 28 hours per week  €2656—€4012 per month  Rotterdam  View on Google Maps  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR)  Requirements  Master degree in Clinical Psychology, Health Psychology or Behavior Change or related disciplines (Research Master is a bonus)  Interest in the field of addiction, eHealth and digital behavior change  Familiarity with advanced research methods and online research (e.g., Randomized Controlled Trials)  Mastering of advanced statistical methods (e.g., multivariate regression, multilevel models)  Basic scientific writing skills (e.g., study reports, parts of scientific papers)  Proactive and independent working approach  Open to collaborate within a wider research team  Strong organizational and project management skills  Flexibility and good oral and written communication skills in English (Dutch proficiency is a plus)  Conditions of employment  Internationally-oriented and varied work within an enthusiastic team, with attractive fringe benefits in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU). Your initial employment term will be 12 months. Your remuneration will depend on the position, your specific knowledge and experience. It will be calculated on the basis of full-time salary ranging between EUR 2656,- and 4012,- gross per year (salary scale 8 or 9, CAO NU ). Erasmus University Rotterdam offers attractive terms of employment, including a holiday allowance of 8%, a year-end payment of 8.3% and 41 annual leave days in case of a full work week. In addition, EUR takes part in the ABP pension scheme, and we also offer partially paid parental leave. For international spouses we have set up a dual career programme. Moreover, EUR staff members are allowed to make use of the EUR facilities, including the Erasmus sports centre and the University Library. We value diversity and believe that a diversity of talents contributes to our vision and strategy to excel as a university on research and education. This means that we are looking for a person who can complement our team well.  Employer  Erasmus University Rotterdam  The Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR), named after Rotterdam-born humanist and theologian Erasmus, is a research university with a strong international orientation and a pronounced social focus, both in its education and research activities. On the lively, modern campus, more than 28.000 students and scholars of more than 100 nationalities are constantly encouraged to develop their talents and meet their ambition. Our more than 2700 scientists and employees work together with all our students to solve challenges faced by global society, drawing their inspiration from the consistently dynamic and cosmopolitan city of Rotterdam. The academic education offered at our faculties is intensive, engaging and strongly focused on practical application. We increasingly perform our research in multidisciplinary teams, which are closely interwoven with international networks. In terms of research impact and the quality of its degree programmes, EUR can compete with the foremost universities in Europe, which is reflected in its consistent top-100 position in most major universities rankings. Erasmus University Rotterdam’s key values are daring, curiosity, social involvement, breaking new ground and striving for success www.eur.nl  Department  Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences  The Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences (ESSB) is home to a vast diversity of scientific disciplines: public administration, pedagogical sciences, psychology and sociology. In addition, the Erasmus University College, IHS, and two research institutes RISBO and DRIFT are linked to the faculty. This also reflects in the content of the (international) bachelor's and master's programs and in research. Our activities are always focused on people and society. At the ESSB fundamental, internationally oriented research is of paramount importance. In addition, social research for professionals, policy makers, and the society is part of our research activities. ESSB offers a stimulating research environment where major national and international research grants are received. Appealing guest researchers and ambitious PhD candidates come along to conduct their research. Our education is small-scale and works with innovative forms of education such as Problem-Based Learning (PBL). Both the Dutch and English programs are highly ranked by students and alumni. ESSB is home to over 4000 students and more than 400 staff-members. The different disciplines are supported by the Faculty Office (for more information, please visit www.eur.nl/essb).  Department of Psychology, Education & Child Studies (DPECS)  The Department of Psychology, Education & Child Studies provides education and research in the area of pedagogical and psychological sciences and is embedded within the Faculty of Social Science. The education is characterized by a successful and innovative didactical approach: problem based learning in combination with extensive professional and academic skills training. Our bachelor and master tracks receive top rankings each year.  Additional information  For more information about EUR and the Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences, please visit www.eur.nl/essb . For additional information about this specific vacancy, please contact Dr. Marilisa Boffo (email: boffo@essb.eur.nl ).  Making minds matter  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR) is a highly ranked, international university, based in the dynamic and diverse city of Rotterdam, with its port acting as a gateway to the world.  Read more about Erasmus University Rotterdam

title: Internship Data Scientist (Data analytics for Operations, Clinical Trials and Compliance)
summary: Experienced in utilizing data analytics tools (e.g. PowerBI) and applying analytical techniques for data retrieval, visualization and reporting.
description: Data Analytics for Operations, Clinical Trials and Compliance. Study: Information Studies – Data Science or equivalent (For example: Business Analytics, Computer Science, Data Science & engineering.) Location: We are looking for a student- candidate who is already based in the Netherlands. Full time for 6 months (adaptable in consultation). Preferred start date ASAP. Background: Multiple data sources exist within ProQR which hold valuable information. These large and complex datasets need to be made more accessible, understandable, and useable for the business. This can be achieved by translating business requirements and combine datasets into consistent and organized data visualizations using advanced technologies. This project will result in more informed, efficient, and fast decision making. Project Description: All activities are performed in collaboration with supervisor and business key stakeholders. Initial focus will be the financial dashboards following further roll-out to clinical trial status, compliance status and/or project updates. Create overview of advantages and disadvantage of available dashboard generating tools (like PowerBI) and come with recommendation and choose tool. Work with the business to define requirements, explain possibilities and limitations, build the required templates, and perform data analytics. Build interactive dashboards that provide clear insights into what is happening in the organization, make better sense of the data and support decision making. Transfer knowledge to the business, educate business on data literacy. Skills and Requirements: Bachelor or Master, preferably senior student. Experienced in utilizing data analytics tools (e.g. PowerBI) and applying analytical techniques for data retrieval, visualization and reporting. Translate departmental gaps/needs to templates and data visualization. Ability to communicate about data in an easy language to key stakeholders. Organizational skills, attention to detail and analytical reasoning. Solution oriented and result driven. English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders. Team player with strong interpersonal skills. We offer: Option to work from home, flexible working hours, stipend. Do you think you can contribute in achieving our mission? If so, we’re looking forward to receiving your application by filling out our application form. Please apply as soon as possible if you are interested in this position. You can contact Laura Faber via recruitment@proqr.com if you have any questions.

title: Interim - Data Scientist (38 uur)
summary: Je gaat grote hoeveelheden (historische) data verwerken uit verschillende bronnen om deze om te zetten naar bruikbare voorspelling door de data te extrapoleren;
description: Vind jij het leuk om My Jewellery naar een hoger niveau te helpen? En wil je graag werken met de nieuwste technieken samen met een jong en dynamisch team? Lees dan snel verder en reageer op de interim vacature, Data Scientist – Marketing.  In deze functie ga je samen met het Data Product team een marketing attributietool ontwikkelingen, die het marketingteam gaat helpen om effectiever te werken. My Jewellery is van origine een E-Commerce bedrijf en heeft dus al veel data verzameld. Jouw taak wordt het om deze data te gebruiken en uit te lezen. Dit alles om ons marketingteam meer inzicht te geven in de aankoopcyclus van onze klanten en het verbeteren van aanbiedingen op de vele (social) kanalen die My Jewellery gebruikt.  Project Binnen dit project draag je dagelijks bij aan het succes van My Jewellery en help je mee met het waar maken van onze ambities op het gebied van groei en efficiëntie. Het betreft een project voor drie maanden met een optie op verlenging.  Taken  Je gaat grote hoeveelheden (historische) data verwerken uit verschillende bronnen om deze om te zetten naar bruikbare voorspelling door de data te extrapoleren; Je selecteert de beste statische methodologie om de data te analyseren; Je schrijft algoritmes om data te ontsluiten, structureren en analyseren; Je identificeert vragen vanuit de business m.b.t. data-analyse en voorspellende modellen; Je ontwikkelt (zelflerende) voorspellingsmodellen. Functievereisten Je hebt een WO werk en denkniveau en een afgeronde Bèta opleiding; Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie; Je bent ervaring met het werken in Agile/Scrum; Je hebt een brede kennis binnen Artificial Intelligence (incl. NLP); Je hebt ervaring met het toepassen van Data Science Tools binnen marketing/sales; Je hebt bij voorkeur al ervaring met attributiemodellen of -toepassingen; Je hebt ervaring met Python en relevante libraries (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, TensorFlow, etc.); Je bent verantwoordelijk en accuraat.  Wij bieden: Een kennismaking met een snelgroeiend en dynamische E-commerce organisatie; Een enthousiaste en gedreven werkomgeving waar zelfstandigheid, verantwoordelijkheid, teamwork en een goede sfeer belangrijke uitgangspunten zijn; Een uitdagende project waarin je de kans krijgt om strategisch mee te denken en een blijvend verschil te maken. Interesse? Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Stuur dan een mail met jouw vraag naar Leonieke via leonieke.vroom@my-jewellery.com

title: Senior Data Engineer
summary: Work closely with data scientists, platform engineers, data architects, and data source owners to deliver foundational data sets, enabling analytics solutions…
description: The Senior Data Engineer is a core member of the team responsible for providing solutions to digital age data challenges through design and implementation of an ecosystem of Cloud solutions to support AI, Machine Learning and other modern data technologies.
