This role will be responsible for designing, developing, optimizing, standardizing data engineering pipelines along with creating robust data models for data publishing while complying with, and adding value to, the data architecture. The Data Engineer will also be responsible for guiding the existing data engineering team and developing cloud-native solutions with low time to market by leveraging DevOps methodologies. This individual will evangelize and implement the modern practices in data engineering that address scale and are essential for digital transformation through high value driven projects. Roles & Responsibilities  Work closely with data scientists, platform engineers, data architects, and data source owners to deliver foundational data sets, enabling analytics solutions driving successful business outcomes. Provide leadership in designing and implementing best practices for efficient sourcing and processing large data sets from Analytics data stores. Build real-time, reliable, scalable, high-performing, distributed, fault tolerant systems. Design and develop code, scripts and data pipelines that leverage structured and unstructured data. Implement measures to address data privacy, security, compliance and ensure robust data governance. Industrializing data lakes or real-time platforms for an enterprise enabling business applications and usage at scale Monitor, maintain and optimize production systems. Investigate and resolve incidents reported by users. Identify opportunities to automate, consolidate and simplify platform. Work with Enterprise Architecture, Digital, and other IT teams to develop and maintain data integrity, integration and governance standards. Contribute to the selection of platforms, data management, libraries, tool chain and OSS for software development. Stay on top of evolving technology to suggest and prototype and implement improvements to the data architecture. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to help utilize and drive adoption of new big data tools / models. Guide business stakeholder and mentor members of the data and analytics teams regarding technology and best practices. Manage assigned activities within time, cost and technical objectives. May manage small projects with internal or external resources. Min. Qualifications  Bachelor's degree required 10+ years hands-on experience in architecting, developing, and successfully operationalizing complex/large scale data management projects At least 5+ years of data warehouse and ETL design and development using SQL on RDBMS and MPP databases Experience in big data development on Hadoop or Spark frameworks using Python, Java, noSQL, TimeSeries DBs, HDFS Experience in development on Cloud (PaaS) Data Solutions, Azure preferred  Preferred Qualifications  Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Technical Science or related disciplines, preferred. Experience building data management (metadata, lineage, tracking etc.) and governance solutions for modern data platforms Experience securing Cloud based modern data platforms Experience working with LAMBDA architecture using real-time Kafka ingestion and high-volume batch loads Understanding of statistics and mathematical techniques to solve real business problems. Experience of working with models in SAP HANA, manufacturing historians, various IoT, subscription and public data sources. Experience of ETL tools such as SAP BusinessObjects Data Services. Experience of Reporting and Analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Alteryx Functional experience in one of more business functions. Experience with global enterprise environment or major consulting firm is a plus. Interested ?  Please feel free to connect with Ton Brands, Corporate recruiter ton.brands @ lyondellbasell.com for more details. Would you like to apply? Just send us your motivation and resume via the application button  #LI-TB1

title: Data Scientist
summary:
At least 2 years experience as a data scientist on the customer side (Oil & Gas or Mining).
Our global data feed starts on a satellite and provides millimeter…
description: Job Description We have a new position available for a Data Scientist with strong quantitative skills, who will extract knowledge from available data in our platform and help develop insights for customers in our suite of products. Responsibilities Processing, modeling and visualization of satellite data in the software system Project engineering (unify statistics, data analysis) Process automation in a supporting role Develop machine learning innovations Work with commercial team in pre-sales consulting with prospects Lead operational support of clients’ domain experts in projects Actively work on linking new or customer datasets to InSAR data Qualifications Ph.D. degree in engineering At least 2 years experience as a data scientist on the customer side (Oil & Gas or Mining) Experience in a professional environment with project management and customer-facing work as part of a team Working knowledge and programming experience in technical computing software such as Python, C++, Matlab or similar programming languages Excellent written and oral reporting skills; continuous communication with customers is a key part of this position Personal characteristics Proven outstanding quantitative and analytical skills Great team player in a technical project environment Entrepreneurial and comfortable with a rapidly changing environment Focused on deadlines and results Location Delft, The Netherlands Meet SkyGeo SkyGeo is a next generation Earth Observation company. Our global data feed starts on a satellite and provides millimeter-accurate deformation data to customers all over the world. Our processing engine and our InSAR-based deformation data is fundamentally changing the way our customers look at their assets. We help people manage their assets for the long term and we provide early warnings for prevention of environmental disasters. Working for SkyGeo is inspiring and challenges you to excel. You will have an opportunity to grow and innovate since the company is at the forefront of InSAR, computational techniques and mapping data onto real world problems.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Onze data scientists zijn allrounders.
Ben jij die allround data scientist?
Tim (data-scientist bij Nippur).
Van idee via data naar antwoorden.
description: Van idee via data naar antwoorden Koopgedrag voorspellen, gevolgen bepalen van een wijziging in het productieproces, maar ook patronen herkennen om fraude te detecteren. Hoe complexer hoe liever. Want wat is er nu leuker dan onverwachte inzichten ontdekken in data? Onze aanpak is duidelijk. De Nippur data science-projectaanpak (gebaseerd op CRISP-DM) laat zien hoe wij een data science-vraagstuk aanvliegen. Hierdoor weet de klant waar hij aan toe is en wat hij kan verwachten. Staat een klant nog in de kinderschoenen en weet hij niet waar te beginnen, dan gaan we samen op zoektocht. Onze data scientists zijn allrounders. Dit betekent dat zij het hele traject van idee, via prototyping tot vervolgens het in productie nemen, doorlopen. En weet je wat dan fijn is? Dat ze hierbij kunnen rekenen op onze data engineers en data architecten. “Vermoedens bevestigen of juist verwerpen door algoritmes toe te passen op data, maar zo ook verrassende nieuwe inzichten ontdekken. Ik word er enthousiast van als ik een klant daarmee kan helpen.” Tim (data-scientist bij Nippur) Ben jij er klaar voor? Ben jij die allround data scientist? Krijg jij er een kick van een klant te verrassen met nieuwe inzichten? En heb jij de kwaliteiten in huis om data science-projecten van begin tot eind uit te voeren? Dan pas jij perfect in ons team. Je komt te werken in een nog groeiend team enthousiaste collega’s. Dit betekent dat je een gezonde dosis ondernemerschap hebt. Je gaat namelijk meehelpen data science binnen Nippur verder uit te bouwen. Superleuk natuurlijk want dit betekent ook dat er veel ruimte is voor jouw ideeën. Pas jij bij ons? Je krijgt energie van het zoeken naar antwoorden in data. Jij maakt hierbij zonder enige moeite gebruik van verschillende algoritmes in Python of R Vraagstukken pak jij aan met methodes zoals CRISP-DM Je hebt een wo-diploma in de richting van econometrie, data science, computerwetenschappen, software engineering, wiskunde of andere technische studie Je bent een sterke gesprekspartner en altijd erg nieuwsgierig om te ontdekken wat stakeholders willen en waarom Je denkt na over de maatschappelijke dilemma’s in het gebruik van data en in je werk ben je hier bewust mee bezig Je werkt graag in een team en vindt het vanzelfsprekend om je kennis en ervaring te delen Passen wij bij jou? Jij krijgt: Veel afwisseling in je werk omdat je als consultant werkt aan datavraagstukken bij grote en middelgrote klanten Volop ruimte om training te volgen en te leren van je collega’s Goede werk-privébalans, we werken in Noord-Brabant, Utrecht, Gelderland en Limburg. We zullen je dus niet naar Amsterdam of Groningen laten rijden Een arbeidsovereenkomst voor een jaar (32 - 40 uur per week), maak jij onze verwachtingen waar? Dan zetten we die binnen het jaar om naar een contract voor onbepaalde tijd Een bruto maandsalaris van € 3.000,- tot € 5.500,- op basis van 40 uur per week (afhankelijk van je leeftijd en ervaring, is dit een indicatie en geen absolute grens) Arbeidsvoorwaarden waar je wat mee kan; zoals 30 vakantiedagen, een dertiende maand, een flexibele vervoersregeling en een collectieve pensioenregeling. Heb je een bijzondere situatie? Bespreek het en we doen ons best te bekijken wat mogelijk is

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Data scientist: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen).
Op basis van verschillende data science methodes, als clustering en outlier detectie, frauduleuze klanten detecteren voor…
description: Organisatie Wil jij werken voor een organisatie waar Data Science & Artificial Intelligence centraal staan bij het beantwoorden van complexe technologische vraagstukken? Zo adviseren, ontwikkelen en beheren zij projecten in diverse marktsegmenten: onderwijs, gezondheidszorg, overheid en NGO’s. Doordat zij acteren in diverse sectoren zul jij jouw kennis kunnen toepassen op een zeer divers scala aan opdrachten. Hierdoor breng jij jouw skills en vakkennis naar een hoger niveau. Team Jij gaat werken in binnen een hecht team van 20 high-skilled Data Science Specialisten. Doorgaans in teams van 3 of 4 specialisten, overzien door iemand met senioriteit. Jullie werken in diverse projectsamenstellingen en staan in nauwe verbinding met de klanten. Projecten -Op basis van A.I. analyse-instrumenten ontwikkelen ter ondersteuning bij medische diagnostiek; -Dynamische prijsmodellen opstellen die prijzen realtime aan kunnen passen; -Een ecosysteem analyseplatform opstellen die op basis van diverse indicatoren een grote verscheidenheid aan zoogdieren kan herkennen; -Op basis van verschillende data science methodes, als clustering en outlier detectie, frauduleuze klanten detecteren voor verschillende domeinen; Eisen - Minimaal Hbo/WO opleiding in een relevant; - Vanaf 2 jaar werkervaring met Python; - Modellen kunnen ontwikkelen, implementeren en in productie brengen; - In-dept kennis van beheer- en ontwikkelprocessen in een datawarehouse omgeving; - Beheersing van Nederlandse en Engelse taal; Voorwaarden -Arbeidsvoorwaarden (goed salaris, bonusregeling etc.) zijn uitstekend; -Online thuis werkplek volledig vergoed door werkgever; -Laptop van de zaak; -Ruimte om te leren van collega’s met diverse senioriteiten & specialisaties; Contractduur 6 maanden Verwachte startdatum: 22-3-2021 Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd Salaris: €3.000,00 - €5.700,00 per maand Aanvullende betalingen: 13e maand Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werk vanuit huis Werkschema: Dagdienst Ervaring: data scientist: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen) Opleiding: Bachelor (Aanbevolen) Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Develop your craftsmanship as a data scientist by using state-of-the-art technologies.
Passion and drive for finding new insights in vast amounts of data;
description: Do you see a challenge in turning (big) data into real business value? Do you have the entrepreneurial spirit to enhance data so you can deliver new Data Science related products and services? Do you fancy statistics? Do you want to contribute to new business models ? We’ll give you the opportunity to: Contribute to the digitalization of industrial, retail and logistic service providers; Work on innovative use cases such as Predictive Maintenance and Process Mining; Enjoy an environment with many highly technical colleagues, with sufficient room for own initiatives; Develop your craftsmanship as a data scientist by using state-of-the-art technologies. Your tasks and responsibilities Identifying business value: You connect with business owners and process experts to understand and address their data and analytics needs; You are able to translate their needs and challenges into concrete value and growth hypothesis and get stakeholder buy-in to validate them; Together with relevant domain and subject matter experts you are capable of defining appropriate experiments that allow you to quickly and iteratively validate your hypothesis and define the possible business case. Realizing business value: You bring together differently structured data from a variety of sources in order to validate your hypothesis; You perform ad-hoc Data Science experiments by using common sense, statistical techniques, predictive analytics and machine-learning; You can turn your findings into actionable insights which you can clearly communicate towards your (business) stakeholders. Grow business value: You productize successful Data Science solutions/services and embed them into standard solutions and processes in order to realize the improvement of the competitiveness; You act as change manager and Data Science evangelist in the Digital Transformation journey to become a more data driven organization; You are the go-to-person for Data Science related challenges and questions. Your profile Master Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research or Data Science; 3-5 years relevant work experience; Experienced with Data Science methodologies, like CRISP-DM; Familiar with big data frameworks and programming languages (R, Python, Spark); Business sense allowing you to act as sparring partner of business stakeholders; Team player with strong communication skills in technical and business domain; Passion and drive for finding new insights in vast amounts of data; Since you embody “Fail fast, learn faster” you act agile and iterative whilst assuring your results are correct and accurate. Contact If this challenging profile appeals to you, apply now by filling in the application form and uploading your CV and cover letter. For more information about this vacancy, please contact Hans Hendrikx.

title: Scientist
summary:
Naast het leiden van de projecten, zullen er ook rapportages geschreven moeten worden en de data moeten worden geanalyseerd.
We’d love to hear from you.
description: Heb je ervaring in de rol van Scientist en krijg je energie van het werken in een R&D omgeving (bijv. binnen de famaceutische industrie)? Dan ga ik graag het gesprek met je aan! We’d love to hear from you. | JOUW UITDAGINGEN In de rol van Scientist bekleed je een zeer diverse maar belangrijke rol in een uitdagende R&D omgeving. Dit betekent dat je je naast de ontwikkeling van nieuwe producten (bijv. vaccins) bezighoudt met het creëren van ideeën, die je vervolgens omzet naar werkende en uitvoerbare projectplannen. Om de door jou ontwikkelde projecten goed te kunnen laten verlopen, stuur je ook diverse projecten aan. Dit betekent tevens dat je de leiding over een aantal Lab Technicians hebt. Waar nodig zal je de Lab Technicians ook ondersteunen in hun werkzaamheden. Naast het leiden van de projecten, zullen er ook rapportages geschreven moeten worden en de data moeten worden geanalyseerd. | WAT VERWACHTEN WE VAN JOU Een afgeronde Msc. of PhD in de richting van Biotechnology, Life Science & Technology, Bioprocess Engineering, Biochemistry, Biochemical engineering of vergelijkbaar; Minimaal een jaar relevante werkervaring; Kennis binnen een GMP ervaring; Ambitie om jezelf te ontwikkelen; Kritisch en nauwkeurig te werk willen gaan. | WAT HEEFT ONZE BUSINESS CEL TE BIEDEN? Bij TMC Science & Technology kunnen wij jou toegang geven tot een groot netwerk van chemici maar wordt ook de samenwerking opgezocht met andere technische disciplines. Naast dat we een groot intern netwerk hebben, werken wij samen met grote spelers in de technische industrie. Bij TMC Science & Technology zetten wij kwaliteit boven kwantiteit en samenwerking boven zelfstandigheid. | WAT MAG JE VAN TMC VERWACHTEN TMC is een uniek gezelschap van technische professionals die ondernemingsgezind, vakbekwaam en bijna zelfstandig te werk gaan. Ons model voor Employeneurship is ongeëvenaard en biedt deskundigen met allerlei achtergronden zowel de voordelen van een dienstverband als de mogelijkheden van het ondernemerschap. Mensen zijn de motor achter technologie. Zij brengen kennis in de praktijk en starten of versnellen innovatie. Omdat we ons bevinden in het hart van de internationale high-tech industrie, weten we wat tech bedrijven die aan kop willen blijven echt nodig hebben. We bieden je een uitdagende en stimulerende werkomgeving waarin je de regisseur van je eigen carrière kunt zijn. Als Employeneur maak je deel uit van onze TMC-familie. Plezier en betrokkenheid zijn belangrijke onderdelen in onze cultuur. We zijn ons bewust van de impact die we hebben op de levens en carrières van onze Employeneurs en op de prestaties van onze klanten. We volgen, dragen bij aan en investeren in thema's die niet alleen op brancheniveau belangrijk zijn, maar ook op organisatie en persoonlijk niveau zoals vitaliteit en expats. | WAAROM KIEZEN VOOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP? De term Employeneurship klinkt misschien onbekend. Dat komt omdat wij de bedenkers zijn. Het is meer dan een woord, het is een werkwijze, een paradigma zelfs. Bij Employeneurship denk en handel je in principe als een ondernemer, maar vanuit de veilige positie van een werknemer. Het is echter in de eerste plaats een manier om voortdurend in ontwikkeling te blijven en het biedt je de kans om je carrière daadwerkelijk te sturen. Employeneurship is gebaseerd op 5 basisprincipes: Een duurzame werkrelatie met een vast dienstverband Individuele winstdeling: je leert je marktwaarde kennen en hebt een aandeel in de winst die je werk genereert YOUniversity: we zullen je ondersteunen met een-op-een coaching en trainingen Businesscellen: voor een sterk en relevant netwerk The Entrepreneurial Lab (TEL): een speeltuin voor nieuwe ideeën en een potentiële lancering voor start-ups TMC is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt en waarde hecht aan diversiteit. We discrimineren niet op basis van ras, religie, kleur, nationale afkomst, geslacht, seksuele geaardheid, leeftijd, burgerlijke staat, veteranenstatus of handicapstatus. Is TMC a perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you. Feel Free to Contact Annelotte van Rossem Business Manager Life Sciences, Netherlands Tel: +31 (0)6 11 38 78 88

title: Data Scientist – Marketing Analytics
summary:
Enjoy figuring out how to use math, code and data to solve business problems.
Have experience in developing data and statistics-driven solutions for real-life…
description: WHO YOU ARE  We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us in developing new revolutionizing ways for IKEA to interact with our customers. We are using cutting edge methodologies to improve customer experience – from marketing to customer support.  Our diverse team within Data & Analytics is growing even more and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:  enjoy figuring out how to use math, code and data to solve business problems have a strong background in math, computer science, engineering or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent) have experience in developing data and statistics-driven solutions for real-life business problems love being creative through code (ideally in Python and beyond basic notebooks or scripts) master techniques for Data Science such as machine learning, deep learning, gradient boosting, Bayesian modelling, natural language processing, time-series analysis or optimization/OR techniques have experience working in at least one area of: customer analytics, personalization, recommender systems, marketing, promotional effectiveness, text classification, NLP and demand forecasting (ideally in a retail setting) are a team player who takes ownership, and you like to work closely with others listen well and are able to explain your ideas to non-technical stakeholders are curious, self-directed and want to keep learning!  This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.  The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.  WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING DAY TO DAY  IKEA is taking huge steps in its digital transformation and our team of Data Scientists are working in cross-functional teams, building intelligent systems for data-driven business decisions. For example, we are developing models and tools to answer questions like:  Which marketing activities are effective and relevant? Can we predict individual customers’ interest and behavior? What is the ideal personalized inspiration, offer, timing and channel for engaging with each customer? How can we design loyalty club member rewards to nurture a sustainable customer relationship? Which topics and sentiments do our customers have about IKEA on social media or when they call us for support? How can we help our co-workers in customer support calls with automated speech analysis in real-time? How much should and will we be selling of each article over time and which commercial levers should we pull to influence this? How do we build a global marketing framework for automating accurate predictions in real-time, while at the same time personalizing inspirational content and communicating to the customer in the right channel at the right time?  Perhaps you have your own questions to ask? Our ultimate goal is to create a better everyday life for the many people by creating a unique partnership with each customer. To do so, we want to give customers the most beneficial offer for them, exactly when they need it, and support them throughout their journey with IKEA in the best way possible.  OUR TEAM WITHIN IKEA  You will work in Data & Analytics together with other Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Stewards and Data Architects. Together you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Technology, Product, Design, that designs, implements and deploys products that help to solve these kinds of problems. It will be a mix of product insights, data visualization and writing code – as well as talking with product owners and business stakeholders.  IKEA has long been a global leader in home furnishing. We are proud of our vision to improve the everyday life of the many people. But our industry is quickly changing, and we need to adapt to stay competitive.  As part of IKEA’s journey to strengthen our digital capabilities, we are building a Dara & Analytics function. This team is working on problems across the company, ranging from customer modeling, pricing, online shopping, visual intelligence to logistic optimization.  We see so many opportunities for what we can accomplish and have the ambition to be a world class team. At the same time, we believe that our work is not just about building models, but also about learning and having fun together.  We can offer you:  Work on some very interesting problems as described above, and you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data Science colleagues in other specialist teams. Opportunities to have global impact with your work. Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform and we use a lot of open source tools across the board. Hardware and OS of your choice. A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data Science). Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning). Flexible and friendly working environment. Relocation support: we are based in southern Sweden.  QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!  Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader at life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us. If you have questions regarding the recruitment system, please reach out to Annette Björkquist-Åhstedt at Annette.bjorkquist-ahstedt@ingka.com.  Please apply with your application in English.  Note that we can’t process any applications through email. Thank you!

title: Senior Data Scientist (Food & Agribusiness - NL)
summary: We are looking for experienced data scientists, who have successfully completed challenging projects in advanced analytics and artificial intelligence.
description: Crunch Analytics is looking for candidates eager to work in our fast-growing Rotterdam branch, which is ready to revolutionize the international agri-food industry. There is an increasing challenge to produce and supply flowers & food across the globe in a sustainable fashion. We believe that the developments in advanced analytics and artificial intelligence provide a great opportunity for the industry to move towards more sustainable and accessible production while increasing business value for the companies who are active within the value chain  With our Rotterdam office, we are close to the largest high-tech horticulture cluster in the world. You, as a Senior Data Scientist, will be one of the driving forces of further innovation in the industry by delivering the latest machine learning & AI technologies. With our selected focus on food & agribusiness, we aim to extend our expertise within the industry, which allows us to support our clients in the best way possible.  We are looking for experienced data scientists, who have successfully completed challenging projects in advanced analytics and artificial intelligence. A successful candidate has the ambition to act as a trusted advisor for companies eager to use data & algorithms, in assisting people when making business decisions and allowing systems to automate such decision-making. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will take the lead in projects that are among various highly relevant topics like vertical farming, business optimization, and autonomous growing. Your excellent programming skills, data science knowledge and business acumen allow you to identify opportunities at a client, define the scope and execution strategy of a project and steer a team, moving along the journey. You complement such technical & business skills with the ability to communicate your findings in a way that is easy to understand for clients. You will act as a tutor in your domain of expertise and be responsible for mentoring junior profiles.  Key responsibilities Experience in project and account management Capable of defining the scope and execution strategy for new projects Expert in every aspect of data science: Understanding and using supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques Wrangling all types of data sources in any shape or form Finding meaningful and actionable business insights with exploratory data analysis and using statistical methods Understanding and being able to translate business problems into data science problems and vice versa Translating your expertise and findings to a variety of different business stakeholders Knowing when not to use “traditional” data science, but revert to other techniques Excellent data engineering skills: Advanced programming in Python (Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Keras, Seaborn, Spacy, ...) Building complex data pipelines and using distributed computing Deploying machine learning solutions on the cloud Working in a Unix environment Using other tools and frameworks such as GIT, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, ... Excellent communication skills. This includes written, oral and non-verbal communication. Willingness to tutor others about Data Science and your area of expertise Able to collaborate with more junior Data Scientists, and give (non-)technical advice and direction Nice to haves Knowledge of bioinformatics or plant physiology Knowledge of other languages (speaking or programming) Experience with lean/agile software development Experience with data-science software and packages (HDFS, Spark, Scikit-Learn, ...) Experience with the Google Cloud, Azure, and/or AWS is a definitive plus Your Profile You have 3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist You have a MS in BioInformatics, Computer Science, Econometrics, AI, Maths, Statistics, Engineering or similar You are eager to learn new things You are fluent in Dutch and English and are a good communicator You are flexible and stress-resistant

title: Data Scientist IT
summary: Het CBS levert als hét statistische bureau van Nederland met betrouwbare statistische informatie en data inzicht in maatschappelijke vraagstukken.
description: Ben jij in staat om de juiste eisen op te halen bij onze data analisten om op basis hiervan vernieuwing te brengen binnen onze maatwerk softwareapplicaties? Help je ons naast ontwikkel werk ook mee met het vernieuwen van onze IT waardoor onze data analisten nog beter hun werk kunnen doen. Ben jij er klaar voor?  Over het CBS Het CBS levert als hét statistische bureau van Nederland met betrouwbare statistische informatie en data inzicht in maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Daarmee voedt het CBS het maatschappelijk debat, de beleidsontwikkeling en de besluitvorming en draagt zo bij aan welvaart, welzijn en democratie.  Het CBS is een innovatieve kennisorganisatie, die voortdurend nieuwe technologieën en ontwikkelingen toepast om de kwaliteit van de gegevens en de onafhankelijke positie te blijven borgen. Locatie: Den Haag Opleidingsniveau: WO Categorie: Dienstverband: Jaarcontract met uitzicht op vast dienstverband Uur per week: 36 Salaris: Minimaal EUR 3279,- en maximaal EUR 5039,- bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur Waar kom je te werken Je gaat werken bij team Sociale Zekerheid, dat bestaat uit 32 enthousiaste en betrokken mensen. Veel van het werk van het team is in opdracht van het ministerie van SZW, zowel de reguliere statistieken als aanvullend onderzoek. Kijk bijvoorbeeld eens op sociale zekerheid, een webpagina van ons team. Vanwege COVID-19 werken we zo veel mogelijk thuis, maar via de ‘digitale wereld’ zoeken we elkaar veelvuldig op: om het professionele contact met elkaar te onderhouden, maar ook voor het persoonlijke contact en de fun.  Wat ga je doen Onze maatwerk software applicaties en productiestraten zijn in transitie en toe aan vernieuwing. Als Data Scientist IT zijn dit je werkzaamheden: Je haalt klantwensen en ideeën op en vertaalt deze in een software ontwerp en uiteindelijke bruikbare applicatie waarmee zij op hun beurt hun werk nog beter kunnen doen; Je kijkt hierbij naar de mogelijkheden voor hergebruik van software bij meerdere statistische processen en je helpt de eindgebruiker de oplossingen optimaal te benutten; Je werkt samen met collega’s aan een overstap naar gestandaardiseerde, generieke systemen die voor meerdere statistieken toepasbaar zijn; Je zet systemen van oude programmatuur (o.a. in SPSS) om in nieuwe productiestraten (Python, R en SQL) en onderhoudt deze; Je neemt deel aan werkgroepen en agile-teams. Ook taken op het terrein van het bouwen van analysebestanden kunnen tot je takenpakket behoren; Denk je met de divisie-brede ontwikkeltrajecten. Wie zoeken wij Een doorpakker die initiatief toon en graag samenwerkt met anderen. Je kunt goed schakelen tussen werkzaamheden en bent stressbestendig. Daarnaast: Heb je een afgeronde Wo-opleiding (bij voorkeur richting ICT) of door werkervaring verkregen Wo werk- en denkniveau; Aantoonbare ervaring met Python en R; Ben je in staat om een brug te slaan tussen uitvoering en IT en een vertaalslag te maken van statistiekwensen naar goed werkende softwareapplicaties; Ben je als (ervaren) ontwikkelaar in staat om ideeën om te zetten in goed werkende software applicaties weet wat nodig is om deze te onderhouden en te beheren; Ervaring met Powershell is een pré; Als je ervaring hebt met SCRUM, Kanban en andere Agile technieken is dat een pluspunt. Wat bieden wij Een salaris volgens de CAO Rijk van min EUR 3279,- en max EUR 5039,- bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur. De inschaling is afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring. Een uitdagende baan in een dynamisch werkveld waar eigen verantwoordelijkheid nemen binnen passende eigen regelruimte voorop staat. Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerkmogelijkheden* Voor het woon-werkverkeer ontvang je een NS Businesscard* De mogelijkheid om bij een fulltime dienstverband (36 uur) 4 uur per week compensatieverlof op te bouwen als je 40 uur werkt. Een studiefaciliteitenregeling. Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB): Met het IKB kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,37% en vakantiegeld van 8% (in het IKB, flexibel te besteden). Een werkplek met voldoende ruimte voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling. Het CBS volgt de richtlijnen van de Rijksoverheid omtrent COVID-19. Dit houdt in dat we in principe thuiswerken en daar waar het niet anders kan naar het CBS gaan. Meer weten? Voor inhoudelijke informatie over de functie kan contact worden opgenomen met Lisette Eggenkamp via telefoonnummer: 06-11499171 of e-mail: l.eggenkamp@cbs.nl.  Voor vragen over de procedure kan contact worden opgenomen met Jeroen Rutten, Recruiter, via telefoonnummer: 06-52888332 of e-mail: j.rutten@cbs.nl.  Momenteel voeren we de sollicitatiegesprekken virtueel via Zoom. Voor het gesprek ontvang je een link waarmee je toegang krijgt tot een beveiligde omgeving. Je hebt hiervoor een laptop met camera nodig of een mobiel. Je hoeft hiervoor niets te installeren.  Mocht je ons willen bellen voor een mogelijke samenwerking: wij stellen de interesse op prijs, maar vullen al onze (tijdelijke) vacatures zelf in.  Alleen sollicitaties via onze website worden in behandeling genomen. Reacties Je reactie op de vacature Data Scientist IT ontvangen wij graag met je CV en motivatiebrief. Klik op de onderstaande knop.

title: Data Scientist
summary: Squadra Machine Learning Company is een vernieuwend Nederlands bedrijf wat kennis over bedrijfsprocessen, data mining, statistiek en data visualisatie…
description: Squadra Machine Learning Company is een vernieuwend Nederlands bedrijf wat kennis over bedrijfsprocessen, data mining, statistiek en data visualisatie combineert met als doel klanten te helpen met machine learning algoritmes en het toepassen van kunstmatige intelligentie. We hebben een passie voor Data Science en Machine Learning in het bijzonder. Machine Learning is een krachtige techniek waardoor software intelligente taken kan uitvoeren die tot voor kort voornamelijk door mensen uitgevoerd werden. Daarmee helpen we onze klanten diverse bedrijfs- en industriële processen, klantgerichte diensten en andere data gedreven functies op een vernieuwende wijze te automatiseren  Wie ben jij? Je bent in het bezit van een WO-diploma in richting van kunstmatige intelligentie, wiskunde, econometrie of een andere analytische studie. Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van R en/ of Python. Je hebt ervaring in het toepassen van big data-oplossingen in de praktijk Je bent bekend met big data platformen (zoals Hadoop, Spark, etc). Wat bieden wij jou? Kansen om mee te groeien in ons bedrijf voor een langere periode. Marktconform salaris. Iedere middag een verzorgde lunch. Maandelijkse teambuilding en gezamelijke activiteiten.

title: Data Quality Manager
summary:
The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist.
Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little.
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you the experienced Data Quality Manager to help create Mendix’s analytics center of excellence? Do you have a good view on what an analytics center of excellence within a pioneering tech company should look like? Then we are looking for you.  What is our analytics center of excellence (CoE)? Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The analytics center of excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the right decisions. The COE is supported by a technical data engineering team who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (datalake & data warehouse). The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist. However analytics has been recognized as an incredibly important area of investment by Mendix’s management. Therefor we will be hiring several new members in the CoE this year and hope to more than double the size of the team by the end of the year.  What job would you be applying for? You should expect to become the ‘go-to’ person for data. Any person in the organization that has a question about data will probably end up with you and you need to be able to assist them or steer them in the right direction. We expect that you will establish data governance processes and frameworks in the organization that will truly empower the business to use data, instead of having conversations on whether this is ‘good’ or ‘bad’ data. We are looking for someone that can partner up with the business. Mendix is a young and dynamic organization that does not have many established business processes or governance frameworks in place. It will be your challenge to help the business see the value of establishing these governance frameworks and to create them. Mentoring people in the business as well as younger members of our CoE is an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of experience that can help enrich the CoE and raise it to the next level. Overview of activities: Establishing governance frameworks within Mendix that introduces data ownership within each business unit (responsibility and accountability); Establishing governance frameworks and processes around data creation, processing, and reporting within each business unit; Coordinating with stakeholders to gather, map, and document meta data from each business unit (master data management); Coordinating with stakeholders to create a clear overview of data flows between systems and data used in reporting; Setting standards for data quality and data accuracy for products created by the analytics CoE; Monitor and improve data quality and being able to identify and improve the reliability of the data; Being a key consulting stakeholder when the business has questions related to the internal data landscape; Identifying risks and solutions for projects where the internal data landscape is involved; Planning and creating the internal data landscape roadmap and strategy. About you: You are a senior data professional that can help shape our new center of excellence. Our team of analysts is relatively young. Our organization is also new to data driven decision making. We are therefore looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the CoE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a variety of data related roles and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for! Technical requirements: 5+ years’ proven experience and excellent understanding of data administration, (master)data management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.), regulatory aspects (GDPR, HIPAA) and experience with FAIR, data governance and data stewardship principles; Experience with data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python. Business requirements: You are a hands-on person with a “can do” mentality and you are not afraid to set up collaborations, make decisions, set priorities and put them into action in a dynamic environment; You are a critical thinker that is not afraid to challenge the business and move the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making; Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains; Experience as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries (the “go-to data person”); Experience with working in an agile scrum environment; Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues; Able to speak fluent English; Speaking Dutch is a plus. Personal character traits: A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level. The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances (environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively. Assertiveness; the ability to bring one’s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders. Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters. The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support.  If you don’t comply with the following criteria please do not respond to this job offer: All technical requirements; Experienced as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries; Experienced in challenging the business and moving the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making.  Get a taste of Mendix Blue culture and see the latest updates to our product by registering for our annual flagship event, Mendix World 2020 launching on September 1st. Attend live Q&A sessions with leaders from R&D, watch demos of the product in action, and meet the Makers who use Mendix everyday. Registration link: www.mendix.com/mendix-world/?&utm_medium=sales&mxworld=mxrec&utm_campaign=GL-CE-2020-09-01-Mendix-World  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  Organization: Digital Industries Company: Mendix Technology B.V. Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

title: Internship Validation Heatstress Data
summary:
In addition, Royal HaskoningDHV employs a score of talented data scientists who are at the forefront of related developments.
We also require the following:
description: Details  Duration  Minimum of 4 months   Location  Depending on government’s Covid regulations at home or at the Royal HaskoningDHV office in Amersfoort or Nijmegen.    Assignment Use statistical analyses to validate the results of historical climatological measurements with the results of our heat method.  Background info and problem statement Within Royal HaskoningDHV we have developed the Heat Monitor to be able to calculate heat stress for municipalities and other customers. The Heat Monitor uses the UCAM-method, which calculates the heat island effect during a heat wave in the Netherlands. The UCAM method uses different neighborhood types (''Local Climate Zones'') and other area characteristics to calculate heat stress.  To improve this method and therefore our product, we want to carry out a validation study. This research will consist of comparing temperature data (on basis of the UCAM-method) with measurements taken in the past. You will collect different temperature data from heat waves in the past and compare them with the data we use now. It is important to involve different urban environments and multiple regions in the Netherlands in the validation. Based on your outcome, improvement proposals are formulated.  Research questions To what extent do historical measurements correspond to the results of our method (UCAM)? How do the results relate to different Local Climate Zones and other characteristics? Your profile For this assignment you will work a lot with quantitative data (such as GIS and Excel), therefore a quantitative, data-oriented mindset is required. You furthermore have affinity with the weather and climate and enjoy working with meteo-data. Due course, you will develop a feeling for the practical use of the UCAM-method by working with our advisors. We also require the following: A relevant HBO/WO study (environmental sciences / environmental sciences / physics / ...) in which you have basic knowledge of GIS (Geographical Information System) Basic knowledge of statistics Interested in data analytics. Affinity in working with Microsoft Excel and/or other data validation applications. Optional: programming skills in Python or R.  What we offer Royal HaskoningDHV is part of the top 5 consultancy and engineering firms in the Netherlands. Following an internship or graduation research here is a good start for a successful career with us or elsewhere. You will become a full-fledged employee and will get to know the organization from the inside. You will work together with people who, like you, aspire to get the best out of every challenge.  We have an inspiring working environment within a professional and successful firm. Our company culture stands apart in having the freedom and responsibility to develop your own initiatives. We strive to a have a balance between work and personal life. Naturally you will receive a fitting compensation for your work.  We offer you an environment in which you will work together with extremely motivated colleagues who belong in the top of GEO-ICT in the Netherlands. In addition, Royal HaskoningDHV employs a score of talented data scientists who are at the forefront of related developments.  Apply If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us by sending an email to [email protected] with the name of the vacancy in the subject.  If you want to apply, please upload your CV and letter of motivation via the RHDHV portal (click Apply). Incomplete applications will not be considered.

title: Global Data Scientist | FMCG | Amsterdam
summary:
Identify valuable consumer touchpoint data sources to help define data requirements.

description: For one of my clients, I am looking for a Global Data Scientist. Essentials – 4+ years experience as a Data Scientist – Proven experience in building predictive models and machine learning algorithms – Extensive knowledge of relevant programming languages like; R, Python etc. – Experience with visualization tools like Tableau, Qliksense etc. – Experience working on different projects at once and talking to stakeholders – Self-motivated, communicator Interested? kai@analysepeople.nl

title: Flavor Scientist
summary:
Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email.
Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition,…
description: Job ID: 41995 Date: Feb 22, 2021 Job function: Research & Development Experience level: Experienced Hire Business: DSM Food Specialties Flavor Scientist DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com . The DSM Biotechnology Center (DBC) in Delft is the main center for biotechnological Research and Development (R&D) within DSM. The DBC steers the biotechnology competence within DSM and is responsible for the realization of biotechnological innovations and the development of new products and cost-effective production processes for DSM business units such as DSM Food Specialties, DSM Nutritional Products, and DSM Bioproducts & Services. As part of DBC, within the Center for Food innovation (CFI), the new Savory Ingredients and Meat Alternatives Workgroup focuses on the development of product and process innovations in the area of savory ingredients and meat alternatives. Within this workgroup, there is a vacancy for a: Flavor Scientist Delft The Role Develop new flavor ingredients and/or solutions for key market segments, i.e. savory, plant-based meat alternatives, dairy and dairy alternatives, beverages and baking; Correlate physico-chemical properties of ingredients with their applicability and release kinetics (related to application); Substantiation of the activity our products at multi-dimensional levels by employing your knowledge on the chemistry and sensing of flavors, food science and consumer response; Demonstrate clear proof of the benefits of new creations by understanding its full potential as well as giving input for product positioning to the Marketing & Application teams; Improve and develop molecular flavor expertise, with insight on the impact of our products across applications and markets; Supervision of sensory experts, by defining design of experiments for sensory evaluation and interpretation of statistical analysis of the results; Support to our regulatory departments with respect the positioning in countries in which we operate; Generate comprehensive reporting and documentation of results and experiments, including preparation of presentations; Working in multidisciplinary and agile project teams with Application, Sensory, Analysis and BioIT experts to create new and improve existing product(s). The Ideal PhD or comparable level in the field of (bio)organic chemistry, food chemistry or equivalent, with several years of experience with food flavors, flavor creation and/or flavor chemistry; Thorough understanding of molecular, biological, physics and sensorial background of flavor (i.e. aroma, taste, trigeminal and texture related aspects) and translate this to application and product optimization & processing (flavor and off-flavor); Able to connect to the experts in Flavor Analytics and Sensory; Having a strong external network, including flavor houses, relevant service providers, academia as well as consumer goods manufacturers; Should be able to represent DSM at symposia, in Public Private Partnerships and building connections to other DSM sites and business units; Capable of offering assistance to technical sales linking market developments to science and external trends; Proven track record (e.g. peer-reviewed publications and/or patents) in relevant fields; Solutions-driven, entrepreneurial and flexible; Team player, with organizing skills, supervising technicians, and if needed takes active part in experiments.  The Reward We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an open and pleasant atmosphere with many opportunities for personal input, plenty of room for discussions with fellow professionals and personal development. Terms and conditions of employment as well as fringe benefits are up to market standards. Salary depends on your education and experience and is based on the Collective Labor Agreement DSM Gist Services. Procedure & Contact Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV & motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Martin Zwart / Recruitment Business Partner ( martin.zwart@dsm.com ).  Reference check procedures and an assessment can be part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be informed when these procedures are required. Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on

title: Data scientist
summary:
Als Data scientist bén je de intelligentie van i2i.
Ervaring met verwerken / analyseren medische (declaratie) data.
Omzetten van hypotheses in analyses.
description: Omschrijving Leuk je te ontmoeten… Wij zijn i2i, een jonge, ambitieuze, doelgerichte en intelligente organisatie gevestigd in Amsterdam, die zich richt op één van de belangrijkste maatschappelijke uitdagingen in de zorg: de verbetering van kosteneffectiviteit en kwaliteit in de zorg. Hoe kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat we het beste rendement op iedere geïnvesteerde euro in de zorg realiseren? Wij hebben hiervoor het ‘Doelmatig Direct Declareren Partnership’ (DDD-Partnership)-model ontwikkeld, waarmee zorgverleners die bewezen zinnige zorg leveren worden beloond. Het vertrouwen tussen verzekeraar en zorgverlener wordt hiermee vergroot, de administratieve lasten nemen af en de zorggelden worden aantoonbaar zinnig besteed. Met ruim 30 collega’s werken wij samen met ziekenhuizen, apotheken en GGZ-instellingen aan zinnige zorg. Deze zorgaanbieders realiseren hiermee voor hen voordelen als betere inkoopvoorwaarden, minder administratieve lasten, verbetering van interne processen en een (nog) beter maatschappelijk imago. Dagelijks is i2i in gesprek met medisch specialisten gericht op het realiseren van een gedragsverandering in kosteneffectiviteit en kwaliteit van geleverde zorg. Wat je gaat doen Als Data scientist bén je de intelligentie van i2i. Je gebruikt je analytische talent om verbeterpotentieel in de kosteneffectiviteit en kwaliteit van de zorg te identificeren. Deze hypotheses vertaal je in haarscherpe analyses die tot overtuigende inzichten en aanbevelingen leiden. Met als uiteindelijke doel een gedragsverandering bij zorgverleners te realiseren die leidt tot doelmatigere en kwalitatief betere zorg. Activiteiten Identificeren van verbeterpotentieel in kosteneffectiviteit en kwaliteit van zorg Omzetten van hypotheses in analyses Uitvoeren MS SQL/R/Python analyses Communiceren en rapporteren van inzichten uit analyses Aanbod Kans om jouw talent in te zetten om een maatschappelijke bijdrage te leveren aan het betaalbaar houden en kwalitatief verbeteren van de zorg Stimulerende en plezierige werkomgeving met versneld groeipad, waarin jouw ontwikkeling centraal staat: o.a. via de i2i Data Science Academy Inspirerende collega’s van uitmuntend kaliber Marktconforme beloning Vereisten Kwalificaties Afgeronde WO opleiding. Pre: Econometrie, Natuurkunde of andere beta-opleiding Creatief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht Teamspeler met capaciteit om zelfstandig te werken Detailgeoriënteerd: levert feilloze kwaliteit Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en/of Engelse taal Beheersing van het Nederlands bij Engelse talige kandidaten Pre Ervaring met data-analyse Ervaring met verwerken / analyseren medische (declaratie) data Ervaring met geautomatiseerde generatie van rapportages Uitgebreide kennis van Excel Kennis van databases / SQL / R / Python Kennis van machine learning technieken Interesse? Neem contact op met Birgitta de Gruijter (020 – 7521964 / of via e-mail) Acquisitie door recruiters naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld

title: MEDIOR/SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
description: In this position you will be responsible for developing new technologies for machines and vehicles. You will use data analytics and machine learning techniques to predict machine behavior and derive the optimal settings for robots, autonomous vehicles and industrial machines. We’d love to hear from you. | Your challenges? In this position you work together in a research team that combines expertise in artificial intelligence with expertise in the operation and control of machines and vehicles. Take the lead in developing predictive algorithms to process collected data and derive optimal machine settings. As a medior/senior data scientist, you will: Understand the goal of the measurement campaign and discuss how to gather relevant data with the team; Provide structure and insight into raw data; Find ways to process the flow data; Use current data analytics methods as well as machine learning and deep learning techniques to search for relevant connections between input signals; Use and model predictive algorithms and interpret the results; Draw conclusions and suggest improved parameters to improve the performances or energy efficiency. | What do we expect from you? The candidate with a related Masters or PhD in Engineering has at least 3 years of experience in an industrial or academic environment. For this position we are specifically looking for a candidate with proven track record and interest in the field of experience with experimental designs for real life technology applications. Using your knowledge of or the ability to use a wide range of data analytics methods and machine learning. In-depth knowledge of Phython, and machine learning frameworks. And at least experience with one machine learning toolkit. In addition, the candidate should have a passion about technology of machines and vehicles, has good communication skills and is an active listener who can build sustainable relationships. | What can you expect from TMC? TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world. At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career. As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture. | Why choose for Employeneurship? We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars: You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Is TMC a perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you. Feel Free to Contact Bram Thelen Director Data Science | Nanotechnology | Physics, Netherlands Tel: +31 (0)6 52 89 25 70

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Communication, critical thinking, taking responsibility and taking a stand are essential skills for the role of data scientist.
Are you up for it?
description: Imagine… That all Rabobank customers in the Business Lending domain use the service processes that you helped realize. Within one of the largest Tribes of Rabobank group, with no fewer than 650 colleagues, you will get the opportunity to join one of our squads and work with data. Are you up for it?  Our day-to-day business at the Tribe Business Lending is selling and servicing business lending propositions. Within the area Data & Analytics we focus on data, not only for reporting purposes, but also for developing new products and services. We work on a challenging roadmap and to make this a success, your expertise in data science is crucial for us. We're looking for colleagues who can, help us to realize our ambition to digitalize by providing insights based on data. Create impact You are eager to help others be successful and always think a few steps ahead. You love to challenge the status quo and are eager to come up with and propose creative solutions to problems in a rapidly changing and complex environment. With your background you can easily connect the dots and help to continuously improve our strategy. With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our distributed DevOps teams bring talented people together from all over the world to build, test and run the best solutions for our users. You can work on your tasks autonomously, but should never lose focus on the Tribe goals. With your team you are responsible to get the job done. Hiding behind functions is not allowed! Together we focus on continuous learning within the squads and chapters, and organize knowledge sharing sessions on various topics. Are you going to organize the next? As a team we leverage data through (advanced) analytics to deliver deep insights to our stakeholders in the domestic business lending domain. Our insights facilitate evidence-based agile strategic and tactical decision-making regarding the quality (and volume) of the loan portfolio. We partner e.g. with sector and portfolio management to mutually increase knowledge. Moreover, we improve data-literacy at all levels within our stakeholder community by providing tools, methods and insights. Thijs, data Scientist: The business is always changing and so are it’s wishes. Whether it is a Dashboard, a Machine Learning model or a geographical map: it’s my job to define the required product and work together towards that goal! With you Communication, critical thinking, taking responsibility and taking a stand are essential skills for the role of data scientist. In addition, it is important that you recognize yourself all criteria mentioned below: Skills / Competencies / Experience: Strong mathematical/statistics background (MSc. and/or PhD) Experienced in solving business problems by applying advanced analytics solutions Demonstrate interest in and deep understanding of new analytics techniques Ability to turn analysis into user-friendly visualisations (e.g. using PowerBI) Understands computational complexity of numerical algorithms (e.g. machine learning) Proficient in the Python programming language Experience with Microsoft Azure (incl. CI/CD with Azure DevOps) SQL knowledge Result-oriented, self-motivated and proactive individual Banking domain knowledge (e.g. business banking) Presenting/communicating insights to stakeholders and manage the expectations Ability to tell stories with data (i.e. communicating key insights) Excellent verbal and written communication skills (Dutch/English) Growing a better world together You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as: Yearly we invest heavily in the Dutch voluntary sector. We support 1250 organizations for sports and culture, which are a second home for many people. In a project with Humanitas, we help people with financial problems, struggling to organize their home finances. We find it important that everyone in the Netherlands has a financially healthy life. Within our products and services, we also provide an online housekeeping book, so that we help our customers and clients to get a better grip on their finances. Interested? Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-hour working week), you can also expect: a gross monthly salary in scale 10/11 depending on knowledge and experience; a thirteenth month and holiday pay; an Employee Benefit Budget (10% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout. 100% reimbursement of the costs of home/work travel if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a home/work travel allowance. a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3,5%.  Let's meet Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Data Scientist and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy! Good to know: You can apply until 31 March, 2021 via the Apply button Hila Leupen-Turabaz, Recruiter, would be happy to answer questions regarding the application procedure via hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether the new staff is reliable enough to work at Rabobank. Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link. We want to use your talent in the broadest sense and would like to look at your response more broadly than this vacancy. Your profile will be included in the Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. If you object to this, you can indicate this by e-mail at data.analytics@rabobank.nl The application process for this vacancy may include a technical assessment. Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Data Scientist Health
summary:
Generate insights and develop data driven models from multi-sensor data streams and heterogenous physiological related data.
In this position you will:
description: What you will do We are looking for a Data Scientist Health to expand our OnePlanet team in Wageningen, Gelderland. You will be responsible for translating state-of-the-art data analytics into a machine learning pipeline to extract new parameters and markers for health conditions. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work on huge data sets that are gathered by our OnePlanet partners from Wageningen University or Radboud University. You will be part of a world class multidisciplinary team working on completely new solutions for the Precision Health, Nutrition and Behavior domain of OnePlanet Research Center. In this position you will: Design and deploy a data flow architecture and a machine learning pipeline for the data-driven health program of OnePlanet. Translate state-of-the art data analytics and machine learning techniques into algorithms and solutions to extract new parameters and markers for specific health conditions. Collect, organize, and structure data of existing datasets (for example on digital twins). Take lead in the interaction with customers and stakeholders to define the features and parameters of interest for selected application domains. Generate insights and develop data driven models from multi-sensor data streams and heterogenous physiological related data. Analyze large physiological data sets to find meaningful personalized health parameters. Optimize the computational constraints of the learning algorithms, validate results in real-life and/or (clinical) studies. Create machine learning pipelines in a cloud computing environment. Present and communicate research results and interpretation to internal and external stakeholder. Give direction to other data scientists (as the Data Science team will be expanded in the future). What we do for you We offer a challenging and international environment at the forefront of technology, in an international network of renowned industrial customers. This is your opportunity to bring new technologies to the market that will have an impact on tomorrow’s society. Imec-NL, as an employer of choice, offers you an attractive compensation and benefits package including a 100% employer paid pension plan and flexible working hours. Furthermore, imec-NL offers a wide range of training possibilities. At the same time OnePlanet is a new collaboration of 3 renowned and globally respected research institutes/universities. By joining the OnePlanet team, you will be part of a team of world changers; disruptive innovators and practical thinkers. Here, your ideas will have an impact on our future lives. Who you are PhD degree in Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics or Physics with focus on Machine Learning, Data Mining and Statistical analysis. 3+ years of experience after your Ph.D. in an applied health research environment. Experience in the field of machine learning and with the development of biomedical signal processing, sensor fusion and time series analysis algorithms are a must have. You have understanding of human physiology and experience with human data (sensors, wearables). Knowledge of neural networks and deep learning research, ideally with hands-on experience in Theano, PyTorch, TensorFlow and/or CNTK. Knowledge of Python and Visualization and a working knowledge of MATLAB, C, and Java. Experience with cloud computing such as Hadoop Azure, Amazon and Spark (Data Bricks). Experience in defining experimental protocols, setting-up and running experimental evaluation is desired. Hands-on attitude; which means taking initiatives, thinking pro-actively, having a flexible attitude and solving problems on a daily base. Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken). Interested Are you interested in this position and do you want to learn more about it, then you can connect with Ana Crehuet, Talent Acquisition specialist. You can reach Ana at ana.crehuet.ext@imec.nl. If you wish to apply, then please submit your full resume and a cover letter Click on ‘apply’ to submit your application. You will then be redirected to e-recruiting.

title: GoDataDriven - Data Scientist
summary:
As senior data scientist, you are responsible for the creation of business value using data & AI.
As a senior data scientist you are capable of rapidly learning…
description: As a senior data scientist you are capable of rapidly learning about the domain of our customers, build models and prototypes and coach data scientists in their way of working. How will you help in creating value with Data & AI At GoDataDriven, we build strong data & AI practices to deliver value to our clients and their customers. In the past, our team of data professionals has predicted the daily demand for millions of loaves of bread, built advanced energy-saving algorithms to nationwide scale, and set up data innovation labs at large multinational corporations. We have already enjoyed great success in making top companies AI-driven - just think of what more we can achieve when YOU join our team! As senior data scientist, you are responsible for the creation of business value using data & AI. You are capable to rapidly learn about the domain of our customers and apply your experience with getting data-driven applications into production; not only by yourself but also by coaching and mentoring other people in your team.  What you will do to make data intensive-applications work effectively and securely. You start by assessing the value-driven use cases at the client and a good sense of what success looks like. Then you apply your skills in mathematics, statistics, machine learning and programming to analyze and model data. You work mostly with notebooks in Python and are also able to translate your notebooks into a working prototype. Together with a machine learning engineer or data engineer, you help to get the model into production and assess the value it creates. If required, you also set up a good way of working for your team, with a proper dev-ops for AI approach. When you're working on-site with a client, you eventually come across something really difficult to solve. Luckily, every few weeks everyone from GDD comes to our office to work remotely on their projects and you have the opportunity to discuss and even solve your problems with the help of the hive mind of GDD. And if that would take too long, everybody at GDD is just a quick message away and ready to help you at any time.  COVID-19 update: Luckily, we are doing well during these uncertain times. This job ad isn't fake. We are hiring!  Why this role is the dream job for you if you like to tell a story with data and the latest AI technology if you want to have impact on the bottom line of organisations if you like working for different clients and like the excitement of getting to learn new environments and people once in a while. is not something you want if you have less than 2 years working experience in a similar role if you lack a working knowledge of the Dutch language if you are not excited by working in teams and coaching people in their role as data scientist or analyst If that sounds like you, let's talk.

title: Junior/Medior Data Scientist | Reclame & Marketing | Den Bosch
summary: Vanuit de functie verzamel jij de aanwezige data, maakt deze inzichtelijk en door gebruik te maken van algoritmes kom jij tot conclusies, advies over de…
description: Ben jij gefascineerd door het online gedrag van mensen? Is marketing een domein waar jij je als een vis in het water voelt? Word jij enthousiast van het ontwikkelen en implementeren van algoritmes? Dan past deze functie bij jou! Het bedrijf is een high tech schale-up marketing reclame bureau dat zich voor ruim 150 top E-commerce bedrijven in Nederland en het buitenland inzet bij het opzetten en verbeteren van hun online Adword campagnes. Hierbij gaat het onder andere over het uitbrengen van advies over biedingen, prijszetting van producten, het inzetten van keywords etc. Allemaal bedoelt om de conversie zo hoog mogelijk te krijgen door middel van een constante monitoring van grootschalige campagnes. Functie omschrijving Samen met je collega’s wordt jij verantwoordelijk voor diverse klantprojecten waarbij het verbeteren van de campagnes centraal staat. Vanuit de functie verzamel jij de aanwezige data, maakt deze inzichtelijk en door gebruik te maken van algoritmes kom jij tot conclusies, advies over de verbetering hiervan en de verwachtingen (predictive analytics) als gevolg. Functie eisen Om deze rol goed te kunnen vervullen wordt gezocht naar iemand die een afgeronde MSc of PhD heeft in de richting van informatiekunde, natuurkunde, econometrie of toegepaste wiskunde etc. Verder spreek je de Nederlandse taal en beschik je over een sterk analytisch denkvermogen.
