Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwikkelen en implementeren van algoritmes, hebt een voorliefde voor marketing en bent een echte teamspeler. Tot slot heb je eerder gewerkt met technieken als; R, Python, Hadoop etc.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
At least two years of experience in data science.
We're data-driven with software at our core.
Our data is registered, logged, consistent...immaculate.
description: At Picnic we care about health and safety, so currently all interviews are done online and our team is working from home. We keep a close eye on the developments around Covid-19, and support your relocation to Amsterdam when it is safe to do so. It is possible to start working remotely with us - have a peek at how the remote onboarding is going here.  Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? At Picnic, you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking startup culture, where everything you do matters. With a data-driven approach and an incredible service, Picnic strives to make grocery shopping simple, fun, and affordable for everyone. Known for our just-in-time supply-chain and a unique last-mile delivery strategy, we have become one of the fastest-growing companies of the Netherlands! We're data-driven with software at our core. Our world-class developers write immaculate code to support our app-only supermarket. We're on a quest for like-minded people to be part of the future of digital grocery shopping. Where you fit in As one of our Data Scientists, you work on creating intelligent, automated systems to solve our company's biggest problems, at scale. You don't stop with building a model - you productionize it alongside the wide variety of models we already have running in production. In our innovative startup environment, you work closely with business leads to identify and solve problems leveraging machine learning. With the Growth team, you build a model that tells us how much orders we can expect in a day, week, or month so that our operations can grow accordingly. Together with Customer Success, you construct a system to classify and label issue types in the messages we receive from our customers. You are more than a model builder: you're a blend of internal consultant, software engineer, and applied mathematician. You might think – 'I like the sound of it, but 80% of my job is going to be cleaning data'. Not here. Our data is registered, logged, consistent...immaculate. There's no wasting time. We are a mature team with the infrastructure, tools, and expertise to get models into production. We have shared some of our past machine learning projects: https://blog.picnic.nl/tagged/machine-learning What challenges await you Projects in various fields, such as: Recommendation systems: generating useful in-app grocery suggestions for our customers Search and suggest Fraud and outlier detection Forecasting demand: order volumes, article demand and trip forecasting, used Picnic-wide Predicting delivery drop-off times for our distribution Natural Language Processing: create automated systems to categorize and label Customer Success tickets Improving operational efficiency in our automated fulfillment center Working closely with business leads to identify opportunities, define the business case, and scope out the requirements Owning your own project from inception to production Developing tools and enhancements for our cloud-based data science platform Who you are Master's degree or higher in AI, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field At least two years of experience in data science Superb communication skills and ability to transfer knowledge to business stakeholders and the rest of the data science team Strong Python and SQL skills Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and CI is a plus Comfortable with taking responsibility and working independently Out-of-the-box thinking, able to take the initiative, and a nothing-is-impossible mindset Quality control: commitment to excellence, performance, and efficiency ‍ Technologies we use Python (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Tensorflow, aiohttp - or we build our own packages) SQL (Snowflake, Postgres) Git Kubernetes Docker Tableau Picnic perks Located in Amsterdam, our fun-filled office is the best place for you to focus on your Picnic projects. Equipped with your favorite hardware and surrounded by like-minded people, you'll grow professionally and personally, while enjoying the startup life along the way. We like to keep our 40-hour work-week flexible around here. Our tech team consists of 15 product teams, which handle tons of innovative projects. Sharing, mentoring and keeping up to date is a must at Picnic: Meetups, webinars, Lunch & Learn sessions, and our very own Tech academy make sure that's taken care of. Your soft skills will get some attention as well, with tailored training and courses. Our salaries are market competitive and our pension program will put your mind at ease. Relocation package? Sure! If you join Picnic from abroad, we'll cover your trip to Amsterdam, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in. If you are joining us from a country that doesn't allow traveling to the Netherlands just yet due to Covid-19, there's a chance that your onboarding could take place remotely. We had lots of new team members starting their Picnic-journey remotely already, you can have a peek at how it's going here. What are you waiting for? Get in touch! And no worries, the whole process is currently fully remote, to keep everyone safe and healthy.

title: Data Scientist bij Transavia
summary: Je hebt een WO-diploma in een business analytics of data science gerelateerde studie en/of relevante ervaring in een data science positie;
description: Wij zoeken jou als Data Scientist  Voor ons Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team bij Transavia zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Dit team leidt de transformatie naar het data-gedreven werken, adviseert afdelingen aan de hand van informatie en inzichten, en bouwt aan data- en AI-oplossingen voor klanten en medewerkers van Transavia. Het team is opgericht om Transavia naar een hoger niveau te brengen in Data & Analytics.  Als Data Scientist ontwikkel je een brede range aan advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen: van recommenders tot forecasting modellen en decision support tools. Heb jij een passie voor slimme modellen en optimalisatie strategieën? Ben jij gedreven om de business nog slimmer te laten werken en klanten beter te servicen met advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen? Dan ben jij mogelijk de Data Scientist naar wie wij op zoek zijn!  Wat ga je doen? Je werkt aan AI, Machine Learning en Optimization oplossingen voor de verschillende domeinen binnen Transavia. Denk aan marketing & sales, revenue management, planning & scheduling, technische dienst, het operations control center, etc. Samen met een Data Analyst en/of Engineer vertaal je de doelstellingen van het AI/ML product door in data (kwaliteits)vereisten en een opzet voor het experiment/prototype of nieuwe release. Samen met de Data Engineers werk je aan de data en machine learning pipelines om het model in productie te kunnen zetten in onze Microsoft Azure cloud omgeving. De resultaten deel je (tussentijds) middels visuals en dashboards. Met andere woorden, je werkt aan de AI/ML oplossingen van begin tot eind: van concept, ontwikkeling en implementatie tot beheer en monitoring van de tools in productie; van MVP/prototype tot verschillende opvolgende releases. Zo optimaliseren we flight schedules, automatiseren we real time aanbevelingen voor klanten, forecasten we de benodigde crew standby en call center bezetting of bedenken we hoe we ons netwerk en vluchtschema kunnen optimaliseren.  Je zal onderdeel uitmaken van het Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team dat naast Data Scientists bestaat uit de Lead SDI, Lead Data Scientist, Analytics Translators, Data Engineers, Data Analysts en Business Consultants. Je zal veel samenwerken met jouw SDI collega’s, de business en onze (data) collega’s bij Transavia Frankrijk.   Wie ben jij? Je herkent je in onze waarden daadkrachtig, bevlogen, verantwoordelijk en vriendelijk, én je hebt dat “tikkeltje lef”; Je hebt een WO-diploma in een business analytics of data science gerelateerde studie en/of relevante ervaring in een data science positie; Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uur per week; Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.  Als Data Scientist Heb je data science kennis (vanuit zowel de theorie als praktijk) op het gebied van advanced analytics, machine learning, operations research, statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation, etc; Gebruik je deze kennis om een probleem uit de business te vertalen naar een wiskundige en technische oplossing; Kun je problemen, maar ook kansen identificeren en begrijpen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om je data om te zetten in een concreet advies waar jij zelf, of het team, mee aan de slag kan; Heb je kennis van verschillende AI/ML best practices en ben je continu op zoek hoe je de kwaliteit van onze producten kan verbeteren (en hoe dit breed in het team toegepast kan worden); Heb je ervaring met Python en veelgebruikte packages (bijv. Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark, etc.) of soortgelijke programmeertalen en de ambitie om Python te leren; Kun je goed overweg met SQL, Git en CLI. Ervaring met Cloud en/of MLops is een pré; Werk je agile. Wat je ontdekt, pas je gelijk toe.  Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Werken voor dé nummer 1 budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij; Vrijheid om je functie naar eigen inzicht vorm te geven; Veel ruimte en initiatieven voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling; (afhankelijk van salaris) een eindejaarsuitkering; 22 verlof- en 4 adv dagen o.b.v. een fulltime dienstverband; Vriendelijke en bevlogen collega’s; Last but not least; ben je reislustig, dan is onze IPB regeling (tegen mooie tarieven vliegen indien plaats beschikbaar) zeker de moeite waard! Deze functie is ingeschaald in een functiegroep 10 of 11. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring doen wij een aanbieding van tussen de € 3.202,- en € 6.120,- euro bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband.  Over Transavia Ons motto is: ‘We make low cost feel good.’ We zetten daarbij graag een stap extra voor onze passagiers en voor elkaar. De sfeer in de organisatie kenmerkt zich door bevlogen medewerkers met een groen hart! Elke dag werken we met elkaar samen om een gemeenschappelijk doel te behalen: een memorabele klantbeleving.  Transavia is een dynamische organisatie (never a dull moment) die continu probeert bij te blijven in een veranderende luchtvaartwereld. Wil jij graag werken in een omgeving met enthousiaste daadkrachtig collega’s die oog hebben voor elkaar? Krijg je energie van verandering en vernieuwing en voel jij je het prettigst in een omgeving waar je regisseur bent van je eigen werk? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.  Is deze functie jou op het lijf geschreven en wil je solliciteren? Ben jij de Data Scientist die wij zoeken en kom je ons team versterken? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button. Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op ons via recruitment@transavia.com  Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen voor deze vacature als Data Scientist bij Transavia? Bedankt, maar hier gaan we niet op in. We werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf.

title: Associate Scientist Genetics
summary:
Processing data as well as working with tools to analyze data (ex. Spotfire, Geneious);
Interested in laboratory automation and use of data-management systems;
description: Job ID: 41921 Date: Mar 13, 2021 Job function: Research & Development Experience level: Graduate Hire Business: DSM Food Specialties Associate Scientist Genetics DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com . DSM Biotechnology Center (DBC) is the primary location for biotechnological Research and Development and is responsible for the realization of biotechnological innovations and the developments of new bio-products and sustainable bio-production processes. DBC has strong competences in high-throughput screening, microbial strain development, bio-informatics and modeling, industrial bioprocessing, biochemistry, application, and analytics. DBC is well connected to the DSM R&D hubs in the USA and China and external research institutes and universities. The Center for Biotech Innovation is part of DBC and works at the interface of development and production of novel biotechnology innovations. By using high-throughput methods, strain engineering and screening techniques, we improve microbial strain performance to produce diverse products like sweeteners, biofuels and enzymes. Within the Center for Biotech Innovation of DBC there is a vacancy for the position of: Associate Scientist Strain engineering Delft  The Challenge As an associate scientist in the Center for Biotech Innovation you will be working with yeast (and other microbes) to screen and develop novel strains for product innovation. DNA assembly, strain engineering, cell biology knowledge and experience in metabolic engineering is essential to building a variety of high-performing microorganisms for the production of diverse biomolecules.  We need members of our team to be detail-oriented, multi-taskers that are collaborative and can fully engage in the execution of the workflows. We are looking to add someone to our team who is: Completed PhD in the area of molecular biology/genetics/microbiology/life sciences/ biotechnology or related expertise with relevant experience in molecular genetics of optimization of microorganisms (fungal/yeast) can be an advantage; Detailed knowledge and skills in genetic engineering concepts and molecular biology techniques, like PCR, DNA assembly, DNA purification, DNA sequencing, DNA transformation, gene expression, etc.; Microbial physiology expertise can be an advantage; Interested in laboratory automation and use of data-management systems; Able to independently manage multiple on-going tasks, small projects/activities including among others writing/design of workplans, progress reporting, and executing daily workflow processes; Capable of mentoring and training others on established or to be established protocols/expertise’s Proactive in initiating improvements in the workflows/processes An creative approach and hands-on mentality in coordinating multiple topics at the same time is seen as a useful and contributing value as well as taking the initiative in connecting to team members. Responsibilities Perform an active role in shaping projects and opportunities together with our business partners and translate project goals into concrete and accepted workplans; Design, plan and execute strain engineering strategies which can comprise using molecular biology tools and mutagenesis and screening approaches; Planning and performing experimental work independently and/or collaborating with- and coaching of technicians in a safe and effective way; Take an active and leading role in designing experiments and testing hypotheses in collaboration with multidisciplinary R&D team members and for example project managers, IP, regulatory affairs; Utilizing automated liquid handling platforms and custom software to run automated DNA assembly and microbial strain construction workflows; Processing data as well as working with tools to analyze data (ex. Spotfire, Geneious); Interpreting, analyzing and then reporting the results of experiments to team members in meetings and reports. The Reward Working for DSM means the opportunity to really contribute to improve people’s lives and solving the challenges of today’s world. Challenging jobs, career opportunities and an inspiring environment allow you to enhance your personal development. DSM recognizes that the on-going success of the company depends on the continued development and engagement of our employees and pursues a fair and competitive remuneration policy, recognizing individual and team competencies and performance. To learn more about DSM's HR vision and policy, please visit our website at www.dsm.com/careers . The Procedure & Contact Please apply on-line by uploading your CV & motivation letter in English via the career portal. For additional questions you can contact, Martin Zwart / Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner ( martin.zwart@dsm.com / +31623431261). Reference check procedures and an assessment can be part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be informed when these procedures are required. Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on

title: (Sr. Associate) Scientist Computational
summary: In those teams you will closely collaborate with bioinformaticians, data scientists, experimentalists and (bio)chemical engineers.
description: Job ID: 40861 Date: Mar 13, 2021 Job function: Research & Development Experience level: Experienced Hire Business: DSM Food Specialties (Sr. Associate) Scientist Computational DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com .  The DSM Biotechnology Center (DBC) in Delft is the main center for biotechnological Research and Development (R&D) within DSM. The DBC steers the biotechnology competence within DSM and is responsible for the realization of biotechnological innovations and the development of new sustainable products and cost-effective production processes for DSM business units such as DSM Food Specialties, DSM Nutritional Products, and DSM Bioproducts & Services.  As part of DBC, within the Center for Biotechnology innovation (CBI), the Biomanufacturing at Scale team is responsible for innovating, developing and implementing bioprocesses from small to industrial scale. Within this center there is a vacancy for a:  (Senior Associate) Scientist Computational Fluid Dynamics Delft  The Challenge As an (Sr. Associate) Scientist computational fluid dynamics (CFD) you will have the responsibility to maintain and further develop the CFD expertise within DBC, including the required software and hardware systems. You will apply this expertise in R&D projects as a member of multidisciplinary project teams. In those teams you will closely collaborate with bioinformaticians, data scientists, experimentalists and (bio)chemical engineers. You connect to the global scientific fermentation and chemical engineering community. You are able to clearly report and communicate the results of your work. It is expected that you will actively contribute to scouting and acquisition of new R&D projects that can benefit from applying CFD simulations. You keep up with external developments in your field of expertise and contribute to the professional know-how of the Center.  The Ideal You hold a PhD degree in the fields of (Bio)Chemical Engineering or Physics, with a formal training in CFD as part of your curriculum and at least 3 years of experience in applying CFD models during your education and/or research work. You have a basic understanding of industrial biotechnology and/or process industry. We are looking for proactive, entrepreneurial person with a high quality standard, and a strong drive for results and able to work in an agile environment. You are a team player, a good communicator, fluent in English. The Reward We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an open and pleasant atmosphere with many opportunities for personal input, plenty of room for discussions with fellow professionals and personal development. Terms and conditions of employment as well as fringe benefits are up to market standards. Salary depends on your education and experience and is based on the Collective Labor Agreement DSM Gist Services. Procedure & Contact Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your CV & motivation letter in English. Due to data privacy reasons we do not handle any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided. For additional questions you can contact, Martin Zwart / Recruitment Business Partner ( martin.zwart@dsm.com ).  Reference check procedures and an assessment can be part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be informed when these procedures are required. Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. For more information about DSM see http://www.dsm.com or connect on

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Agrifirm is looking for a full-time (40-hour) data scientist with specialist with applied data base insights & experience.
Do you have a “yes, I can” DNA?
description: Data scientist Are you interested in digital world of agriculture? Do you want to contribute to the development of sustainable farming systems through digital & data driven solutions? Are you innovative, a team player who is enthusiastic? Do you have a “yes, I can” DNA? Then Agrifirm is looking for you! Function Agrifirm is looking for a full-time (40-hour) data scientist with specialist with applied data base insights & experience. As a Data Scientist you will contribute to the development & implementation of digital solutions. You will work on different levels in strong connection with the Product Owner and Research and you will also be the bridge between the product team and the data science department. You will be working in a multi-disciplinary team in a network organization with limited hierarchy and room for developmemt. Tasks and responsibilities: Responsible for defining and setup of (joint) research and implementation projects, according to RAG/arable strategy. Acting as a project leader or contributes to (joint) research and development projects. Active networking and connecting RAG/Arable with external institutions for knowledge gathering and development of future oriented added value concepts. Profile Experience in working in a business environment. In possession of an MSc Degree mathematics, econometrics or similar You do not mind travelling. You speak English fluently. Minimum 4 years’ experience in the field of soil science. Knowledge of Soil Science and experience in data handling and modeling. Experience in working with R, Pyhton and DataBricks Competences You have strong communication skills and like to network.. You are a team player, are enthusiastic and know how to take ownership. Project management is something you are good at. You are market oriented and know how to make and create impact. What can you expect from us? A challenging full-time job within an enthusiastic and committed team where cooperation and results come first. As a colleague at Agrifirm you will receive the following: An extensive introduction program A good salary Approx. 36 free days (23 holidays & 13 ATV based on a full-time job) Laptop and an iPhone Good secondary employment conditions Extensive development opportunities through our Agrifirm Academy Royal Agrifirm Group Agrifirm's vision is to work every day on a responsible food chain for future generations. We want to ensure that we can continue to offer affordable, healthy and sustainable food to everyone. Agrifirm therefore supplies high-quality products such as animal feed, products for the cultivation of crops and professional advice. Agrifirm was founded in the Netherlands about 120 years ago and is now a leading agricultural cooperative with an international network of subsidiaries located in 16 countries in Europe, South America and Asia and a worldwide distribution network. The head office is located in Apeldoorn and with more than 3,000 committed employees, Agrifirm works every day on a healthy future for farmers and society. Are you our new colleague who knows how to make a difference? Then a great career lies ahead for you at Agrifirm! For more information, please contact Dennis van Straaten, Talent Sourcer, on +316- 27 89 35 32.  You can apply through our website or other portals; please use the application button. You can send your reaction (CV and motivation) to Dennis van Straaten. Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. Although we appreciate the support, Agrifirm does not accept unasked CVs from recruitment agencies. All CVs submitted to Agrifirm by e-mail, internet or directly, without a valid written agreement between Agrifirm and the recruitment agencies, are considered the property of Agrifirm. No fees are paid if the applicable candidate is hired by Agrifirm. An assesment is part of the procedure. Waarom werken bij Agrifirm? Bij Royal Agrifirm Group zijn we gepassioneerd door landbouw. We willen het verschil maken, zorgen voor de toekomst en ambitieuze doelen halen. Samen kunnen we de beste zijn en wereldwijd relevante impact creëren. Bij Agrifirm werk je mee aan een verantwoorde voedselketen voor de toekomstige generaties.

title: Mars Project Scientist (M/F)
summary:
Ensuring that scientific data is made available to the community and supporting its utilisation.
Coordination of all aspects of the science for payloads,…
description: Tasks and Responsibilities Coordination of all aspects of the science for payloads, missions and systems for which science benefits are intended, including: Establishing and supporting a user community, engaging them in science definition activities and preparing the establishment of a formal Science Team Generating science and research objectives and requirements; supporting the Project Manager / Technical Officer in establishing a technical baseline and system requirements that address the science and research requirements; iterating the requirements during studies; assessing the technical baseline and performance against the science requirements in reviews Preparing the Science Management Plan Leading or supporting research activities that support the development of missions and system concepts and requirements Preparing and coordinating Announcements of Opportunity, Peer Reviews and Selection processes for Experiments, Science Teams, and Projects Ensuring that scientific data is made available to the community and supporting its utilisation Initiating and supporting research activities that aid design and implementation. Additional activities: Supporting the formulation of new research activities and concepts within ESA and with Topical Teams and other external scientific groups Recording and tracking actions and requirements for activities in the team Support the planning and coordination of interactions between members of the team Supporting the benefit management, performance tracking and reporting processes of the HRE directorate. Qualifications and Experience A PhD in Mars atmosphere, geology, geophysics, or relevant scientific domain Professional experience in fundamental or applied research, in planetary science (Mars) or space resources utilisation processes Demonstrated experience in coordination of scientific activities Experience and/or familiarity with current ground and space research platforms, research and operations. The successful candidate will have the following skills A proactive approach, with initiative and ability to work independently Ability to: Synthesise, summarise and draw conclusions Adhere to strict standards of confidentiality Work in distributed international teams Strength to cope with schedules and deadlines Excellent organisational and communication skills and attention to details Excellent written and spoken English. What Do We Offer? Working at a prestigious Customer location, in a growing company with Staff located in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands A professional, pleasant atmosphere with motivated and passionate Staff, where autonomy and initiatives are encouraged An interesting remuneration package with a relocation allowance, if applicable A full-time position with an indefinite contract of employment. How To Apply? Please apply to this Job Advert by sending your CV and Motivation Letter (both in English) via our website (www.spaceapplications.com), to the attention of Mr. Olivier Lamborelle. Applications received through the Career page of our website are reviewed in priority.  The candidate shall be eligible to work in the European Union or in possession of a European Blue Card for two or more years. We are looking for someone to start as of 19th April 2021.  Image Credit: ESA/DLR/FU Berlin

title: Freelance Data Scientist Pricing
summary:
Verzamelen, prepareren en interpreteren van de beschikbare data.
Toch zijn we zelf nog lang niet klaar met onze ontwikkeling als data specialisten.
description: Independer wil het beste aanbod in vaste lasten voor elke klant. Door zelf passende (verzekerings-) producten te ontwikkelen kunnen we nog beter aansluiten op wat onze klanten nodig hebben. Ben jij de Data Scientist Pricing die ons helpt productontwikkeling een boost te geven?  Wat ga je doen als Freelance Data Scientist Pricing? Bij Independer helpen we onze klanten met het zelf regelen van hun financiële zaken. We bieden overzicht, kennis en slimme tools. Zo kunnen klanten zelf een deskundige keuze maken. En waar we al een groot assortiment aan producten aanbieden, willen we dit assortiment nog steeds laten groeien. En dat is precies waar we jouw hulp bij kunnen gebruiken. Want aan het eind van de opdracht staat er een goede werkwijze/ raamwerk om sneller en beter nieuwe producten te ontwikkelen. Dit doe je als onderdeel van zowel het Productontwikkeling als het Data Science team. Een mooie combinatie van zowel de business kant als de data science & machine learning technieken. Concreet ga je aan de slag met: Verzamelen, prepareren en interpreteren van de beschikbare data. Ontwikkelen van modellen die de schaderisico's zo goed mogelijk kunnen voorspellen. Bepalen van rekenregels door statistische technieken zoals machine learning. Actief delen van de resultaten met de belangrijkste stakeholders. Oftewel, met jouw kennis & ervaring breng je de ontwikkeling van nieuwe verzekeringsproducten in een versnelling. Waarom juist Independer? Waar corona natuurlijk een beetje roet in het eten gooit qua werken op kantoor, durven wij nog steeds te zeggen dat je terecht komt bij een gezellige en hechte club mensen. Professionals die echt het beste willen voor de klant en gedreven zijn in hun specialisme. En waar jij je eigen opdracht hebt als Freelancer sta je er zeker niet alleen voor. Het leuke aan de opdracht, is dat je met dit project absoluut impact gaat maken op de organisatie. We bieden een grote diversiteit aan data en daarmee een uitdagende omgeving om in te werken. We loggen veel en goed. Wat maakt dat we alle data in huis hebben om hier het verschil mee te maken. Toch zijn we zelf nog lang niet klaar met onze ontwikkeling als data specialisten. En we zijn dan ook benieuwd naar jouw tips & tricks.  Je bent per direct beschikbaar voor 2-3 dagen per week. En dat voor een project van 4 maanden. Verder letten wij op het volgende: Je hebt bij voorkeur 3+ jaar relevante werkervaring specifiek met het onderdeel Pricing. Business kennis van het verzekeringsdomein. Ruime ervaring met programmeren in Python en SQL. R is een pré. Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met het verantwoord toepassen van Data Science methoden en statistische technieken. Vlotte sociale- en communicatieve vaardigheden, zodat je je inzichten en oplossingen helder kunt overbrengen. Je begrijpt en beheerst de Nederlandse taal. De pictogrammen hieronder gelden voor een groot deel ook voor deze opdracht. En met vragen kun je altijd bij onze recruiter (Janne Koel) terecht.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Ontwikkelen van (technische) data science oplossingen welke waarde toevoegen voor de business;
Uitstekende beheersing van Python en R, aangevuld met andere…
description: De strijd aangaan met complexe problemen? Daar hou jij wel van. Je hebt oog voor detail, een enorme passie voor data, werkt graag samen met anderen en kunt makkelijk technische vereisten in duidelijke taal overbrengen.  Naar vacatureoverzicht Data Scientist Zet in favorieten Deel deze vacature Zet in favorieten Deel deze vacature Insights and data | Banken en Kapitaalmarkten, Verzekeringen, Utilities, Publieke sector, Aerospace en Defensie, Automotive, Consumer Products en Retail, Electronics en High Tech, Gezondheidszorg en Life Sciences, Manufacturing en Industrial Products, Media & Entertainment, Natural Resources, Telecom, Transport & Distributie | Full time Jouw uitdaging Met jouw inzicht in cijfers, data en techniek leg je elke complexiteit simpel uit aan de klant. Aan de ene kant zit je in het technische deel van het team waar je de problemen begrijpt en oplost via de juist gekozen methode. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan regressies en decision trees en het gebruik van machine learning met open sources als Python of R. Aan de andere kant zit je op de zachte kant, waarbij je de bevindingen begrijpelijk presenteert en de klant meeneemt in de oplossingen. Klanttevredenheid is belangrijk voor je, dus je luistert goed en geeft inzichtelijke antwoorden die de klant het vertrouwen geeft dat het probleem wordt opgelost. Een greep uit de werkzaamheden die hierbij komen kijken: Ontwikkelen van (technische) data science oplossingen welke waarde toevoegen voor de business; Nieuwe initiatieven kunnen identificeren (solutioning) op basis van organisatorische processen Modellen naar productie kunnen brengen (dus niet alleen maar experimenteren met data science) – AI/ML-OPS Kunnen aansturen van een team van Data Scientists op basis van inhoudelijke expertise Wat jij ons brengt? WO-opleiding afgerond in richting van; IT, Computer Sciences, Engineering of vergelijkbaar; Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist; Kennis van de theorie en applicatie van statistische en machine learning modellen; Uitstekende beheersing van Python en R, aangevuld met andere relevante data science tools/technieken; Aantoonbare ervaring en pro activiteit in kennisoverdracht, ontwikkeling van de community en trainingen; Je hebt ervaring met werken in Agile/Scrum teams; Je beheerst de Nederlandse én Engelse taal vloeiend. Wat wij jou bieden? Onze Global Insights & Data-organisatie maakt deel uit van leiders in de volgende generatie data-oplossingen. Samen met ons wereldwijde ecosysteem van technologiepartners ontwerpen en implementeren we state-of-the-art oplossingen om waarde te genereren uit een steeds meer datagedreven wereld en daarmee onze klanten te helpen de exponentieel groeiende enorme hoeveelheid data te beheersen en te verkennen. Daarbij heerst er binnen Capgemini een open sfeer waarbij iedereen bereid is elkaar te helpen. Je werkt voor grote (internationale) organisaties en aan de meest uitlopende projecten. Naast hard werken en inhoudelijke kennissessies, kun je natuurlijk ook rekenen op maandelijkse borrels en gezellige lunches met collega’s. Wat kun je nog meer verwachten? Direct een vast contract met een passend salaris; Een premievrij pensioen waarbij je de mogelijkheid om zelf ook bij te dragen; Een vergoeding voor je reiskosten. Deze kun je bijvoorbeeld gebruiken voor een leaseauto, NS business card of beide; 26 vakantiedagen en vakantiegeld; Een laptop en simkaart zodat je overal kunt werken.

title: Associate Scientist Data Engineer
summary:
Strong affinity for data engineering, data(base) management, and data analysis.
You will also be responsible for data verification and translating these data…
description: What will your job be As an Associate Scientist Data Engineer you will support multiple projects moving into late stage by means of (historical) data analysis. Furthermore, you will increase data-integrity by performing additional reviews. You will be primarily responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automation systems that support process development activities The automation systems in scope include but are not limited to GxP excel VBA-enabled spreadsheets, Python Dash, several types of Graphical User Interfaces, AWS S3 cloud environment, Microsoft SQL Server, web-based dashboard applications, and Spotfire dashboards In addition, activities related to data extraction via SQL are in scope. You will also be responsible for data verification and translating these data into reportable formats as well as historical data mining You will be involved in the development and improvement of data management systems The results of your work will be directly used for regulatory submissions What are we looking for For the position of Associate Scientist Data Engineer we are looking for a motivated candidate within the field of Process development who has strong affinity with data management and analysis.  MSc in a relevant discipline in biopharmaceutical/biomedical sciences / biochemical engineering / biotechnology / bioinformatics Programming skills and knowledge in Python, SQL, and Visual Basic are required. Specifically in a data-automation context 1-2 years of experience in process development (lab/production/biotechnology) is required Experience working with unstructured data originating from several sources to produce analysis-ready datasets Familiarity with R, Spotfire, or Tableau are considered to be an important advantage Strong affinity for data engineering, data(base) management, and data analysis Experience with production, technology transfer, and knowledge of GMP is an advantage What do we offer Long-term position starting with a contract for 6 months via CheckMark Labrecruitment Salary indication from €2600 gross per month based on a full-time position Full-time position (40 hours/week) Where will you work Pharmaceutical company specialised in the development of vaccines. The Drug Substance Development group develops & characterizes processes for purifying and formulating recombinant viruses from harvest as a vaccine production platform. They will be implemented in a GMP pilot plant facility for the production of clinical trial material and scaled-up for commercial production. More information Sebastiaan Loriaux 088 00 211 26 sebastiaan@checkmark.nl Jurjen Wilschut 088 00 211 22 jurjen@checkmark.nl Ref.nr: 6983

title: AI Scientist
summary:
As an AI scientist, you will:
Analyze data to discover patterns, find opportunities, and develop and apply innovative ML algorithms.
We’d love to hear from you.
description: As an AI Scientist you will work in a top tier team of AI experts, solving real-life cases using latest ML techniques. You are expected to build innovative AI solutions that together with engineers and system developers can be deployed as real-time solutions to provide customer value. We’d love to hear from you. | YOUR CHALLENGES? In this position you'll closely collaborate with an engineering team to bring models into toolkits, and business developers to impress the client. As a AI Scientists you’re expected to have strong publications or projects showing clear evidence of high-quality research and innovation in fields directly related to AI and proven experience and ability to implement high-performance AI solutions. As an AI scientist, you will: Analyze data to discover patterns, find opportunities, and develop and apply innovative ML algorithms. Validate new or improved models via statistically relevant experiments. Work closely with AI engineers to build scalable prototypes for testing, and integrate successful models and algorithms in production systems. Support in identifying opportunities in creating customer value with ML. Advance exploratory research projects in ML and related fields to create highly innovative customer experiences. Technically lead and mentor AI Interns and Fellows. | WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU? The candidate with computer science related Masters/PhD should have extensive knowledge, deep insights, and experience in the field of artificial intelligence, including traditional machine learning, deep learning and semantic reasoning. For this position we are specifically looking for a candidate with proven track record (3-8 years of experience) and interest in the field of natural language processing, ontologies, knowledge graphs, information extraction, text generation, and hands-on experience with tools such as Python, Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow. In addition, the candidate should have an interest in, and ideally also experience with, translating new machine learning and AI technologies. Someone with a medical/bioinformatics background is preferred. | WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC? TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world. At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career. As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture. | WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER? We have a highly specialized and varied team. This provides a lot of expertise and knowledge that you can learn a lot from. With our strong network and your personal ambition, we will ensure a wonderful career together. | WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP? We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars: You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Is TMC a perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you. Feel Free to Contact Marnix Bosch Business Manager Data Science, Netherlands Tel: +31 (0)6 15 57 86 19

title: Data Scientist - McKinsey Analytics
summary: You will apply data science methods to improve and optimize our clients performance needs, capture meaningful insights from data and turn them into competitive…
description: QUALIFICATIONS MSc or PhD degree in the field of Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics 2+ years of working experience in statistical modelling and/or machine learning 2+ years of technical experience in predictive analytics, machine learning, optimization, and fluent in a number of the following technologies: R, Python, SQL, MATLAB, SAS, Java, Spark, Scala, AWS, Tableau Experience in applying data science methods to business problems Ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields Strong presentation and communication skills Business level fluency in English is mandatory, Dutch language skills is an asset Willingness to travel up to 80% of time to the client's site WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH You will be based in Amsterdam and will be part of the McKinsey Analytics Europe team, serving clients mostly from Western Europe but also globally. McKinsey Analytics works together with clients to build analytics-driven organizations. We combine the latest techniques with deep industry, functional, and analytics expertise to help clients capture the most value from data. WHAT YOU'LL DO You will apply data science methods to improve and optimize our clients performance needs, capture meaningful insights from data and turn them into competitive advantages. You will drive the creation of statistical models to solve specific operational problems. These problems may include: How can we predict equipment failure to do proactive maintenance for wind turbines? How can we use machine learning to predict consumer behavior? In solving these problems, you will have access to proprietary feature engineering AI and teams of world-leading experts in the domain you are working on. You will be in the room, often with the senior management, working side by side with talented data scientists from leading client organizations both on technical issues and on making the change happen.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Data scientist: 5 jaar (Vereist).
We're looking for a Data Scientist; you will be working on creating models and simulations for the further development of…
description: We're looking for a Data Scientist; you will be working on creating models and simulations for the further development of important applications. Full details upon request. Projectduur Start: zsm Eind: 30 juni (verlenging mogelijk) Uren: 32/week Standplaats: Amsterdam Code: 0303s1 Uw Reactie: Als u aan bovenstaande eisen voldoet* dan ontvangen wij van u graag zo spoedig mogelijk: · Een chronologisch CV (.word) · Motivatie gericht op dit project (maximaal 2000 tekens) · Uw uurtarief (inclusief reis- en verblijfkosten en ex BTW) · Uw mogelijke startdatum en eventuele vakantieplannen * Wij merken vaak dat deskundigen aan nagenoeg alle eisen voldoen, maar net dat ene certificaat missen. Als voorbeeld: u werkt al jaren volgens de Agile of Scrum methodiek of volgens Prince, maar U hebt nooit het certificaat behaald. In principe zou u dan niet in aanmerking komen. Wij hebben voor u de oplossing: onze opleidingsdivisie kan er voor zorgen dat u in zeer korte tijd over dit certificaat beschikt. Wij kunnen dat – ook individueel – tegen zeer scherpe tarieven COVID-proof aanbieden. Interesse? Reageer dan op de aanvraag en vermeld dat u meer info wil. Wij verwachten van u exclusiviteit om te voorkomen dat u meerdere malen op dit project bij onze opdrachtgever wordt aangeboden. Mochten wij van uw aanbod geen gebruik maken dan zullen wij u hierover uiteraard zoveel mogelijk nader informeren. In algemene zin geldt dat als binnen twee dagen na de uiterste aanbiedingsdatum geen reactie is gegeven, een beter passend profiel is geselecteerd. KIJK VOOR DE MEEST RECENTE PROJECTEN EN VACATURES OP: http://bit.ly/OKE4Ujobs Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Freelance/ZZP Werkschema: ma-vr Ervaring: data scientist: 5 jaar (Vereist) Opleiding: Bachelor (Aanbevolen) Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

title: Scientist
summary:
En je helpt bij het interpreteren en analyseren van deze data.
Je analyseert je data kritisch en komt zelf met voorstellen voor eventuele vervolgstappen.
description: Het Biologie Team van Acerta Pharma in Oss is aan het groeien! Kom jij als Scientist ons laboratorium-team nog sterker maken? Ben jij als een vis in het water als het gaat om biologie-experimenten bedenken/ontwikkelen en uitvoeren? Acerta Pharma is een jonge ‘science driven’ organisatie, onderdeel van AstraZeneca, met z’n allen streven we een doel na: het ontwikkelen van nieuwe oncologische medicijnen die het verschil maken in het leven van patiënten.  Ben je een wetenschappelijke doorzetter die met ons gaat voor het beste resultaat? En vind je optimaal samenwerken in een hecht en sterk team erg belangrijk? Als dat zo is, lees dan verder, want Acerta Pharma is op zoek naar een actieve en creatieve Scientist Oss Fulltime (40 uur) Jouw uitdaging Als Scientist heb je een brede, zelfstandige labfunctie binnen onze Discovery Science groep van het Translationele Biologie Team in Oss. Vanuit jouw kennis en ervaring als Scientist met diverse technieken zoals celkweek, flow cytometrie, immunoblotting, ELISA, moleculaire biologie en biochemische en fenotypische screens weet jij bij welke vraagstelling je welke techniek het beste kunt inzetten bij onze experimenten. En je helpt bij het interpreteren en analyseren van deze data. Je werkt nauw samen met jouw collega’s in het Biology lab en ook met het Medicinal Chemistry team. Samen zet je je in om nieuwe oncologische medicijnen te ontwikkelen die het verschil maken in het leven van patiënten. Je hebt daarnaast contact met collega’s van de Early Oncology Discovery Sciences groepen van AstraZeneca in Cambridge (VK) en Boston (VS).  Wat ga je doen? Je plant en voert dagelijks experimenten uit op het lab. Je ontwikkelt nieuwe methodes en gebruikt diverse technieken om onderzoekshypotheses te testen met het doel de werking van potentiele nieuwe medicijnen binnen de hematologische oncologie te bestuderen. Je analyseert je data kritisch en komt zelf met voorstellen voor eventuele vervolgstappen. Je neemt actief deel aan de project- en werkbesprekingen met collega scientists en chemici van zowel Acerta Pharma als AstraZeneca. Je deelt je data, doet mee met discussies, je stelt positief kritische vragen en komt met voorstellen en/of nieuwe ideeën om de voortgang in de projecten te houden. Je zorgt voor nauwkeurige en goed georganiseerde laboratoriumdata, werkbladen en een elektronische labjournaal in overeenstemming met het kwaliteitsbeheersysteem van Acerta Pharma. Je identificeert en weet open te communiceren over issues. Wat vragen we van je? Je hebt een afgeronde Masteropleiding in (Bio)Medische Wetenschappen, Farmacologie of aanverwante studie aangevuld met minimaal 1 jaar relevante lab- ervaring (goed stage-ervaring kan ook). Een afgeronde Bachelorsdiploma in Life Sciences (HLO) of aanverwante studie op Bachelorsniveau, aangevuld met minimaal 3 jaar relevante lab-ervaring. Ervaring in een farmaceutisch of academisch onderzoeks- en/of ontwikkelingslaboratorium is een harde eis. Ervaring met in vitro cellulaire testen zoals, flow cytometrie, celkweek, ELISA, immunoblotting is een harde eis. Verder is het een pre als je kennis en ervaring meeneemt met celbiologie en moleculaire biologie, bij voorkeur met een focus op oncologie en cellulaire immunologie. Competenties: je stelt hoge eisen aan kwaliteit, veiligheid en milieuvriendelijkheid, vindt het prettig om zeer nauwkeurig te werken, kunt goed onafhankelijk denken, je bent betrouwbaar en een teamspeler. En je bent van nature pro-actief! Goede beheersing van het Engels. Het is een pre als je ook Nederlands beheerst.  Wat bieden wij jou? De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen in de breedte van de functie, een mogelijkheid is om naar een meer senior rol met meer verantwoordelijkheid te groeien. Een dynamische, innovatieve, internationale werkomgeving, om je deel te laten uitmaken van de ontwikkeling van de nieuwe geneesmiddelen die het verschil kunnen maken voor het leven van patiënten. De mogelijkheid om in een klein, toegewijd team te werken, waar je veel van elkaar kunt leren. De teamgeest is erg goed! De mogelijkheid om samen te werken met je internationale collega's van de Discovery Sciences en klinische afdelingen van Acerta Pharma en AstraZeneca in het VK en in de VS. Goed salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden waaronder 8% vakantietoeslag, 25 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis. Collectief pensioen met een vast percentage eigen bijdrage, bonusregeling. Vitaliteit van onze collega’s vinden we belangrijk, daarom mag je met korting sporten of gebruik maken van ons fietsplan. Wij bieden je een jaarcontract met de intentie om dit na één jaar te verlengen naar onbepaalde tijd. Het team Het Discovery Science Team maakt deel uit van het Biology and Translational Science Team in Oss. In deze functie rapporteer je aan je projectleider/Research Scientist. De cultuur is informeel en er is een goede teamgeest en bereidheid om te delen, te helpen en van elkaar te leren. Er heerst een positieve, gezellige vibe. Je werkt allemaal voor hetzelfde doel! Acerta Pharma Op ons internationale hoofdkantoor in Oss werken meer dan 60 collega’s hard aan het ontwikkelen van nieuwe behandelmogelijkheden voor patiënten met specifieke soorten (bloed)kanker. Samen met onze collega’s bij onze Amerikaanse dochteronderneming in San Francisco zetten wij ons in voor innovatief geneesmiddelenonderzoek en -ontwikkeling, vooral op het gebied van hematologische oncologie.  We werken nauw samen met AstraZeneca, dat in februari 2016 een meerderheidsbelang verwierf in Acerta Pharma. Inmiddels hebben wij goedkeuring van zowel de Amerikaanse- (FDA) als de Europese toezichthouder (EMA) voor onze behandeling voor patiënten met chronische lymfatische leukemie (CLL). Daarnaast werken AstraZeneca en Acerta Pharma samen aan een groot aantal andere innovatieve geneesmiddelen met kleine moleculen en biologische geneesmiddelen voor de behandeling van bepaalde oncologische aandoeningen. Solliciteren: Als je interesse hebt en wilt solliciteren ontvangen wij graag jouw Engelse CV en motivatiebrief. Ga hiervoor naar de apply button onderaan deze vacature. Je kunt jouw CV en motivatiebrief uploaden onderaan de tweede pagina.  Heb je nog vragen over deze vacature, dan is ons Recruitmentteam bereikbaar via info@werkenbijacertapharma.nl of op +31(0)85 - 047 0244.

title: Data analytics manager
summary: Establish a transparent and secure framework, with good data governance, data quality, and data cleansing processes in place.
description: Project Description: This is a back-office position for the world renowned booking.com platform. The Dutch branch of the company is looking to augment its team with a Data Analytics Manager that will be in charge of a team of 6-8 people.  In this role, the Data Analytics Manager (DA) will be responsible to develop and coach a team of data analysts that embraces and drives change, business partnering, efficiency with the use and development of right tools, growth, empowerment, and teamwork.  The DA Manager is responsible for the daily operations of the data analytics in his/her specific scope and is making sure that the team maintains timely delivery of critical reporting and analysis to different stakeholders and (senior) managers.  The DA Manager has a global scope and global impact. The DA Manager manages the analytics team and stakeholders, and serves as a business advisor to their stakeholders. The DA Manager takes the lead to prioritize and delegate new initiatives and projects based on business impact, and develops the team to build meaningful and insightful reports and dashboards that help scaling business and steer business decisions.  Responsibilities: Develop, manage and inspire a team of data analysts, translating company, and departmental goals in to the team and personal objectives Serving as the leader of the group, ensuring work tasks are adequately prioritized and completed, team member's workloads are balanced and actively monitored Tracking and monitoring performance levels, and manage underperformance Establish a data framework which supports decision making, accountability, and process improvements, keeping in mind control environment and compliance requirements Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of a data framework for new products and processes to scale business through standardization Provide advice and analytical support on process and /or data improvement areas for a range of cross-functional projects and strategic business initiatives including new payment products Work closely with other technical or analytical departments to ensure data is accurate and consistently used for similar purposes Engage with the data scientist community at Booking.com to identify Data Analytics opportunities to understand developments in the company infrastructure and the impact that has on the team Establish a transparent and secure framework, with good data governance, data quality, and data cleansing processes in place Provide added value by identifying opportunities to improve and drive positive change in data integrity and governance Analyze key trends and variances, and leading production of monthly/quarterly/ad-hoc reporting to the finance (senior) management See beyond the numbers, "be the voice of data" when communicating findings to decision makers, product owners and senior management by translating complex problems into a simple story and communicate this effectively to various stakeholders Continuous development of efficient reporting tools and processes to support decision-making, driving optimal use of the various systems and datasets available within the organization Advancing the current data strategy to the next level in order to bring more insights to the business in a faster and more automated way Develop and lead the application of innovative Data Analytics techniques as a key function within the payments accounting team. Enable the development of "data mindset" within finance Establish the methodology on how to perform finance related analytics on key business and IT processes, including transformation of large, complex data sets into pragmatic, actionable finance insights and findings.  Skills Required:

title: Data Scientist Lead
summary: For our Data Science team we’re looking for a professional that will lead the team and bring our data driven decision making to the next level throughout the…
description: QWIC is growing. And fast. We are a scale-up where lots of tasks are undefined, structures can change fast and we expect a certain flexibility and taking responsibility. For our Data Science team we’re looking for a professional that will lead the team and bring our data driven decision making to the next level throughout the organisation. Full-time · Amsterdam

title: AD Scientist
summary:
Actively participate in scientific discussions with other R&D scientist.
Manage, process and prepare experimental data for reporting/trending.
description: At Kiadis, we are leveraging the natural strengths of humanity and our collective immune systems to source the best cells for life. Our NK cell (natural killer cell) research and development programs and partnerships are at the cutting-edge of the industry, paving the way for a new and exciting therapies, in immuno-oncology and beyond.  In support of developing our innovative NK cell therapies, we are looking for a Scientist Analytical Development based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.  The role As a Scientist AD, you develop analytical methods in our Analytical Development department to support the cell therapeutics at Kiadis. A big contribution to getting our therapies to the patients. There is still a lot of development to be done, to optimize methods and establish new technologies. You’ll be doing the experiments independently in our newly renovated state of the art lab, with an amazing view. In your day-to-day work you will: Develop assays/methods for release testing and product characterization Be responsible for design, planning, execution and reporting on development experiments. Perform statistical data analysis. Advise on characterization of samples from process development department. Train technicians and support method transfer activities Ensure our knowledge on relevant state-of-the-art analytical technologies is up to date. Actively participate in scientific discussions with other R&D scientist Support troubleshooting in case of aberrant test results Manage, process and prepare experimental data for reporting/trending. Provide hands-on technical support, training and expertise to other operations departments.  The department The Kiadis Operations team is responsible for all aspects of CMC development, manufacturing, procurement, planning and customer service. We are a group of experienced professionals – cell therapy experts, biologists, engineers, analysts, production associates, and more, driven by the passion to develop and supply innovative cell therapy products, directly to patients. We work through a global network of internal and external laboratories and production facilities, and interact on a daily basis with apheresis centers and hospitals around the world. Join us and see for yourself how your talent and skills will bring us closer to our ultimate goal: helping patients worldwide.  The ideal candidate We are looking for someone that shares our love for cells, and likes being part of a dynamic organization. It would be great if you have the following requirements: PhD in cell biology, immunology, hematology, or related Life Sciences fields. 2+ years of experience in a related field, preferably in industrial cell therapy or other biopharmaceutical analytical development. Excellent knowledge and hands-on experience with primary cell culture, flow cytometry and ELISA assays. Experience with other molecular and/or biochemical assays is a plus. Experience with assay development and/or assay validation and assay transfer to QC. Knowledge on GMP would be a plus. Familiar with statistical experimental design of experiments is a huge plus. Excellent team player, capable of working independently and with good communication skills, plus if you have experience with supervising/interacting with technicians. Analytical mindset, conscientious and curious. No nine-to-five mentality. Fluency in English, other languages are a plus.

title: Data scientist (planning and forecasting)
summary:
Your role as data scientist planning and forecasting.
As data scientist you are part of the EyeOn Data Science Team, one of the most innovative teams within our…
description: As Data Scientist Planning and Forecasting you help companies make better forecasting and planning decisions based on quantitative analysis and models. You are a creative mind with a passion for forecasting and planning algorithms and a fascination for technology. Your role as data scientist planning and forecasting In your work, you deal with the three pillars of applied analytics: data engineering, model development and storytelling (presenting and visualizing results in an insightful, compelling and narrative way). With a sharp analytical eye, you translate business challenges and opportunities into a design that you implement and embed in the customer’s organization. Designing your solutions, you never lose sight of the people that work with these and the processes that they support. At EyeOn, you will work with the latest techniques, solutions and insights in the field of data science. As believers in a future where data is the core and most decisions are made by machines, we are constantly developing ourselves and the techniques and methods we work with. We challenge you to share this drive for continuous improvement. Your working location will mainly be at our office in Aarle-Rixtel. Our Forecasting & Planning and knowledge center is located there. Responsibilities Translating planning, forecasting and sensing challenges into a variety of mathematical decision support models; Raising the efficiency and quality of applied analytics projects by standardizing and improving technical methods and applications, including the technical set-up, design, and scalability of our in-house plugins; Contribute to the innovative power of EyeOn by running applied analytics lab projects; Presenting results in a narrative and insightful way to managers and planners; e.g. Tableau, PowerBI. Raising the expertise of EyeOn colleagues in the area of applied analytics. Profile candidate A completed university education and master’s degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Econometrics, or similar; Relevant experience (3-8 years) in or affinity with supply chain planning and forecasting processes; You enjoy translating complex real-life problems into mathematical models; Experience with programming, preferably in Python (eg. Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Scikit-learn); Experience with processing and analyzing data (eg. SQL, Hadoop, Spark, Kubernetes); Tech-savvy: eager to learn new technologies and applications; Knowledge of, and experience with, typical data science techniques (regression, classification, clustering, math programming, simulation, etc.) ; EU-working permit. Data Science & Solution (DS²) As data scientist you are part of the EyeOn Data Science Team, one of the most innovative teams within our industry. We perform data analysis and assessments based on tools such as Dataiku, Python, Spark, PowerBI, Tableau, and many more. We help companies make better forecasting and planning decisions based on quantitative analysis and analytical models. We are creative minds with a passion for analytics, forecasting- and planning algorithms and a fascination for data. We believe in the digital transformation and a data-driven future. We develop and implement new and innovative solutions for our customers based on the latest technologies and insights. Why work for EyeOn? A great place to work in a no-nonsense environment: you will work with colleagues that have absolute passion for supply chain planning and data science. Challenging projects with large multinationals: varying in length from one-week up to eight months. You will typically work on 2-3 projects at a time. A healthy work/life balance: at EyeOn your private life is equally – if not more – important as your work. Employee autonomy: you decide how you schedule your agenda, work and working location. Focus on personal development: at EyeOn you create your own personal development program and we facilitate you in this. We are proud that our employees rate our mentoring and coaching very highly. Excellent employee benefits and perks including bonus potential: you can receive bonusses on personal development, on how well the company is doing. Lease car, public transportation business card, laptop, phone, reimbursement of expenses. An individual assessment is part of our selection procedure. For more information about applying, please contact Bart Geerts at bart.geerts@eyeon.nl or call +31 (0) 683340107 About EyeOn In striving for success, large companies must continuously struggle against growing internal complexity. We help our clients manage this complexity by designing, implementing and executing excellent planning processes as a discriminating factor for this success. In order to achieve this, we develop and share knowledge about top level planning and forecasting, with constantly demonstrable return on investment for our clients. For additional information check our website.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Je hebt 1 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, als data scientist of data analist in vergelijkbaar werkveld.
In jouw rol zul je de onderzoeksvraag concreet moeten…
description: Als onafhankelijk onderzoeks- en consultingbureau zijn we bij MeMo² continu bezig om marketing vraagstukken voor onze opdrachtgevers op te lossen. We doen dit door het meten, kwantificeren en optimaliseren van reclame-effecten. Met onze innovatieve onderzoeksproducten zijn we in staat reclame campagnes en commerciële bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren. MeMo² is in 2019 als onderzoeksbureau van het jaar verkozen (MOA Awards) en heeft verschillende internationale prijzen behaald. Dit jaar (2020) zijn we met onze nieuwste innovatie de THX. app zeven keer in de prijzen gevallen, voor onder andere de beste mediaresearch (AMMA Awards). Als Data Scientist zal je binnen MeMo² verantwoordelijk worden voor (internationale) marketing intelligence projecten. Dit houdt in dat je je bezig zult houden met vraagstukken als ‘in hoeverre draagt een crossmediale campagne bij aan de naamsbekendheid van een merk?’, ‘wat is de invloed van een video advertentie via YouTube op de koopintentie van consumenten?’ en ‘hoeveel conversies voorspellen we voor de komende vier weken aan de hand van ons statistische modellen?’. Je zult daarnaast ook uitgedaagd worden om te innoveren op het gebied van (complexere) statistische analyses. Is de huidige manier waarop we effecten in kaart brengen nog steeds de beste? En hoe kunnen we het beste inspelen op behoeftes vanuit onze klanten? Beschrijving Je zult verantwoordelijk worden voor het correct en accuraat beantwoorden van (internationale) marketing vraagstukken. Je bent één van de voortrekkers om de huidige vraagstukken vanuit een statistisch oogpunt te benaderen. In jouw rol zul je de onderzoeksvraag concreet moeten formuleren, inzicht hebben in welke beschikbare data nodig is om de vragen te beantwoorden om vervolgens op zoek te gaan naar de juiste tools en modellen om deze vraagstukken voor de klant op de juiste manier te kunnen beantwoorden. Je krijgt de kans om je opgedane kennis op het gebied van marketing, media en modellering in te zetten om strategische vraagstukken voor (internationale) klanten te beantwoorden. Naast het beantwoorden van de vraagstukken vanuit klanten zal je aan de slag gaan met business intelligence tools, ontwikkeling van nieuwe MeMo² tools en maak je jouw collega’s enthousiast over al deze nieuwe methodieken en uitkomsten. Wij bieden jou: Een unieke kans in een succesvol bedrijf met veel young-professionals Een diverse rol met veel doorgroeimogelijkheden, waarbij je veel ruimte krijgt om jezelf te ontwikkelen De kans om met grote (internationale) klanten te werken Een eerste klas lunch en lekkere koffie Een salaris waar je blij van wordt Gunstige pensioenregeling 25 vakantiedagen per jaar Wat we van jou verwachten: WO werk- en denkniveau met een relevante studie, bijvoorbeeld: Marketing Intelligence, Econometrie, Computer Science, of (Toegepaste) Wiskunde Je hebt 1 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, als data scientist of data analist in vergelijkbaar werkveld Het samenwerken in een team gaat jou goed af, maar je bent ook in staat om zelfstandig aan het werk te gaan Pro-actieve, ondernemende houding. Je wilt jezelf vastbijten in huidige en nieuwe mogelijkheden van modellering en machine learning Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift Ervaring met R, Python, SQL en Excel Pre: Photoshop, Microsoft PowerBI, Javascript, PhP Waar je jezelf in terug moet zien: Je vindt het leuk om strategische vraagstukken op te lossen en deze resultaten te presenteren bij de klant Je hebt interesse in marketing en media Je bent initiatiefrijk en ambitieus Je houdt van een borrel op zijn tijd (elke vrijdag wordt een drankje gedaan) Experimenteren met nieuwe datatechnieken om vragen te kunnen beantwoorden of om nieuwe tools te ontwikkelen Je woont in/in de buurt van Groningen

title: IBM Technology Garage - Data Scientist
summary: Leverage a variety of structured and unstructured data sources, analytics, AI tools and programming language to derive meaningful data insights (e.g., Python,…
description: Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities Data Scientist in IBM Garage are part of cross-functional team that delivers unique client co-creation experience to accelerate client transformation. Acts as a key contributor to a pre-sales Garage team, partnering with clients to understand business problems and propose solutions. Contributes to c-creation of rapid proofs of concept and minimally viable solutions that demonstrate business value, leading to client investment in strategic solutions. Translates business problems into leading-edge analytics solutions using consulting skills, industry expertise and technical knowledge. Delivers meaningful insights and predicts emerging trends to inform business solutions that optimize client value. IBMReferred_Europe    Required Technical and Professional Expertise Demonstrates strong business acumen and ability to understand business problems, formulate hypotheses and test conclusions to influence solution design Leverage a variety of structured and unstructured data sources, analytics, AI tools and programming language to derive meaningful data insights (e.g., Python, Spark, TeansorFlow, Jupyter etc.) Processes relevant industry and/or business domain knowledge such as Finance or Healthcare. Typically has academic training in a quantitative discipline and/or specialized degree in data science or analytics. User-centric approach Works in Agile fashion Communication, visualization and storytelling skills Growth Mindset Fluent local language skills, fluent English skills     Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  About Business Unit IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.  Your Life @ IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition.  What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.  Location Statement For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.
