title: Business Data Analyst
summary:
Execute and lead on data wrangling, data prepping and the gathering of insights.
Monitor the progress of data deliveries and liaison between data science and…
description: Company Information Dashmote is an AI technology scale-up headquartered in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. We connect the offline and online worlds by decoding the digital footprint of locations, allowing companies including in the F&B industry to understand the on-trade market and make smarter and data-driven decisions. Today, our company has offices in Amsterdam, Shanghai, Vienna, and New York. Over the past few years, our teams have solved a wide variety of cases, such as analyzing beer drinking and hairstyle trends by utilizing our Visual Recognition Tools, as well as identifying prospective leads by generating intelligence dashboards.  Role Description As our Business Data Analyst you will participate and lead data driven projects in a creative and confident manner. You help our clients embrace intelligent technologies, analyze data to derive insights and turn this into business value. You also know that a big part of data analysis is data wrangling and you bring hands on experience to do this at scale. You will be part of the rockstar delivery team consisting of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Data Analysts. You will be building upon our software as a service application which helps our clients win new business through our unique data and data science capabilities. You will be working with the project and data team to deliver projects to clients across the globe.  Main Responsibilities Develop data insights reports, support in storylines and drive business change Execute and lead on data wrangling, data prepping and the gathering of insights Monitor the progress of data deliveries and liaison between data science and client project managers. Define and maintain data taxonomy of key business metrics Identify data inconsistencies and build an approach to resolve this Effectively communicate insights to team & business stakeholders Build and support effective data quality and assurance programs  Your Background: Process Improvement and/or Continual Service Improvement experience Minimum of 3-7 years’ of relevant experience, experience in tech consulting is a plus! MS Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Econometrics or equivalent fields. Proficient in Python and other analytical tools. Proven analytical skills and business understanding. You have a big affinity for data and numbers, and a curious mind to discover insights Strategic, creative and conceptual mindset Effective communication, project management skills and a proactive approach Full time availability   What’s in it for you Great office location right in the city centre of Amsterdam. We mostly work from home for now but you can have access to the office if you prefer it! Efficient virtual communication channels to work from home Working within an international team of over 65 people that truly values your contribution Growing company full of opportunities & awarded by Google, McKinsey and Rocket Internet for best B2B startup in Europe An awesome culture of responsibility and the freedom to turn your ambition into reality - regardless of your role and level Exciting work atmosphere with no shortage of birthday treats, monthly team events and weekly Friday company catch-ups, even though most of the fun is virtually for now! If this sounds like a match, we would love to hear from you! Please note that to be considered for this role you will need to hold a valid NL Work Visa or NL Residency or NL Citizenship.

title: Fermentation Technician
summary: Strong affinity with technical aspects of biotechnoly labrartory equipment like programming of biocontrollers, data storage and control protocls, and…
description: Functieomschrijving The Environmental Biotechnology research group of the Biotechnology department of TU Delft conducts research and provides education in the field of biotechnological processes for wastewater treatment and the conversion of substrates to products using undefined microbial communities. To conduct this research we have an extensive laboratory suite of different laboratory fermentors of different sizes and equiped with a wide range analytical equipment including off-gas analysis and sophisticated process control. As fermentation technician the job described in this vacancy will be to provide technical support for this equipment and contribute to the development and implementation of the fermentation facilities in the research group. Functie-eisen HBO/HLO or equivalent laboratory education with emphasis on biotechnology Strong affinity with technical aspects of biotechnoly labrartory equipment like programming of biocontrollers, data storage and control protocls, and implementation and maintenance of equipment some affinity with fermentation technology or biological wastewater treatment is appreciated good communicator, flexible, taking initiative, and with affinity for instructing students in the laboratory. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount on health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. For international applicants we offer the Coming to Delft Service and Partner Career Advice to assist you with your relocation. An International Children's Centre offers childcare and there is an international primary school. TU Delft Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context. At TU Delft we embrace diversity and aim to be as inclusive as possible (see our Code of Conduct). Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. Challenge. Change. Impact! Afdeling With more than 1,000 employees, including 135 pioneering principal investigators, as well as a population of about 3,400 passionate students, the Faculty of Applied Sciences is an inspiring scientific ecosystem. Focusing on key enabling technologies, such as quantum- and nanotechnology, photonics, biotechnology, synthetic biology and materials for energy storage and conversion, our faculty aims to provide solutions to important problems of the 21st century. To that end, we train students in broad Bachelor's and specialist Master's programmes with a strong research component. Our scientists conduct ground-breaking fundamental and applied research in the fields of Life and Health Science & Technology, Nanoscience, Chemical Engineering, Radiation Science & Technology, and Engineering Physics. We are also training the next generation of high school teachers and science communicators. https://www.tudelft.nl/en/tnw/ Additionele informatie For information about the selection procedure, please contact Joyce Alexander-Buis, HR advisor, email: j.j.b.alexander-buis@tudelft.nl. Sollicitatieprocedure For more information about this vacancy, please contact Robbert Kleerebezem, Associate Professor, email: r.kleerebezem@tudelft.nl, tel. +31 15 278 1091 or contact Dirk Geerts, Fermentation Technician, email: d.geerts@tudelft.nl, tel. +31 15 278 8243. FACULTY/DEPARTMENT Faculty of Applied Sciences JOB TYPE Technical, laboratory positions SCIENTIFIC FIELD not applicable HOURS PER WEEK 32-38 SALARY € 2.656,00 - € 3.548,00 DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION Higher professional education VACANCY NUMBER TUD00760 Apply Now

title: Data visualization designer
summary:
Work side by side with our data scientists, data engineers, developers, and industry-leading clients;
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources…
description: We are looking for an Information Data visualization designer – Utrecht, Netherlands in Utrecht, Netherlands. Reports to: Head of Product Operations Intellerts is an innovative company. Our goal is to help the business stay ahead of its competitors using Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools. We love to maximize the potential of AI and Data Science. Applying AI requires extensive Data Science expertise we harvest the true value of Big Data. Every day, we translate AI technologies and AI research into new business assets. Three core values drive our company and team culture: mastery — being good at what we do (the pursuit of mastery), autonomy — the ability to decide how we do what we do (right to self-organize and self-govern), and purpose – to have a clear understanding of why we do what we do. All data has hidden stories. You need to know how to write them. That is where you come in! As a Data visualization designer, you‘ll be part of our product development team. You will be responsible for the process of using narrative-style tactics to bring our data out into the open, where it becomes easier for our audiences to understand and consume it. You will be telling a story about our data, which is fundamental for driving business growth and strategy. You are responsible for: Develop functional and beautiful visualization content and data-driven solutions; Create information in a story format presenting information more memorable, persuasive, and engaging; Make data the centrepiece of content such as blog posts and case studies; Articulate findings clearly and concisely and create data-driven content with unique narratives for target use cases, including presentations, design solutions, and visualization; Write up your findings in short and long reports, including visually appealing graphs and deep insights based on your analysis, answering the “why“ behind the “what“; Interact with clients to provide insightful answers to challenging data problems and support them in custom data visualization projects; Support the rest of the data science team in their data and research quests as needed; Work side by side with our data scientists, data engineers, developers, and industry-leading clients; Be comfortable with an iterative process to continuously improve data visualizations and design based on stakeholder feedback; Self-driven, agile, and able to work independently and on multiple engagements simultaneously. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Proven experience working with data environment and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, D3, ggplot, etc.; Basic experience with MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL; Implement processes that improve and lead to greater data quality; Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques; Understanding valuable data sources, automate collection processes, and work with other team members on the integration process; Have interest and knowledge about Graphic Design; Into data journalism, with a background in statistics, applied mathematics, or computer science; Implement processes that improve and lead to greater data quality; Ability to signal the noise in the data and answer the ‘so what?‘ the question behind the observed numbers and patterns in data; Ability to visualize data effectively, producing eye-catching and easy-to-understand graphs; Excellent presentation skills; Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both Dutch and English; Dutch language skills, A2 level or above. In return, we offer you: Autonomy to define how you are going to do work; Flexible working hours, ability to work from home, and professional development; The opportunity to grow in your field in an international company; The opportunity to learn from professionals; Excellent environment to expand your knowledge and skills; Holiday pay (8%) Holidays – 27 days per year Pension arrangement – Employer contribution of 50% of the pension premium We are a team with challenging goals. Join us, and let’s reach the company and your personal goals together. Let’s talk! To apply, please send your CV and cover letter to j.dobrovolskiene@intellerts.com Only selected candidates will be informed about the further process

title: Data Analyst bij Transavia
summary: Je werkt nauw samen met de rest van het team (bestaande uit Analytics Translators, consultants, data analysts, data scientists en data engineers), en de…
description: Wij zoeken jou als Data Analyst bij Transavia Ben jij de Data Analyst die ons van “actionable” insights weet te voorzien? Als Data Analyst ben je de expert die voorziet in de informatiebehoefte binnen een bepaald strategisch domein. Je kent de business processen en de databronnen die de relevante processen beschrijven. Je draait je hand er niet voor om data te modeleren, onderzoeken op te zetten, en dashboards te bouwen over bijvoorbeeld onze klanten, kanalen, vluchten of andere delen van de operatie. En daarmee sta jij aan de basis van verbeterde en/of nieuwe processen en proposities. Samen met data engineers bouw je aan het data- en informatiefundament van Transavia, om een hoge kwaliteit van inzichten en informatieproducten te waarborgen.  Wat ga je doen? Als Data Analyst ben je op dagelijkse basis verantwoordelijk voor het verkrijgen van inzichten die direct in actie om te zetten zijn. Je voorziet de stakeholders in de juiste analyses en inzichten. Je helpt hen bij het identificeren van de Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s), en jij bent de persoon die alles weet over de KPI’s binnen jouw domein. Je maakt deze meetbaar, en interpreteert deze (trends) om tot concrete beslissingen en acties te komen. Je voorziet actief (gevraagd en ongevraagd) in inzichten en tooling die bijdragen aan de uitvoer van de strategie en het maken van betere keuzes binnen jouw domein, zoals een monitor van klanttevredenheid of een kostenmodel voor verstoringen; Je bent in staat om daar de juiste inhoud en vorm bij te kiezen qua databron, analyse en presentatie (rapportage, dashboard, of een andere vorm) welke je zelf ontwikkelt en indien nodig continu optimaliseert; Je kiest continu voor de juiste balans tussen het beheer van de bestaande dashboards en reporting voor de dagelijkse business, en nieuwe (strategische) vraagstukken die tot andere inzichten en invalshoeken leiden; Je stelt de business in staat om zelf meer data gedreven te werken, maar neemt ook een pro-actieve advies rol op je.  Waar ga je aan de slag? Vanuit het centrale Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team ben jij een belangrijke link tussen business en analytics, en begeleid je Transavia naar een meer datagedreven cultuur. Dit centrale team leidt de transformatie naar het datagedreven werken, adviseert afdelingen aan de hand van informatie en inzichten en bouwt aan data- en AI-oplossingen voor klanten en medewerkers van Transavia. Je werkt nauw samen met de rest van het team (bestaande uit Analytics Translators, consultants, data analysts, data scientists en data engineers), en de stakeholders binnen jouw domein. Welk domein dat is staat nog open; dit zal (een deel van) het Operations (waaronder crew planning, ground services en integrale planning), Corporate (waaronder HR, organizational development en sustainability) of Commercial (waaronder revenue management en sales) domein betreffen. Tevens onderhoud je nauwe samenwerking met onze collega’s van Transavia Frankrijk.  Wie ben jij? Je bent ‘wendbaar’, ofwel continu veranderingsbereid. Dit hebben we nodig om steeds beter te worden in wat we doen en mee te bewegen met de continu veranderende wereld om ons heen. Daarnaast ben je daadkrachtig, bevlogen, verantwoordelijk, vriendelijk, en je hebt dat “tikkeltje lef”. Jij hebt een HBO- of WO-diploma en/of ervaring opgedaan als (Data/Business) Analyst, (Onderzoeks) Consultant of in een vergelijkbare rol; Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uur per week; Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.  Als Data Analyst heb je kennis van: het vertalen van business doelstellingen en ideeën in informatieproduct use cases het doorgronden van business processen en informatiebehoefte en het toetsen van informatiebehoefte aan business doelstellingen het uitvoeren van de verschillende fases in de ontwikkeling van rapportages en dashboards, van experimenteren tot en met het in productie en beheer nemen van business intelligence oplossingen het beheren van data, het onderzoeken van de betekenis van data en het genereren van inzichten uit data met behulp van BI tooling zoals PowerBI en SQL het uitleggen van datavraagstukken aan een non-expert publiek de complexiteit, mogelijkheden en onmogelijkheden van informatieproducten vanuit het perspectief van data analyse, science en engineering.  Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Werken voor dé nummer 1 budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij; Veel ruimte en initiatieven voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling; (afhankelijk van salaris) een eindejaarsuitkering; Vriendelijke & bevlogen collega’s; Last but not least; ben je reislustig, dan is onze IPB regeling (tegen mooie tarieven vliegen indien plaats beschikbaar) zeker de moeite waard! Afhankelijk van ervaring wordt deze vacature geschaald in functiegroep 8 of 9. Dit betekent dat wij op basis van kennis en ervaring een aanbieding doen tussen de 2.592,- en 4.519,- euro bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband.  Over Transavia Ons motto is: ‘We make low cost feel good.’ We zetten daarbij graag een stap extra voor onze passagiers en voor elkaar. De sfeer in de organisatie kenmerkt zich door bevlogen medewerkers met een groen hart! Elke dag werken we met elkaar samen om een gemeenschappelijk doel te behalen: een memorabele klantbeleving. Als zelfstandige airline binnen de AIR FRANCE-KLM Groep verzorgen wij al 50 jaar lijndiensten en chartervluchten naar meer dan 100 bestemmingen in Europa en Noord-Afrika. Bij Transavia werken gemiddeld 2500 collega’s: 230 bij de Technische Dienst, 600 vliegers, 1300 cabin attendants en 370 kantoormedewerkers. Transavia is een dynamische organisatie (never a dull moment) die continu probeert bij te blijven in een veranderende luchtvaartwereld. Wil jij graag werken in een omgeving met enthousiaste daadkrachtig collega’s die oog hebben voor elkaar? Krijg je energie van verandering en vernieuwing en voel jij je het prettigst in een omgeving waar je regisseur bent van je eigen werk? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.  Wil je solliciteren? Ben jij de Data Analyst die wij zoeken en kom je onze vloot fulltime versterken? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button. Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met Noëll Wever, Lead Strategy, Data & intelligence via noell.wever@transavia.com Zij komt graag met je in contact! Jouw sollicitatieprocedure  Je solliciteert op de vacature! Binnen twee weken bekijken wij je sollicitatie en hoor je of wij je uitnodigen voor een gesprek. Eerste contact: Wij bellen je om kennis te maken en een afspraak in te plannen. Het eerste gesprek: er volgt een eerste (digitaal) gesprek met een teamleider en een collega uit het team. Is er een match? Dan volgt het tweede gesprek dat zich meer richt op de inhoud. Is de match compleet? Dan doen we je met veel plezier een voorstel en begint jouw reis bij Transavia! Wel moet je wegens (luchtvaart)veiligheidseisen eerst een screening doorlopen en maakt een antecedentenonderzoek deel uit van de procedure.  Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen voor deze vacature als Data Analyst bij Transavia? Bedankt, maar hier gaan we niet op in. We werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf.

title: Vacancy Team Lead Data Management
summary:
Knowledge and experience with data storage technologies.
Demonstrated affinity with scientific research, ideally in a data intensive discipline or computer…
description: We are looking for a Team Lead who, as a playing captain, is responsible for the Data Management team and its portfolio of services and projects. In addition to managing the team, the team leader will be a linking pin between SURF and its members, clients, users, and other external contacts. Educational background: academic Location: Amsterdam Employment: 32-40 hours Closing date: 17 March 2021 Open About SURF and Data Management configuration options About SURF and Data Management SURF supports research and education through innovation and service development, by leveraging its expertise in High Performance Computing, Data Processing and Data Services. Within the Data Management team, we develop services that help researchers to safely store, share, analyze and publish their research data according to the FAIR principles and in support of Open Science. Our enthusiasm for our customers (scientists, students and scientific institutions) and their research is what drives us. We love to work with and for others. We believe in working in close-knit teams that are strongly allied with our research communities. We see data management as an interesting and highly relevant challenge and are excited to work in this field alongside the scientific community. What will you be doing exactly? As Data Management Team Lead, you manage a team of five people (consultants and software developers), reporting into the Domain Manager Research Development. You ensure the cohesion and effectiveness of the team while stimulating the professional development of your team members. You are contributing to the vision and objectives of SURF and the domain and responsible for formulating the vision, objectives and annual plans of the team. In addition to these team management duties (approximately 0.3 FTE), you are responsible for a number of services and projects to which you also contribute with your knowledge and expertise. The service portfolio consists of three RDM services based on iRODS technology, two of which are fully production ready and one is in pre-production. You are responsible for the further development of these services and for ensuring a high-quality, reliable service delivery. Together with other SURF colleagues, you ensure that SURF members can easily find their way to these services and make optimal use of them, and you actively monitor (potentially changing) user needs and requirements. As a (senior) advisor, you contribute directly to service optimization, supporting proof-of-concept and pilots with interested parties, and advising customers and users. As part of your advisor role you can for instance also participate in (international) projects on FAIR RDM such as FAIRsFAIR and in SURF-wide innovation projects such as the SURF Data Exchange. Finally, as Team Lead you play an active role in external communications and in connecting the team with SURF members, customers, and other parties. You represent SURF in national bodies concerned with RDM, visit conferences, and give lectures and/or training sessions. We are looking for An academic level of thought and work and professional experience, including: Demonstrated affinity with scientific research, ideally in a data intensive discipline or computer science Sound knowledge of Research Data Management and the FAIR principles Experience in leading complex projects with multiple stakeholders People management skills Knowledge and experience with Linux and distributed computing systems Knowledge and experience with data storage technologies You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, in writing and in Dutch and English. You are customer-oriented, results-oriented, and used to taking initiative and being proactive. Finally, you have an eye for detail and quality, balanced with a healthy dose of pragmatism. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have experience in one or more of the following areas: FitSM service management iRODS technology One or more software languages such as Python, Java, or C/C++. We offer SURF has a very diverse, dynamic, and open environment. It is unique in providing its employees with an opportunity to innovate and experiment with state-of-the-art technology on a very large scale, while also developing and maintaining highly reliable high-performance data and computing services for researchers on a national and international level. We offer a diversified and challenging job for 40 hours (1.0 FTE) with a salary range of € 4.710 to € 6.729 gross based on a full-time appointment. SURF offers extensive training opportunities and excellent fringe benefits, including 36 holidays and a 1st class NS business card. Our office is located at the Amsterdam Science Park, with good public transport facilities nearby. The appointment is initially on the basis of a one-year contract, with the prospect of a permanent employment in the event of good performance and unaltered business conditions. Contractduur 12 maanden Parttime uren: 32-40 per week Deadline sollicitaties: 17-3-2021 Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Bepaalde tijd Salaris: €4.710,00 - €6.729,00 per maand Aanvullende betalingen: 13e maand Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Bedrijfsfeesten Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Flexibele werkuren Gezondheidsprogramma Kerstpakket Lunchkorting Pensioen Personeelskorting Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werk vanuit huis Werkschema: Flexibel werkrooster ma-vr

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: Our team of +/- 25 data scientists and data engineers are continuously stimulated and challenged while working with the wealth of data at Albert Heijn.
description: Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek Do you want to make impact, work for the biggest retailers in The Netherlands and help shape our growing Data Science & Engineering team? Then we're looking for you.  As a Senior Data Scientist at Albert Heijn, you will be part of the ambitious Data Science team within our Strategy & Analytics department. We work closely together with Digital, Commerce and Operations as well as outside our department with Store, Commerce, eCommerce, and Supply Chain. Data and technology are central to Albert Heijn’s strategy. Together with the team of data engineers, business stakeholders and IT, you will play a crucial role in this strategy improving numerous processes and the experiences of millions of customers every single day.  Our team is behind many high impact projects within Albert Heijn both online and in stores. Several of these projects like Bonus Box personalized offers (check Bonus Box out in the AH app) have high public visibility while others such as promo forecasting are key to planning logistics and finances. You will have the opportunity to shape new innovations like dynamically setting markdowns on near expiry products in store in order to minimize food waste. You will use applied statistical techniques, machine learning, A/B testing, evaluating causation and impact. You will take projects from design/conceptualization through proof of concepts to release as live products.  Our team of +/- 25 data scientists and data engineers are continuously stimulated and challenged while working with the wealth of data at Albert Heijn. Our data scientists and engineers have different backgrounds and nationalities, which we believe is important. We are passionate, enthusiastic, and we don’t mind getting our hands dirty, but most importantly: we will never stop evolving and learning. As Senior Data Scientist at AH Technology you: Have a leading role in building models and algorithms specifically for our use cases Code, test and put our algorithms into production Use your experience and knowledge to mature our Data Science team and perfect our agile way of working Coach and mentor your colleagues Help shape thought leadership throughout Albert Heijn on AI/ML opportunities Forecast, classify and make recommendations to get the most out of our data Work in multidisciplinary product teams and closely to our business stakeholders  Your Office. Albert Heijn, part of Ahold Delhaize, is the number one food retailer in the Netherlands. We’ve been inspiring customers and building trust for more than 130 years. We like to say, “we’re always there for you.” And with more than 1000 stores in the Netherlands and Belgium and 24/7 shopping on ah.nl, it’s truer than ever! But now we want to take our business to the next level. By making better food accessible to everyone – and making shopping fit the way people live today. By joining our team, you will be part of AH Technology, a department transcending community consisting of the departments Data, Digital and Tech. You can make your mark on the daily lives of millions of people. At AH Technology, our smart professionals create digital solutions that make (online) shopping simpler and more inspiring. We’re continually rethinking the way people shop, pay and even enjoy food. That’s why we’re investing heavily in data, tech and digital to further transform Albert Heijn into a leading Food Tech company.  Are you curious about your colleagues? At AH Technology you work with highly qualified professionals in an open environment. Expertise is valued, we learn from each other, and we have the freedom to create innovative solutions and make a real impact. As a Senior Data Scientist, you are part of the Strategy & Analytics department. Your colleagues will be other engineers and scientists, with a background in AI, Computer Engineering, Econometrics, Psychology, as well as other data-savvy people. Together with them, you play an essential role in creating impact through advanced data analysis. Next to this, other Albert Heijn departments, our shops, supply chain, and real estate play a key role as your stakeholders. For more information about AH Technology you can also visit our Stack Overflow page: https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/ah-technology-albert-heijn  Covid-19 Our main priority continues to be the health and safety of our employees and customers. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this position will be remote until further notice. We will continue monitor the circumstances and when we feel comfortable, this position will return to our Headquarters in Zaandam, where you will have the opportunity to collaborate face-to-face with a talented and diverse group of colleagues. This also means that all job interviews for this position will take place via video calls. Dit bieden we jou At AH Technology, we aim to grow, and that’s only possible if you grow with us. That’s why you get access to best-in-class guidance and inspiring training to shape your development and career. As we work together to build on our brand and your career, you can count on (based on 40 hours per week): A salary up to € 6.250,-. gross a month A bonus on top of your salary Holiday allowance 20 vacation days A budget choice in which you can decide whether you spend it on extra days off (+12,5 days), discounts or pay-outs Courses from our Albert Heijn Data Academy Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home An excellent pension plan with a personal contribution of 6.2% A travel allowance for traveling to and from Zaandam, once possible again Attractive discounts on various insurance policies A laptop and telephone 10% discount on your grocery shopping in our Albert Heijn stores, up to € 300 per year Dit breng je mee At AH Technology, you'll be working for one of the world's biggest retailers, and we know you are bursting with the ambition to keep up with us. You supplement this ambition with: A Master in Data Science, Econometrics, Computer Science or other relevant studies. If no relevant study, demonstrably relevant experience and interest At least 5 years of experience as Data Scientist, preferably within the commerce and/or operations domain A desire to coach and educate your colleagues and the ability to explain complex matter in an easy and enthusiastic way to business stakeholders Advanced experience in Python, Spark (both must haves) and other programming languages Experience in Cloud Platforms, Microsoft Azure Databricks and visualization tools are a big plus You are based in The Netherlands Apply. Do you want to play an active role in changing the food retail landscape as we know it? Then hop onboard and join us on our expedition. Apply now via the button on this page. We ask you not to send a standard motivation letter, but to formulate an answer to the following questions:  Why would you like to work for Albert Heijn? Why do you think you will be successful in this position and what kind of technical skills do you bring with you for this role? What is one of your personal strengths and one skill you wish to improve or develop? Last but not least: what are your salary expectations?

title: Scientist Antibody Discovery
summary: The BioProduction Division (BPD) offers biopharmaceutical customers a complete range of products including single-use technologies, analytical instruments, cell…
description: The BioProduction Division (BPD) offers biopharmaceutical customers a complete range of products including single-use technologies, analytical instruments, cell culture media, centrifugation, purification, and analytics. A fast growing segment within this large offering is the CaptureSelect™ affinity product line which delivers a range of purification and analytical products for every step in the development process, from discovery to final manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. The products are developed and manufactured by BAC BV, a Thermo Fisher Scientific company with two sites in The Netherlands. Position Summary: As a Scientist in the Antibody Discovery department:  You will be part of a small team focusing on the development of innovative affinity products in the field of cell therapy for clinical and research use applications. You have a hands-on mentality and will use your expertise in cell biology for the discovery of new antibody leads. It is your responsibility to outline and manage execution of project plans and document the progress. You have excellent communication skills that drive collaborations within a broader interdisciplinary team and are in regular dialogue with other departments within Thermo Fisher Scientific. You will build and expand your network of collaborators in academia and industry to ensure our products meet customer needs and expectations. Other responsibilities include: analyzing experimental data, discussing and presenting results, both written as in oral form. Furthermore, you will keep track of new developments in relevant literature and implement this knowledge in all aspects of your work. Minimum Requirements/Qualifications: You have a Master or Ph.D. degree with a background in cell biology or immune-oncology and have gained significant scientific experience in preferentially the area of cell therapy You have excellent communication skills to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment and manage internal and external relationships You have hands-on experience with mammalian cell cultivation and analysis. Experience in working with antibodies or antibody fragments will be an asset. You are a team player and have the ability to organize and prioritize to meet deadlines. You are proficient in the English language (both orally and in writing). Communicative level of the Dutch language will be an advantage.

title: Scientist Clinical Immunology
summary: To that effect, the scientist needs to consider the long-term strategies of the project and align the strategy accordingly.
description: Janssen Vaccines & Prevention is dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health and protecting people worldwide from infectious diseases. In our organization, entrepreneurial people are working in a diverse and dynamic environment in which innovation and a 'can-do' state of mind are the central points. In order to strengthen our team, we are continuously looking for enthusiastic, hardworking colleagues who have the ambition to develop themselves and help us on our mission. Department: The Clinical Immunology department is responsible for the immunological evaluation of vaccine candidates in clinical trials. In close collaboration with the Biomarker group and clinical development group, our team executes the immuno strategies analyzes clinical samples, and reports the data. Typical assays to analyze the immunogenicity of vaccines are antibody ELISA, T cell ELISpot, Intracellular Cytokine Staining, and virus neutralization assays (VNAs). The clinical immunology department offers Janssen Vaccines with services in Scientific and operational excellence, with high standards of quality and compliance. The main responsibility of the scientist is to guarantee the correct design and execution of experiments for the development and validation of the immunological assays used for clinical sample analysis. His/her activities must be executed and reported according to Good Clinical Laboratory Practice (GCLP) quality requirements. Besides this, the scientist is responsible for the scientific quality of the analysis of clinical trial samples, as well as life cycle management of the methods he/she is the specialist on. To that effect, the scientist needs to consider the long-term strategies of the project and align the strategy accordingly.   Qualifications  Must have: Multiple years (>3) of experience at a pharmaceutical company and/or CRO Proven, hands-on experience of bio-assay development to validation according to regulatory guidelines (eg. ICH, FDA, etc) In-depth knowledge of and multiple years of experience with wild type VNAs and Pseudovirion neutralization assays. Experienced in working under quality standards such as GCLP and GCP Nice to have: Experience In working with a LIMS system Experience working with working on vaccines Competences: The right candidate is: Quality minded and flexible. Able to remain calm and positive under pressure. A standout colleague with soft skills, able to motivate and empower others. Good planning and coordinating skills. Our company offers a broad range of benefits and a competitive salary, as well as flexible hours and home office possibilities. Are you our right candidate and ready to take this step in your career? Help us to get these vaccines on the market and be part of this outstanding opportunity! Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   Primary Location Netherlands-South Holland-Leiden- Organization Janssen Vaccines & Prevention BV (8852) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2005847643W

title: Data Scientist - Retail & Consumer Products
description: Position Description: Als Data Scientist help je mee met het uitbreiden van onze positie bij klanten in de wereld van Retail. Je helpt onze klanten met complexe problemen waarbij een beroep wordt gedaan op jouw analytische vaardigheden.  Wat ga je doen? Jij voert slimme analyses uit en maakt daarbij gebruik van de nieuwste concepten en mogelijkheden zoals machine learning, predictive modelling en deep learning; Jij ontwikkelt slimme algoritmiek waarmee retailers het koopgedrag van hun klanten kunnen beïnvloeden op het gebied van bijvoorbeeld promoties. Of modellen die bepalen wat de optimale prijs moet zijn voor de consument, of welke store locaties het beste gekozen kunnen worden op basis van enorme hoeveelheden data? Jij ontwikkelt machine learning algoritmes die bijvoorbeeld de basis bieden voor sentiment analysis. Voor dit doel worden alle transacties, e-mails, en search inquiries, vroegere aankopen, etc. geanalyseerd en verwerkt om uiteindelijk de merchandising processen te optimaliseren; Jij helpt onze klanten deze verschillende modellen van data analyses te implementeren om de customer shopping experience zo optimaal mogelijk te maken; Je bent in staat om industrie- en IT trends te vertalen naar (innovatie) oplossingen, die passen bij de bedrijfsvoering van onze klanten. Je neemt hiervoor deel aan business development- en sales trajecten met als doel nieuwe kansen te creëren bij bestaande of nieuwe klanten van CGI; Je werkt nauw samen bij de klant met de verschillende business stakeholders om te komen tot uiteindelijke relevante data modellen voor de bedrijfsvoering van de klant.  Wat breng je mee? Je hebt een passie voor data en innovatie. Je bent van nature nieuwsgierig, proactief en weet gemakkelijk anderen voor jouw ideeën te winnen. Daarnaast ben je actief in kennisdeling en –ontwikkeling binnen je vakgebied en bezit je aantoonbare consultancy vaardigheden. Verder heb jij: Een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding met een sterke statistiek component, zoals (toegepaste) wiskunde, technische natuurkunde, econometrie of data science; Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist in het commerciële domein; Kennis en ervaring met het gebruik van advanced analytics, big data, machine learning; Ervaring in het vertalen van bedrijfsproblemen of -uitdagingen naar oplossingen; Aantoonbare ervaring in het oplossen van complexe uitdagingen met behulp van data analyse en modellering; Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met Big Data-concepten en technologieën: Programmeren in SAS, R en/of Python; Ervaring gebruik ML Libraries voor classification, regression, NLP (sklearn, nltk, genism); Ervaring met BI tooling en dashboarding zoals tableau, Power BI of vergelijkbare toolings. Kennis op het gebied van Agile werkmethoden; Aantoonbare ervaring met cloudplatformen, zoals Azure, AWS of Google; Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en schrift.  Waar kom je terecht? Als Data Scientist kom je te werken binnen de unit Retail & Consumer Products, de snelst groeiende unit binnen CGI. CGI biedt een uitdagende, dynamische en afwisselende omgeving waarbij jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling centraal staat. We zijn een grote organisatie, maar door het gebruik van kleine teams bevorderen we de persoonlijke aandacht. Naast ons werk bij de klant, delen we kennis en discussiëren we met collega’s binnen de practices over nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen jouw specialisatie. Discussies die leiden tot tastbare oplossingen die passen in de digitale transformatie van onze klanten. CGI helpt retailers om hun internationale groei te realiseren. Wij helpen onze klanten om een client first organisatie neer te zetten waarbij het inrichten van een omnichannel omgeving als onderdeel van de digitale transformatie van groot belang is. Door de COVID zijn retailers en dus onze klanten versneld in een omnichannel omgeving gaan investeren. Wij geven samen met de klant vorm aan de digitale transformatie door mee te denken over de roadmap, IT-architectuur, procesoptimalisatie, implementatie omnichannel / unified commerce platforms tot aan wereldwijde global IT retail support toe. Ook werken wij mee aan Proof of Concepts op het gebied van bijvoorbeeld verkoop/promotionele data waarvoor we voorspellende algoritmes ontwikkelen.  Ons aanbod? Een vaste baan en de mogelijkheid om aandeelhouder te worden en zo mee te delen in onze successen. Zo wordt werken bij CGI dubbel beloond. Via de CGI Academy helpen we jou de juiste trainingen te volgen, want jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling vinden wij belangrijk en staat bij ons voorop. Een plek in onze hechte community waar we samen met elkaar de verantwoordelijkheid van projecten dragen en klantverwachtingen overtreffen. Een rol in ons CGI verhaal.  Are you ready to Be part of our story?  Interesse? Solliciteer dan direct! Wil je eerst meer informatie over de inhoud van de vacature? Neem dan contact op met Yvon van Boekholt (Director Consulting Services) via 06 1700 2048 of via yvon.van.boekholt@cgi.com Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met Seren Taylan (Recruitment Business Partner) via (088) 564 0000 of via seren.taylan@cgi.com  Benieuwd naar onze Retail expertise? Klik dan snel op CGI Retail & Consumer Products  Bezoek voor meer informatie over CGI: www.cginederland.nl  Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature is niet gewenst. What you can expect from us: Bouw met ons aan je carrière  Het is een bijzondere tijd binnen de wereld van IT, de digitale transformatie zit in een versnelling. CGI heeft een schat aan kennis en praktische ervaring op het gebied van digitale transformatie. Zo helpen wij onze klanten belangrijke stappen te zetten op de weg naar hun digitale transformatie en bieden we onze professionals uitdagende carrièremogelijkheden.  Ons succes is gebaseerd op het talent en de betrokkenheid van onze professionals. Samen, als één team, staan we voor de uitdagingen en delen we de beloningen die gepaard gaan met de groei van CGI. Dit versterkt het gevoel van eigenaarschap, want al onze professionals delen mee in de waarde die wij gezamenlijk creëren.  Kom werken bij CGI én bouw samen met ons aan een van de grootste, onafhankelijke, IT en zakelijke dienstverleners ter wereld.  Bezoek voor meer informatie over CGI: www.cginederland.nl  Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.  Wij bieden onze professionals een gelijkwaardige behandeling en gelijke carrièrekansen.  Meer informatie of vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem hiervoor contact op met de afdeling Recruitment via (088) 564 00 00.

title: Process Assessment and Validation Scientist III
summary: Drives process performance data trending during TT and post- TT, assessing the process performance and provides suggestions for process improvement.
description: Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. For our MSAT department in Geleen we are hiring a Process Assessment & Validation Scientist III. As Process Assessment & Validation Scientist III you are in charge of executing process assessment and validation activities in joint collaboration with the client with high level of independency. You will Provide technical know-how on GMP and aseptic manufacturing to the process development team. You will also providing guidance to the junior member of the team. Key responsibilities: Drives completion of process assessment and validation activities as per agreed timeline in close collaboration with internal and external parties Executes proper assessment on all process related areas including but not limited to the process, APS, facility, equipment and materials from GMP point of view, identifying the risks and suggesting appropriate mitigation strategies. Drives process performance data trending during TT and post- TT, assessing the process performance and provides suggestions for process improvement Actively participates in troubleshooting and serves as investigation lead for process impacting deviations and investigations. Provides technical guidance on change controls and how they might impact customer processes. Provides supervision and technical guidance to the junior members of the team Ensures and encourages an Operational Excellence environment Develops and report metrics for clients to trend project progress in collaboration with PM Keeps current with advances in cell and gene therapy field Strongly collaborates with process transfer manager on improving the performance of the team Key requirements: The position requires extensive knowledge in the field of process validation, cell and gene therapy and applicable technologies, GMP and aseptic manufacturing, risk mitigation The position requires solid experience in interacting and collaborating with the clients and internal parties, including professional communication and transparency The position involves in training of junior members of team on their daily tasks This function requires solid knowledge and adherence to ATMP specific regulations This function must perform independently in the area of responsibility and is responsible for ensuring in time delivery of deliverables assigned to. This position requires experience in working in a fast pace environment and demonstrating professional response to unexpected events. Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically. People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

title: Data Scientist Credit Risk
summary:
As a Data Scientist Credit Risk , you will be analysing data and credit risk models across all portfolios of Rabobank.
Growing a better world together.
description: Imagine… having an impact on all the models that affect all of our clients. As a Data Scientist Credit Risk , you will be analysing data and credit risk models across all portfolios of Rabobank. You’ll have a hand in monitoring the entire range of models that serve our business, clients and risk management, such as IRB credit risk and IFRS9 models.  Making a difference Implement and perform tests to monitor the models performance in Python Interpret and translate the results of quantitative analyses to understandable reports Practice your skills in communication and presentation by effectively sharing your observations with stakeholders, which in turn improves their work. Prove the added value of model monitoring by identifying flaws at the earliest possible moment. Be a part of the team engagement and take up . Have the opportunity to act as project manager and bring monitoring projects to a successful completion With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Our Credit Strategic Model Unit (CSMU) team brings diverse and talented people together to monitor and backtest the most important models of Rabobank. Your experience with modelling will be your guide as you analyse the performance of a variety of models and ensure that they meet ever-changing market and regulatory requirements. As a Data Scientist Credit Risk , you will practice intelligent ways of analysis with your CSMU team colleagues and dealing with stakeholders such as model validation and model developers.  Reinhardt, Team Lead Monitoring & Backtesting: “We are uniquely positioned within Risk analytics. We are involved in the whole model chain, from the monitoring aspect, and policy and methodology aspect that also impact model development and the strategy of the bank. From the monitoring specifically, what I appreciate is being able to propose solutions that contribute to strengthening the models in collaboration with a broad range of stakeholders, being the data, the business or even the regulatory side. All of this in a truly multicultural, diverse, and passionate team.” Jeroen, Advanced Analytics Young Professional: "For me CSMU has been a great starting point in getting to know the bank. In CSMU we work together with many other teams and face a wide variety of challenges. And because we focus on three aspects of credit models (strategy, methodology & backtesting) there is always plenty to learn!" With you If we were to ask your friends to describe you in a few key words, the answer would be: customer-focused, pro-active, accommodating, positive, empathetic and eager to learn. For the position of Data Scientist Credit Risk , you should also have: A Master’s or PhD in an exact science (econometrics, mathematics, physics, engineering, astronomy or similar) 1-3 years of experience in (credit) modelling/validation Programming experience in Python, SQL, GIT or similar Practical experience with regulatory requirements (IFRS9, Basel2, TRIM, LGD, PD) Fluency in English; both in writing and in oral communication Experience in project management and organisation or Agile way of working Growing a better world together Rabobank is a financial services provider for 8,5 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we are also working to make the world a better place? We do so in countless ways, such as: Supporting risk-savvy models that ensure the right balance between business opportunities and appetite, to drive effective financial services. Growing better models together, which enables the right customers to get the right support at the right time to pursue their dreams. Ensuring that the models that are made, are made even better by your impact. Interested? Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36 hour working week), you can expect: A gross monthly salary between €3.200,- and €5.300,- depending on your experience and Seniority. A thirteenth month and holiday pay. An Employee Benefit Budget of 9% or10% of your gross monthly salary. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, or making extra pension contributions. Flexible working times and location-independent working. 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport. Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a home/work travel allowance. A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3,5%. Let's meet Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Data Scientist Credit Risk and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht. Good to know: Laura Dijkerman, recruiter would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via Laura.Dijkerman@rabobank.nl The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank. Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link. Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are. Acquisition further to this vacancy is not appreciated

title: Stage Data Analytics en/of Data Science
summary:
Een passie voor data en mogelijk data science.
Ad hoc klantenkaart data analyses tbv merchandising teams, marketing teams en customer data & retention team.
description: Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek Ben jij een enthousiaste student(e) met een flinke dosis motivatie en opzoek naar een leerzame stage bij Ahold Delhaize? Bekijk dan de volgende vacature:  Dit ga je bij ons doen Met onze klantenkaart en app hebben we toegang tot een grote hoeveelheid klantenkaart en transactie data, waar we klantsegmentaties mee hebben gemaakt, en analyses kunnen doen op klant of transactie niveau. Dit staat nog in de kinderschoenen maar de mogelijkheden zijn natuurlijk eindeloos. Voor de stage zijn we op zoek naar iemand die kan ondersteunen bij data analyses, en/of eventueel zelfs mooie data science modellen op zetten, enerzijds met onze klantenkaart- en transactie data, maar ook met Nielsen marktdata. Je gaat direct bijdragen aan de dagelijkse operatie van het team en hierin aan de gang met eigen en gezamenlijke projecten. Je werkt hierbij samen met de Loyalty data scientist, business analist, andere afdelingen binnen Etos en Nielsen. Ben jij iemand met sterke analytische skills en eventueel full on programmeer ervaring of interesse in data science, dan hebben wij echt een superleuke plek voor jou in ons team. Je gaat je onder andere bezighouden met: Ondersteunen bij wekelijkse en periodieke klantenkaart programma performance analyse Wekelijkse analyse email performance (omzet uplift, transactie uplift) Ad hoc klantenkaart data analyses tbv merchandising teams, marketing teams en customer data & retention team Eventueel meehelpen met bouwen nieuwe klanten segmentaties en algoritmes ten behoeve van bijvoorbeeld email klantenselectie Nielsen marktdata periodieke markaandelen analyses Verbeteringen aanbrengen in de periodieke Nielsen analyses Support en uitleg aan leveranciers mbt klantenkaart data rapportages\  Jouw nieuwe werkplek Bij Etos, onderdeel van Ahold Delhaize, hebben we maar één doel: mensen helpen en inspireren om gezonder en gelukkiger te leven. Werken bij Etos betekent werken bij een organisatie in transitie. Je helpt mee in het vormgeven van de (online) drogist van nu én in de toekomst. De afdeling E-commerce is verantwoordelijk voor de online kanalen zoals de webshop en email. Via het loyalty programma genaamd 'Etos Extra' kunnen deze kanalen worden gepersonaliseerd, met als doel het binden van de klanten aan het merk Etos. Dit doen we mede door het spaarprogramma, het aanbieden van extra acties aan onze deelnemers en het versturen van diverse digitale nieuwsbrieven met beauty & gezondheidstips en inspiratie voor jonge ouders. De twee data scientisten werken nauw samen met bijvoorbeeld de business analisten binnen Marketing, maar ook met de afdelingen Digital, Campagne en Merchandise. Onze doelstelling is om klanten loyaler te maken en te inspireren met relevante kortingen en informatie. Normaliter werk je vanuit ons bruisende hoofdkantoor in Zaandam, op de vijfde etage. Vanwege de huidige situatie is thuis jouw nieuwe werkplek.  Dit bieden we jou Interessante en veelzijdige stageplaats voor 5 of 6 maanden; Veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen initiatieven; Een kijkje op de afdeling waar meegedacht en –gewerkt kan worden aan alle vernieuwingen en verbetering voor de winkel en de medewerker; De Ahold Delhaize internship experience (borrels, events en netwerken met alle stagiairs binnen het hoofdkantoor); Goede stage- en reiskostenvergoeding (450-500 euro per maand plus reiskostenvergoeding); Stage waarin je échte werkervaring opdoet in het veld! Mogelijkheid tot afstuderen in combinatie met 4 dagen meewerken. Dit breng je mee HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau met gewenste afstudeerrichting; Studie (Commerciële) Economie, Econometrie of Data Science, of aanverwante studies. Andere studierichtingen niet uitgesloten, maar wel met duidelijke motivatie Affiniteit met retail en ‘hands on’ mentaliteit. Je werkt zelfstandig en bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen Een passie voor data en mogelijk data science Een sterke analyticus die snel situaties kan doorgronden en tot de kern komt Kennis en ervaring met analystic tools of data science en ervaring met een of meerdere programmeertalen zoals Python, PySpark, R is een pré." Solliciteer en kom binnen Werken bij Etos betekent flexibel werken. Vanuit huis en op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Wil je mee bouwen aan het succes van Etos? Solliciteer direct, en zeker vóór 21 maart. We willen je vragen om geen standaard motivatiebrief te sturen, maar een antwoord te formuleren op de volgende vragen: Waarom zou je bij Etos stage willen lopen? Waarom denk jij dat je geschikt bent voor deze stageplek? Vermijd woorden die in deze vacaturetekst staan en houd het persoonlijk. Wat is een van je sterke punten en welke vaardigheid zou je (verder) willen ontwikkelen tijdens deze stage? Eerst meer weten voordat je de stap maakt? Fleur Wijtman vertelt je meer over deze vacature via fleur.wijtman@etos.nl. Algemene vragen over stages kan je mailen naar stage@aholddelhaize.com  Wat bieden we? Als vulploegmedewerker bij Etos ontvang je een uitstekend salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Gezelligheid Afwisselend werk Goed worden in adviseren en verkopen Leren om service- en klantgericht te zijn Leren en groeien in vakgebied Expertise opbouwen Beste drogisterij van Nederland 2018 Medewerkersbetrokkenheid 88%

title: Data Analist Capacity Management
summary: Je spot patronen in een enorme bak gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data, verzorgt diepgaande analyses en ontwikkelt samen met het IT-team, data scientists…
description: Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij? Bol.com verandert retail om het dagelijks leven van 11 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten makkelijker te maken. Op die missie worden we vergezeld door de 39.000 zakelijke partners die op ons retail tech platform ondernemen. Samen zijn we goed voor een aanbod van ~30 miljoen artikelen en ‘bestelpieken’ tot wel 700 orders per minuut (Black Friday 2020). Om die strak te verwerken, moeten we de – per definitie beperkte – capaciteit in de warehouses slim benutten. Crunch jij hoe? De grootste uitdaging Bol.com groeit razendsnel. Dat is positief, maar brengt ook uitdagende vraagstukken met zich mee. Uit welk magazijn kunnen we een bestelling het best verzenden? Hoe zorgen we ervoor dat klanten hun bestellingen vaker in één verpakking ontvangen? Welk assortiment leggen we waar neer? We hebben een steeds complexere logistieke operatie en moeten toch zo goedkoop mogelijk blijven en altijd de volgende dag kunnen leveren; capacity management. Elk project is anders en vergt een unieke aanpak. Dat is meteen een van jouw uitdagingen: Met jouw unieke data-skills ontwikkel en verbeter je deze processen, IT services en/of (data science) modellen bestaande uit een brede variëteit van variabelen. Wat je doet als Data Analist Capacity Management Je spot patronen in een enorme bak gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data, verzorgt diepgaande analyses en ontwikkelt samen met het IT-team, data scientists en business analisten analyses die logistieke kansen, knelpunten inzichtelijk maken Je benut je ketendenkvermogen om schaalbare oplossingen te bedenken, waarbij het gehele logistieke netwerk in scope is Je helpt collega’s bij complexe analyses en modelleringen, waarbij jij vaak net die creatieve route kunt plotten die collega’s ontgaat Je werkt nauw samen met een brede range stakeholders op alle niveaus, zowel vanuit de logistieke operatie als bij andere afdelingen zoals logistieke strategie en sourcing excellence Als Data Analyst (DA) ben je het cijfermatig geweten van je team en lever je een impactvolle bijdrage aan het doel van het team voor het product (gebied) of domein. Jouw rol is het toepassen van tooling om data te analyseren, relevante inzichten te formuleren en je bevindingen voor stakeholders te presenteren en te visualiseren. Uitdagend, want de analyses zijn uiterst complex en we willen dat de inzichten die je ontwikkelt impact hebben. Hoewel de DA rol dicht bij het werkveld van Data Science ligt, ben je nauw betrokken bij business beslissingen. De DA rol is niet een rol waar je gewoon analyses uitvoert op aanvraag. We verwachten meer dan dat. We hebben je nodig om voortdurend nieuwe hypothesen te formuleren en te testen. Duik op eigen initiatief in de gegevens, stel innovaties of projectverbeteringen/ voorstellen voor. Blijf ons meer inzichten geven, meer manieren om diensten en producten te verbeteren. Visualiseer de gegevens voor innovatieteams, maar ook voor bol.com partners. Dit vereist het helder kunnen presenteren en weergeven van complex materiaal. Het invloedrijke karakter van deze baan en het baanbrekende aspect dragen bij aan de aantrekkingskracht. Daarnaast coach je de Business Analisten in de innovatieteams om hun datavaardigheden te verbeteren, om datagedreven besluitvorming en innovatie te bevorderen. De pay off is groot, want jouw oplossingen dragen bij aan het overwinnen van majeure logistieke capaciteitsuitdagingen en daarmee aan het gemak van miljoenen klanten. 3 redenen waarom dit (n)iets voor jou is Wel, als je een solide (3+ jaar) analytisch trackrecord kunt overleggen Wel, als je complexiteit kunt doorgronden én op kunt breken in gesimplificeerde onderdelen Wel, als je bij python denkt aan modelleren Niet, als je het managen van stakeholders als noodzakelijk kwaad ziet Niet, als je heel goed bent in analyses, maar de interpretatie graag elders belegt Niet, als je bang wordt van een complex en extreem datarijk landschap Hier kom je terecht Bij hét online retail tech platform van Nederland en België. Een platform waar 11 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten kiezen uit 30 miljoen artikelen. En een platform dat zo’n 39.000 zakelijke partners helpt succesvol te ondernemen. Maar vooral een platform dat nooit ‘af’ is, want bol.com verandert retail al sinds 1999. En dat blijven we doen. Als het beter kan, maken we het beter! Samen met klanten, partners en zo’n 2.100 collega’s. En hopelijk samen met jou! Als Data Analist Capacity Management ben je onderdeel van het Capacity Management team. Dat bestaat uit 10 collega’s met een academische achtergrond. De setting is open, informeel, scherp op de inhoud, nuchter en innovatief. Bol.com gelooft in zelforganiserende teams, data-gedreven pionieren en samen successen vieren. Solo ga je snel. Samen met je collega’s kom je verder. Wat je krijgt Wat je krijgt Wat je nog meer krijgt Een blauwe landing Nieuwe collega's krijgen bij bol.com een warm welkom, zodat jij je zo goed en snel mogelijk thuis voelt bij ons. Tijdens jouw introductieprogramma bol.com & ik, nemen we je helemaal mee in de bol.com wereld! Geld enzo.... Werken bij bol.com is uitdagend en daar zetten we uiteraard iets tegenover. Naast salaris, ontvang je ook een jaarlijkse prestatiegerichte bonus, vakantiegeld, 29 vakantiedagen, woon-en werkverkeer regelingen, aanvullende premievrije verzekeringen en meer. Jouw sollicitatieprocedure Je solliciteert We bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig en binnen 2 weken weet je of we je uitnodigen voor een gesprek. Eerste contact We bellen om het eerste gesprek in te plannen. Prangende vragen kun je dan al meteen stellen. In het ‘echt’ ontmoeten Dit eerste gesprek zien we als een kennismaking. We leren elkaar beter kennen en ontdekken of we goed bij elkaar passen. Het vervolggesprek Smaakt het naar meer? Dan gaan we in het tweede gesprek de inhoud in. Hiervoor vul je eerst een online assessment in met persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst, capaciteitentest en een case. Wij lichten de functie en het team toe. Wederzijdse liefde Twee gesprekken zijn vaak genoeg om een goed beeld te krijgen. En als onze liefde wederzijds is, dan begint jouw carrière bij bol.com. :) Nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Marvin Ensing Recruiter marvinensing@bol.com

title: Senior Data Scientist FR&R
summary: With your experience as an data scientist, you combine both data science, data management and communicative skills to deliver high quality analytical use cases.
description: As a Data Scientist you play an important role within the Data & Analytics team of Financial Restructuring & Recovery (FR&R). You know the world of data and advanced analytics well, and within a short period of time you are able to link this to the complex data environment within ABN AMRO. With your experience as an data scientist, you combine both data science, data management and communicative skills to deliver high quality analytical use cases.  You are one of the Data Scientists within the Data & Analytics team. The team currently consists of 17 people and is responsible for all data and analytics related activities within FR&R. We are a new, young and dynamic team that is characterized by a collaborative working environment. We are an enthusiastic team working on a variety of data and analytics activities that strengthen our department and the bank and fun is of utmost importance during our daily work. Your job Your role focuses on formulating and developing data science solutions relevant to FR&R. You will take care of the full development cycle from exploring, presenting and identifying opportunities, experimenting and creating prototypes, to developing, benchmarking and testing models. Your role combines both technical and communicative skills to deliver high quality data science and stakeholder management.  You will start with one of the key analytical use cases for the department: the redevelopment of the Red Square project. Red Square will lead to a significant improvement in managing credit risk, efficiency and effectivity in the credit review and an expected improvement from a client perspective within FR&R. The project is already initiated but despite high scoring performance metrics, a redevelopment of the model is needed. You will work with a team of people on this use case, ranging from business experts to technical people from our data management department. Besides this program, we are very keen to see your creativity and skills on other analytical use cases.  You will support FR&R to become a data driven department. You will engage with a large number of stakeholders from FR&R, Central Architecture & Data Management, Modelling, Corporate Data Office, business lines (Commercial Banking and Corporate & Institutional Banking) and the supporting IT teams. Combining technology and business knowledge, you’ll have a pivotal role. Working environment Financial Restructuring & Recovery (FR&R) is responsible for the high-risk loans of ABN AMRO, and therefore positioned in a dynamic environment in which customer relationships, managing risks and dealing with internal and external stakeholders (including regulators, advisers and other parts within ABN AMRO) is of great importance.  FR&R aims to guide clients through difficult times. FR&R's ambition is to work with the client to restore their financial and strategic health while minimizing losses and capital costs for ABN AMRO. In doing so, we also pay attention to our duty of care and our role as a bank. We respond adequately to the developments that are taking place in the (financial) markets and the world around us.  The Data & Analytics team within FR&R forms and implements the strategy to ensure FR&R’s activities are as data-driven as possible or to provide data-driven support. Data & Analytics ensures a "data & analytical mindset" and competence throughout FR&R. In our activities we continuously seek alignment with regulatory requirements and with various developments within ABN AMRO (such as development of the credit system landscape, collateral management solutions, Data integration hub, Risk Data & Analytics, data ownership / usership). This means that Data & Analytics both develops and maintains the capabilities within FR&R, and collaborates with a diversity of stakeholders to realize its ambitions.). Your profile You have 6+ years of relevant work experience MSc in the field of Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Statistics or similar Programming experience: e.g. Python, SQL, etc. Experience in Databricks is a plus You have a track-record in developing data science solutions that deliver business value You are pragmatic and value-focused. e.g. not afraid to work with existing solutions to reduce time-to-market You are able to communicate effectively with technical and business counterparts You are a team player that requires limited steering to be productive You work creatively, conscientiously and pragmatically You are up-to-date on the latest developments within data science and can guide others in finding optimal solutions Experience in financial services (preferably Risk Management experience) is a plus Proficiency in the Dutch language is plus We offer We offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to follow general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits:  A good monthly salary based on a 36-hour working week A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development The ability to work flexibly We help you to stay fit & vital An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel A good pension scheme A great organization with a great work culture Interesting work and challenging projects A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each other  Unfortunately, candidates without a Dutch work visa and / or living abroad are not eligible for this position. Interested? Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Anne Merel Oosterbroek, Head Data & Analytics FR&R (annemerel.oosterbroek@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Maike Daub (maike.daub@nl.abnamro.com). Equal opportunities for everyone The success of our organization stands or falls with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our customers are created by a combination of culture, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to our organization. To ensure that all colleagues within ABN AMRO can develop their qualities, we encourage an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. Location Multiple office locations in Amsterdam and, naturally, the option to work from home.

title: Head of Data & Analytics
summary: You will manage and develop a team of data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers many of whom until recently worked in separate organizations.
description: The Head of Data & Analytics will be responsible for data & analytics including data strategy, governance and architecture across the Infinitas Learning Group. They will drive day-to-day insights in business intelligence, develop new use cases for data science, and be responsible for delivery of our long-term data transformation roadmap, thereby ensuring that the needs of the stakeholders from the different operating companies are being met. Furthermore, they will play a big role in transforming the company into a data-driven and data literate company, and will bring the current team to a new level through hands-on coaching and management. Infinitas Learning is a dynamic educational resources company, and one of Europe's leading providers of innovative and engaging products and services for teaching and learning. The company is passionate about unlocking the maximum potential of every individual through lifelong learning. Infinitas Learning's companies create an impressive array of educational resources that are used in primary schools, secondary schools, further education colleges and the professional markets. Infinitas Learning's products span interactive software, online learning, e-books, audio books and printed text books, many of which are market leaders in their field. The Infinitas Learning group includes Noordhoff (Netherlands), Liber (Sweden), and Plantyn (Belgium). The group consists of approximately 600 employees. Infinitas Learning is based in Utrecht, Papendorp. Key Responsibilities and Behaviors You are responsible for designing and executing a futureproof Data & Analytics strategy which will serve both the company’s internal insight needs, as well as serve our external clients by providing them with deep insights in, and recommendations for, their learning progression You drive and elevate your team in delivering business insights and analysis that helps business owners accurately understand their business and make the right decisions to steer it going forward You lead the data transformation, ensuring that Infinitas’ goals & ambitions with respect to data are met, and with help of company management are a driving force to instill a data- driven way of working throughout Infinitas Learning Group You will set-up Advanced Analytics with the aim of creating data products / services that improve learning performance and further ‘Personalized Learning’ for users of our educational solutions You are responsible for setting the right data definitions, create ways to accurately collect data, optimize how we store data, and present data in an insightful & accessible manner to stakeholders You will manage and develop a team of data analysts, data scientists, and data engineers many of whom until recently worked in separate organizations  5-7 years’ experience as head of data or similar role, otherwise strategy consulting Strong business sense and analytical skills Capable of leading a team of data specialists distributed across multiple locations, focussing on development of a professional, structured and data oriented culture Affinity with developing people through hands-on coaching Strong communication skills, ability to influence and guide peers and senior stakeholders to get buy in to changes Experience in leading (data / digital) transformation is considered a plus Experience in working with Azure / Python / PowerBI is considered a plus Fluent in English is a must, Dutch or Swedish beneficial but not essential
