title: PhD candidate: MRI Electrical Properties in Radiotherapy
summary: To create the data used to train and validate such framework, you will perform electromagnetic simulations and MRI measurements on phantoms and in-vivo.
description: This project aims at developing a novel reconstruction framework, which will turn MRI-based electrical properties measurements into a new biomarker for early-stage radiotherapy treatments assessment, and at testing it in clinical settings. In particular, you will develop a novel reconstruction framework integrating physics-based reconstruction methods and deep-learning solutions. To create the data used to train and validate such framework, you will perform electromagnetic simulations and MRI measurements on phantoms and in-vivo. You will benchmark in-vivo electrical properties reconstructions against metabolic sodium-MRI using a unique high-field metabolic scanner present at the radiotherapy department. Ultimately, to demonstrate the clinical applicability of tissue electrical properties imaging for diagnosis and early-stage assessment of radiotherapy treatments, you will perform the first study in brain tumor patients facilitated by the radiology and radiotherapy departments. The success of this project will open a window into personalized radiotherapy treatments and improve their cost/efficiency. The lack of ionizing radiation and the excellent soft tissue contrast make Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) the key imaging method in radiation oncology to diagnose cancer and monitor the efficacy of radiotherapy treatments. Currently, the assessment of radiotherapy treatments relies on surrogate indicators derived from MRI images, which show changes only months after treatment. To monitor the efficacy of radiotherapy treatments at earlier stages, new quantitative MRI biomarkers are needed. Radiotherapy alters tissue viability at early-stages of treatment, leading to abnormal electrolyte concentrations, where sodium is the most important electrolyte determining the electromagnetic properties of tissues. Tissue electromagnetic properties would therefore represent an original biomarker to assess tissue viability allowing early-stage treatment assessment. Tissue electrical properties images can in principle be reconstructed from clinical MRI measurements. However, state-of-the-art physics-based reconstructions are very sensitive to noise in the MRI signal, making these images inadequate for clinical use. Recently, the introduction of deep-learning methods and their integration with physics-based reconstructions have demonstrated impressive improvements in image quality, opening a new horizon for this technique. The starting date is at the latest September 1st 2021. Department You will be working at the internationally renowned Center for Image Sciences at the UMC Utrecht, within the Computational Imaging Group. In this project, you will collaborate with a team of image scientists, mathematicians, physicists, radiologists and radiation oncologists.  Profile You have a master degree in either Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics or Mathematics. You are also strongly motivated to acquire deep knowledge of MRI. A strong affinity with numerical computation, deep learning, and electromagnetism is highly appreciated. The maximum salary for this position (36 - 36 hours) is € 3.196,00 gross per month based on full-time employment. In addition, we offer an annual benefit of 8.3%, holiday allowance, travel expenses and career opportunities. The terms of employment are in accordance with the Cao University Medical Centers (UMC). More information If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact Stefano Mandija, Assistant professor, phone number: 088-7556037, e‑mail adress: S.Mandija@umcutrecht.nl. Acquisition based on this jobopening is not appreciated.

title: GA NAAR VACATURE
summary:
Echter: één van de key componenten van een goed getraind model, is (correct) gelabelde data.
We hebben de ambitie om een leading – next generation – business…
description: DATANEXT is een solide werkgever, met een fijn kantoor in Groningen Zuid. We hebben diverse teams, die o.a. bestaan uit Data Scientists, Data Developers, Customer Success Consultants en Developers, waarbij jij mede verantwoordelijk bent voor de (door) ontwikkeling van ons eigen Data Managent Platform en ons Marketing Automation Platform. We hebben de ambitie om een leading – next generation – business intelligence en data analyse oplossing voor een breed scala aan toonaangevende opdrachtgevers te onderhouden en door te ontwikkelen, o.a. door het toevoegen van Kunstmatige Intelligentie. Kunstmatige Intelligentie is één van de snelst groeiende en boeiende industrieën. Machines en computers zijn extreem goed geworden in het herkennen van spraakherkenning, zelfstandig “typen”, of zelfs spreken en converseren. Dit alles wordt mogelijk gemaakt door Machine Learning modellen. Echter: één van de key componenten van een goed getraind model, is (correct) gelabelde data. Om dat te bereiken zoeken wij mensen die door onze modellen gegenereerde transcripties willen en kunnen controleren en waar nodig corrigeren, om zo onze systemen te verbeteren. Daarnaast kan je aan taken denken waar emotie, sentiment en persoonlijkheid worden geclassificeerd in recordings of transcripties. Alle werkzaamheden vinden plaats binnen ons eigen platform. Jij? Jij bezit een laptop, beschikt over een internet verbinding en bent érg scherp op details. Je werkt zorgvuldig. Uren zijn flexibel en in overleg (maar wel altijd tijdens onze kantoortijden), we adviseren niet meer dan 5 uur per dag, aangezien een goede concentratie erg belangrijk is. Werken kan vanuit huis, of bij ons op kantoor. Interesse? Laat het ons weten via hr@datanext.nl, onder vermelding van de functietitel en gericht aan Louise Wiggers – Manager Operations.  Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt NIET op prijs gesteld.

title: Data scientist - datavirtualisatie
summary:
Dat is de uitdaging die jij als data scientist - datavirtualisatie bij de Volksbank in Utrecht oppakt.
We staan voor goed gevalideerde data, toegankelijke…
description: Werken aan de optimalisatie van een complex rapportagelandschap in een omgeving die volop in beweging is. Dat is de uitdaging die jij als data scientist - datavirtualisatie bij de Volksbank in Utrecht oppakt.  Zo ziet jouw baan eruit Een nieuwe basis voor onze interne rapportages en analyses waarbij datavirtualisatie centraal staat: die ga jij opzetten en onderhouden. Dit doe je, na een inwerkperiode, zelfstandig en waar nodig in teamverband. Datavirtualisatie is binnen onze bank een relatief nieuw fenomeen. Door jouw brede technische kennis heb je snel door hoe we deze manier van data-integratie optimaal kunnen toepassen. Zie je zaken die beter kunnen? Dan trek je onmiddellijk aan de bel bij het management en kom je met voorstellen.  Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het monitoren, beheren, verbeteren en bewaken van de continuïteit van de omgeving die inmiddels in de cloud staat. Jouw doel? Zorgen dat alle opgezette rapportages en analyses optimaal beschikbaar zijn. Je beheert de bestaande informatiestromen en waar nodig analyseer en ontsluit je nieuwe bronnen. Ook ken je rollen en autorisaties toe, richt je schedules in en bewaak je de databeschikbaarheid. Dankzij jou voldoet onze data-omgeving aan de wensen van de eindgebruikers. Het spreekt dan ook voor zich dat je goed op de hoogte bent van de behoeftes van die gebruikersorganisatie, oftewel je collega’s binnen Finance en Risk. Alles wat je doet, is gericht op het realiseren van een stabiel en optimaal ingerichtrapportagelandschap.  Hier kom je te werken Je gaat aan de slag in het team DNA Innovation, dat onderdeel is van de afdeling Accounting, Reporting en Control. DNA Innovation onderzoekt en verbetert de processen rondom finance-rapportages. Ons doel? De dataproductie en -verwerking voor deze rapportages optimaliseren. We staan voor goed gevalideerde data, toegankelijke rapportages en moderne tooling. Daarbij werken we steeds meer datagedreven. We zijn met z’n dertienen en, vanwege nieuwe taken, nog volop groeiende. Als team halen we graag het beste in elkaar naar boven en kunnen we goed relativeren. We gaan voor resultaat, en vinden het leuk om onze ervaringen met elkaar te delen en samen te lachen.  Jouw kwaliteiten Voor ons team ben jij een echte aanwinst. Je bent betrokken, betrouwbaar en sociaal, waardoor je door iedereen wordt gewaardeerd. Ook communiceer je open en vlot. Daarnaast ben je analytisch sterk, resultaatgericht en een conceptueel denker. Je taken en verantwoordelijkheden neem je serieus. En je bent erg integer. Niet onbelangrijk gezien de vele vertrouwelijke informatie waarmee je in aanraking komt.  Verder heb je: Een kwantitatieve achtergrond op hbo- of wo-niveau, Ervaring met Apache Spark (big data processing) en met werken in de cloudomgeving. Kennis van data-architectuur, en bij voorkeur ook van datavirtualisatie (fraXses). Ervaring met programmeren in Python/SQL en kennis van Kubernetes,. Affiniteit met Finance en reporting in de context van een financiële dienstverlener. Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels. Voldoe je niet helemaal aan de bovenstaande eisen, maar heb je wel de ambitie en potentie om je te ontwikkelen tot een zelfstandig opererende informatiespecialist datavirtualisatie? Ook dan nodigen we je van harte uit te solliciteren. Afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring mag je rekenen op een salaris van minimaal € 2.827,54,- (bij schaal 8) tot maximaal € 4.948,26,- (bij schaal 9) per maand en voldoende mogelijkheden om door te groeien binnen de Volksbank.  Solliciteren? Upload je motivatie en cv via de sollicitatiebutton. We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Vragen over de functie? Stel ze aan Peter Goris, businessmanager Finance bij Accounting, Reporting en Control, via peter.goris@devolksbank.nl. Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure kun je terecht bij Vera Reidinga, corporate recruiter, via vera.reidinga@devolksbank.nl of 06 – 53 94 03 79 (of stuur een whatsapp bericht).

title: Staff Data Scientist
summary:
Your role also involves technical leadership and mentorship of data scientists and machine learning engineers.
Who we are and what we do.
description: Who we are and what we do SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our platform empowers more than 20 million active users to analyze and act on feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and market research respondents. SurveyMonkey's products, enterprise solutions, and integrations enable more than 345,000 organizations to deliver better customer experiences, increase employee retention , and unlock growth and innovation. Ultimately, SurveyMonkey's vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. More about our Product Data Science Team Equipped with rich product data ranging from text to image and video, we build cutting edge ML models to solve real customer issues. In the past, we have filed patents about our novel machine learning algorithms to help customers from survey creation to insight extraction, such as bias questions identification models to provide recommendations on rephrasing these questions, sentiment analysis models to reveal the emotions behind what respondents are thinking, and response quality models to suggest removing bad responses. We work closely with Machine Learning engineers to ship models in production seamlessly. Therefore you will see the impact of the models quickly. You will report to Data Science Manager. What we're looking for You will play a leading role in deriving key insights from our enormous data, suggest and implement new product features, and make improvements in existing models for better user experience. Your role also involves technical leadership and mentorship of data scientists and machine learning engineers. You will Transform a business problem to a machine learning problem Develop machine learning algorithms and systems Evaluate offline and online performance Involve in strategy planning You have Deep knowledge in machine learning algorithms, especially in the domain of natural language processing Strong programming skills, expert knowledge of algorithms, and data structures (Python preferred) Expert knowledge of AWS, Pytorch/Tensorflow, Scikit-learn and Pandas Prior experience in partnering with business teams to identify trends and opportunities. What we offer our employees SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can thrive. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals. SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and we have also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC's Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100. Our commitment to an inclusive workplace SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

title: Analyst, Creative Labs
summary:
6+ years of relevant work experience as an analyst, product manager, data scientist or creative program manager.
Bachelor’s degree or higher.
description: Amsterdam, Netherlands Creative Production Who are we? Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.  Netflix’s Creative Production Team is in part responsible for developing engaging promotional creative (videos, imagery, text, synopses, etc) to launch content at a global scale. Creative Studio Labs within Creative Production experiments with compelling artwork, video, and audio for our global platform. As a part of Creative Labs, this role is responsible for empowering team members to be more strategic and data-informed in their decisions around promotional media. The charter is to empower creative producers and makers with data-informed strategies which elevate the work and provide an optimal experience for Netflix members.  An Analyst thinks at a high level to collaborate on the development of creative strategies that contribute to improved promotional imagery, AV, and copy that represent shows and films on Netflix. You possess a strong ability to partner closely and effectively with a variety of internal teams, as well as partners external to Netflix, to develop not only the strategies but also the metrics, tools, and tests that allow us to arrive at them. You are always thinking about how testing both on and off of our product can drive improvements in the ways we promote to our members, as well as how we elevate and innovate upon the actual work. You are a translator of data and testing results, providing far reaching insights across our growing global business. You bring knowledge of the EMEA market to your global team while working to connect dots across all Labs initiatives. While you are always looking to maximize your impact for the EMEA market, you root your work in aligned-upon priorities and business objectives. Role and Responsibilities Leading and attending cross-functional meetings with partners to understand ongoing and upcoming product business objectives and prioritizing creative questions and ideas according to those business objectives (i.e. emerging markets, automation-assisted asset creation for scale, etc.). Prioritizing business objectives and ideas from key stakeholders to develop creative curiosities into testing hypotheses and strategies. Drafting and driving the execution of specific qualitative and quantitative analyses on the various creative assets. Collaborating with data science partners on metric, tooling, and dashboard development that is crucial to providing feedback to creative design strategies. Partnering with product innovation partners to inform and ensure optimal execution of tests and related initiatives. Identifying opportunities specific to your market while staying highly aligned with your core Labs team and their objectives. Constantly documenting and communicating upcoming tests and changes in strategies and operations as they relate to the creative assets. Consistently rethinking and improving the ways by which we collect ideas, aggregate insights, and communicate those insights broadly. Addressing questions and issues related to tests and results surrounding creative assets from both engineering and creative producer partners. The position will report directly to the Manager, Optimization Strategy. Requirements 6+ years of relevant work experience as an analyst, product manager, data scientist or creative program manager. Experience with A/B testing, data analysis, and ideation of new product features and processes. Ability to effectively distill and communicate complex concepts in a digestible manner. The soft skills to recognize when to challenge conventional thinking, the courage to voice suggestions and the maturity to accept feedback on ideas and work. Understanding of and passion for algorithms and machine learning. Demonstrated data fluency; comfortable with large datasets, constructing queries, designing data visualizations and extracting meaning from your analysis. Bachelor’s degree or higher. title: Data Science Thesis Intern
summary:
Contribute to the connection within the data scientist community of Rabobank.
Understand business challenges and able to translate their needs to a data…
description: Imagine… Imagine you enable Rabobank to understand the new era of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. As a Data Science Thesis Intern, you can make the difference for Rabobank to become the large Fintech of the future. Making a difference Become an expert on applying machine learning and artificial intelligence on risk models. You are open and eager to continuously expand your knowledge by connecting to internal stakeholders and external experts. Understand business challenges and able to translate their needs to a data scientist perspective. You will perform business interviews and workshops to get an understanding about the needs, translate the needs into a project and ensure the end result will be delivered. Present machine learning, artificial intelligence and the results of your modelling efforts in an understandable way to the business. Contribute to the connection within the data scientist community of Rabobank. With each other Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Advanced Analytics connects data scientists across Rabobank and our subsidiaries to solve business challenges with new and innovative ways of working. We make risk models based on machine learning and artificial intelligence for various business purposes. We are continuously looking to broaden our knowledge and look beyond the beaten path. We dare to challenge and are committed to contribute to a better Rabobank. Advanced Analytics is relatively young team within the Risk domain that brings talented people together to build on the core of Rabobank: maximize risk-return decisions supported by data driven models. With you as a Data Science thesis intern, the team will consist of nine diverse colleagues. Tom, Data Scientist “I immediately got a lot of responsibility and got to know many departments within the Rabobank in a short amount of time.”  With you We are looking for enthusiastic colleagues who are willing to think outside of the box and are inspired by driving change. Definitely consider applying if you recognize yourself in the following skills: You have strong analytical skills, are able to understand and challenge complex processes, can quickly analyse key messages from documents and interviews You love machine learning and are eager to learn even more of it. Previous experience is a pre. You have > 2 years of programming experience in Python and SQL or familiar programming languages. You are enrolled in a relevant Master’s degree: Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science or related. You operate as a self-starter, you work independently and you pro-actively look for solutions. You are not set back by internal and/or external guidelines. You are prepared to be challenged by our team and other stakeholders. In return, we expect you to do the same. You show style flexibility to adjust to different situations to reach your goals. You love to connect and are able to create and maintain a network across Rabobank and with relevant external parties. You are fluently proficient in English (speaking, listening and writing). Research questions Within our team we offer the possibility to do research on the following topics: 1. Optimization metrics based on monetary values In loan applications a client can default on his loan. As a bank, there is great value in knowing the exact cost of a default. A machine learning based approach can be used in order to determine the cost of a default. If we also know the cost of a healthy client, Rabobank can use this information to make better predictions concerning credit risk when correcting for these costs. 2. Scanning tool for financials reports Data on financial statements of clients are key in the loan origination process. If the data is not obtained from the client correctly, the data is missing in the model and prediction accuracy might suffer. To ease the client journey in the loan acceptance process, a financial report scanner that makes use of machine learning models is very useful. Having such a tool not only increases the accuracy and cleanliness of the data, but eases the loan application journey for the client. 3. Simulation tool for portfolio experimentation In order to assess the effects of new policies or strategies regarding portfolio management, a simulation tool can be very insightful. E.g. to ascertain the impact of calibration of loan rates to long term averages, or to determine the effects of implementing more restrictive conditions to loan applicants, and many more scenarios. This research could potentially be used to determine the effect that portfolio changes have across the entire Rabobank. Growing a better world together You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? Within Advanced Analytics we are continuously looking for opportunities to be involved in our community as well as to grow a better world together with help of our data science capabilities. Interested? Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. Please submit your CV and cover letter by clicking on the Apply Now button below. Make sure to include the exact time span in which you are available in your cover letter. Let's meet Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Data Science Thesis Intern and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy. Good to know: For an internship you have to remain enrolled at a university for the whole duration of the internship. If you have any questions about the specific details of this position, please contact Lennart Verboven via +31621896837 or lennart.verboven@rabobank.nl. If you have questions about the recruitment procedure, please contact Madelyne Janssen via Madelyne.Janssen@rabobank.nl The application process includes screening. Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Analyst
summary:
Qualitative and quantitative data analysis.

Data synthesis in Excel (SPSS pré).
description: We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply... Job Details The Consulting division of Kantar in Amsterdam is specialized in building purposeful organizations. Identifying new growth opportunities, creating purposeful brands and building futureproof capabilities is at the core of our expertise. Change now occurs at warp speed and impacts every aspect of how people live and buy. This challenges companies to look beyond traditional sources and methods to drive growth. We believe that businesses have an unprecedented opportunity to find new sources of growth by harnessing the power of people, technology, data and digital to fulfil consumer needs before people even knew they had them.  ABOUT THE ROLE  We currently have an exciting opportunity to join our team across the practices areas of Strategy, Purpose & Organizational Performance. We are looking for an Analyst who has a passion for helping our clients grow through diverse and bespoke consulting solutions. Making a positive impact by defining our clients’ purpose, transforming their organization, building futureproof capabilities or identifying new growth opportunities. In general, a strong passion for brands, learning & development, people and marketing is a must. Analysts work closely with Associate Directors and a team of consultants to help clients identify and capture purpose-led growth opportunities. They are expected to combine both “right” and “left” brain skills across engagements to enhance client deliverables and elevate organizational thinking. Analysts play an integral role in supporting all aspects of client engagements by conducting financial analysis, designing & analysing market research, synthesizing various data sets, translating data into consumer insights, creating client presentations, and preparing client workshops. Travel is a part of many client engagements, but usually does not exceed 10% of time requirements.  KEY OUTCOMES Qualitative and quantitative data analysis Data synthesis in Excel (SPSS pré) PowerPoint slide creation for training purposes, proposals, analytic plans, client deliverables, etc. Written and verbal client, vendor, partner communication CAPABILITIES Strong academic background, including Bachelors or Masters degree or equivalent from a top-tier university required A minimum of 1+ year’s experience working for or with a global brand in brand marketing Must be currently located in the Netherlands and/or hold a valid employment permit to work in the Netherlands Proven and strong business/brand acumen Strong interpersonal and English communication skills, both written and verbal Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office, in particular Excel and PowerPoint Critical and structural thinker Resourceful problem-solving skills and ability to take initiative Excellent organization and time management skills with the ability to multi-task Strong work ethic with superior attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and within a team  JOIN US  At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. We love to hear about your affinity to brands in general and our organizational and excellence practice in particular.  ABOUT KANTAR’S CONSULTING DIVISION We are a powerfully diverse mix of cultural, innovation and future experts, marketing, brand and organization consultants, data and marketing scientists, drawn from Kantar Futures, Kantar Added Value and Kantar Vermeer. We take a whole human approach to understanding the customer and the commercial opportunity, and a whole business approach to delivering our growth strategy through your people, brands and total customer experience. As part of WPP and Kantar, Kantar Consulting is a member of the world’s largest network of advertising and marketing consultancies. https://consulting.kantar.com/ Location Amsterdam, AmsteldijkNetherlands Kantar Rewards Statement At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Innovatie en data gedreven werken zijn essentieel voor onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij op basis van de verzamelde data innovatieve oplossingen te bedenken?
description: Waar een ander zenuwachtig wordt van de vele data stromen, word jij juist enthousiast. Zie jij de relaties binnen beschikbare data en kan jij deze formuleren tot een kans voor jezelf en onze opdrachtgevers? Dan ben jij de Data Scientist die wij zoeken. Dit is je kans! Groei jij mee met onze ambitieuze organisatie?  Codit is dé grootste Europese Microsoft-partner op gebied van integratie, IoT en Azure cloud-oplossingen. Clouddiensten zijn onmisbaar geworden binnen het IT-landschap. Wij nemen onze klanten graag mee in deze transitie. Hoe? Door hen te adviseren en bij te dragen aan het realiseren van de migratie naar de cloud. Deze transities bieden nieuwe mogelijkheden tot opslag en analyse van grote hoeveelheden data.  Innovatie en data gedreven werken zijn essentieel voor onze opdrachtgevers. Data goed organiseren en er maximaal rendement uit halen is een hoofdzaak geworden in onze dienstverlening. Door de dynamische ontwikkelingen in de markt, is het zeer uitdagend geworden om inzichtelijk te krijgen hoe deze data gebruikt kunnen worden. Jouw passie voor Data is zo groot dat jij samen met ons een bijdrage wilt leveren om onze klanten succesvol te maken. Jij legt met de analyse van data het fundament voor het verbeteren van bedrijfsprocessen. Samen met verschillende opdrachtgevers zoek je naar mogelijkheden om klanttevredenheid te verhogen, kosten te reduceren, materialen en dus het milieu te sparen en/of doorlooptijden te verkorten.  De mogelijkheid om Codit op de kaart te zetten als dé AI/IoT speler van Nederland, is iets waar jij energie van krijgt. Jij ziet mogelijkheden waar anderen beperkingen zien en schroomt niet om jouw bevindingen te delen met zowel collega’s als de wereld om ons heen. Jij begrijpt dat je bepalend bent voor het succes van onze Data Science, IoT, AI, Realtime en Data Lake projecten.  Kortom: Weet jij op basis van de verzamelde data innovatieve oplossingen te bedenken? Ontwikkel je graag prototypen en proof-of-concepts om te laten zien welke business waarde de nieuwste technologie kan brengen? Kan jij op verschillende niveaus adviseren en overtuigen? Heb je brede kennis en ervaring in het ontwikkelen en evalueren van Machine Learning & Data Mining-algoritmen (anomaliedetectie, voorspellende analyse, verkennende data-analyse en / of andere gebieden van datawetenschap)? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.  Werken bij Codit is werken met de nieuwste Microsoft technologieën, waaronder de laatste Azure oplossingen. Codit is een Microsoft Gold Cloud Platform partner en wordt mede daarom veel gevraagd om klanten te adviseren op het gebied van Azure en Data Science.  Jouw profiel: Heb jij een afgeronde Master of Science; Aantoonbare track record op gebied van Data Science/AI; Je bent bekend met Microsoft producten en hebt ervaring met de Clouddienst Azure; Ervaring met een of meerdere big data technologieën (bv. Databricks Spark, Cloudera / Hortonworks Hadoop); Ervaring met cloud computing omgeving (bv. AWS, Azure); Je werkt graag voor verschillende klanten en hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden; Je bent pro-actief en zelfredzaam; Je hebt een goede beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Wat wij jou bieden: Een enthousiast team van collega’s die graag met elkaar samenwerken. Bij Codit sta je er nooit alleen voor! We delen graag kennis en ervaringen met elkaar en blijven elkaar stimuleren om onze klanten tevreden te stellen en onze professionaliteit te vergroten. We investeren graag in het laten groeien van ons talent; iedereen krijgt een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget en -dagen. Dat je er niet alleen voor staat blijkt ook uit de Get2Gether; Elk kwartaal vindt de kwartaalmeeting plaats waarbij Business&Fun gecombineerd worden! Om het familiegevoel te vergroten organiseren we twee keer per jaar events waarbij het gezin van harte welkom is. Ook niet geheel onbelangrijk: Markt conform salaris en bonusplan; Leaseauto, mobiel en laptop; Gunstige pensioenregeling; Veel mogelijkheden om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen; Werken bij een officieel erkent Great Place To Work organisatie!  Let op: omdat onze opdrachten- en klantendatabase voornamelijk Nederlandstalige is, zoeken wij kandidaten die de Nederlandse taal vloeiend spreken!

title: Internship Albedo Calculation
summary: In addition, Royal HaskoningDHV employs a score of talented data scientists who are at the forefront of related developments.
description: Details Duration  Minimum of 4 months   Location  Depending on government’s Covid regulations at home or at the Royal HaskoningDHV office in Amersfoort or Nijmegen.    Assignment Improve our workflow to calculate surface reflectance (Albedo) from a Sentinel2 composite of images taken in a summer period, and validate it using the heat calculation (UCAM) method and in situ measurements. Background  Urban Heat Island effect Climate change is making our planet warmer and more extreme. Long periods of heat and drought are more common than they used to be in the past. As more and more people are moving into cities, urban areas are expanding. Buildings and roads replace vegetated areas[1]. Open, permeable soil is covered by impermeable and dry surfaces. As there is no water to evaporate, the suns energy is trapped between buildings, and absorbed by bricks and cement. This causes urban areas to heat up to 1-3 °C more than their neighbouring rural areas. This is called the Urban Heat Island (UHI) effect. The higher temperatures increase the risk of heat stress, resulting in health risks.  The Heat Monitor We, as heat risk advisors within Royal HaskoningDHV, support municipalities in their quest to keep our cities and villages healthy and liveable in the future by identifying the areas that are prone to heat risk and advise on mitigating measures. In the middle of our approach to identify and tackle areas of heat stress is the Heat monitor. This is a 3d digital twin supporting policy makers in tackling heat-stress using solid, validable data in an easy to interpret visualisation. It shows priorities for municipality policy makers where to start implementing improvement measures.  At the core of the Heat Monitor is the UCAM ((Urban Climate Assessment & Management) method. This method is developed by our lead heat stress consultant Ronald Groen together with Wageningen University, Witteveen+Bos and the KNMI.  Albedo An important factor that determines the UHI effect is the surface reflectance, i.e. albedo. A low albedo means less solar radiation is reflected away from the surface, leaving more energy to be absorbed by the buildings and streets. An accurate calculation of albedo is therefore important to correctly advise on the locations where inhabitants are at risk of heat stress.  Your profile We are looking for an intern that matches the following profile: Currently following a relevant HBO/WO study in the field of GIS and remote sensing. (Note: It’s compulsory that you are enrolled at a university or HBO at the time of the internship) Experience in scripting/programming languages such as Python or Google Earth Engine code. A pro-active attitude, can you work independently, work as a problem owner, and takes the lead in finding the solution. Affinity with environmental and/or climatological subjects is a plus.  What we offer Royal HaskoningDHV is part of the top 5 consultancy and engineering firms in the Netherlands. Following an internship or graduation research here is a good start for a successful career with us or elsewhere. You will become a full-fledged employee and will get to know the organization from the inside. You will work together with people who, like you, aspire to get the best out of every challenge.  We have an inspiring working environment within a professional and successful firm. Our company culture stands apart in having the freedom and responsibility to develop your own initiatives. We strive to a have a balance between work and personal life. Naturally you will receive a fitting compensation for your work.  We offer you an environment in which you will work together with extremely motivated colleagues who belong in the top of GEO-ICT in the Netherlands. In addition, Royal HaskoningDHV employs a score of talented data scientists who are at the forefront of related developments.  Apply If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us by sending an email to [email protected] with the name of the vacancy in the subject.  If you want to apply, please upload your CV and letter of motivation via the RHDHV portal (click Apply). Incomplete applications will not be considered. [1] https://www.epa.gov/heat-islands/learn-about-heat-islands

title: Senior Scientist Freeze-Drying & Formulation Technologies
summary:
Use advanced skills in experimental design, data analysis, problem solving and data presentation;
You manage and use (big) data towards predictive and…
description: Job ID: 40533 Date: Feb 24, 2021 Job function: Research & Development Experience level: Experienced Hire Business: DSM Food Specialties Senior Scientist Freeze-Drying & Formulation Technologies DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com . The DSM Biotechnology Center (DBC) in Delft is the main center for biotechnological Research and Development (R&D) within DSM. The DBC steers the biotechnology competence within DSM and is responsible for the realization of biotechnological innovations and the development of new products and cost-effective production processes for DSM business units such as DSM Food Specialties, DSM Nutritional Products, DSM Innovation Center and DSM Bioproducts & Services.  As part of DBC Center for Food Innovation, the Culture House is responsible for developing cultures from small to industrial scale. Within this center there is a vacancy for a:  Senior Scientist Freeze-Drying & Formulation Technologies Delft   The Challenge As a Senior Scientist Freeze-Drying & Formulation Technologies, you will be integrated in the team working on the development and improvement of dried industrial microbial cultures and their production processes. You will contribute to: The development of improved drying processes and improved formulations from bench up to commercial scale will be the key challenge in this position; You apply physical and chemical insight in such formulations and drying technologies; You manage and use (big) data towards predictive and successful processes; You will design and perform processes on lab-, pilot and/or production scale in accordance with the DSM quality and safety regulations at DSM facilities and at toll manufacturers; You keep in touch with developments within your discipline, through participation and maintenance of the external network in the scientific community, with peer companies and technology institutes; You contribute to the further development of the formulation and drying competence within DSM.  The successful candidate will be responsible for: Providing technical expertise in freeze-drying for microbial products and developing practical and cost-effective formulations that enable commercialization; Plan and execute experimental studies in an efficient manner to develop formulations that meet project goals and timelines; Employ various analytical instruments to conduct physicochemical/biophysical/biological characterization of dried formulations; Preparation and delivery of reports, and technical presentations for both in-house and external parties; Use advanced skills in experimental design, data analysis, problem solving and data presentation; Provide concise and quantitative analysis of data and interpretation of experimental results; Integrate experimental design expertise with technical knowledge; Participate in internal and external scientific meetings; Keep up with new developments in field and is familiar with the scientific literature; Possess strong analytical skills and good verbal and written communication skills.  The Ideal You are a Chemical, Biochemical or Food process Engineer or similar by training. Preferentially you have experience in freeze-drying and product formulation technologies in an industrial context.  You master the thermodynamics and physical chemistry related to drying and formulation. You are capable to combine the knowledge and problem analysis with practical judgment and creativity, to generate novel product formulations and better drying technologies.  We are looking for people with plenty of initiative, who like to learn and work in multidisciplinary teams in an innovative environment. You are an active networker and good communicator, fluent in English.  Skills PhD degree in Chemical, Biochemical or Food process Engineering, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Biotechnology or related fields; Experience in the formulation of biological products and understanding of technologies such as freeze-drying, spray-drying, granulation, emulsion, encapsulation, etc.; Experience in freeze-drying and formulation; Excellent communication, collaboration and writing skills; Strong analytical and communication skills; Highly motivated with the ability to resolve technical issues, develop and implement corrective solutions, be able to quickly adapt and respond effectively to changes.  The Reward We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an open and pleasant atmosphere with many opportunities for personal input, plenty of room for discussions with fellow professionals and personal development. Terms and conditions of employment as well as fringe benefits are up to market standards. Salary depends on your education and experience and is based on the Collective Labor Agreement DSM Gist Services. Terms of conditions: local contract (DSM Gist Services)  The Procedure For further information on this position please contact Martin Zwart, Senior Talent Acquisition Business partner: martin.zwart@dsm.com . Applications can be directed via the career-portal www.dsm.com/careers . Reference check procedures are part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be contacted when these references checks are required. Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext. title: Data Scientist, Bunnik
summary:
Je maakt deel uit van een team van data scientisten met ook een actieve internationale data science community binnen ENGIE.
Dat is de basis van jouw uitdaging.
description: Complexe data van grote omvang met behulp van algoritmes omzetten naar oplossingen. Dat is de basis van jouw uitdaging. Jouw doel is het verbeteren van klantoplossingen, business modellen en operationele processen door het geautomatiseerd vertalen van data naar informatie. Ben jij een ervaren data scientist met ruime kennis van het ontwikkelen van algoritmes? Dan maken we graag kennis met jou!   Wij zoeken voor ENGIE Digitaal Nederland in Bunnik een Data Scientist.  Dit ga je doen als Data Scientist Als data scientist bij ENGIE ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van algoritmes en het beantwoorden van digitale vraagstukken met behulp van data. De basis voor jouw werkzaamheden is relevante data. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het verkrijgen en selecteren van relevante data en het vertalen van deze data naar informatie om betere beslissingen te kunnen nemen, te differentiëren in klantoplossingen, operationele efficiëntie te verbeteren en toekomstige business modellen te ontwikkelen.  De digitale vraagstukken waarmee je aan de slag gaat, hebben betrekking op data waarvan de omvang erg groot en complex is. Data komt real-time binnen en moet vaak real-time toegepast worden. Je benadert vraagstukken vanuit verschillende invalshoeken en komt met diverse mogelijkheden om een probleem op te lossen. Je bent gewend om een grote hoeveelheid aan informatie snel om te zetten in een eenvoudig concept.  In jouw functie als data scientist werk je veel samen met zowel interne als externe stakeholders. Intern zijn dat je collega’s binnen IT zoals solution en domain architecten, maar ook product managers. Jouw externe contacten zijn met name gesprekken met opdrachtgevers. Je maakt deel uit van het Digital Business Center en rapporteert in deze functie aan de Directeur ENGIE Digitaal Nederland.  Dit zijn je belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden: Je draagt zorg voor het verkrijgen en ontsluiten van de relevante data. Je behandelt vraagstukken die leiden tot toegevoegde waarde uit beschikbare data, mitigerende maatregelen of een hogere performance (KPI’s). Je zorgt voor een professionele ontwikkeling, executie en beheer van algoritmes. Dit doe je op basis van de gewenste IT architectuur, waargenomen trends in de markt en ervaringen uit grote projecten. Je levert input voor het centrale datamodel. Je vertaalt complexe materie naar een business context voor ENGIE. Je werkt samen met verschillende interne en externe partijen voor het verkrijgen van relevante data en het opstellen van predictieve modellen. Beiden met aandacht voor de data kwaliteit en het datamodel. Je werkt volgens geformuleerde kwaliteitseisen voor producten en diensten. Je vormt de brug tussen data en de opdrachtgever door het toepassen van onder andere machine learning. Je volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van technologie en processen binnen data science.  Dit breng je mee Als data scientist breng je de volgende ervaring en competenties met je mee:  een afgeronde WO opleiding in een bèta richting of met een stevige basis in statistiek; minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring op het gebied van data science; ruime ervaring in projectmatig werken; kennis van wiskunde en statistiek, machine learning en optimalisatie algoritmes; kennis van databases, het inladen van data uit verschillende bronnen (oa SQL), opschonen, verrijken en transformeren van onbewerkte data en toepassen van statistiek met Python/R; kennis van visualisatiemogelijkheden binnen Python/R; in staat om duidelijk en to-the-point te communiceren en daarin complexe materie te kunnen vertalen in begrijpelijke boodschappen; van nature ben je nieuwsgierig, oplossingsgericht en creatief in ideeën en oplossingen die niet altijd voor de hand liggen; gewend aan zelfstandig werken: van een eigen planning tot afstemming met stakeholders; competenties als klantgericht, analytisch, integer, resultaatgericht en verantwoordelijk zijn onmisbaar in deze functie; open, respectvol, gedreven en gedurfd? Eigenschappen die jou aanspreken en – niet toevallig – ook de kernwaarden van ENGIE.  Wat bieden wij je Als data scientist bij ENGIE werk je aan meerdere projecten tegelijk voor verschillende onderdelen van ENGIE, waardoor je werk heel afwisselend is. Je maakt deel uit van een team van data scientisten met ook een actieve internationale data science community binnen ENGIE. Je leert van elkaar, daagt elkaar uit én kan tegelijkertijd zelf het verschil maken voor collega’s en opdrachtgevers.  Naast aandacht voor persoonlijke (door)groei bieden we je een goed salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Van ons krijg je natuurlijk een laptop en telefoon. Maar ook een goede pensioenregeling, een collectieve zorgverzekering en personeelskortingen op o.a. uitjes en producten. En wist je dat je bij een dienstverband van 40 uur per week maar liefst 38 vrije dagen per jaar hebt? Zo kun je werk en privé extra goed in balans houden.  Wij zijn ENGIE ENGIE Nederland is onderdeel van de beursgenoteerde ENGIE Groep. ENGIE is actief in 70 landen, met wereldwijd 150.000 medewerkers. Als groep is het onze missie om bij te dragen aan de verduurzaming van de wereld. ENGIE Nederland bestaat uit ENGIE Services en ENGIE Energie. Samen voorzien we onze klanten van energie en technische oplossingen. Van B2B en B2C, van kleine tot grote klanten, van Terneuzen tot Delfzijl.  ENGIE Digitaal Nederland versnelt de digitale transformatie van ENGIE Nederland. De afdeling bestaat uit IT Services, een Digital Business Center en een CIO Office. Het CIO Office bepaalt de landelijke richting op het gebied van onder andere security, architectuur, licentiemanagement en IT-strategie. Binnen het Digital Business Center is de kennis verzameld om de business te ondersteunen in het digitale transformatieproces, zoals enterprise portfolio management, agile werken en data science.  Zo kun je solliciteren Heb je interesse en spreekt deze vacature je aan? Reageer dan via de button 'solliciteren'. Graag ontvangen we behalve een cv ook een motivatiebrief. Voor vragen kun je contact opnemen met Janneke van Nunen via janneke.van.nunen@engie.com of telefonisch op 06 – 83 09 36 79.

title: Data scientist Machine learning
summary: Als data scientist ben je binnen CreditDevice verantwoordelijk voor onder andere ontwerpen van modellen, algoritmes en implementatie.
description: Als data scientist ben je binnen CreditDevice verantwoordelijk voor onder andere ontwerpen van modellen, algoritmes en implementatie. DATA SCIENTIST NOORDWIJK, ZUID-HOLLAND Beschrijving Als data scientist ben je binnen CreditDevice verantwoordelijk voor onder andere ontwerpen van modellen, algoritmes en implementatie. De algoritmes zijn leidend bij het belangrijkste onderwerp: de bepaling van de juiste acties in het credit management! Binnen het credit management spelen Machine Learning en Artificial Intelligence een steeds grotere rol. Je gaat hierin samenwerken met de IT collega’s en data analisten. Daarnaast wordt creativiteit en zelfstandigheid zeer gewaardeerd! Wat breng je mee? WO werk- en denkniveau. Achtergrond in een sterk kwantitatieve richting, bijvoorbeeld econometrie of (toegepaste) wiskunde; Ontwerpen van voorspellingsmodellen; Actuele kennis en ervaring met relationele databases en schrijven van queries(SQL); Kennis van en ervaring met statistiek, modelbouw, optimalisatie, het ontwikkelen van heuristieken. Ervaring in diverse programmeertalen als SQL, R, Python, Excel/VBA; Interesse op het gebied van big data, machine learning technieken, AI, process mining; Overtuigend, onafhankelijk denkend en adviesvaardig. Proactieve en gedreven werkhouding; Goed kunnen schakelen tussen verschillende niveaus, goede communicatie- en presentatie vaardigheden. Wat bieden wij Fulltime functie; Goed salaris; Contract voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op vast dienstverband; Een leuke en afwisselende baan met veel klantcontact; Werken op de mooiste locatie in Noordwijk met enthousiast en gemotiveerde teamleden; Een paar keer per jaar organiseren we leuke feestjes en we doen veel aan informele borrels; 26 vakantiedagen per jaar (op basis van 40 uur per week) en de mogelijkheid tot het kopen van extra dagen. Beschrijving CreditDevice is in 2001 opgericht met als doel organisaties te helpen kredietrisico’s te beperken. Credit management software helpt onze klanten de communicatie over achterstallige facturen te vereenvoudigen. CreditDevice ontwikkelt nu al circa tien jaar haar eigen geavanceerde credit management software. Een systeem dat voldoet aan de snel ontwikkelende marktbehoeften van hedendaagse ondernemingen. CreditDevice is in Nederland de enige leverancier die in-house ontwikkelde credit management software combineert met haar eigen kredietinformatiedatabase. CreditDevice bedient klanten zoals YoungCapital, Advantech, Buckaroo, Meyn en Saint Gobain.  Contact Heb je een vraag? Wil je meer informatie over een vacature of heb je een vraag over ons bedrijf? Neem dan contact met ons op of bel ons op +31 71 36 400.

title: Full time lecturer in Business Information Management
summary: Educating and inspiring the next generation of managers as they investigate the opportunities presented by data analytics (machine learning, deep learning, data…
description: You will be part of a strong community of 90 researchers and lecturers, including more than 40 PhD candidates in information systems, supply chain management, and innovation management. The department has a strong research and teaching tradition and an international orientation to the academic and business communities. Our specialised MSc in Business Information Management is ranked among the best programmes in the world. The BIM section is one of the founding members of the MScBA in Business Analytics & Management. The department is also involved in RSM's extensive portfolio of post-experience education such as its executive MBA programmes.  For more information about the group: https://www.rsm.nl/research/departments/technology-and-operations-management/business-information/  Role  Educating and inspiring the next generation of managers as they investigate the opportunities presented by data analytics (machine learning, deep learning, data mining) and new information technologies (platforms, cloud computing, AI, internet-of-things, blockchain).  Join a team of scholars contributing to education in the field of Information Systems and Data Science.  Your main tasks Your main task is teaching students of BSc BA and BSc IBA, and MSc Business Information Management and MSc Business Analytics and Management, involving:  Course delivery, including lectures (online, blended and classroom), assignments and examinations  Course design and redesign, for course content and didactics  Supervise BSc and/or MSc theses.  Specifications  32—38 hours per week  max. €3886 per month  Rotterdam  View on Google Maps  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR)  Requirements  You have (or expect to complete soon) a PhD in information systems, economics, computer science, marketing, econometrics, or a closely related field, and demonstrate a strong interest and a proven track record in this respect  You have a strong background in quantitative empirical data analysis methods, such as econometrics, statistics, and machine learning.  You have completed University Teaching Qualification (BKO) or equivalent (or are willing to acquire that in short term).  Your required competences  You demonstrate a potential for excellence in teaching  You have familiarity with online education platforms (e.g. Canvas, Zoom), techniques for inspiring successful blended learning, and ability to provide critical yet constructive feedback.  You are able to teach in English. The ability to teach in Dutch is considered an advantage.  You are a team player and are open to collaborate with various faculty members across the different courses.  Conditions of employment  We expect the candidate to start on 1 September 2021. An earlier starting date can be discussed.  Both positions are currently defined at the level of Lecturer, on a temporary basis (maximum two years). Subsequent promotion to Senior Lecturer with a permanent contract is possible with a track record of excellent teaching.  We offer competitive salary, based on the candidate's experience. See employment conditions below. The conditions of employment correspond with the collective labour agreement for Dutch Universities (CAO NU).  Salary is subject to training and experience and may vary and up to a maximum of € 3,886.00 gross per month (scale 11-1 CAO NU), based on a full-time contract of 38 hours.  Erasmus University has attractive employment conditions, which include a holiday allowance of 8 per cent, an end-of-year bonus of 8.3 per cent, and a considerate amount of vacation days. More information is available at www.eur.nl/werkenbij/hr_informatie. We offer excellent training and career development opportunities. You will closely collaborate with experience faculty members in developing and delivering courses at the BSc and MSc levels. RSM has a dedicated Learning Innovation Team, which supports faculty in improving and innovating their courses and programmes.  Employer  Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University  Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (RSM) is one of Europe's top-ranked business schools. RSM provides ground-breaking research and education furthering excellence in all aspects of management and is based in the international port city of Rotterdam - a vital nexus of business, logistics and trade. RSM's primary focus is on developing business leaders with international careers who can become a force for positive change by carrying their innovative mindset into a sustainable future. Our first-class range of bachelor, master, MBA, PhD and executive programmes encourage them to become critical, creative, caring and collaborative thinkers and doers. Study information and activities for future students, executives and alumni are also organised from the RSM office in Chengdu, China. www.rsm.nl  RSM is a faculty of Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR). EUR is an internationally oriented university with a strong social orientation in its education and research. Our scientists and students work in close collaboration with internal and external parties to solve global, social challenges, inspired by the always dynamic and cosmopolitan Rotterdam. Our mission is therefore "Creating positive societal impact". Our academic education is intensive, active and application-oriented. Our research increasingly takes place in multidisciplinary teams, which are strongly intertwined with international networks. With our research impact and thanks to the high quality of education, EUR can compete with the top European universities. The Erasmian values function as our internal compass and make Erasmus University recognizable to the outside world: engaged with society, world citizen, connecting, entrepreneurial and open-minded. www.eur.nl  Department  The Business Information Management (BIM) section is a vibrant community with world-class research and education on advanced information technologies and systems and its impact on firms, markets, and customers. Topics such as digital strategy and business, platform ecosystems, artificial intelligence for business, personalization and the privacy paradox, smart city platforms, digital technologies for a sustainable and carbon neutral society are investigated with students, companies, and partner universities.  Additional information  Are you interested in this position? We would like to hear from you before Thursday, 1 May 2021. Screening will start immediately and continue until the positions are filled. Make sure to include in your application:  your letter of interest  your curriculum vitae  a teaching statement  teaching evaluations If you have questions about the position, please contact Dr Dimitrios Tsekouras, Academic director of MSc BIM ( dtsekouras@rsm.nl ), or Yanick Kuper, BIM programme co-ordinator ( kuper@rsm.nl ).  Making minds matter  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR) is a highly ranked, international university, based in the dynamic and diverse city of Rotterdam, with its port acting as a gateway to the world.  Read more about Erasmus University Rotterdam

title: Clinical Data Manager Intern
summary:
CDM will be exposed to data collection tools and data flows from study start up.
As such, the CDM reviews all necessary data flows, the Data Management Plans…
description: The Clinical Data Manager (CDM) intern is the Data Manager who, within the therapeutic area, is performing scientific (complex) clinical data review in close collaboration with the Study Responsible Physicians (SRP) and Study Responsible Scientists (SRS). Tapping into technical and clinical experience, the CDM closely collaborates with the SRP, SRS, Data Management functions and the rest of the study team members when implementing the data management related activities for protocols, with focus on more complex indication and therapy related elements of the study. As such, the CDM reviews all necessary data flows, the Data Management Plans and performs continuous (complex) data review activities on the studies in the assigned program. Impact of Decision‐Making: This position may make recommendations and influences decisions for specific trials or assignments. Accountability/Decision‐Making: This position analyzes and provides input into decisions with direction from manager or Data Management Leader. Supervision Received: This position receives ongoing direction to achieve objectives. Work is reviewed on a regular basis with the Data Management Leader. Supervision Given: There are no direct reports for this position.  Principal Responsibilities: CDM works with more senior CDMs, GDM, SRP/SRS and other internal partners to establish, align and confirm Clinical data management expectations to the business for assigned trial(s). CDM is involved in study related activities from the protocol design stage onwards, providing input into the study specific and/or indication specific data collection tools. CDM supports (complex) scientific study data review, manages CDM and SRS/SRP related queries in eDC system and holds discussions with SRS/SRP. Involvement in other review activities (e.g., Coding, SAE reconciliation) is possible. CDM leads and/or attends meetings as appropriate. CDM will be exposed to data collection tools and data flows from study start up. Contributes to the creation of the study Integrated Review Plan ensuring appropriate quality, scientific content, organization, clarity, accuracy, format and consistency. CDM reviews clinical data management documents for appropriate quality, scientific content, organization, clarity, accuracy, format, and consistency. Works with GDM and DML to facilitate compliance with regulatory guidelines and the documentation matrix. Works with DML to facilitate real‐time inspection readiness of all assigned deliverables for the trial. Participates in regulatory agency inspections and J&J internal audits as necessary. Works with DML to plan and track applicable CDM deliverables. Supports the assigned clinical working group(s) to ensure that DM and TA trial needs and deliverables are met. Identifies and communicates lessons learned with support from DML and frequently asked questions at trial level. May participate in process, system, and tool improvement initiatives within DM. Collaborates with the SRS/SRP to ensure that DM and Therapeutic Area trial needs and deliverables are met.  Qualifications  Master/Bachelor degree in Business, Communications, or Management.   Primary Location Netherlands-South Holland-Leiden- Organization Janssen Biologics (7266) Job Function General Administration Requisition ID 2105897581W

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary:
Je werkt zelfstandig aan data-analyses gebaseerd op geodata.
Wij bieden een complete range aan Monitoring, IoT, meet- en inspectiediensten aan, waarbij de klant…
description: Innovatief, verbindend en LEF! Dat is Asset.Insight, onderdeel van VolkerWessels. Wij bieden een complete range aan Monitoring, IoT, meet- en inspectiediensten aan, waarbij de klant overal op een veilige manier bij zijn data kan komen en algoritmes op deze data kan laten uitvoeren. Wij zijn de partner voor onze klanten als het gaat om het inspecteren, monitoren en voorspellen van hun assets. Of het nu gaat om sporen, dijken, gebouwen, industrie, bruggen, wegen of een combinatie daarvan. Ons doel: samen met onze klanten werken aan de veiligheid, duurzaamheid, beschikbaarheid en efficiëntie van onze assets. Wil jij daaraan bijdragen? Wat ga je doen? Als Senior Data Scientist draag jij bij aan het ontwikkelen en operationeel houden van onze algoritmes en producten. Je denkt op een innovatieve manier na over hoe we onze productiestraat zo effectief mogelijk kunnen inrichten en hoe dit kan worden omgezet tot een waardevol product voor klanten. Je gaat met verschillende soorten data werken afkomstig uit bijvoorbeeld onze meettrein, 3D LiDAR-scanners op zowel de weg als het spoor, 360 graden beelden van onze meetauto’s of IoT-sensoren.  Je gaat samen met de klant op zoek naar de echte klantvraag en weet databronnen samen te brengen om tot inzichten te komen; Je gebruikt geavanceerde technieken om bestaande diensten, processen en producten te verbeteren of nieuwe producten te ontwikkelen; Je werkt zelfstandig aan data-analyses gebaseerd op geodata. Wat bieden we jou? Zodra je bij Asset.Insight. binnenloopt, staan jouw diverse collega’s (in leeftijd, achtergrond en ervaring) voor je klaar om samen te werken. Vanaf dat moment werk je mee aan een innovatieve en inspirerende omgeving. Jouw inzet belonen we graag met onder meer een flexibel arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket. Denk aan: Een opleidingsbudget; Pensioenregeling; Op basis van het individuele keuzebudget ‘MyChoice’ de mogelijkheid om te kiezen wat jij belangrijk vindt: meer vakantie, extra opleidingsbudget of toch liever geld?  Daarnaast bieden we je: Een open werksfeer waar collega’s elkaar vertrouwen en waar fouten maken mag, zolang we daarvan leren. En waar de medewerkers trots zijn op de samenwerking met elkaar; Een datagedreven kennisorganisatie waar je kunt uitgroeien tot een topspecialist of generalist, ook binnen andere VolkerWessels-ondernemingen; 20 wettelijke verlofdagen en 8 collectieve verlofdagen + eventueel 5 bovenwettelijke dagen en vitaliteitsdagen (in het MyChoice-budget opgenomen, zodat je zelf kunt kiezen); Reiskostenvergoeding. Ben jij de ideale Senior Data Scientist? Je hebt een passie voor geo-informatie en de ambitie om echte veranderingen teweeg te brengen in de infrastructuursector. Door jouw sterke interesse in data binnen de technische infrastructuur, gecombineerd met jouw drive om nieuwe ontwikkelingen binnen de data science wereld te volgen, ben jij in staat om innovatieve oplossingen in een operationele omgeving te implementeren. Naast gepassioneerd ben je communicatief vaardig, zodat je een duidelijke toelichting kan geven aan collega’s en klanten over jouw werk en de bijbehorende resultaten.  Verder vragen wij: Een afgeronde opleiding in een exacte wetenschap (kunstmatige intelligentie, wiskunde, natuurkunde, informatica, geomatics etc.); Ruime ervaring met Python; Ervaring met Databricks is een pré; Ervaring met Azure is een pré; Minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring als Data Scientist of in een relevant vakgebied; Beschikbaarheid: 32-40 uur; Standplaats: Nieuwegein. Welkom bij Asset.Insight.! Enthousiast? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw cv en motivatiebrief op werkenbij@assetinsight.nl. Een video of andere creatieve sollicitatie mag natuurlijk ook! Heb je eerst nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Stefan Wierda (Manager Data Analytics) via +31 6 153 853 26.  Een online persoonlijkheidsassessment kan deel uitmaken van de procedure.  #LI-JV2  Meer informatie

title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
summary:
Experiment with new ideas, technologies and data to identify new data science use cases.
We leverage the AWS technology stack with data from 32 organisational…
description: Who are we? At LeasePlan, Data Science is a core component of expanding our digital presence to create the 'Future of Digital' in mobility. As part of the Enterprise Information Management (EIM) department, the Data Science team functions as a global Center of Excellence for Data Science throughout the organisation. We leverage the AWS technology stack with data from 32 organisational entities – made available on our data platform Global Data Hub (GDH) - to generate business value. For this purpose, we identify data science opportunities across different LeasePlan value streams and engage with stakeholders, data engineers and solution developers to solve complex business problems using machine learning and advanced statistics. The primary focus is to apply data mining techniques and build high quality prediction systems integrated with business and digital products. Who are we looking for? We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer who is not only excited about solving complex analytical problems, but also about applying and deploying their solutions in a dependable, consistent and lasting way that adds value to our business. You should have a solid background in integration, testing and deployment of ML models. Data science is proliferating at LeasePlan; we are growing the team in all directions, and are looking for someone who enjoys contributing to that growth and working in this changing, fast-paced environment. What are you going to do? Collaborate with business, digital products and engineering department to understand company needs and devise possible data science solutions. Build scalable data science solutions in a cloud environment (AWS) using python and PySpark. Develop projects through proof-of-concept, pilot and full deployment phases. Further develop our cloud based AI Platform to improve our technical infrastructure, standards of working and tool stack. Connect the final model with other aspects of the application; design and control how they communicate with one another (REST APIs, database queries, etc..). Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers; explain complex use cases at an appropriate level for the audience using effective data visualization techniques. Liaise with other Data Science teams at other LeasePlan entities to streamline implementations and share knowledge. Experiment with new ideas, technologies and data to identify new data science use cases. What do you need to do the job? MSc in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field; PhD degree preferred OR equivalent experience. Ability to solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skills. Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc. Strong data-oriented scripting (e.g. SQL), statistical programming (e.g., python or R) and big data frameworks (e.g. Spark, Hadoop MapReduce). Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS stack. Strong understanding of software engineering best practices such as requirements analysis, system design, modularity, version control, testing, documentation, etc.. Strong knowledge of and experience with ML testing and deployment strategy (e.g. CI/CD, // architecture). Proven track record over multiple aspects of the end-to-end machine learning life cycle from proof of concepts to scalable solutions in production. Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, R Shiny, Python dash etc. Good stakeholder management and communication skills. How is life at LeasePlan Digital?  With around 1.7 Million cars in over 30 countries and more than 50 years of experience on a global scale, LeasePlan is the largest automobile leasing and fleet management company in the world. LeasePlan Digital, is there to create our ambition for a customer centric experience across all digital touch points, to deliver true value to our customers and in turn maximize long-term customer satisfaction.  We offer a dynamic & challenging atmosphere, incorporated in one of the world's leading fleet management companies. That means a working environment surrounded by like-minded innovators working together from their home offices using Microsoft Teams, Slack, Jira and other tools to get the job done together. Our working community is close, sharing work and personal related matters to stay connected.  You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You'll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry.  This role is based in Amsterdam. To apply, just upload your information via the link and apply directly. We are looking forward to exploring your opportunities with us!

title: Consultant Data Transformation
summary: You are an expert in data governance, data management, data analytics and big data from a strategic and conceptual point of view.
description: Data Transformation Consultant Xebia is a Global Digital and IT consultancy that came to the market 20 years ago, far ahead of the curve on the Digital Transformation. Being so long on the market has allowed Xebia build a profound expertise across the board, from software development, IT architecture, DevOps, Cloud and Cybersecurity, to building Data Driven and Agile organizations with the sole purpose of helping organizations make most of the value promised by technology. As the digital ambitions of our clients grow, so is Xebia looking to scale and use its experience to create ever more value, moving the needle on the success of digital and Agile Transformations at the prime companies in the Netherlands like ING, Unilever, Philips, bol.com, Ahold, Schiphol, Elsevier, Heineken, Grandvision, Keylane, NXP, KPN and Shell.  Xebia is looking for experienced and hands-on, pragmatic and no-nonsense Data Transformation consultants with a strong track record in delivering large scale Digital Transformations at companies mentioned above or similar, who can align strategy, operating model, and IT architecture with execution – from Diagnosing and Designing, to Executing Digital Transformations with a strong focus on up-skilling the workforce to stay relevant in a fast paced and ever changing market and improving (Leadership) Agility to make a profound and lasting change. As Xebia Data Transformation consultant, you will be involved in working on client challenges related to, e.g.:  Pre-transformation: Digital & Agile Maturity Assessments Designing Digital Strategy (Data, IT, Cloud, Agile) Designing Product Vision and Strategy Designing Operating Models (Agile (SAFe, LeSS), DevOps, Data, Cloud, Security) Business Case & Value tracking of Digital Transformation Designing Roadmaps Designing pragmatic Transformation Programs Designing integrated Portfolio management Designing Change (including learning journeys)  Transformation Execution: Digital & Agile Transformation Program Management Strategy Implementation Transformation Value tracking Product management (PO) Portfolio Management Implementation Processes and value chain Implementation Implementing way of working Team coaching Leadership coaching Implementing learning journeys (Training, coaching, intervision) Fixing the organizational eco-system (Environment, culture & behavior)  We believe each Xebia Digital & Agile Transformation Consultant should be able to have sufficient experience to do the majority of the above. We also believe they should have one strong core set of skills in which they can add most value.  One such set of skills is combined in the role we are currently looking for: Data Transformation Consultant.  It is becoming commonly accepted that data is important and can deliver much value. Our clients are embracing data but often have difficulties defining a good strategy and/or effectively executing on the strategy while developing the required new capabilities. We are looking for experienced consultants that can help answer our clients’ key questions: Key Questions for Data & AI strategy What is the value of data and AI in my industry and for my organization? How do I identify and unlock the value of data? What organizational capabilities do I need to deliver value with data? How do I enhance operations, products, services or decision making with data and AI? What application and infrastructure strategy fits my data strategy?  And on top of these questions clients ask us to help them implement data and AI. We do this by working closely together with our data engineers, scientists and cloud engineers from the Xebia-labels GoDataDriven and Binx. Profile: You have at least 6-10 years of experience in Data Transformations bridging strategy and execution You are an authority in what you do and known for it in your community of peers You understand the theory and know how to effectively implement it in practice to make a successful change You are an expert in data governance, data management, data analytics and big data from a strategic and conceptual point of view You are no data scientist/engineer (although experience in building algorithms and data pipelines would be a pré) but you can work with them hand-in-hand to deliver value to your clients You are an expert in translating business goals and issues into data capabilities and products and embed them into the daily business of your client You are a non-nonsense person and that demystifies, removes vagueness and gets things done You have a strong point of view on Data Transformation and know from experience what works and doesn’t work in any
