De nadruk ligt hierbij op het verkrijgen van klantinzichten om verbeteringen te kunnen initiëren waar klanten blij van worden. Je evalueert marketingcampagnes. Wat krijg je van ons? een functie met inhoud, vrijheid, verantwoordelijkheid en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Want Voordeeluitjes.nl staat niet stil, maar jij ook niet! goede voorwaarden: marktconform salaris en gepaste vergoedingen. We denken ook aan je oude dag: je neemt deel aan een collectieve pensioenregeling; een plek binnen een enthousiaste, groeiende organisatie waar sfeer en teamgevoel essentieel zijn. Waar je de ruimte krijgt om te leren, inclusief vallen en opstaan, iedereen kennis met elkaar deelt en memorabele bedrijfsuitjes de norm zijn; alles wat je nodig hebt om je functie naar behoren uit te kunnen voeren o.a.; zit-sta bureaus en heerlijke koffie; elke dag een volledig verzorgde lunch; je eigen bammetjes kan je thuislaten! Wat krijgen we van jou? Je werkt zelfstandig en zoekt een omgeving waarin je uitgedaagd wordt om het beste uit jezelf te halen. Je hebt een passie voor het (proactief) leveren van gegevens op basis van aanbevelingen voor meetbare verbeteringen in de bedrijfsresultaten en de tevredenheid van de consument. Verder heb je: een afgeronde opleiding op HBO/WO-niveau, bijvoorbeeld richting Wiskunde, Marketing, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Informatica of Econometrie; minimaal drie jaar relevante werkervaring; het inzicht om snel verbanden te leggen, en ben je goed met cijfers; goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling; ervaring met Tableau; ervaring met Mysql; ervaring met Google Analytics of met andere web analytics Software; ervaring met R en/of Pyton heeft een pré werkervaring in een commercieel B2C bedrijf in een analytische rol met als doel inzichten verschaffen, aanbevelingen doen en optimalisaties uitvoeren. Over ons Voordeeluitjes.nl is een jonge, toonaangevende organisatie met 110 gedreven medewerkers, gevestigd in o.a. Deventer en Amstelveen. We zetten ons al ruim tien jaar in voor de leukste én meest voordelige hotel- en vakantieparkaanbiedingen en zijn inmiddels uitgegroeid tot dé specialist in hotel- en vakantieparkarrangementen. Onze brandstof? Dat is elke dag een heerlijke verzorgde lunch, de wekelijkse vrijdagmiddagborrel, zo nu en dan een mud-run en een aantal keer per jaar samen op (Voordeel)uitje. We krijgen ook energie van elkaar; werken bij Voordeeluitjes.nl betekent werken in een inspirerende en motiverende omgeving waarin collegialiteit, creativiteit en een commerciële focus centraal staan en jij volop de kans krijgt jezelf te ontwikkelen. Wij geloven bovendien in een platte organisatie, waarin iedereen ertoe doet en zijn steentje bijdraagt aan het eindresultaat. Hebben we een match? Spreekt de functie en ons bedrijf jou aan en wil je (bijna) elke dag het maximale uit jezelf halen, dan kun je een sollicitatie met CV en motivatie sturen t.a.v. Yvette Langermans (HR Manager). Heb je nog vragen over deze leuke en veelzijdige functie? Dan kun je ook bij haar terecht via 06-33333299 of kijk op onze website www.vacatures.voordeeluitjes.nl. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Bedrijfsfeesten Kerstpakket Lunchkorting Pensioen Personeelskorting Reiskostenvergoeding Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: ma-vr Ervaring: data scientist: 1 jaar (Vereist) Opleiding: Bachelor (Vereist) Licentie en/of certificaat: Tableau (Vereist) Taal: Nederlands (Vereist)

title: Data Scientist (Rotterdam)
summary:
2 à 4 jaar ervaring als data scientist of in soortgelijke functies;
Je filtert bruikbare data via een data warehouse, waarna je een voorspellend algoritme…
description: DIT GA JE DOEN Met jouw diepgaande statistische kennis maak jij voor de klant voorspellingsmodellen en zorg je voor de juiste oplossingen.  Jij komt altijd op tijd uit de escape room en krijgt energie van het zoeken naar de juiste oplossing binnen de deadline. Als Data Scientist ben jij de oplossing van de puzzel! Jij weet de bergen aan data goed te analyseren, structuren en modelleren waarmee je handvatten biedt voor de klant. Zo help jij bijvoorbeeld een grote GGZ-instelling om door middel van jouw data-analyses en voorspellingen te bepalen hoeveel tijd er aan bepaalde zorg besteed wordt in het volgende jaar. Jij maakt dus impact! Je identificeert de klantvraag en zoekt naar antwoorden door grote hoeveelheden data te verzamelen, analyseren en modelleren; Je filtert bruikbare data via een data warehouse, waarna je een voorspellend algoritme ontwikkelt; Je helpt organisatie om meer datagedreven te gaan werken. Hierbij faciliteer je het gehele proces om tot een hoger niveau te komen. Deze vacature staat open tot en met 31 april! DIT IS EEN DATA SCIENTIST BIJ TEAM DATA DRIVEN Wij bieden jou de mogelijkheid om het pad te bewandelen dat jij graag wilt. Jij wordt uitgedaagd op verschillende terreinen, in een brede variatie aan opdrachten bij uiteenlopende opdrachtgevers. Dat brengt afwisseling, vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Je wordt gedurende je hele carrière bij EIFFEL door een Performance Manager begeleid in je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.  Je wordt onderdeel van het team DATA DRIVEN. Vanuit dit groeiende team lever jij je bijdrage aan vraagstukken om binnen organisaties datagedreven werken centraal te stellen. Je bent nieuwsgierig, op de hoogte van de nieuwste technologische ontwikkelingen en vindt het leuk om hier met collega's over te sparren. Zo creëer je niet alleen impact op de organisatie, maar ook op je eigen carrièreontwikkeling.  Betrokken, warm en open; dat is EIFFEL. Een sociale organisatie met veel enthousiaste professionals, die naast vakinhoudelijke evenementen ook veel leuke activiteiten organiseert. Wat denk je van een citytrip naar Parijs, een wintersportvakantie of een boottocht over de grachten van Amsterdam? Het jaarlijkse nieuwjaarsfeest mag uiteraard ook niet ontbreken op deze lijst. DIT BEN JIJ Steeds nieuwe projecten, in een nieuwe omgeving, met nieuwe mensen. Projectmatig werken vraagt om flexibiliteit. Als Data Scientist maak je jezelf snel zichtbaar bij de opdrachtgever. Je geeft de organisatie het vertrouwen dat jij de aangewezen persoon bent om hen te helpen. Daarbij denk en kijk je verder dan de rest en voeg je extra waarde toe. Daarbij hoef je niet alles zelf te kunnen. Samen met je collega's ga je als één team voor maximaal resultaat. En net als in de topsport staan er mensen om je heen om je te helpen. Voor de functie van Data Scientist breng je daarnaast het volgende mee: Een HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau met een achtergrond in wiskunde en/of computer science gerelateerde studies; 2 à 4 jaar ervaring als data scientist of in soortgelijke functies; Ervaring met het werken volgens Agile projectmethodieken zoals Scrum is een pré; Sterke beheersing van SQL; Ervaring met analytische talen zoals R, Python of Julia; Ervaring met moderne datawarehouse oplossingen zoals Azure, Redshift of Bigquery is een pré; Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift. DIT KRIJG JE VAN ONS Een uitdagende job in een dynamische organisatie (32-40 uur); Bruto maandsalaris tussen 3.000 en 3.800 euro per maand (afhankelijk van ervaring en inhoudelijke kennis); Onkostenvergoeding: 60 euro netto per maand; Leaseauto, telefoon en zakelijke OV-kaart; 25 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld; Groot aanbod aan training & opleidingen; Gunstige extra voorwaarden (bonusregeling, premievrij pensioen en collectiviteitskorting). Zet jij graag die extra stap voor je opdrachtgever, door naast je inhoudelijke werkzaamheden mee te denken over hoe relevante inzichten beter gepresenteerd kunnen worden? Klik dan uiterlijk 31 april 2021 op de knop ‘Solliciteren’ en stuur ons jouw cv. Indien er een sollicitatieprocedure ingang zal worden gezet, zullen wij ook een referentie check doen.   Met deze vacature willen wij zelf onze nieuwe collega werven. Dit is dan ook geen oproep voor acquisitie.

title: Data Specialist
description: Data Specialist Compaxo Fijne Vleeswaren B.V. gevestigd in Gouda levert haar producten nationaal en internationaal aan klanten binnen Retail, Horeca en Groothandel. Er wordt zowel onder eigen label als onder private label geproduceerd. De organisatie ontwikkelt zich momenteel snel, door haar processen te innoveren en automatiseren en haar kwaliteitszorg naar een (nog) hoger niveau te brengen. Compaxo Fijne Vleeswaren B.V. heeft honderden medewerkers en heeft een groot deel van de productieketen van grondstof tot eindproduct in eigen beheer. Ook verzorgen wij grotendeels onze eigen distributie. Je treft er dan ook volop diversiteit qua functies en werkzaamheden. Het maakt de organisatie complex, maar ook heel eigen en ín control’ over het totale proces. Functieprofiel Als uitbreiding voor de afdeling Verkoop zijn wij op zoek naar een accurate en proactieve collega die zich gaat bezighouden met artikelbeheer en de werk voorbereiding. Het betreft een nieuw op te zetten functie waarbij je met diverse afdelingen binnen de organisatie zal gaan communiceren en schakelen. Je verzamelt, controleert, ordent, verwerkt en onderhoudt relevante artikeldata in onze interne ERP systemen (Mixx en Reflex), externe klantportals en bent betrokken bij verdere informatievoorziening door de organisatie rondom artikeldata. Dit betreft een spilfunctie binnen de verkooporganisatie met als doel een continue correcte artikeldata en een goede doorstroom van onze artikelen richting de klant. Het is een leuke en dynamische, soms hectische rol waarin jij altijd nauwkeurig te werk blijft gaan. Je zal gaan werken in een gedreven en leuk team van circa 10 collega’s. Ben jij dol op cijfers en schrik je niet van (big) data? Dan is dit wellicht wel dè baan voor jou! De collega die wij zoeken - Om deze functie goed uit te kunnen oefenen beschik je over HBO werk- en denkniveau; - Je bent accuraat en ook in hectiek behoudt jij het overzicht; - Zelfstandig, analytisch en proactief kunnen handelen; - Assertief, inlevingsvermogend, probleem signalerend en proces dekkend. - Kunnen omgaan met big data, dus goed cijfermatig inzicht; - Goede kennis inzake Excel en ERP; - Ervaring in een productieomgeving (food) is een pré; - Heeft goede contactuele vaardigheden. - Beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Wij bieden - Een jaarcontract met de intentie dit na het jaar om te zetten in een overeenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd. - Een marktconform salaris. - 40-urige werkweek. - 24 vakantie/snipperdagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband - Pensioenregeling - Reiskostenvergoeding - Een gezellige groep collega’s. - Een werkplek/-omgeving die volop in beweging is. - Inbreng in de inrichting van deze werkomgeving. - Voldoende ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling in de vorm van opleidingen en cursussen. Reageren Bij interesse ontvangen wij graag jouw motivatiebrief + CV. Uiteraard gaan wij vertrouwelijk met jouw gegevens om. Disclamer Compaxo werft graag zelf haar kandidaten. Recruiters worden uitdrukkelijk gevraagd om geen contact over deze functie op te nemen. Contractduur 12 maanden Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr Ervaring: data scientist: 1 jaar (Aanbevolen) Opleiding: HBO (Aanbevolen)

title: Scientist Immunology-based Technologies
summary:
Processing and analyzing results and data.
Converting data and results into reports and scientific papers.
UniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or…
description: Location: Amsterdam (Netherlands) Job category: Research  uniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. In doing so each function in uniQure is directly or indirectly responsible for the lives of patients. This responsibility should be part of our day-to-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.  The Immunology Group has two functions and responsibilities (a) getting a better understanding of immunological aspects related to AAV-based gene therapy, and (b) exploring new technologies and/or targets with immunological background.  Main purpose of the job  Design and execute in silico and in vitro experiments related to new technologies and/or targets with immunological background Provide deep molecular understanding of antibody-antigen binding Explore and propose novel technological approaches to engage immune-mediated mechanisms Manage technical team members to guarantee the execution of the research projects Processing and analyzing results and data Converting data and results into reports and scientific papers Staying abreast of developments in the scientific discipline by keeping up with the scientific literature in this field, visiting scientific meetings and integrating the information in the project  Qualifications and skills  PhD level trained within the field of immunology, structural biology, molecular biology, or related discipline Preferably 3 to 4 years of relevant scientific experience in the field Experience with standard cell and molecular biology techniques and assays including qPCR and cDNA cloning (required) Hands-on experience with antibody and/or protein binding biochemical/biophysical assays (Western Blots, ELISAs, SEC) (required) Experience with antibody expression and/or purification (required) Experience with flow cytometry and FACS analysis is a plus Able to act in a fast changing and demanding environment, willing and able to demonstrate a hands-on attitude Capacity to communicate in a clear and concise manner and think through a complex problem and express it in a structured way Pro-active attitude, flexible, professional Excellent presentation and writing skills (knowledge of English language)  Competencies  Scientific experience and interest in the area of interest Intrinsically motivated Has a high level of integrity; regarding both personality and data Capable to solve day-to-day problems Able to think and work in a creative and explorative way Adapts new information and ideas and applies this effectively to his or her own work. Pro-active attitude, flexible, professional

title: Innovation Manager
summary:
Our legal basis for much of our data processing activity is ‘Legitimate Interests’.
You have the right to object to us processing your data in this way.
description: Medical Delta is a network of research-driven life sciences, health, and technology organisations in the west of the Netherlands, which brings together a rich body of knowledge and experience and acts as a catalyst for health innovation and cooperation in the west of the Netherlands. Medical Delta aims to harness the promise of digital technologies, new materials, and techniques in the field of healthcare. Medical Delta consists of three renowned universities, two university medical centers, four universities of applied sciences, as well as several governmental organisations, private companies, healthcare institutions, and funding bodies in the region. In the coming years, nearly 300 scientists will work together in 15 different consortia, 10 Field and Living labs, and 15 programmes on technological solutions for sustainable care. The interdisciplinary collaboration between academics, mainly clinicians and technologists is characteristic of Medical Delta. Medical Delta is seeking an Innovation Manager with the ability to capitalize on the potential of the network. The Innovation Manager develops and supports the realization of public-private consortium projects, which impact the development, testing, and validation of bio or medical technology products and services for sustainable care. The successful candidate is equipped with an entrepreneurial mindset and can develop, manage, and sustain relationships with key strategic partners, including knowledge organisations, private companies, healthcare institutions, and funding bodies. The incoming Innovation Manager will be an avid advocate for Medical Delta who has a keen eye for mapping the environment and identify and seize opportunities to secure public-private funding for (research) projects. The successful candidate is primarily content-driven. S/he is an experienced programme and project manager with significant experience in process management, particularly in translating strategy and vision into concrete objectives and steps for the consortia, their programmes, and the projects. S/he can communicate pleasantly, has tact and cultural sensitivity, and has the presence to be an ambassador for Medical Delta. Conditions of employment The maximum monthly salary is determined nationally on a scale of 12/13 (€ 4.538 – max. € 6.317) based on full-time work. The salary and benefits are based on the collective labour agreement for Dutch universities of applied science and Dutch law. An initial temporary contract of one year will be offered with the possibility to renew into a permanent contract. How to apply An executive search exercise is being undertaken by Perrett Laver, who will support Medical Delta in helping to identify the widest possible field of qualified candidates and assisting in the assessment of candidates against the requirements for the roles. Applications should consist of a covering letter explaining motivation and qualifications for the position and a full curriculum vitae. Perrett Laver may be contacted for informal enquiries and questions about the post at +31 (0)20240 4379 or thomas.modder@perrettlaver.com. Applications can be uploaded at http://www.perrettlaver.com/candidates quoting reference number 5017. The deadline for applications for this position is 09:00 am (CET) on Saturday 20th March 2021. The selection committee will then meet to decide on a shortlist of candidates at the end of March. These individuals will subsequently be invited for the formal interviews for the position will take place at the beginning of April 2021. Selection of and negotiations with the preferred candidate will take place thereafter. Reference checks are a final step of the hiring procedure. Protecting your personal data is of the upmost importance to Perrett Laver and we take this responsibility very seriously. Any information obtained by our trading divisions is held and processed in accordance with the relevant data protection legislation. The data you provide us with is securely stored on our computerised database and transferred to our clients for the purposes of presenting you as a candidate and/or considering your suitability for a role you have registered interest in. Perrett Laver is a Data Controller and a Data Processor, as defined under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Our legal basis for much of our data processing activity is ‘Legitimate Interests’. You have the right to object to us processing your data in this way. For more information about this, your rights, and our approach to Data Protection and Privacy, please visit our website http://www.perrettlaver.com/information/privacy-policy/.

title: AI and Conversational Agents for Behaviour Change Support
summary:
Have training or experience in data science and data merging techniques;
Developing and evaluating data science techniques for merging and analysing fixed and…
description: Publicatiedatum 15 maart 2021  Sluitingsdatum 5 april 2021  Opleidingsniveau Master's degree  Functieomvang 38 hours per week  Salarisindicatie €2,395 to €3,061 gross per month  Vacaturenummer 21-168  Do you have affinity with machine learning, and have a keen fascination for both behaviour change support systems such as chatbots, artificial intelligence, and human-computer interaction? Do you like to work in multidisciplinary research and collaborate with scientists, clinicians, and other PhD candidates from a wide range of related disciplines, including computational linguistics, medical and clinical psychology, biomedical engineering, and cardiology? If so, this PhD position may be yours. This PhD project is part of the larger research project TIMELY, funded by the Horizon 2020 EU grant scheme. The main aim of TIMELY is develop and evaluate an artificial intelligence-based healthcare platform for coronary artery disease patients. This specific PhD project will focus on developing, adapting, and validating a conversational agent (“chatbot”) for real-time personalized behavioural change support through such techniques as reinforcement learning and deep learning. This support system will bring together different streams of (un)structured data, including a patient’s context, physiological parameters, and motivational and emotional state, derived from text and sensor data. Based on these data, the support system will perform personalized and adaptive monitoring and coaching for lifestyle change and optimization of adherence to treatment. What are you going to do Coronary artery diseases (CAD) is a leading cause of disease burden worldwide. The disease develops gradually over the course of a lifetime, which prominently involves multiple modifiable risk factors (life style) For patients who already developed CAD, self-management is generally considered the most important strategy to keep the disease manageable and prevent further progression. However, the large heterogeneity among CAD patients requires a fine-grained assessment of CAD risk profiles as well as a personalized support with lifestyle change. The aim of this European Horizon 2020-funded project TIMELY is the development and implementation of a healthcare platform, involving an artificial intelligence-powered decision support and conversational agent tool, that allows for personalized risk evaluation, outcome prediction, and tailored behaviour change interventions. For these interventions, the University of Amsterdam will develop, adapt, and evaluate mobile applications that combine different types of fixed and streaming data, such as geo-context, structured and unstructured text data, psychological states, and physiological markers. These tools will be integrated within the larger healthcare platform, that is subsequently evaluated in multiple European academic centres and companies; encompassing the fields of cardiovascular medicine. The PhD position has an intended starting date of June 1st 2021. The tasks for this PhD position include: developing, integrating, and evaluating artificial intelligence tools, and specifically a conversational agent, for real-time monitoring and lifestyle coaching; developing and evaluating data science techniques for merging and analysing fixed and streaming data, as well as structured and unstructured data, integrate these tools and techniques in pilot versions of the behaviour change support system (chatbot); consideration of transparency and ethical concerns of these technological solutions; writing papers jointly with team members; communicating the results of the studies to academic and general audiences; completing a PhD thesis. What do we require You have a keen interest in multidisciplinary research and collaboration, and interest for behaviour change support systems such as chatbots, and knowledge or interest in behaviour change techniques. You also have excellent organizational and social skills, a collaborative nature and you have compelling ability to communicate your research with peers the broader research community and stakeholders. Strong computational and data skills are self-evident. In addition, you: have a (research) Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Health Technology, or equivalent; can demonstrate experience with artificial intelligence techniques, preferably for health; have expertise in machine learning and deep learning research; have training or experience in data science and data merging techniques; have strong foundation in statistical and computational skills and programming (e.g., R, Python); have excellent English writing and presentation skills. Speaking (or willingness to learn) Dutch is preferable. Our offer The position concerns temporary employment of 38 hours per week for a maximum term between 45 to 48 months. The initial employment is for one year. Following a positive assessment and barring altered circumstances, this term will be extended by a maximum of 36 months, which should result in the conferral of a doctorate. We will put together a curriculum which will also include the opportunity to attend training courses and both national and international events. Teaching opportunities and requirements, such as supervision of Bachelor theses and teaching groups - will be discussed. Your salary will be €2,395 gross per month in the first year and will increase to €3,061 in the final year, based on full-time employment and in keeping with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. We additionally offer an extensive package of secondary benefits, including 8% holiday allowance and a year-end bonus of 8.3%. What else do we offer An intellectually stimulating and inspiring academic environment with a variety of duties and ample opportunity for autonomy and development. The social and behavioural sciences play a leading role in addressing the major societal challenges faced by the world, the Netherlands and Amsterdam, now and in the future. The Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences is an active participant in a diverse, international community. Our goal is for you to feel at home here, regardless of your background, race, orientation and/or beliefs. To work at the University of Amsterdam is to work in a discerning, independent, creative, innovative and international climate characterized by an open atmosphere and a genuine engagement with the city of Amsterdam and society. Further information Do you have any questions or do you require additional information? Please contact: Dr Gert-Jan de Bruijn, supervisor Would you like to learn more about working at the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences (FMG)? Visit our website. Job application The UvA is an equal-opportunity employer. We prioritise diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We value a spirit of enquiry and perseverance, provide the space to keep asking questions, and promote a culture of curiosity and creativity. Does this profile sound like you and is this the vacancy you have been waiting for? If so, we are eager to receive both your CV and motivation letter (please note applications that do not contain both will not be considered). You can apply online by clicking on the link below. The deadline for applications is 5 April 2021.

title: Technician/associate Scientist Immunomonotoring Services
summary: The nature of our clients means a swift response is always necessary, whilst we keep working meticulously to assure high quality data.
description: Are you a technician looking for an exciting new job working in a stimulating environment in translational medicine? Do you like performing different cellular assays with which you are supporting the research questions of our biotech and pharma clients?  The role on offer The Unit Pharma & Biotech Services, Sanquin Diagnostic Services, is looking for a technician to strengthen the Immunomonitoring Services team. The Immunomonitoring Services team is part of the Sanquin Diagnostic Services and develops and performs cellular immune assays for biotech and pharmaceutical companies. Our lab is embedded in the Research facilities which means you will have direct contact with academics and colleagues within the Diagnostic Services offering.  Your daily work will consist of running and setting up cellular immune assays in a team (approximately 6 persons) of dedicated technicians and scientists. The work is divers due to the variety of the type of requests we get from our clients. We mainly use immune cells such as T cells, B cells, monocytes and dendritic cells isolated from PBMCs for our cultures. For the analysis we often use flow cytometry, ELISA or ELIspot. Sanquin has a fantastic flow cytometry core with image stream, flow sorters and flow cytometers that measure up to 28 colours. The diversity of the work with ever changing time-lines makes the work exciting and challenging and demands flexibility of you. The nature of our clients means a swift response is always necessary, whilst we keep working meticulously to assure high quality data.  Where you wil work Sanquin is a large not-for-profit company with nearly 3,000 committed employees dedicated to their profession who, together with blood donors, ensure to give patients a better life. Sanquin Diagnostic Services is a for-profit part of Sanquin and works in close collaboration with Sanquin Research. Any profit made by the for-profit parts of Sanquin feed into the not-for-profit Sanquin Research, which hosts academics. Sanquin Diagnostics Services provides advice and diagnostic services in the context of transfusion medicine, blood-transferable infections, immunopathology, coagulation and haematology. We perform highly specialised laboratory for hospitals, blood banks and midwiferies but notably also for pharmaceutical- and biotech companies. Sanquin Diagnostic Services is now in transition from mainly providing diagnostics for hospitals towards more contract research for pharma- and biotech companies. Sanquin is a knowledge centre. We communicate with customers at a high level about the technical aspects of our bioanalytical services. Our laboratories are ISO15189 certified and we work according to GCLP and GMP. Immunomonitoring Services offers tailor made cellular assays in the pre-clinical stage of therapeutic drug development and clinical testing.  Your profile a Bachelor(HBO)/Master degree in biomedical-, biopharmaceutical sciences or related science; experience in immunological assay development; ability to work on - and plan multiple projects at the same time and adhere to tight deadlines; accurate in documentation; experience in GXP and/or regulatory (EMA/FDA) requirements is a plus; good command of written and spoken English; willingness to learn Dutch (Dutch is the general language in the lab); ability to work independently as well as being a team player.  What we offer We offer unique research opportunities in a dynamic environment. Nowhere else in the world you will find an organization that combines medical, pharmaceutical, diagnostic and scientific research under one roof. The combination of having a societal function and operating at a commercial market is a very interesting challenge. In addition, we offer the following terms of employment: terms of employment and salary in accordance with the Sanquin Collective Labour Agreement; gross fulltime (36 hours) salary FWG 45 € 2202-3156 depending on experience; 8.33% end-of-year bonus, i.e. a thirteenth month in case of full-year employment; 8.33% holiday pay; 201 hours of leave with full-time employment (36 hours); compensation for travel expenses; collective agreements with various insurers; pension plan with Pensioenfonds Zorg & Welzijn (PFZW); a multiple-choice system that enables employees to select their own preferred terms of employment. You can find more information about our terms of employment at https://www.sanquin.org/working-at/who-we-are/employment-conditions More info For more information about the position, please contact Annelies Turksma at +31 6 57311981 or A.Turksma@sanquin.nl. Are you excited about this position and do you think you fulfill the requirements? Apply by sending us your letter of application accompanied by curriculum vitae before March 22th 2021. A pre-employment screening will be part of the selection procedure. Please note that we will only process applications from candidates who have a valid work permit for the EU.  Sanquin does not accept unrequested help from bureaus for this vacancy. CV's (in whatever shape or form) that are send by mediation bureaus to any employee of Sanquin without a written assignment of a corporate recruiter, will be considered property of Sanquin and Sanquin will therefore not owe compensation in any way.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Je hebt interesse in data engineering en voelt je thuis in data gedreven organisaties. dashboarding en rapportages.
Wat kun je van ons verwachten?
description: Wat ga je doen? Als Data Scientist heb jij een passie voor data en effectieve informatievoorziening. Je analyseert, ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en test oplossingen voor deze vraagstukken en weet deze te vertalen richting de organisatie. Jij weet je nieuwe werkgever te verassen met het opzetten van een Datawarehouse of bijvoorbeeld het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van ETL processen. Met behulp van BI-tools weet jij de creatieve oplossing te vinden en de organisatie naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Wij kijken naar de kwaliteiten waarover je beschikt en de functie die je nu uitoefent. Hierbij kijken we graag naar de eigenschappen en vaardigheden van jou als persoon, zodat je bij je nieuwe baan echt op de juiste plek terecht komt. Een plek waar jij je talenten volledig kan benutten en waar jij je compleet op je gemak voelt. Diegene die wij zoeken Je gelooft in de waarde van data voor organisaties Je hebt uitstekende analytische en programmeer vaardigheden Je snapt de informatie behoefte van de organisatie Je hebt interesse in data engineering en voelt je thuis in data gedreven organisaties. dashboarding en rapportages Je spreekt vloeiend en schrijft uitmuntend Nederlands en Engels Wat is je achtergrond? Je hebt een succesvol afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding richting Informatica of Wiskunde. Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in het programmeren van Business Intelligence oplossingen. Je hebt kennis van BI- applicaties. Bijvoorbeeld Power BI of Qlickview maar ook Phyton of R zit in je bagage. Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Data & Proces is er van overtuigd, dat ook voor alle organisaties voordelen ontstaan in data gedreven werken. Het werken met data of business intelligence wordt steeds belangrijker voor de continuïteit van organisaties. Door hier focus in aan te brengen worden de beste oplossingen geboden in mensen en technische ondersteuning. Met onze kennis zijn wij een gespecialiseerde dienstverlener in capaciteitsvraagstukken rondom data gerelateerde functies. Wat kun je verwachten? De functies waarin wij regelmatig bemiddelen zitten in de salarisrange van € 55.000 tot 75.000. Soms zelfs hoger. Onze klanten bieden een goed pakket arbeidsvoorwaarden, tenminste 25 verlofdagen, mogelijkheden tot ontwikkelen van je kennis door middel van opleiding en training.

title: Associate Scientist Data Systems
summary: You will have a wide range of responsibilities with regards to Smart QC and BSI systems including: writing procedures, perform testing, system setup / master…
description: What will your job be As an Associate Scientist Data Systems your main focus will be on implementing and administrating Smart QC and BSI systems. Smart QC is a non-GMP lab resource planning tool and BSI is a GMP digital inventory management system which will be used to manage the storage of GMP material administered by QCD. You will have a wide range of responsibilities with regards to Smart QC and BSI systems including: writing procedures, perform testing, system setup / master data configuration, troubleshooting and maintenance of the system You will also train users and becoming a system SME (during GMP audits) and SKU You will need to communicate with partners, troubleshoot issues and initiate improvements You will maintain communication with the software vendors and / or with the global IT support team You are able to work in a constantly evolving environment with short timelines, initiate improvements and ensure the most efficient use of our systems Besides you will have general Data Systems tasks such as assisting in eLIMS configuration and review  What are we looking for For the position as an Associate Scientist Data Systems we are looking for an quality oriented candidate with a strong affinity with digital systems. Furthermore we ask for:  Hbo / BSc degree in the biomedical field or equivalent A minimum of 2 years experience with quality and laboratory systems such as cGMP, SAP and LIMSs. Experience working in a Quality driven environment, GMP experience is an advantage Experience with project management is an advantage Detail oriented and proactive person with good communication skills which allow you to connect to different partners and build strong relationships Fluent communication skills in English and Dutch What do we offer A contract for 6 months at CheckMark, with the possibility of an extension Salary indication from €3000,- gross per month based on a full-time position Full-time position, where 32 hours a week is negotiable Dayshift Where will you work Pharmaceutical company specialised in the development of vaccines. In this role you will be part of the Data Systems (implementation) team, which is part of the Quality Control Development (QCD) group.   More information Jurjen Wilschut 088 00 211 22 jurjen@checkmark.nl Sebastiaan Loriaux 088 00 211 26 sebastiaan@checkmark.nl Ref.nr: 6962

title: Associate Scientist Data Systems
summary:
Systems setup / master data configuration, user acceptance testing, training users and becoming an SME and SKU.
Strong affinity with digital systems.
description: The Company Our client is a global leader in healthcare and pharmaceutical products, with base in Leiden. The company focuses on the discovery, development, manufacture, and marketing of vaccines to protect people worldwide from infectious diseases.  Role Description As an Associate Scientist you will join the Data Systems team within the Quality Control Development Department which is responsible of handling QC data and laboratory information in a GMP manner via eLIMS, Tableau, Jasper reports (Data Systems). Your main focus will be implementing Smart QC and BSI systems  Responsibilities Systems setup / master data configuration, user acceptance testing, training users and becoming an SME and SKU. Communicate with partners, troubleshoot issues and initiate improvements. Maintain communication with the software vendors and / or with the global J&J IT support team. Smart QC: join the Smart QC implementation team, performing parameter and assay mapping into Smart QC together with assay & eLIMS SMEs; Write procedures, perform testing, train users; Troubleshoot and maintain the system as SME and Site Key User. BSI: join the BSI implementation team; Set up master data such as storage locations, label templates, etc; Perform and document UAT according to GMP standards; Write procedures and train users; Troubleshoot and maintain the system as SME and SKU. Ensure compliance with quality standards (GMP) and production schedules. Assist in eLIMS configuration and review; Assist in eLIMS SKU activities. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in the biomedical field or equivalent Strong affinity with digital systems Experience with quality and laboratory systems such as cGMP, SAP and LIMS Experience in the pharmaceutical industry Fluent in English  Other Information For more information please contact Carla Garcia at +31 (0) 20 658 98 01 or c.garcia@sire-search.com.

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: You will also be part of the data guild, collaborating with other data scientists, data engineers and data analysts across the company to align on the data…
description: Company Description  We are on a mission to be the easiest and most reliable way to arrange home services, connecting homeowners with qualified service professionals. We operate the market-leading brands in France (Travaux.com) and the Netherlands (Werkspot.nl) and expanding in Italy (Instapro.it). Our Product, Technology & UX department consists of approximately 100 talented professionals, deeply passionate about creating beautiful digital marketplaces.  Job Description  Team & Technology We are forming a new product team that will focus on improving our ‘paid acquisition’ efforts related to acquiring demand (a.k.a homeowners with jobs to be done) on our marketplace. An example of a paid acquisition is buying an advertisement on google (via google adwords) for upper funnel keywords such as “install an air conditioner”, “find a painter in amsterdam” etc. As a Data Scientist, you will be a part of the newly formed ‘Paid acquisition’ team, together with other backend and frontend engineers, a user experience specialist, an agile coach, a business analyst, and a product manager. Our marketing department will be a key internal stakeholder of this team. Within this team, you will use your analytics, advanced data science and machine learning skills to build effective models and measure their efficiency. You will also support the experiments from hypothesis to analysis and interpretation. You will also be part of the data guild, collaborating with other data scientists, data engineers and data analysts across the company to align on the data strategy, development standards, and exchange knowledge and experience. Your responsibilities Join a cross functional team that aims to support and boost our paid marketing strategy Contribute to build an automated campaign management system Use data intelligence (revenue prediction models, measure incremental performance of campaigns, identify the right keywords…) to improve the performance of our marketing campaigns Drive innovation by using recent advances in machine learning, imagining new experiment methodologies and statistical techniques Work with the product owner to understand user goals and requirements alongside stakeholders and customers Summarise and communicate conclusions and solutions to analytic and non-analytic stakeholders  Qualifications  Your skills and experience You have 4+ years of experience as a Data Scientist You have 2+ years of experience in marketing analytics with a proven track record of delivering projects from conception to production Advanced skills in analytics, statistics, building experiments and A/B testing You have advanced Python skills (including clean and well-tested implementations) You have an understanding of digital media (social, search, display) You have familiarity with marketing tracking platforms (mainly Google Ads) Advanced SQL skills You apply software engineering principles to your projects by writing maintainable, testable and documented code You are a team player who contributes to a collaborative atmosphere You are reliable, communicative and business-minded  What we offer We have offices in both Amsterdam and Aix-en-provence. We offer a great working environment in either of these offices (once we go back to the office) Flexible working hours and remote working to accommodate personal needs A competitive salary Personal growth budget and time for attending training courses and conferences Relocation budget if coming from abroad (once it is safe/possible) 25 days of annual leave Pension arrangement Lunch allowance (even with the current remote working situation) Free fitness in our building (once it is safe/possible) Frequent and fun events with the entire company to celebrate achievements and milestones  Additional Information  How we are organised: Our Product, Technology and UX department currently consists of 4 tracks and approximately 100 professionals, from all over the world: Brazil, Canada, India, France, Greece, Ireland, Israel, Italy, The Netherlands, South Africa, Paraguay, Poland, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Turkey, the UK, and the USA. Each track focuses on the most valuable opportunity within their given scope. Within the tracks, multidisciplinary product development teams collaborate on achieving the goals that they set and commit to each quarter. We approach our decisions in an experiment-guided and Agile way: we validate new directions using a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods. Our shared values: We believe our success starts with sharing the same values when it comes to how we work. These values are the foundation of everything we do, and you’ll experience them on a daily basis. Our values are: Be stronger together; Aim high; Take ownership; Be transparent and respectful; Be open-minded and curious; Embrace diversity; Focus on our customers. The company culture in our organisation is very open and inclusive; we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Special note related to COVID-19 We will be hiring mostly through online video interviews. In-person interviews can be scheduled for candidates in the Amsterdam area, with the agreement of both parties. The position is based in Amsterdam and requires relocation to the Netherlands. Note that in-line with the current government (RIVM) recommendations, we are currently working from home. We will do our best to make the on-boarding as smooth as possible and help you get up-to-speed. Is this for you? Send your resume with a brief explanation of why you are highly motivated by this role. You can apply via the “Apply” button or by sending your information to Samy Bouras, Data Lead at Werkspot, Travaux and Instapro. We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Excellent understanding of physical and logical data models and its implications on the data quality.
Collaborate with data scientists and product development…
description: At SkinVision, every single day is an opportunity to make a difference. We are on a mission to saving the lives of 250,000 people in the next ten years by revolutionizing the way we care about our skin. Our technology allows users to take ownership of their health, recognising signs of skin cancer from anywhere, at any time.  We are hiring a Data Engineer who will improve the quality of our skin cancer detection service, ensuring we continue to lead positive change and deliver value to our users. Are you looking for a role at the crossroads of infrastructure, data and analytics? This role is the perfect fit for you.  We are looking for a Data Engineer with a passion for development and infra/devops engineering with a solid backing in data processing techniques. In this role, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the architecture, infrastructure, pipelines and tooling for unlocking the raw data in the various sources that we use in our systems. With a focus on reliability and timeliness to guarantee the quality of our current services, you enable new services through data driven development. You will team with our Data Analysts and Engineering team to provide robust data pipelines and share best practices to the rest of the team to ensure we process data according to the requirements and standards applicable to the healthcare industry.  What success looks like in this role? You provide a solid data infrastructure, tooling and processing that unlocks new insights and provides new capabilities for delivering value for our end users, healthcare professionals and the business. You think big and have the ability to discern which problems are important to create positive impact on the business perspective and articulate it to the rest of the team.  Daily Drivers  Building, testing and validation of data pipelines with a focus on data reliability including the infrastructure and tooling that we need. Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes. Monitor for inconsistencies in our data definitions or processing and define and build effective strategies for dealing with them Model logical and physical data schemes Enabling and running data migrations across database schemes. Improve data governance across the business in accordance with the standards within the healthcare industry. Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data, including writing tooling and tests Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges. Collaborate with data scientists and product development teams to improve the quality of or product and processes. What you will bring in  Minimum education is Bachelor degree in exact sciences such as Computer Science, Econometrics, AI or Physics. Affinity for the health industry is definitely a plus. Minimum 2 year experience working as a Data Engineer building infrastructure, processing pipelines and tooling. Experience working with GIT for version control. Experience in setting up, running and maintaining data processing infrastructures in the cloud (AWS), terraform. Hands-on experience working with data storage or processing frameworks such as RedShift, Snowflake, Kafka or the like. Expertise in data processing frameworks and pipelines such as AWS Glue, dbt, StitchData/FiveTran Excellent knowledge of SQL (Postgres) and Python. Having demonstrable knowledge of other languages is a plus (e.g. Java). Excellent understanding of data processing concepts such as ETL, ELT and you are able to reason about their pros and cons. Excellent understanding of physical and logical data models and its implications on the data quality Software engineering mindset: you apply industry best practices in your day to day work. Proficiency of English both verbally and written. Domain of other languages are certainly a plus. Not sure if you are qualified?  Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women tend to only apply only when they check every box. If you feel energised by our mission and would like to use your first-class talent to accelerate the growth of SkinVision but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still apply. We'd love to receive your application and see if you could be a great fit.

title: Chapterlead Data
summary:
You oversee the full scope of the data landscape and the data science developments;
As a Chapter Lead Data you are responsible to connect the right data and by…
description: Are you an expert in the field of data and do you want to work for a large and successful player in the financial world? Do you have affinity with working in a complex environment? Then don't hesitate to apply! ISRI49020 Organisation The organization is one of the largest financial institutions in the world with millions of customers. They hold a leading and solid financial position in the market with an international strategy. Key to this position are the employees of the organization. Within the organization they have an open communication, love to hear your input as a professional and promote your personal growth! All with staying flexible and innovative, to help the organisation keep it's leading position. As a Chapter Lead Data you are responsible to connect the right data and by doing so being able to create insights and the possibility to make predictions regarding the data. Therefore you will perform root cause analysis, including A/B testing, and implement better service to the clients. These insights are valuable, because then you and your team are able develop and design solutions to help the teams, within the organization, to make the right decisions. Every day you monitor the processes and with you analytical skills you think of creative ways to optimize the processes and the further development, while always keep the customer in mind. Besides that you will introduce new or improve existing models, like high lapsing customers or models to indicate potential fraudulent customers. Also you will identify the topics of written customer messages. Basically you and your team have the end-to-end responsibility in developing, deploying and maintaining the data solutions of the organization. In addition you are also responsible to develop specific expertise, within the team. You are actively involved in sharing knowledge in an international network of expert within the organization, being HR responsible for your Data scientists and BI specialist and you embed the performance management of them. Together with your peer Chapter Leads you oversee the whole organization and you detect flaws and act on it. You recognize yourself in the following characteristics: Hands-on, lead by example, customer obsessed and got a passion for data. Tasks You are responsible to build a clear strategy for your Chapter. Together with your fellow Chapter Leads you are responsible for the QBR’s; Identify customer topics; Create models or improve existing ones, like high lapsing customers or to indicate fraudulant customers; Perform root cause analysis, including A/B tests; You are responsible for the overall targets of the company together as a team; You know the Insurance market, competition, new trends and technologies; You have a clear vision on the direction for developing your Chapter; You are responsible for the development of the data platform of the organization, unlocking of valuable insights from the data with various analysis including machine learning for the benefit of the customers; You are HR responsible for your CJE’s and in that role you embed the performance management of the CJE’s in your chapter. Requirements University degree in a relevant field such as computer- or information science, econometrics, mathematics or data science; 10+ years’ experience with proven track record in the area of expertise; 5+ proven years’ experience in leading a team; Strong analytical skills to make good, timely strategic decisions; You have an entrepreneurial mind set, are Customer obsessed and show Servant leadership; Inspirational leadership skills including change management (Coaching, Listening and conflict); Passion to improve and expand your specific expertise; Strong communication skills, excellent level of English language; You oversee the full scope of the data landscape and the data science developments; A solid understanding of technology and its capabilities. Employment conditions Excellent salary; 25 vacation days; Good secondary employment conditions; Informal organization where openness and cooperation are paramount. Salary indication €5.500,- to €6.500,- based on 40 hours a week, and knowledge. About iSense iSense is a young, energetic and ambitious specialist in IT employment services. iSense will help you find a job on different levels within organizations, such as operations, business consultancy and (project)management. We want to help you find a job were you can be successful and above all happy. Working together with iSense will bring you: Personal guidance before, during and after your application process; Good understanding of your personal skills through various reports; Relevant preparation for your job interview; Always aware of your application process; Monthly personal contact with a Field Coach; Free participation on a quarterly basis in Personal Development Workshops. Locatie Rotterdam Publicatiedatum 15.03.2021 Publicatie eindigt 24.02.2022

title: PhD position Decentralization of Care Provision
summary:
Have a solid understanding of advanced statistical methods for the analysis of register and survey data.
This is a four-year fully funded position, for a PhD…
description: This is a four-year fully funded position, for a PhD candidate to carry out the research project “Provision of Care: Decentralization and Cooperation”. This project aims to understand the conditions under which the decentralization of care provision leads to possible social inequalities deriving from local variations in care provision. For a detailed project description, see the link https://www.scoop-program.org/program-projects/471-1-3-the-provision-of-care-decentralization-and-cooperation .  The project is part of the transdisciplinary and interdisciplinary research programme SCOOP: Roadmaps to Resilient Societies (see: http://www.scoop-program.org ). SCOOP is a research and training centre dedicated to the interdisciplinary study of sustainable cooperation as a key feature of resilient societies. SCOOP brings together researchers of Erasmus University Rotterdam, VU Amsterdam, the University of Groningen, Utrecht University, and Radboud University Nijmegen.  The PhD candidate will participate in the SCOOP PhD training programme, see: https://www.scoop-program.org/(...)-transdisciplinarity . The PhD candidate will be part of the Erasmus Graduate School of Social Sciences and the Humanities under the supervision of Dr. Tom Emery (primary supervisor), Prof. Pearl Dykstra and Prof. Martin van Hees.  Specifications  max. 40 hours per week  €2395—€3061 per month  Rotterdam  View on Google Maps  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR)  Requirements  The PhD candidate should  hold a Research Master degree in sociology, demography or have equivalent qualifications.  excel academically, as shown in grade transcripts and curriculum vitae.  have a solid understanding of advanced statistical methods for the analysis of register and survey data.  have an excellent written and spoken command of English.  have the ability and eagerness to work in an interdisciplinary research team as part of the SCOOP research programme.  preferably have some demonstrable interest in political philosophy and/or ethics.  Conditions of employment  Internationally-oriented and varied work within an enthusiastic team, with attractive fringe benefits in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU). Your initial employment term will be one year at first, it can be extended up to a maximum of four years if your performance proves satisfactory. Your remuneration on the basis of full-time salary will start at EUR 2.395 gross per month (salary scale PR, CAO NU) and will end up to EUR 3.061 gross per month (salary scale PR, CAO NU) in the fourth year. Erasmus University Rotterdam offers attractive terms of employment, including a holiday allowance of 8%, a year-end payment of 8.3% and 41 annual leave days in case of a full work week. In addition, EUR takes part in the ABP pension scheme, and we also offer partially paid parental leave. For international spouses we have set up a dual career programme. Moreover, EUR staff members are allowed to make use of the EUR facilities, including the Erasmus sports centre and the University Library.  Employer  Erasmus University Rotterdam  The Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR), named after Rotterdam-born humanist and theologian Erasmus, is a research university with a strong international orientation and a pronounced social focus, both in its education and research activities. On the lively, modern campus, more than 28.000 students and scholars of more than 100 nationalities are constantly encouraged to develop their talents and meet their ambition. Our more than 2700 scientists and employees work together with all our students to solve challenges faced by global society, drawing their inspiration from the consistently dynamic and cosmopolitan city of Rotterdam. The academic education offered at our faculties is intensive, engaging and strongly focused on practical application. We increasingly perform our research in multidisciplinary teams, which are closely interwoven with international networks. In terms of research impact and the quality of its degree programmes, EUR can compete with the foremost universities in Europe, which is reflected in its consistent top-100 position in most major universities’ rankings. Erasmus University Rotterdam’s key values are daring, curiosity, social involvement, breaking new ground and striving for success www.eur.nl  Department  Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences  The Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences (ESSB) is home to a vast diversity of scientific disciplines: public administration, pedagogical sciences, psychology and sociology. In addition, the Erasmus University College, IHS, and two research institutes RISBO and DRIFT are linked to the faculty. This also reflects in the content of the (international) bachelor's and master's programs and in research. Our activities are always focused on people and society. At the ESSB fundamental, internationally oriented research is of paramount importance. In addition, social research for professionals, policy makers, and the society is part of our research activities. ESSB offers a stimulating research environment where major national and international research grants are received. Appealing guest researchers and ambitious PhD candidates come along to conduct their research. Our education is small-scale and works with innovative forms of education such as Problem-Based Learning (PBL). Both the Dutch and English programs are highly ranked by students and alumni. ESSB is home to over 4000 students and more than 400 staff-members. The different disciplines are supported by the Faculty Office (for more information, please visit www.eur.nl/essb ).  Department of Public Administration and Sociology (DPAS)  DPAS covers the disciplines of Public Administration and Sociology. Two related scientific fields with different profiles. Public Administration studies governance capacity and policy interventions. It focuses on the institutional power to organize and intervene in the relations between different social, political and economic actors. Public Administration in Rotterdam goes well beyond the public realm itself and pays attention to public-private cooperation and networks of organizations. Sociology investigates the social structure of societies and the way it evolves. Sociologists in Rotterdam focus among other things on processes of globalization and individualization and on the effects of these processes on international social relations, the labor market or family relations. Related social problems that are studied are migration, flexibilization and solidarity. The perspectives of Public Administration and Sociology complement each other. Together they guarantee a highly relevant and scientific approach to topical administrative and social issues. The bachelor- and master programmes of DPAS are built on this profile and educate students to become scientifically schooled professionals.  Additional information  We value diversity and believe that a diversity of talents contributes to our vision and strategy to excel as a university on research and education. This means that we are looking for a person who can complement our team well. For more information about EUR and the Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences, please visit www.eur.nl/essb . For more a detailed project description, see the link https://www.scoop-program.org/program-projects/471-1-3-the-provision-of-care-decentralization-and-cooperation .  For additional information about this specific vacancy, please contact dr. Tom Emery, via email: t.e.emery@essb.eur.nl .  Making minds matter  Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR) is a highly ranked, international university, based in the dynamic and diverse city of Rotterdam, with its port acting as a gateway to the world.  Read more about Erasmus University Rotterdam

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of a large number of teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in the way they operate.
description: Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Scientist to join us! FULL-TIME · AMSTERDAM Who are we? We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions in cities all over the world. Our technology allows users to easily browse and book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks and more simply by showing their smartphones. About time, right? We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as a Senior Data Scientist, send us your resume. We might be looking for YOU! Our values Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other. Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together. Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart; take responsibility and push forward. Life at Tiqets What you will do The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of a large number of teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in the way they operate. As a Senior Data Scientist on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to lead and drive several key projects related to Marketing Campaign Optimization, A/B Testing, Conversion Funnel Optimization, Recommendations, Forecasting and much more. You will work closely together with other Data Scientists, ML Engineers, Data Analysts, Developers and Product Owners to ask the right questions, challenge the status quo, build new hypotheses and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning. If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment and believe in the importance of teamwork then this could be the right opening for you.  Responsibilities  Architect intelligent, creative Data Science solutions to complex business problems with a bias for starting simple and iterating  Collaborate with other Data team members on short and long-term Data projects related to Experimentation, Product Ranking, Recommendations, Internal Search, Forecasting, Retention, Marketing Campaign Optimization, etc Think beyond just the Data. Interact directly with Product Owners, Developers and other teams to build a strong understanding of how Tiqets operates and the opportunities/challenges ahead Design, run and analyse A/B Tests across our products; Help propagate a hypothesis-driven culture of testing and learning Mentor junior members of the team by building a strong culture of Data Science best practices and ensuring that we pick the right tools (and techniques) for the right job  Continuously look for ways in which Tiqets can improve its Products and InternalOps by staying up-to-speed with latest trends, tools and techniques in Machine Learning  Qualifications Masters degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or equivalent 5+ years of experience in Data Science and/or Machine Learning roles (past experience at a Tech company desired) Strong Analytical and problem-solving skills; Ability to break down complex problems into simpler components Expertise in Machine Learning algorithms; Sound fundamentals in Probability & Statistics, Calculus and Mathematics Prior experience designing, running and analysing A/B Tests Strong SQL skills; Proficiency using Python and popular ML libraries like scikit-learn Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake or BigQuery, and using BI tools like Looker, Tableau or Qlikview Excellent oral and written communication skills; Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently and take ownership of your work Nice to have: past experience working in PPC Marketing and/or travel industry experience working at an OTA like Tiqets Fluent in English; Living in the Netherlands/EU Perks at Tiqets Young, dynamic, international working environment Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scaleup 20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide Annual company getaway to undisclosed location Health insurance Tiqets learning academy: skill lab, group & individual learningTuesday's Pizza & beer sessions Friday drinks Visa sponsorship Summer party Competitive salary and paid holiday leave Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more Pension scheme and travel compensation Everyone - employed at Tiqets will receive a monthly contribution for working from home Everyone - employed at Tiqets can reimburse home work space necessities Our Data Science Stack Python  AWS  Airflow  Redshift  DBT  Looker Meet the Team

title: Junior Data Scientist
summary:
Formulating data science solutions relevant to the client.
As a creative, entrepreneurial and curious Junior Data Scientist, you’ll be working on a wide variety…
description: Wat breng je? Relevant Master's degree 0-2 years of working experience Experience with programming, databases, machine learning Wat krijg je? € 3.500 - € 4.500 gross per month Training budget of € 1.500 Commuting reimbursement Introductie Junior Data Scientist | Developing Prediction Models | Programming | Big Data | Databases | SQL | Python | 0-2 Years Experience | MSc | € 3.500 – € 4.500 | Amsterdam Are you a creative and curious Junior Data Scientist, who is eager to work on the development of prediction models? Do you want to work in an international work environment in Amsterdam? Then we might have an interesting opportunity for you! Organisatie Our client is a leading global player in Financial Markets services. They provide professional investors (including professional traders, market makers, brokers and investment parties) access to Financial Markets and make it possible for these clients to trade in financial products. These investors are further supported in complying with law and regulations. You will be working in the Global Data Science team, this team closely co-operates with the finance, risk and operations departments. Functie As a creative, entrepreneurial and curious Junior Data Scientist, you’ll be working on a wide variety of topics within finance and will discover further improvements using data insights. Your activities will include, but will not be limited to: Developing and testing prediction models; Exploring, presenting and identifying opportunities; Experimenting and creating prototypes; Formulating data science solutions relevant to the client. Functie-eisen To be successful as Junior Data Scientist, the following should apply: Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, (Data) Engineering, Econometrics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence or similar 0-2 years of relevant working experience; Experience with programming (Python); Experience with database handling (SQL); Experience with Pyspark; (Theoretical) knowledge of machine learning; Experience with visualization tools; Able to communicate effectively both to IT and the business; Strong affinity with Financial Markets; Excellent communication skills in English; You are always thinking one step ahead, able to look at things from another perspective and your enthusiasm and passion is contagious! We understand that skills depend on experience, if your skillset differs slightly from the above we do welcome you to apply. Aanbod As Junior Data Scientist, we offer you: The opportunity to work in an innovative and international team in Amsterdam; Insights into various banking processes, systems, products and regulations at one of the most professional player in the Financial Markets; A challenging and very dynamic working environment; The chance to build a unique network; You work for important stakeholders inside and outside the bank. Furthermore: € 3.500 – €4.500 gross per month, depending on your work experience and educational background and based on a 40 hours working week; 8% holiday allowances; Paid public holidays and 24 holiday days (plus two bonus holiday days); Participation in pension arrangement; Training budget € 1500, – per year; Commuting from home to work reimbursement. Sollicitatie Interested? If you wish to receive more information about this job opening, please contact Noortje Slagter via +31 20 489 23 20 or send an e-mail to recruitment@youngfinancials.com

title: Business Analist Operations
summary:
Leren van andere expertises zoals klant reizigers en data scientists.
Werken in een data snoepwinkel.
Passie voor het analyseren van data.
description: Je maakt Coolblue elke dag een beetje beter door ervoor te zorgen dat alle beschikbare data wordt ingezet. Wat doe je als Business Analist Operations bij Coolblue? Krijg je veel energie van data analyseren en stakeholders helpen bij het maken van slimme beslissingen op basis van data? Lees dan vooral verder. Eva legt je uit hoe je Business Analist Operations wordt bij Coolblue.   Dit vind je leuk om te doen Werken in een data snoepwinkel.Je bent namelijk de baas van de data van de klantenservice, het magazijn, de bezorgers, retouren of de winkels. Leren van andere expertises zoals klant reizigers en data scientists. Zodat je het beste advies kan geven aan een domein baas. Bevindingen presenteren in wekelijkse demo’s, want iedereen is super nieuwsgierig. Adviseren van operationele bazen op het behalen en overtreffen van targets. Jij beheert namelijk de KPI’s en quality metrics binnen het domein. Schrijven en automatiseren van logica in SQL, Excel, Airflow en Tableau.   Hier herken jij jezelf in Passie voor het analyseren van data. Daarnaast ben je nieuwsgierig en analytisch. Afgeronde wo-opleiding met een stevige kwantitatieve component. 1 jaar werkervaring. Ervaring met tools als SQL, Tableau, Python of andere tools. Heb je dat niet? Geen probleem! We leren het je graag. 40 uur per week beschikbaar.   Dit zoek jij verder in een baan Geld. Met meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek kun je elke dag een beetje beter worden. Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen. Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met collega's waar je blij van wordt, (digitale) epische feesten, pubquizzen en andere teamactiviteiten. 25 vakantiedagen. Als je belooft dat je terugkomt. Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling. Een kantoor waar je foto's van wilt maken op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen. Een baan bij één van de snelst groeiende bedrijven van de Benelux. Ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën. Daar staan we altijd voor open. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt. Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan, zodat je af en toe vergeet dat je aan het werk bent. Op dit moment werken we thuis wanneer dit mogelijk is. Natuurlijk zorgen we dat je thuis een top werkplek hebt. Inclusief bureaustoel, laptop en blauwe slingers.

title: Medior/Senior Data Scientist | EMEA | The Hague
summary:
Teach and guide data scientist.
Act as hands-on data scientist rolling out successful use cases through continental Europe.
2-5 years hands-on experience.
description: Would you like to become part of an international operating team of Data Scientists? Tasks: – Act as hands-on data scientist rolling out successful use cases through continental Europe – Teach and guide data scientist – Monitor and guide data science projects by traveling through Europe and visit the departments Essentials: – 2-5 years hands-on experience – Proven track record using machine learning techniques – Experience in using techniques like; R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, Spark etc, – You are passionate about data science – You are communicative and have a strong developed client oriented way of working. Interested? kai@analysepeople.nl

title: Data Engineer Python
summary: You have the capability to structure data from 30,000 active data systems, of which 90% are available in real time.
description: Company Description  Lely, founded in 1948, directs all its efforts towards creating a sustainable, profitable and enjoyable future in farming. Circling the cow, the company develops premium robotics and data systems that increase animal welfare, flexibility and the production on the dairy farm. For more than 25 years, Lely has been leading in the sale and service of automated milking systems to successive generations of dairy farmers across the globe. Every day, Lely inspires her employees to offer customers innovative solutions and be a reliable partner for long-term advice and support. With her Head office in The Netherlands and a worldwide network of dedicated Lely Center locations for tailor-made sales and support, the Lely Group is active in more than 40 countries and employs around 1.200 people.  Job Description  Check the recap of our latest ‘yellow revolutions’ in Diary Farming here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WTm_GWGOuw0&t=1s You have the capability to structure data from 30,000 active data systems, of which 90% are available in real time. To achieve the best results, it is important to gain insight into all facets of the dairy farm and make well-grounded data-driven decisions. Your task is to make data readily available for our organization regarding animal welfare, rations, grazing, reproduction and robotic performance via our Lely Data Platform. The data directly influences development and operations of the robots, as well as day-to-day business on farms worldwide. Your position You will be part of the growing Competence Center Data & AI with other Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts. You will work hands-on in product domains like Feeding and Milking. Working with tons of robot data from all over the world is what you have a passion for! With >2 years of experience in the field, you know best practices, are accustomed to code reviews and have experience in the cloud. Building scalable and reliable data pipelines is what you love to do. Working closely with our local team in Maassluis, in addition to high end partners in Prague and Istanbul exposes you to expert knowledge and capabilities providing a great community to develop your skillset, knowledge base and build up your career. Technologies we use: Microsoft Azure - for building cloud native solutions (Azure Storage, SQL, Kubernetes, Event Hubs / Service Bus). Python. .Net Core C# language - both Windows and Linux compatible. Azure Key Vault - we take security very seriously and build it into our projects from the beginning. GitLab – source code management, documentation, as well as continuous integration (CI/CD). Want to know more? Check this introduction from our Head of Data & AI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zVBUqayZzbE&t=8s  Qualifications > 2 years in data engineering or computer science related work. Making scalable and maintainable applications & understandable frameworks. Distributed systems: cloud computing, cluster computing. Python (required), .NET C# (optional) In the cloud, we use Python or C# for Data Engineering. In-depth knowledge of data APIs for specific cloud provider (preferably Azure). Good communication skills.  Additional Information  A job for a true inventor, at a company driven by innovation. You will see your ideas come to life as they leave the factory to our customer, the dairy farmer. At the end you will contribute to a sustainable way of farming. We offer.. flexibility in terms of working times and conditions; variety one day you will be at the workshop, another day on the farm and the next day you will work at the main office; the space and freedom to innovate, construct new ideas and tinker in our workshop; 40 holidays per year; the tastiest coffee you will ever drink, courtesy of our barista; time for fun: table football, volleyball and a basketball court. Recruitment or Consulting agency? We appreciate your interest, but we are sourcing all our candidates directly. We understand you are trying to offer your candidates interesting jobs at an innovative company like Lely but consider that any unsolicited profiles you send us will be treated as direct applications.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Ervaring met data-analyse tools (als Tableau, Rapidminer, R of Python);
Je past in deze functie verschillende geavanceerde technieken toe om data om te zetten…
description: Omschrijving Je komt in een team van Data Scientists, Customer Success Consultants en Developers, waarbij jij mede verantwoordelijk bent voor de (door) ontwikkeling van het Data Managent Platform en ons Marketing Automation Platform.
