Vanuit jouw vakgebied lever je een essentiële bijdrage aan een leading – next generation – business intelligence en data analyse oplossing voor een breed scala aan toonaangevende opdrachtgevers. Jij vult het team aan met jouw kennis van o.a. Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning, e/o Artificial Intelligence. Omdat het toevoegen van de eerder genoemde expertise nodig is voor het realiseren van onze plannen, zal je veel ruimte krijgen om dat zelf vorm te geven en wordt jouw eigen inbreng hierin gewaardeerd. Je past in deze functie verschillende geavanceerde technieken toe om data om te zetten in inzichten. Deze inzichten worden door klanten gebruikt om gedrag te verklaren, voorspellen en/of te beïnvloeden. Naast het (door)ontwikkelen en de reactieve werkzaamheden ga je ook proactief op zoek naar kansen die verscholen liggen in ruwe data vanuit diverse in- en externe databronnen. Je draagt actief bij aan de ontwikkelingsrichting en de technische strategie van de organisatie. Wat wordt er gevraagd Naast de profielschets hierboven wordt er verwacht dat je eigen initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid neemt en dat je breder kijkt dan alleen je eigen takenpakket. Het kantoor is open tijdens reguliere kantoortijden, maar het is mogelijk dat er in het weekend hoog urgente zaken binnen komen. Daarin wordt flexibiliteit verwacht. Het ambitie niveau ligt hoog, DATANEXT groeit graag door totdat ze een echte topspeler zijn op het gebied van ‘Big Data’, processen en Business Intelligence oplossingen. Ze zoeken daarom (aankomende) topspelers met dezelfde ambitie, die binnen hun vakgebied een actieve en ondernemende bijdrage leveren aan het succes van de DATANEXT Group. – WO werk- en/of denkniveau; – Brede kennis van datamodellen en -typen; – Ruime ervaring met SQL; – Ervaring met data-analyse tools (als Tableau, Rapidminer, R of Python); – Studie- of professionele achtergrond in Machine Learing, Deep Learning en/of Artificial Intelligence of Computer Science; – Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie. Wat wordt er geboden DATANEXT is een groeiende, maar solide werkgever. De teams bestaan o.a. uit Data Scientists, AI/ML specialisten, en developers. Humor speelt een grote rol. Er is veel vrijheid en ze stimuleren en faciliteren ieder lid van het team om door te groeien. Het is een open en platte organisatie, waarin men elkaar respecteert, support én stimuleert. Ze hebben goeie koffie, verzorgen je lunch en zorgen voor vers fruit op de werkplek. Allemaal in een fijn kantoor in Groningen Zuid. Salarissen zijn marktconform en er is een uitstekende regeling voor een persoonlijke oudedagsvoorziening. Bedrijfsprofiel De DATANEXT Group bestaat uit een aantal labels, allen gebaseerd op haar eigen Customer Data Platform ‘DNX’. De uitingsvormen variëren in vorm en functie per klant, maar data staat altijd centraal, al dan niet gecombineerd met AI en Machine Learning. De verschillende labels richten zich o.a. op Customer Data, Marketing Automation, Quality Monitoring in klantcontact, AVG-ondersteuning en Lead Management. Om al deze data te kunnen verwerken is het van essentieel belang dat onze databases, datastromen en systemen goed worden ingericht en gemonitord. PLAY_GRND werkt voor deze vacature samen met DATANEXT. Heb je interesse? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button of neem gerust contact met ons op voor meer info!

title: Data Scientist Insights - Customer Insights
summary:
The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists.
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions.
description: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. The Customer Insights department is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will have the opportunity to build data products that will be used across various departments of our business to help us predict and understand our customers’ behaviour, enabling us to offer them the most relevant personalised experience. The NITS team (No-Intent-To-Stay) works on our machine learning models that predict the probability of a cancellation. As a Data Scientist Insights in the NITS team, you’ll have the chance to work with one of the most established and widely used ML models at Booking.com and play an integral role in taking it to the next level! You’ll have the chance to collaborate closely with other Analysts, Developers, Product Managers and various business stakeholders and take full ownership of your work - from the initial idea generation phase to the implementation of the final product. You will thrive at Booking.com if you are result-focused, innovative, and with a solid quantitative background, but most of all by understanding our complex business model and the logic behind it. B.RESPONSIBLE Utilize ML and other statistical techniques, to continuously generate insights related to the performance of the model and advise the team on potential improvements. Generate cancellation related insights to influence the model development. Communicate regularly with the model’s stakeholders and assist with answering their questions. Develop insightful metrics, dashboards, reports. Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments. Actively contribute to the Data Science Insights craft at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues. B.SKILLED At least 2 years of relevant work experience. Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.) Fluency in at least one programming language, with a strong preference for Python. Strong working knowledge of Spark and SQL. Strong knowledge of reporting/visualization techniques (e.g., Tableau, Graphite, Power BI, etc.) Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders. Good understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts. Experience with forecasting techniques is a plus. Team player with strong interpersonal skills. Solution oriented and result driven. Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and analytical reasoning. What’s in it for you? The DSI role is open to worldwide candidates. We provide assistance for you and your family with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We have successfully relocated 300+ technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year. Headquarters located in one of the most vibrant cities in Europe: Amsterdam Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture Diverse, unique colleagues from every corner of the world Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Associate Scientist
summary:
Experiment design and data analysis skills.
You will analyze and interpret data, propose the next steps, and report/present to (senior) colleagues.
description: The Vaccine Generation group is part of the Viral Vaccines department of Janssen Vaccines & Prevention (JVP) and focuses on the research and development of vaccines against viral infectious diseases. The group is responsible for the design, generation, production, and characterization of recombinant viral vectors, for applied research in the vaccine field. Interaction with R&D groups in the organization is an important aspect of our work. You will join a stimulating group of researchers in a very collaborative environment. We are looking for an Associate Scientist to strengthen our team in developing innovative vaccine candidates aimed to prevent and treat life-threatening diseases. As an experienced Associate Scientist (Technician), you will be working under the supervision of a (senior) Scientist to support programs by generating, characterizing our (adeno) viral vectored vaccines, and improving our assays and procedures. Work within our team is dynamic and requires a flexible attitude. You will analyze and interpret data, propose the next steps, and report/present to (senior) colleagues. Cooperation and communication are important to all levels within the department. This job requires you to be an expert in techniques like (q)PCR, sequence analysis, standard DNA cloning, western blot, and cell culture. An interest in keeping up-to-date with relevant scientific literature is a plus. Expected activities include but are not limited to: Cloning of viral vectored vaccines using molecular techniques Generation and characterization of viral vectors Plan, design, conduct, and troubleshoot complex experiments Present results to team members and senior colleagues  Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: Education: you have finished an HLO or master's education with significant molecular, (bio)chemical, and virology training with more than 5 years of working experience in a relevant position. Furthermore, proven experience in molecular biology showing a good understanding of the matter is required. Required skills: (q)PCR, standard DNA cloning techniques, sequence analysis, cell culture, western blotting Preferred skills: Experience working in ML-2 laboratory with viral vectors. Specific Knowledge: Experience with adenoviral vectors is a plus. Competences: Organized and highly accurate Experiment design and data analysis skills Written and oral communication skills in English Dynamic, flexible, and open demeanor Digital literacy Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.   Primary Location Netherlands-South Holland-Leiden- Organization Janssen Vaccines & Prevention BV (8852) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2105898963W

title: Machine Learning Scientist - Accommodations
summary:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions.
The Product Foundations & Help Technologies department is in the process of bootstrapping a team specifically for…
description: It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission.We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready. At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties.  In order to support the objectives of focusing on the customer, personalisation is key to the augmented customer support and enhancing the post-booking experience. This requires the building of a personalisation engine, and the deep integration of this engine into a complex systems landscape. The Product Foundations & Help Technologies department is in the process of bootstrapping a team specifically for this building, with a machine learning scientist being at the centre of this team. The heavy lift of the modularisation of the b.com homepage and addition of personalised content requires a deep skill-set that this MLS position will bring.  B.Responsible Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into products through machine learning (incl. understanding product requirements, data discovery, model development and evaluation, to implementation of a full production pipeline for both batch and stream-based deployment). Use the model’s output to deliver both short-term commercial impact and longer-term differentiated business value and customer experience. Define and build proof-of-concepts to test new ideas and demonstrate their potential value to relevant stakeholders. Document and share the findings, and identify when these technologies can be generalised into reusable frameworks. Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies, and upskilling on these as needed. Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues. B. Skilled At least 3 years of relevant work experience. Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.) Prior experience with classification and regression algorithms and an excellent understanding of the specifics of those algorithms. Experience with deep learning is a plus. Solid understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts. Fluency in at least one programming language, with a strong preference for Python. Strong working knowledge of Spark and SQL. Experience with putting machine learning models in production is a plus. Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders. B.Offered Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Het modelleren van de data.
In deze rol zul je datamining en data-analyse uitvoeren om grote heterogene datasets te ontgrendelen.
Python: scikit-learn, panda's.
description: De vacature In deze rol zul je datamining en data-analyse uitvoeren om grote heterogene datasets te ontgrendelen. Je kunt voorspellende modellen ontwikkelen en moet de wiskunde en de statistieken erachter kunnen begrijpen om het gedrag van het model te interpreteren en uit te leggen in termen van leken. Functie eisen 2+ jaar ervaring. Je bent gepassioneerd over het toepassen van A.I. technieken zoals NLP en machine learning. Idealiter gepromoveerd of MSc in computerwetenschappen, wiskunde, natuurkunde, operationeel onderzoek, statistiek, econometrie of ander technisch gebied. Programmeerervaring met ten minste één scripttaal. (Python, R, Julia, MATLAB, SQL etc.) Sterke datavisualisatie vaardigheden om de resultaten van analyses op een duidelijke en effectieve manier te communiceren. De mogelijkheid om de resultaten van analyses op een duidelijke en effectieve manier te communiceren Nederlandse taal heeft de voorkeur Ervaring met: Python: scikit-learn, panda's R: Studio, Shiny Spark Jouw belangrijkste taken: 01 Je werkt in agile teams 02 Het designen, implementeren en het testen van modellen. 03 Ervoor zorgen dat bepaalde issues zo snel mogelijk opgelost worden 04 Het modelleren van de data 05 Het optimaliseren van processen

title: Big Data Engineer
summary: De nadruk ligt op de interne data maar kan deze ook plaatsen in het grotere geheel door combinaties te maken met data van partners en open data.
description: Omschrijving Voor een toonaangevende publieke organisatie vitaal voor Nederland zet jij jouw kennis en ervaring als data engineer in met betrekking tot ETL, ontologie, SQL, NoSQL, Python, data cleansing en data configuraties. Jij bent in staat om het uit te werken maar ook te implementeren en neemt een sturende rol in het omgaan met de steeds groter wordende hoeveelheden en de toenemende diversiteit en neemt actief deel aan de landelijke data science community binnen de keten en blijft goed op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op jouw vakgebied. Jij speelt een onmisbare rol om te komen tot de realisatie van een modern BI-platform in de strijd om Nederland steeds veiliger te maken. Opdrachtomschrijving In een DevOps setting werk je midden in de business en in nauwe samenwerking met de analisten en data scientists applicaties die direct meerwaarde hebben voor een belangrijke organisatie binnen de Veiligheidsketen. Je houdt je bezig met het analyseerbaar maken van de juiste en volledige dataverzamelingen voor analisten, business intelligence experts en datascientists. Je bent de expert op het gebied van ontologie, datamodellen, structuren en relaties in de grote gegevensverzamelingen. De nadruk ligt op de interne data maar kan deze ook plaatsen in het grotere geheel door combinaties te maken met data van partners en open data. Om de gegevensverzamelingen goed te kunnen analyseren en samen te stellen moet je bedreven zijn in een breed scala aan skills en technieken om de grote diversiteit in data bij elkaar te kunnen brengen. Je kent de ETL principes en bent vaardig in SQL, NoSQL, Python, data cleansing en data configuraties. Als data engineer kan je de gevolgen overzien bij gebruik van onvolledige, onjuiste of onbetrouwbare data en vervult daar een (dwingend) adviserende rol in. Het voldoen aan autorisatieregels en wetgeving is daarbij essentieel. Naar de organisatie toe heb je een sturende rol in het omgaan met de steeds groter wordende hoeveelheden en de toenemende diversiteit. Je bent goed op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op jouw vakgebied. Doelstelling Wij bouwen in het kader van een nationaal project aan een reeks van applicaties die samen moeten zorgen voor een moderne analyse omgeving. Die omgeving is de basis om het intelligence vak naar het volgende level te brengen. Moderne front - en backends leveren betere data in een moderne database omgeving, zodat de analisten kunnen werken zonder te veel data preparatie. Verantwoordelijkheden Jij bent een van de developers die de databases in orde maakt. Je werkt in nauwe samenwerking met een aantal ontwikkelaars en data scientists die deels mee ontwikkelen. Er is een product owner die de gebruikerswensen voor je op een rij zet. Jij helpt meedenken in de juiste oplossingen. Aan het eind van het jaar staat een robuust omgeving waarmee analisten en data scientists hun werk goed kunnen doen. Vakmatige taken Programmeren aan backend en database Analytisch ben je sterk, je onderscheidt gemakkelijk hoofd- van bijzaken en brengt informatie uit diverse bronnen met elkaar in verband. Je bent ondernemend en nieuwsgierig: je signaleert kansen en bent alert op trends, ontwikkelingen en jurisprudentie. Je kunt zelfstandig werken waarbij je proactief zoekt naar nieuwe mogelijkheden en kansen. Daarnaast zoeken wij een teamspeler die hoge eisen stelt aan het werk en voortdurend zoekt naar mogelijkheden om de kwaliteit te verbeteren. Je beschikt je over het vermogen om daadwerkelijk zaken te organiseren en te implementeren. Contacten Contacten op diverse niveaus van management tot medewerkers. Je werkt ook samen met collega’s van de landelijke data science community op het landelijke intelligenceplatform. Naar de organisatie toe heb je een sturende rol in het omgaan met de steeds groter wordende hoeveelheden en de toenemende diversiteit. Je bent goed op de hoogte van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op jouw vakgebied. Competenties Organisatievermogen Initiatief Klantgerichtheid Accuratesse Flexibel gedrag Samenwerken Stressbestendig Bijzonderheden Een rol waarbij je een tastbare maatschappelijke bijdrage levert en aan de voorfront van big data technieken mag werken. Voor aanvang van deze deze rol dient een screening door de Veiligheidsdienst te worden doorlopen. Hiermee rekening houdend wordt een start beoogd in de loop van augustus/september 2020. 4x9 is in deze rol mogelijk. Herken jij je in bovenstaande rol neem contact met ons op en wij nemen binnen 24 uur contact met jou op.

title: Applied Data Scientist with a Data Engineering Focus
summary:
Experience with deploying data-processing pipelines.
Solid understanding of data structures and algorithmic complexity.
Problem solving and analytical thinking.
description: Founded in 2012 and based in Amsterdam, Owlin turns news into actionable intelligence. Our international client base is growing rapidly, and more prospects come knocking at our door every day. That is why we need a best-in-class Applied Data Scientist to join our team. Instead of sitting in a cubicle in a corporate environment, working at Owlin means that you will be making a visible impact while working in an ambitious, fast-growing team and bringing exciting products to the global financial market.  About the job You will be working in a young and dynamic Data Science Team that aims to deeply understand our clients’ business challenges and build solutions that answer those needs. We leverage cutting edge technologies from NLP and other areas of ML or develop entirely new techniques in-house if need be. Even though deep learning definitely has its place within Owlin, we also particularly value models that can be introspected and adjusted on the spot by data analysts.  About you You are not the type of person that needs or asks for instructions. You are expected to proactively engage with what is already in place and pitch ideas for improvement. You will make sure your ideas are understood, validated, and implemented in practice as well. You have a passion for technology and the way it is changing traditional markets and institutions. You want to be part of that revolution and are looking for an adventurous job where you can make a real difference.  Responsibilities As part of the Data Science Team, you have a central role in extracting value and insights from our data (mostly structured and unstructured text as well as time series data of various kinds) and translate this into new tools and resources for our clients. As an Applied Data Scientist with a Data Engineering Focus, your core objective is to support the team in turning ideas into production-ready models, infrastructure and code. You’ll get your hands dirty on the command line of Linux servers, and help us develop data pipelines both on and off the cloud. If you also possess bona fide research skills, you are more than welcome to let it show. How you develop yourself within Owlin is limited only by your own ambitions and capabilities.  Hard skills 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist / Engineer Problem solving and analytical thinking Demonstrable programming proficiency Ability to implement algorithms in Python / NumPy Numba / Cython / C(++) / JavaScript (NodeJS) / GO are a bonus Solid understanding of data structures and algorithmic complexity Experience in Deep Learning and ML general (PyTorch / TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, SciPy, ...) Experience in NLP Experience with deploying data-processing pipelines Experience using Linux Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases Familiarity with REST APIs and their deployment (Flask, FastAPI, Nginx, passenger) English: full professional working proficiency We also really appreciate: Strong mathematical and statistical background An intuitive understanding of business problems  Soft skills Authentic and ambitious Entrepreneurial and pragmatic mindset High degree of personal motivation Ability to manage your own schedule Deep care for end users and their experience  Benefits We offer a wide array of perks to help our employees find an ideal work-to-life balance. We’re all about increasing productivity by maximizing joy. Here are some of the benefits that we have to offer: Competitive pay: good primary and secondary benefits Great place to work: a beautiful office with a view right in the city center of tech hub Amsterdam. Great WFH-support to make sure you have all you need to “get shit done”. International team Personal development: surrounded by the best and brightest tech talent Flat hierarchy where your work will directly touch our clients Fun(virtual) company-wide events. Daily lunch and Friday afternoon drinks when things are back to normal! In a (post-)COVID world, we are flexible and accommodating when it comes to working remotely. The office is available for those who need to use it (within limits in line with governmental public health safety guidelines), but the infrastructure and routines are in place to facilitate working remotely for everyone, all while staying engaged, motivated and productive.  If you think this position has your name written all over it, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: (Full stack) Data scientist - Amsterdam
summary:
You have at least 5+ years of professional experience as a full-stack data scientist.
You are excited about leveraging data to bring people together.
description: Are you an experienced Full Stack Data Scientist looking to make your mark on a platform that touches the hearts of millions of people? Then you’re at the right place. We designed a social dating experience that brings people together and changes the course of their life.  Inner Circle helps busy, life-loving singles meet their match in real life. Since its inception in 2012, Inner Circle has rapidly expanded and is currently active in more than 40 cities across the world with more than 3 million members and thousands of amazing love stories to tell. Inner Circle brings singles together in real life through the app and website.  We are a small but mighty team of 27 who are passionate about dating, tech, and getting people together. Inner Circle won the Deloitte Fast 50 in 2018, as the fastest growing technology company. The company is profitable and healthy and we take good care of our team. Our offices are in Amsterdam (HQ), London, Dnipro and São Paulo.  What you’ll be doing We pride ourselves on being data-driven decision-makers here at Inner Circle.  As the first Data Scientist at Inner Circle, you will get ownership of the data domain, maximizing the value of our matching platform as well as enabling teams to make the best decisions based on data and insights.  From start, you will get your hands dirty, build business cases and make an impact across all customer touchpoints, from the earliest touchpoint in the marketing funnel, to the core Inner Circle apps on web and mobile, down to CRM. Over time you will Lead and Expand your Data & BI team to meet the growing challenges of a scale-up.  With hundreds of millions of likes, messages and images exchanged monthly, there is an incredibly exciting opportunity to further develop your data science skills, while at the same time shaping the way people get together, and with that change the course of their lives! The Role: You proactively drive and deliver (advanced) analytical solutions for complex growth or product-related challenges (e.g. behavioral clustering, pattern mining, revenue/churn predictions, business-models quantitative assessments, argumentation for new pricing strategies, etc.) You drive improvements to the recommender systems by coordinating, building and deploying effective (auto) ML/AI models (e.g. one of the key challenges is to efficiently determine who should be recommended to match together - to find the best matches that satisfy both requirements). You drive automation and optimization of the key business processes as well as core improvements of the end-user experience through the use of computer vision, NLP, and ML models (automated detection of scam and fake profiles, rude and inappropriate behavior in conversations, etc). You take the lead on data and BI, working closely with product, engineering, marketing and other teams to make sure they have accurate self-service analytics and are able to leverage those tools to make the right decisions. You work closely with our engineers to build out a scalable data infrastructure that acts as a single source of truth.  What will make you successful Hard skills: You are excited about leveraging data to bring people together. You have at least 5+ years of professional experience as a full-stack data scientist. You have solid technical knowledge and confidence in terms of programming, scripting, querying, and working with large data sets (strong Python and SQL essential). You have demonstrable experience ML models from initial conception right through to the final production model. You have strong knowledge in additional areas of data science such as computer vision and NLP. You have hands-on experience setting up and working with data visualization and analytics tools (Tableau, Looker, Google Analytics, Amplitude, etc). Soft skills You communicate clearly, listen, and show empathy as a foundation for effective collaboration. You have strong prioritization and project management skills, understanding of business impact for various solutions. You are able to turn complex business problems and data insights into clear business cases that are easy to understand and practical to act on for cross-functional teams. You are goal-oriented and driven by making an impact. You are humble, organized, ambitious and always looking to learn.  What we offer A chance to make a positive, life-changing impact on people's lives, by leveraging our data A competitive salary matched with your experience and ambition The fun and hustle of a tech scale-up, inside a small but profitable company Monthly Bring Your Own Device compensation Monthly Stay Healthy allowance A Macbook or other hardware of your choice to be able to do your job Training and development budget An annual trip with the whole company (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Frequent team get-togethers (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Monthly Inner Circle events to meet all the cool members IRL (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Free Inner Circle VIP membership for you and your single friends An amazing work environment in our own 400 m2 office at Prins Hendrikkade, at the heart of Amsterdam Sounds like your dream role? Apply today with a short cover letter and your resume (in English, please). Note: You must have to have permission to work in the EU. We are unable to provide relocation for this position.

title: Data Architect
summary: Constantly you’re looking for opportunities to register the right data in the right place to feed data engineers, data scientist and Business intelligence…
description: You are the right person to share your vision and make people enthusiastic about data. Besides that, you like working with the latest technology in a young and fast-growing organization.  What are you going to do? Allianz Direct is building an awesome global insurance platform, that you built and run. We are looking for an experienced hands-on Business Intelligence (BI) & Data Warehouse (DWH) architect, for developing end-to-end DWH solutions and with a strong focus on the data preparation, modelling and transformations (‘ETL’, ‘ELT’ , ‘LETS’). This is How you do it: As an architect you will set the blueprint to for a data management framework; You share your vision and make people enthusiast about using the data; You will be part of the Direct architecture chapter with specific responsibility for our data architecture and work with our data team to deliver your vision; Constantly you’re looking for opportunities to register the right data in the right place to feed data engineers, data scientist and Business intelligence experts to improve the use of data in our decision-making processes; With your deep understanding of data modelling, transformations and reporting you ensure the architecture used is future proof and trusted; We live Dev-Ops! You run what you build! What do you bring? Preferably experience in working with insurance data and background in analysis and understanding information from a usage perspective, Information / Business Analysis; Experience working with conceptual, logical and physical model design, translating conceptual designs to physical implementation; Experienced and deep understanding of modelling techniques (3NF, Data Vault, Kimball, Imon); Experience and strong skills in SQL (including T-SQL or equivalent); Understanding of coding and scripting, specifically using .Net or Java and with Visual Studio and Data Tools (BIDS); Experienced in data visualization; Understanding of data science concepts and development cycle; Experienced in Big data solutions; Ideally, experience working with the Microsoft data stack, including Azure, SQL Server and Power BI, including strong SQL skills and understanding of database administration concepts; At least 3 years of experience in a Data Architect role; MCSE certification or equivalent is preferred, including components of managing / optimizing databases; Familiar with DevOps concepts including automated unit testing, deployment. Experience & Key skills Strong problem solving and delivery capabilities coupled with attention to detail and the ability to work independently; Good communications skills and helpful attitude towards business users so that they can get access to the data to do their job; Flexible mindset and hands-on / can-do attitude; Strong analytical skills. About Allianz Direct Allianz Direct is the fastest growing car insurance company in the Netherlands. In ten years' time we have grown to become the online market leader and have managed to gain a leading position in the market. In addition to car insurance, we also offer home and liability insurances and we are investigating other options to expand our range. Furthermore, Allianz Direct is part of Allianz, one of the largest insurance groups in the world. At Allianz Direct you have the best of both worlds: a flexible organization that can respond quickly to innovations with a solid, sustainable parent organization that guarantees continuity. Allianz Direct is a European project in which several European direct labels work together to offer the same products throughout Europe: a unique company to work in. The cooperation with other countries gives us the opportunity to respond faster and better to changing customer requirements. Our ambition is to become the best European insurer, with the best products, prices and customer experiences. What do you get in return? You are part of an international team where you get the freedom to shape things. We offer a versatile and challenging position with broad development opportunities in an international organization. A challenging role, with high visibility and impact, and excellent perspectives to get acquainted with the different departments, products, people and entities in Allianz Direct; Working in a dynamic environment that encourages you to take initiative, where you can grow and actively contribute to strengthening our position as world leader; (Partly) work from home – also after Covid; Be part of an enthusiastic, experienced and ambitious team; Working with the latest technology in a young and fast-growing organization; Excellent learning & development opportunities and an attractive salary package. Does the above function appeal to you? Then apply via the button below and find out what your options are at Allianz! Questions? Contact our recruiter: Dion van Alphen T: 06 42 54 84 02 (preferably by Whatsapp) M: recruitment@allianz.nl To guarantee the integrity of our employees, a positive result of the Pre-Employment Screening will be a precondition for employment.

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: We are a diverse team of data scientists that is passionate about data and algorithms lifting insights and actions hidden in large data sets.
description: The adidas Digital Data Science team is looking for talents. We are a diverse team of data scientists that is passionate about data and algorithms lifting insights and actions hidden in large data sets. We work on a variety of use cases, from forecasting to product recommendations, from pricing to allocation. We help our digital customers, managers, business analysts - everyone - to benefit from their data and drive their strategic and day-to-day decision making.  We are looking for data science talents who are as passionate, curious and dedicated as we are and who want to contribute to the sustained growth of our eCom business.  What you'll do  Guide a team of highly skilled Data Scientists from diverse backgrounds like statistics, mathematics, economics and computer science in developing and factorizing complex data science solutions.  Support the analysis of stakeholder objectives, assess the problems to be solved and what internal or external data sources to use or acquire.  Specify and apply appropriate mathematical, statistical, predictive modelling or machine-learning techniques to analyze data, generate insights, create value and support decision-making.  Design, code, verify, test, document, amend and refactor complex programs/scripts and engage in mutual code reviews.  Seek to fully address client needs, enhancing the capabilities and effectiveness of client personnel, by ensuring our data science solutions are properly understood and appropriately exploited.  Support the review of the benefits and value of our data science solutions and recommend improvements.  Actively contribute to our Communities of Practice and knowledge sharing events and thereby shape our analytics policies, standards and guidelines.  Who you are  You are an expert in Machine Learning (in particular tree-based models, NLP, image processing) who is strong in exploratory data analysis and feature engineering.  You should have a solid understanding of statistics/ statistical inference, linear algebra, optimization and time-series modeling.  Python and its state-of-the art analytical libraries (e. g. , pandas, scikit-learn, PySpark, plotly) are your second nature. Hands-on experience in Deep Learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch) is not a must but would be a plus. Solid knowledge of R (including tidyverse) is an advantage.  You are set up for success if you effortlessly work in a Jupyterlab/ Notebook environment and know how to use Bitbucket/ GIT for version control and collaborative coding. Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem/ cloud environments would be a plus.  You have a solid understanding of relational databases and the ability to efficiently query large databases (e.g., via SQL, Hue, Spark).  You know what it takes to factorize data science solutions as you stick to basic software engineering principles (e.g., integration/ unit testing) and are familiar with the concept of continuous integration and the use of Jenkins.  You have a proven track record in at least one of our focus areas (i.e., recommender and ranking systems, website personalization, search engine optimization, demand forecasting, image processing, social media listening, customer lifetime value).  You know the principles of agile development and have already worked as a member of an agile development team.  You hold a Master's degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Econometrics, or related field with a strong quantitative focus (Mathematics/Physics), PhD welcome but not required  You have at least 5 years experience as Data Scientist outside academia, ideally in online retailing or sporting goods industry with expertise in developing data-driven products end-2-end.  You have excellent professional communication skills (English, written and oral), German would be a strong plus.  You interact confidently with developers and stakeholders alike and can present your work to technical and non-technical audiences.

title: Projectmanager
summary:
Naast dit team is er een warehouse team en een team met data scientist.
Als projectmanager werk je nauw samen met het team data scientist en spar je geregeld…
description: Jouw werkplek Voor een ambitieuze organisatie in Amsterdam zijn zoeken wij een projectmanager die zich wil inzetten om de zorg nog gezonder te maken. Door efficiënte declaratiestromen te garanderen willen ze de zorg betaalbaar houden. Het betreft een platte organisatie waar werkplezier en ontwikkeling voorop staan. Wanneer je door de wandelgangen loopt, zie je overal kantoorruimtes met glazen wanden, een open omgeving. Met een pingpong tafel waar dagelijks toernooitjes gespeeld worden en een grote eettafel waar gezamenlijk geluncht wordt. Als je door de ramen naar buiten kijkt, zie je een mooi park waar je met collega’s een heerlijke wandeling kan maken. Naast deze sociale activiteiten, wordt binnen deze organisatie ook veel aandacht gegeven aan persoonlijke- en professionele ontwikkeling. Zo ben je minstens twee uur per week bezig met het volgen van een training en/of cursus die op dat moment aansluit op jouw leerdoel. Binnen deze organisatie zal jij onderdeel worden van het team projectmanagers. Naast dit team is er een warehouse team en een team met data scientist. Alle drie de teams rapporteren aan de Chief Operation Officer (COO). Als projectmanager werk je nauw samen met het team data scientist en spar je geregeld met de COO over je ontwikkeling. Ook heb je regelmatig contact met de directie aangezien zij de projecten binnen halen die jij vervolgens gaat oppakken. Deze projecten betreffen intellectuele uitdagingen met betrekking tot kostenbeheersing in de zorg. Mét behoud van kwaliteit en toegankelijkheid. Jouw rol Als projectmanager wordt jij verantwoordelijk voor de projecten van klanten zoals; ziekenhuizen, apotheken en GGZ-instellingen. Hierbij is het belangrijk dat je organisatorisch sterk bent, je werkt aan meerdere projecten tegelijk. Als projectmanager is het aan jou om per project het proces rondom kostenbeheersing te analyseren en vervolgens op te pakken. Het doel is namelijk dat de organisatie doelmatig en rechtmatig gaat declareren. Om dit te verwezenlijken ga je het gesprek aan met medische specialisten om gedragsverandering te realiseren in kosteneffectiviteit van geleverde zorg. Hierbij is het belangrijk dat je kennis hebt van de DBC systematiek en inzicht hebt in de declaratiestromen binnen de zorg. Doordat jij de taal van de medische specialist spreekt en begrijpt weet jij zowel tactisch als analytisch dit gesprek te voeren. Tijdens de gesprekken doe je observaties en weet je snel verbanden te leggen in data. De opdrachtgever biedt Een ambitieuze werkomgeving waarin je onderdeel wordt van een jong en hecht team; Een uitdagende functie waarmee jij het verschil kan maken binnen de gezondheidszorg; Aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke- en professionele ontwikkeling door het op maat aanbieden van trainingen en cursussen; Maandelijkse personeelsuitjes of (online) activiteiten. De opdrachtgever vraagt Je bent in het bezit van een WO master en je bent organisatorisch, analytisch en communicatief sterk; Je weet hoe het DBC-systeem werkt en beheerst medische kennis wat jou een goede gesprekspartner maakt; Je kan om gaan met weerstand en je ziet het als een uitdaging om een gedragsverandering plaats te laten vinden. Interesse? Ben jij de projectmanager die wij zoeken? Dan zie ik graag jouw motivatie verschijnen! Mocht je vragen hebben over de vacature kan je terecht bij Susan Steevens, Talentmanager bij Q-Talent, via susan.steevens@qtalent.nl of 06 25 06 50 60.

title: Technician/Junior Scientist Bioreactor Operator – Bioprocessing
summary:
Collect, analyse, interpret and present experimental data.
We are currently looking for a technician or junior-level scientist to join our bioprocess…
description: We're working on a challenging and incredibly exciting mission: to bring cultured meat to market. Stem cells are central to this process. We are currently looking for a technician or junior-level scientist to join our bioprocess development team. As a member of our friendly and dedicated team, you will perform bioreactor cultures of stem cells and tissue constructs. Full-time · Maastricht What you can achieve Be a crucial part of bringing cultured meat to market, having a massive positive impact on the world. Collaborate with a friendly, international team of world-class scientists and engineers in a fast-paced and exciting start-up environment. Gain experience and expertise in a range of different cell and tissue culturing techniques. Develop and hone your skills of scientific thinking and analysis. Your responsibilities  Perform large scale cell and tissue culture in bioreactor systems.  Analyze and optimize bioreactor culture system in collaboration with engineers and team members of the large scale cell culture team. Collect, analyse, interpret and present experimental data. Assist in the smooth day-to-day running of the laboratory. What we're looking for  Academic background (BSc or MSc) in Cell Biology, Life Sciences, Biotechnology, Bioengineering or related field Knowledge of and experience with bioreactor cultures, bench-top or larger scale is required Experience with culture of mammalian cells is a must Experience with culture of stem cells & microcarrier cultures is highly desirable Passionate about our mission, and excited about working in a commercial start-up environment. A hardworking, organised and dedicated team-player. Good verbal and written communication skills (minimum B2 level English). Ability to commence soon (desirable). Permission to work in the EU (essential). Willingness to work on a shift schedule What you can expect from us We are a small team working on an innovation that we believe will have a huge global impact. As part of this exciting project, we promise that you will get to: Enjoy an enterprising work culture with lots of freedom in your projects. Combine science with a commercial goal. Enjoy 25 days of paid leave per year. Work in the beautiful, historical city of Maastricht. Enjoy flexible working hours. Receive SARs in the company (on top of competitive remuneration). We really look forward to hearing about you. Please submit an application, and we will be in touch with you shortly. We are reviewing application on a rolling basis. If you have any questions please reach out to HR@mosameat.com or our team lead of bioprocess development Naya Moutsatsou at naya@mosameat.com

title: Digital Talent Programme – Data Engineer
summary:
You are able to translate business requirements into data solutions.
You create the data infrastructure in a simple and efficient matter.
description: Climate change is one of the greatest challenges of humankind. A challenge that has completely come to define our work at Vattenfall. And we know that the future of energy will be formed by tomorrow’s talents. New digital innovations and solutions are vital to reach our goal: fossil free living within one generation. By applying to the Digital Talent Programme 2021 you can become 1 of 12 talents working towards that goal. Each position in the programme is unique and has its own specific responsibilities and challenges. Next to your personal development in this position, you will also be enjoying one year of all we have to offer. A year within this programme will include both virtual and live meet-ups with your international colleagues. During the year you will work on assignments virtually together, as well as participating in four seminar weeks during which you will meet live. Furthermore, you will have the opportunity to join a variety of trainings.  Your role as a Data Engineer At Customer Analytics department we create customer value in a close business and IT partnership to reach the “Power Climate Smarter Living” vision. We promote a positive digital mindset and establish an open learning culture to run stable, secure, efficient and compliant IT services. As a Data Engineer you are responsible for the creation of data products that meet our customers’ growing demands and with your work you accelerate Vattenfall’s digital transformation strategy. Your daily activities: You create the data infrastructure in a simple and efficient matter You design, build and integrate data from source system to end customer You work closely with Data Scientists, other Data engineers, UX colleagues on creating data solutions as well as with our business partners in Sales, Marketing to help them getting better insight in our customers’ demands  Who are you? You want to drive digital innovations and you are a firm believer of using your skills to tackle climate change. We believe you are a brilliant networker, a critical thinker, a resourceful innovator and a keen learner who always keeps an ear to the ground to catch up on developments.  As a Data Engineer you recognize yourself in the following qualifications: You have a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science or similar You have an affinity with the latest Data technologies or in creating data solutions You are able to translate business requirements into data solutions You have a drive to automate and to continuously improve and keep your knowledge up to date You write software and understand Python; SQL or Spark is an advantage, but not a must You have experience with coding assignments or a development project You’re very keen to learn new tools in software development and you have an Agile mindset You are our ideal talent if you are a recent graduate with an academic degree or a young professional with no more than three years of working experience. You are fluent in English. Skills in other languages can be a merit. Furthermore, you are willing to relocate for possible assignments throughout the organization.  Location: You will be working in department Customer IT and the position is located in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.  Our offer The Digital Talent Programme is a kickstart to your career within Vattenfall. It will give you the opportunity to visit different parts of our organization, e.g. in Sweden, the Netherlands, Germany, and Poland. There are planned weeks including personal development and internal leadership development from our Vattenfall Management Institute. Furthermore, a hackathon, huddles and longer assignments will also be part of the programme. Each position comes with a competitive salary and an excellent remuneration package. Read more about our programme here https://careers.vattenfall.com/young-talents/digital-talent-programme/  Application process We welcome your application in English, including resume and cover letter. Last day to apply is 4th of April 2021. Selection period starts in April, followed by online tests and interviews in April and May. The recruitment process will be finalized around the end of May. The last step will be a pre-employment screening. Starting date of the Digital Talent Programme will be 1st of September 2021. Due to COVID-19 all steps of the recruitment process will take place virtual. At Vattenfall we are committed to acting responsibly in response to the challenges posed by COVID-19 and we are taking all necessary measures to protect employees and job applicants. For more questions about COVID-19, please visit our generic FAQ page. We look forward to your application! If you have any questions regarding the Talent Programme in general, please check our FAQ page . For further information regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact responsible recruiter Olena Sorkina at Olena.sorkina@vattenfall.com  Our organization At Vattenfall you can free your superpowers! We are one of the European market leaders in the generation of renewable energy and are primarily active in Scandinavia, Germany, Denmark, UK and the Netherlands. We take our responsibility seriously and together we are making the change towards fossil freedom. Our goal is to enable a fossil-free living within one generation. We are a dynamic company with an international focus and a social face at the heart of society. Diversity and inclusion is in everything we do, read more about our work with diversity.

title: Account Manager – Behavioural Research – Full Time – Rotterdam
summary:
Develop a clear view of upcoming challenges and suggest solutions supported by data.
To work directly with leading economists, researchers and scientist from…
description: SurveyEngine is a Berlin-based global research agency providing data, technology and exceptional management for preference research projects to global clients in the Pharmaceutical, Academic, Transport and Energy sectors. As Account Manager, you will be responsible new account acquisition, growing your existing customers and supporting delivery of projects for your clients with your project team. You will be working in our Rotterdam office. What you'll do: Work directly with leading economists, researchers and scientists from all over the world, contributing to the development of social, health and environmental research. Work within a motivated team of Account Managers, reporting to the Account Director. Interface with project managers to deliver high quality project research and data to clients. Drive incremental revenue inside existing strategic accounts by uncovering new use cases, client education, growing adoption of current opportunities and selling additional services. Manage lead generation, qualification and quoting to contract closure. Using CRM tools to support the forecasting and your sales pipeline. Develop a clear view of upcoming challenges and suggest solutions supported by data. About you: A creative thinker, problem solver, self-motivated, competitive, positive attitude, team player, accountable, reliable, strong work ethic, focused, organized, process-driven and strong drive for results. Have excellent communication (interpersonal and presentation) and closing skills, and have successfully applied these in previous sales roles. Knowledge of Econometrics, Behavioral Science, Market Research and the Healthcare market is a plus. A minimum of 2 years commercial experience in sales or account management Have a passion for going above and beyond satisfaction, to delight your customers. Have work rights in the European Union. Very good oral and written skills in English. Good knowledge of Excel, Word and PowerPoint and content file formats. Highly reliable, conscientious, able to work independently and take initiative. title: Director, Clinical Scientist - Pediatric Immunology
summary:
Responsible for data review in conjunction with other clinical team members prior to database locks.
Support the assessment and review of clinical safety data…
description: Janssen Research and Development, L.L.C., a member of Johnson and Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Director Clinical Project Scientist (Immunology) to be located in Spring House, PA.  At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.  Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.JanssenRnD.com for more information.  We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. The Clinical Project Scientist is a responsible member of the pediatric development team dedicated to the development and execution of clinical trials and the clinical and operational implementation of a complex compound program. The Clinical Scientist provides active scientific contribution to a cross-functional clinical team developing a molecular entity. Specifically, the Clinical Scientist provides input to the pediatric development plan, develops the pediatric trial protocol and trial materials, takes responsibility for coordinating completion of study reports, and supports preparation of relevant documents for regulatory filings. Responsible for design, execution, safety monitoring, and reporting of Phase 1,2 and 3 pediatric clinical trials in collaboration with study responsible physician. Leads the development of the Pediatric Investigational Plans and Pediatric Study Plans Provides significant strategic input to pediatric drug development group Collaborates with early and late development clinical teams and Compound Development Teams to align pediatric strategy This role involves extensive team matrix interactions with a number of different disciplines. The position will also have responsibility for various activities associated with safety monitoring and assessment of relevant clinical studies/programs, and will have clinical ownership of or provide clinical support for various regulatory documents, including the Investigator Brochure, the Risk Template of the Informed Consent form, the Development Safety Update Report (DSUR), the Periodic Benefit Risk Evaluation Report (PBRER) and the Safety Risk Management Plan. Supports the Global Clinical Development Operations group with trial set up, conduct, and monitoring, and database locks. Integral in the collection and analysis of clinical trial data, and assists with completion of clinical study reports Support the assessment and review of clinical safety data from studies by collecting and summarizing appropriate safety data/information for review by the Molecule Responsible Physician (MRP) and/or Study Responsible Physicians (SRPs) or Safety Management Team (SMT). Assists in the evaluation of adverse events and supports the interpretation and reporting of results. This will include attending and presenting at SMT Assists Regulatory Affairs in determining requirements for any corrective actions or health authority reporting Interprets, reports and prepares oral and written results of product research, in concert with senior clinical personnel, in preparation for health authority submissions Responsible for data review in conjunction with other clinical team members prior to database locks Participate in Immunology TA initiatives as requested Participate on and may lead cross-functional teams for evaluation of new product ideas Reviews medical literature and related new technologies   Qualifications  Qualifications - External A minimum of a Bachelor's degree is required Advanced degree (MD, MS, RN, RD, PhD or PharmD) is preferred. Pediatric specific experience is preferred but not required. A minimum of at least 5 years of clinical research and development experience within the Pharmaceutical, Medical Device OR CRO industry or experience as clinical research coordinator in non-industry setting is required. Clinical research operational knowledge, strong project planning/management and excellent communication skills is required Ability to operate with limited day to day supervision is required Independent decision-making and analytical skills are required. Successful work experience in a matrix team environment with cross functional teams is required. Travel up to 10 % of time both domestic and international may be required  Johnson & Johnson is an equal opportunity employer ImpactImm   Primary Location United States-Pennsylvania-Spring House-Welsh & McKean Roads Other Locations Europe/Middle East/Africa-Netherlands-South Holland-Leiden Organization Janssen Research & Development, LLC (6084) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2105890838W

title: postdoc single-molecule studies of DNA replication
summary:
As a researcher on this project, you will be responsible for planning and carrying out experiments and for analysing data.
Are you interested in this vacancy?
description: postdoc single-molecule studies of DNA replication Apply Now Job description In recent years, it has become possible to reconstitute the activity of eukaryotic replisome in biochemical experiments. Here, you will take on the exciting challenge of understanding the dynamics of DNA replication by studying this key biological process at the single-molecule level, both on bare DNA and on chromatin substrates. This includes examining replisome composition, replisome dynamics, and the interplay between these two quantities; as well as examination how these change in the chromatin context, among other topics. To do this, you will utilise our fluorescence imaging and single-molecule force spectroscopy systems. You will be involved in the purification and labelling of proteins as necessary. You will analyse resulting datasets using biophysical modelling, and discuss extensively with collaborators in the Diffley Lab (Francis Crick institute) in the areas of molecular biology and biochemistry.  The Nynke Dekker Lab is a highly successful single-molecule biophysics research lab within the Department of Bionanoscience at the TU Delft. Our lab focuses its studies on understanding DNA and RNA replication both in vitro and in vivo. We quantitatively characterize replication processes individually and in the cellular environment. To do so, we employ cutting-edge techniques including advanced single-molecule fluorescence, magnetic and optical tweezers, and microfluidics. Studying the dynamics of molecular processes at the single-molecule level requires broad expertise; as such, our lab is composed of a multidisciplinary team of international scientists with training in biophysics, biochemistry, or cell biology. You will be part of this group and will interact actively with current members. Requirements We are looking to hire an outstanding experimentalist for this exciting NWO-funded collaborative project at the interface of biochemistry and biophysics. We have an opening for a post-doctoral researcher keen to participate in probing different aspects of DNA replication from a mechanistic perspective. While our preference is for a post-doctoral researcher, we will also consider applications from talented prospective PhD students. As a researcher on this project, you will be responsible for planning and carrying out experiments and for analysing data. You will be expected to contribute to the interpretation of biophysical experiments on the basis of detailed analysis, to acquire an in-depth knowledge of the background literature, and to integrate the results of your data with those of ongoing molecular biology and biochemistry experiments in the field. A strong background in biophysics or biochemistry is a necessity. A good command of spoken and written English is a must. Conditions of employment Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount on health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. For international applicants we offer the Coming to Delft Service and Partner Career Advice to assist you with your relocation. An International Children's Centre offers childcare and there is an international primary school. TU Delft (Delft University of Technology) Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context. At TU Delft we embrace diversity and aim to be as inclusive as possible (see our Code of Conduct). Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. Challenge. Change. Impact! Faculty Applied Sciences With more than 1,000 employees, including 135 pioneering principal investigators, as well as a population of about 3,400 passionate students, the Faculty of Applied Sciences is an inspiring scientific ecosystem. Focusing on key enabling technologies, such as quantum- and nanotechnology, photonics, biotechnology, synthetic biology and materials for energy storage and conversion, our faculty aims to provide solutions to important problems of the 21st century. To that end, we train students in broad Bachelor's and specialist Master's programmes with a strong research component. Our scientists conduct ground-breaking fundamental and applied research in the fields of Life and Health Science & Technology, Nanoscience, Chemical Engineering, Radiation Science & Technology, and Engineering Physics. We are also training the next generation of high school teachers and science communicators. Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Applied Sciences. Application procedure Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before May 15th 2021 via the application button and upload your motivation and CV. A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure. Applying for an exemption for specific research and educational areas is an obligatory part of the selection procedure for this vacancy. This exemption must be obtained from the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science (OCW) before an employment contract is agreed upon. Click here for more information. You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post. Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. FACULTY/DEPARTMENT Faculty of Applied Sciences JOB TYPE Postdoc Positions SCIENTIFIC FIELD Natural sciences HOURS PER WEEK 38/40 SALARY € 2.790,00 - € 4.402,00 DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION Doctorate VACANCY NUMBER TUD00915 Apply Now

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Strong understanding of data models and data warehouses in general.
You have at least two years of experience with data warehousing and/or data engineering.
description: About us: We are Fixico, a fast-growing car damage repair marketplace, backed by world-class Silicon Valley-based investors. Trusted by fleet owners, leasing, rental, and insurance companies. Fixico has managed hundreds of thousands of repairs for companies ranging from the world's biggest brands to local players. Fixico is on a constant upward trajectory and rapidly expanding throughout Europe. To continue our success we are looking for a Data Engineer who will strengthen our Data team.  What you will be doing: Fixico is a data-driven company. In this role, you will play a vital part in ensuring that each team in our company is supported with accurate data. You are responsible for setting up the entire data pipeline architecture from scratch and create new and scalable workflows. This means you'll have the unique opportunity to determine the technologies that will be used.  By working towards a robust and reliable data pipeline, you will allow other teams to analyse this data, spot trends, and take action. Data engineering will be your main focus, but analysing, inquiring, and promoting your findings will also be part of the role. You will be collaborating with industry experts; you'll be uncovering unique industry insights and trends that will further entrench our position as a data-driven company. Your responsibilities: Designing, implementing, and maintaining a scalable data pipeline architecture Building completely new and scalable workflows from scratch Collaborating closely with our Data Scientist to run and manage the ML/Analytics models in production Collaborating with other teams to solve data problems and needs Developing unique industry insights, advanced data reporting, and visualizations Solving various interesting data engineering tasks as you wish   What are we looking for: We are looking for an A-player engineer who is ready to solve complex tasks proactively. Someone who's looking forward to applying the newest technologies and who is always prepared to learn and use any necessary new tool. You have at least two years of experience with data warehousing and/or data engineering Excellent SQL skills, ability to create and optimize scripts Experience with one or more programming languages (Python preferred) Strong understanding of data models and data warehouses in general Experience with data processing platforms like Snowflake, Hadoop, Spark, Snowplow, Airflow, Dataproc, etc Experience with the Google Cloud Platform and CI/CD deployment is a plus Experience using BI tools like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, etc is a plus You are fluent in English; Dutch is not a requirement  What’s in it for you: The rare opportunity to be in the first row in building a world-leading platform in the automotive world A young, talented, and extremely driven team An open, transparent working environment Plenty of responsibility and opportunity to grow A roller coaster experience you’ll never forget A lot of flexibility An inspiring office view overlooking the Rijksmuseum in the heart of Amsterdam

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: Je hebt minimaal 8 jaar ervaring en bent bedreven in data analyse, data strategie, predictive modelling, conversion attribution en revenue optimization.
description: Ben jij ondernemend en barst je van ambitie? Kan jij bedrijven maximaal laten groeien door hun data strategie te ontwikkelen en executeren? Dan zoeken we jou! Elevator helpt klanten als KPN, CheapTickets, Essent, scale-ups en corporate start-ups om hun ambities te verwezenlijken d.m.v. data driven marketing. We combineren data met onze jarenlange marketing ervaring zodat de beste keuzes gemaakt kunnen worden om de klantbeleving in campagnes, product, site en app te verbeteren. Alles staat bij ons in het teken van samen inzicht creëren en resultaten neerzetten. Wij zoeken een energieke collega die ons data science team kan verstevigen, leiden en uitbouwen. Je werkt samen met ons team van leergierige, talentvolle data analisten, online marketeers en conversie specialisten. Wij bieden een inspirerende en ambitieuze werkomgeving, waar veel mogelijk is als je er maar voor gaat! En natuurlijk hebben we een professioneel espresso apparaat, compleet verzorgde lunch, een VanMoof fiets en een kantoortuin die je doet denken aan de jungle van Borneo. Onze droomkandidaat ziet er zo uit: Je bent gek op je vak en deelt je passie en de nieuwste innovaties graag met collega’s en klanten. Je bent ondernemend; spot kansen in de markt, in ons bedrijf en bij de klant en weet deze ook te verwezenlijken Je hebt minimaal 8 jaar ervaring en bent bedreven in data analyse, data strategie, predictive modelling, conversion attribution en revenue optimization Je bent een serieuze gesprekspartner, zowel vanuit inhoud als persoonlijkheid, voor de CTO’s en CMO’s van deze wereld Je vindt het leuk om mensen zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk te coachen Je bent zowel gericht op de klant als de eindgebruiker en weet hiervoor uit de juiste tools, de juiste data te crunchen en helder te presenteren Je bent niet vies van wat gezelligheid. Op dinsdag heb jij de playlist voor de vrijmibo al klaar. Kortom, jij brengt de fun in de funnel.
