title: Study Director Microtracer Research | Leiden
summary:
We are an international mix of approximately 20 technicians, study directors, scientists and project managers lead by a team leader.
What will you be doing?
description: What will you be doing? The department of Metabolic Health Research (MHR) develops technology, models and knowledge in the area of biomedical health. Together with (international) collaborators from academia, research institutes, public bodies and food, cosmetics and pharma industry we directly implement our innovations in industrial applications and projects. In this way we help companies to innovate. Within the team Accelerator Mass Spectrometry (AMS) & Biomarkers we perform advanced analytical research and measurements in clinical samples from drug development studies. For the analysis we use AMS, chromatographic techniques and accurate mass spectrometry in our new Good Laboratory Practice-compliant facility in Leiden. We focus on microtracer and microdosing applications in early clinical studies and determine absolute bioavailability and mass balance for new drugs. Our measurement technology is so sensitive that the dose of tracers that are needed is so low, it does do not pose any risk for human health. This approach was found to be safe even for small children. This enables pharmaceutical companies to use microtracers in earlier stages of the research and collect data on pharmacokinetics but also on efficacy of new drugs in development. What do we require of you? Our team is growing to match the growing interest of our customers. Currently we are looking for a study director. The study director is responsible for the scientific conduct of his/ her study at TNO. The study director ensures successful method development, method qualification and supervises the analysis of clinical samples once these are received from collaborating clinical Contract Research Organisations. The study director is in charge of a study starting with the writing of the study plan until reporting to the sponsor. Together with the project manager, the study director communicates directly with the sponsors and the clinical research organizations involved in the study. You preferably have a degree in life sciences, (bio) analytical chemistry experience is considered a plus. You have experience in working in (multidisciplinary) project teams and also at least 3 years of experience as a study director, science lead or project leader. You have experience with leadership and coaching of technicians in projects. You have excellent communicating skills in English and enjoy writing plans and reporting your work internally and to your collaborators (clients). You enjoy keeping up with new developments in analytical chemistry that can be applied in this area of work. You have experience with quality systems, such as ISO 9001, GLP and or GCP. What can you expect of your work situation? You will join the dynamic team AMS & Biomarkers which is part of the department Metabolic Health Research. We are an international mix of approximately 20 technicians, study directors, scientists and project managers lead by a team leader. We are open, customer oriented, support each other and are also in for fun together. During the current pandemic, the study directors balance their work between working at home and in the office. Our lab facilities are state-of-the art, with currently two AMS systems and two accurate mass spectrometers, number of UPLC systems and growing. For our team members, TNO offers various personal and technical development possibilities, such as courses, training on a job or conference participation. What can TNO offer you? Work enjoyment means something different for each employee. This is why we offer a-la-carte terms and conditions of employment that you can switch around on a monthly basis. Flexible working hours (like 4 days x 9 hours) and different leave schemes mean that you can create a package attuned to your specific wishes. TNO attaches great value to both your personal and your professional development. Many opportunities exist for you to develop: conferences, courses, workshops, coaching, intervision, mentoring and job rotation. At TNO you can orchestrate your own career. The salary for this position is in scale 10 and depends on your expertise and experience. Visit this page to find out more about our flexible terms of employment. Application process You can apply till the 22nd of March. The first round of interviews is scheduled on the 25th of March. The second round of interviews is scheduled for the 30th of March. The process comprises at least two (selection) rounds. First two interview rounds and then an assessment OR presentation. After a positive selection, we will finish off the process by discussing terms and conditions of employment. We try to complete the interviews and assessment within 4 weeks. Has this vacancy sparked your interest? Then please feel free to apply on this vacancy! For further questions don’t hesitate to contact us.  Recruiter: Heleen Stork Mobile phone: +31 (0)6-515 34922 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/heleen-stork-a30a121/  Hiring manager: Han Sandt, van de Phone number: 08886 61833    Note that applications via email and third party applications are not taken into consideration.

title: Staff Data Scientist
summary:
Your role also involves technical leadership and mentorship of data scientists and machine learning engineers.
Who we are and what we do.
description: Who we are and what we do SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our platform empowers more than 20 million active users to analyze and act on feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and market research respondents. SurveyMonkey's products, enterprise solutions, and integrations enable more than 345,000 organizations to deliver better customer experiences, increase employee retention , and unlock growth and innovation. Ultimately, SurveyMonkey's vision is to raise the bar for human experiences by amplifying individual voices. More about our Product Data Science Team Equipped with rich product data ranging from text to image and video, we build cutting edge ML models to solve real customer issues. In the past, we have filed patents about our novel machine learning algorithms to help customers from survey creation to insight extraction, such as bias questions identification models to provide recommendations on rephrasing these questions, sentiment analysis models to reveal the emotions behind what respondents are thinking, and response quality models to suggest removing bad responses. We work closely with Machine Learning engineers to ship models in production seamlessly. Therefore you will see the impact of the models quickly. You will report to Data Science Manager. What we're looking for You will play a leading role in deriving key insights from our enormous data, suggest and implement new product features, and make improvements in existing models for better user experience. Your role also involves technical leadership and mentorship of data scientists and machine learning engineers. You will Transform a business problem to a machine learning problem Develop machine learning algorithms and systems Evaluate offline and online performance Involve in strategy planning You have Deep knowledge in machine learning algorithms, especially in the domain of natural language processing Strong programming skills, expert knowledge of algorithms, and data structures (Python preferred) Expert knowledge of AWS, Pytorch/Tensorflow, Scikit-learn and Pandas Prior experience in partnering with business teams to identify trends and opportunities. What we offer our employees SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can thrive. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals. SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and we have also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC's Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100. Our commitment to an inclusive workplace SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities. Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

title: Data Scientist, Experimentation
summary:
Mentor other data analysts and data scientists within the team.
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products…
description: About us Beat is one of the most exciting companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space. One city at a time, all across the globe we make transportation affordable, convenient, and safe for everyone. We also help hundreds of thousands of people earn extra income as drivers. Today we are the fastest-growing ride-hailing service in Latin America. But serving millions of rides every day pales in comparison to what lies ahead. Our plans for expansion are limitless. Our stellar engineering team operates across a number of European capitals where, right now, some of the world's most ambitious and talented engineers are changing how cities will move in the future. Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Argentina. About the role We're accepting these challenges by applying data, algorithms and machine learning to problems in logistics, routes, personalization, search, pricing, experimentation and more. Our Data Science team is at the heart of this effort and is an essential ingredient in Beat's aggressive growth plan and vision for the future. As a member of the Experimentation team, you will take on some of our biggest challenges and your work will impact the entire Beat experience. Our team moves very fast, so you'll have the opportunity to make an immediate difference. The experimentation squad's primary objective is to democratise data driven decision making and accelerate adoption of experimentation in the organisation. You will be working closely with data analysts, engineers, designers and product managers to drive a culture of causal reasoning, and push for features that improve the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments. Our remote workforce works East Europe Timezone hours (10am - 6pm) and therefore we will need you to be located within UTC to UTC+3 to reasonably overlap with your team members' work schedule. With the various tools and communication technologies we're using, you'll feel connected to your team. You always have the option to travel to our headquarters for meetings, events, and team bonding—or you can join virtually. Whatever works best for you and your work style. What you'll do day in day out: Lead the effort in building robust and efficient causal inference methodologies in our experimentation platform to aid decision making. Employ advanced statistical methods to help decision makers draw detailed conclusions on their experiments. Advise other product and business teams across Beat and help them design and run experiments. Evangelise experimentation and data driven decision making within Beat by conducting workshops, sharing knowledge and promoting adoption of good statistical practices. Leverage data to find business opportunities and develop creative solutions to solve those by employing data science methods such as machine learning, optimisation algorithms etc. Be the changemaker by identifying, and challenging status-quo while advocating use of statistically sound decision making processes. Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products. Mentor other data analysts and data scientists within the team. What you need to have: Educational background in Maths, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative discipline or equivalent experience. At least 3 years of hands-on experience in machine learning methodologies and predictive analytics to solve business and user problems using Python or R. Experience with experimentation - designing experiments, using causal inference methods to draw conclusions. Proficiency in R/Python, and SQL. Additional competence in data engineering, Scala, noSQL, Apache Hadoop, Spark or Tensorflow, is appreciated but not required. Excellent grasp of concepts of statistics, causality, and terms such as statistical significance, interference effects, biases, variance etc. Experience with exploratory data analysis, testing and modelling. Self-initiative - be able to independently take initiatives without much direction. Deep belief in data and ability to rally people behind your findings/recommendations. What's in it for you: Competitive salary package Flexible working hours High tech equipment and top line tools Working in a hyper-growth environment, you will enjoy numerous learning and career development opportunities A great opportunity to grow and work with the most amazing people in the industry. Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy and mentoring, which creates incredible opportunities, both for you and the company. As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Beat is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

title: Technologist Electrochemistry
summary:
As a Technologist you will work together with the Volta engineers and scientists on research and development.
Most of the materials and chemicals used in modern…
description: Amsterdam Science Park, fulltime Most of the materials and chemicals used in modern daily life – such as plastics, packaging, furniture and clothing – are based on fossil resources like oil, gas and coal. Changing this paradigm is an ambitious goal but also a promise for a better future. This is why we at Avantium Renewable Chemistries work on developing practical solutions to accelerate the transition to a fossil-free world. We do this by focusing on innovative plant-based chemicals and materials as well as converting carbon dioxide (CO2) to sustainable products by making use of electrocatalysis. For this platform technology, we are looking for a Technologist in Volta, the electrochemistry team. Volta is currently working on technology development and scale-up activities and we are looking for someone to strengthen our team. Responsibilities As a Technologist you will work together with the Volta engineers and scientists on research and development. You are responsible for planning and executing experiments and the set-up and testing of equipment. You will also: operate the batch and flow electrochemical equipment on different scales; execute electro-catalyst performance tests; monitor the process conditions, sampling, monitor the analytical equipment and data quality; execute synthesis of electrocatalysts / electrodes; communicate status updates of your project activities to the project team; prepare samples for routine analysis of reaction products (for example IC, IR, HPLC and GC). Requirements The Technologist Electrochemistry is a laboratory position and experience in working in a laboratory and adhering to safety regulations is required to fulfil this position. Much of the research being conducted is experimental and therefor initiative and creativity are very important to succeed in this role. Furthermore, we look for: preferably BSc or MSc in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or related area; experience with (electrochemical) equipment and techniques; ability to communicate information clearly in spoken and written English; experience in the field of electrocatalysis, electrosynthesis or photocatalysis is considered a big plus; team player that is comfortable with giving and receiving feedback. Offer As we are a small company, we also offer you a unique chance to learn a lot about many fields, not only science, but also how a business works, intellectual property, operations, market strategies, quality and last but not least safety. Learning paths can be steep and we do not offer you predefined career paths and development tracks. You are in the lead of your career, what you bring to the table will be noticed and taking initiative is rewarded and recognized. We have an informal culture, a flat organization and we recognize and celebrate the many cultures that we represent. And on top of that we offer good primary and secondary benefits. Interested? If this description matches your skills or interest, feel free to contact us. We will be happy to show you the innovative world of Avantium. You can reach HR Advisor Manon Stam at 020 586 0244 or via recruitment@avantium.com

title: Associate Scientist USP (Yacht Life Sciences)
summary: Within the department, a lab team is responsible for performing all hands-on experimental activities, data processing and documentation, whereas a team of…
description: Bedrijfsomschrijving  Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V. is part of Johnson & Johnson, one of the biggest and most respected health care companies in the world. They are dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health. Their teams focus on the discovery, development, manufacturing and marketing of novel vaccines to prevent some of the most devastating and complex infectious diseases. These range from respiratory infections like respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) and pathogens of global concern such as Ebola and COVID-19.  In their organization, entrepreneurial people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are of crucial importance. We are continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value to Janssen. The offices of Janssen Vaccines & Prevention are located in Leiden, The Netherlands.  Functieomschrijving  Job description: Yacht Life Sciences has a vacancy for an Associate Scientist USP. We are looking for a motivated Associated Scientist within the field of upstream process (USP) development. Under limited supervision, but as part of our lab team you will support the preparation and execution of scientific studies. These will be part of a project plan, and you will be responsible for practical execution of experiments, support of data analysis and reporting main conclusions. Next to this, there is room to work on continuous improvement topics to increase safety, efficiency in workflow and support of scientific projects. Experiments will be performed in bioreactors or in a reduced-scale shaker flask model.  The USP department is responsible for the development of scalable, pharmaceutical-grade production processes for viral vaccines using mammalian cell lines as a production platform. Novel technologies are used to make sure that the processes are safe, reliable, scalable and cost-effective, so that the vaccines can be produced in large quantities at low costs. The developed production processes are transferred into GMP production facilities for the production of clinical batches and scaled-up for commercial production. All activities are performed in close collaboration with other departments. Within the department, a lab team is responsible for performing all hands-on experimental activities, data processing and documentation, whereas a team of scientists is responsible for the overall scientific approach and progress within our projects.  Functie-eisen You have a Master, or Bachelor with 3 years of experience, in a relevant environment like biotechnology or pharmacy. Candidates with a PhD (background) will be considered as overqualified for this role. You have demonstrated work experience with mammalian, bacterial, or other cultivation techniques, hands-on experience with bioreactors, preferably at lab scale You have a strong affinity with upstream process development You have good communication skills in English  Arbeidsvoorwaarden  We offer a challenging position which allows you to work in a dynamic and international environment, ensuring diversity in your work and creating plenty of opportunities for personal development. This concerns a full-time secondment contract for 1 year (extension is anticipated). Salary between 2600 and 3600 gross per month. Start date: as soon as possible. We will offer a competitive benefit package in line with the seniority of the position. You will become a member of a strong professional network who shares your education, ambitions and competencies. This will enable you to interact with your colleagues and to become a member of the YACHT network, which stretches the Life Science industry. You will be challenged by your peers, you will be able to follow courses and training via our Yacht Academy in order to keep your knowledge and skills up-to-date, i.e. boosting your career through personal and scientific growth.

title: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
summary:
Zo helpen wij elkaar én klanten om klaar te zijn voor de data vraagstukken van morgen.
Het is allang geen geheim meer dat organisaties enorme stappen kunnen…
description: Wat wij bieden een voorbeeldfunctie als ‘thought leader’ i.c.m. een divers takenpakket; een groep gepassioneerde vakgenoten met brede kennis en ervaring; kunnen bijdragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van onze unit, proposities en marktbenadering de focus op het werken in teamverband bij gerenommeerde klanten; een omgeving waarin ondernemerschap en eigen initiatief worden gestimuleerd; een cultuur waar collegialiteit, kennisdeling en samenwerking centraal staan; veel mogelijkheden voor opleiding, ontwikkeling en doorgroei; een budget om arbeidsvoorwaarden aan te passen aan jouw wensen; flexibiliteit en oog voor jou als persoon; Wat jij meeneemt minimaal een afgeronde HBO studie; minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring; uitgebreide ervaring met R of Python; uitgebreide ervaring met SQL en databases; uitgebreide ervaring met machine learning algoritmes; ervaring met het ontwerp en de implementatie van meerdere modellen; kennis van aanverwante domeinen t.o.v. Data Science; De uitdaging Het is allang geen geheim meer dat organisaties enorme stappen kunnen zetten door slim gebruik van hun data. Hoe je daadwerkelijk tot waardevolle inzichten komt is een ander verhaal. Digitale transformatie staat dan ook hoog op de agenda bij veel bedrijven. In een dynamische markt met alsmaar groeiende datasets en nieuwe technologieën, weet jij hierin het verschil te maken. Dit is jouw topbaan Als ervaren Data Scientist ben jij voor zowel klanten als collega’s het aanspreekpunt. Je bent een drijvende kracht in projecten, zowel technisch als adviserend. Met jouw uitgebreide kennis van de markt en aanverwante domeinen kijk je verder dan slechts de antwoorden op een vraagstuk. Je hebt een visie, kijkt verder en weet anderen daar in mee te nemen. De breedte van jouw functie hoeft niet uitsluitend te gelden voor bij de klant. Ook binnen Ordina kan je een belangrijke rol spelen m.b.t. het verder brengen of uitdragen van de Data Science expertise. Denk aan pre-sales, spreken op events, coachen van collega’s, schrijven van blogs/artikelen en propositieontwikkeling. Dit ben jij Een vakman met passie voor zijn werk. Iemand die gaat voor kwaliteit en klanttevredenheid. Positief ingesteld en niet bang om fouten te maken. Communicatief vaardig, lef, proactief, resultaatgericht en een sterk analytisch vermogen typeren jou. Je vindt ontwikkeling belangrijk en kijkt daarin verder dan alleen jezelf. Een collegiale teamspeler, die goed zelfstandig kan werken indien nodig. Waar ga je aan de slag In een unit met tientallen betrokken en vakkundige collega’s. Je werkt op projectbasis voor gerenommeerde klanten in branches als Energie, Logistiek & Transport, Publieke Sector, Retail, Finance en Industrie. Professionaliteit en gezelligheid gaan hand in hand. Kenmerkend zijn thema’s als diversiteit, kennisdeling, ondernemerschap en samenwerking. Zowel sociaal als vakinhoudelijk zijn er daarom veel contactmomenten en initiatieven. Zo helpen wij elkaar én klanten om klaar te zijn voor de data vraagstukken van morgen.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Understanding data architecture and data sources.
Proposing architecture solutions to novel data science problems.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING.
description: ABOUT THE TEAM Deliver the product and technical roadmap with agility and pace to create quality experiences in reliable timelines at manageable cost. Provide technical innovation of the services platform. Support the perpetual evolution of the future roadmap.  ABOUT THE ROLE As a Data Scientist, you will be improving shopping experiences by leveraging AI technologies. We use several deep learning models to improve search results by exploiting image, text, and user activity data. You will be looking for opportunities to improve the accuracy and performance of such models, as well as bringing in new ideas for data products and features.  WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING Proposing architecture solutions to novel data science problems Developing and improving machine learning models Technical knowledge and understanding of Attraqt machine learning platform technologies Understanding data architecture and data sources Taking part and contributing to knowledge sharing sessions with the immediate and other teams Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner where necessary Maintaining and updating automation affected by changes made Documenting work and reviewing documentation of more junior team members Testing and reviewing the junior team members’ testing QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE YOU NEED TO THRIVE IN THIS ROLE MSc in AI/Data Science/Computer Science or related scientific field Proficiency in Python High degree of familiarity with at least one widely used deep learning package such as Pytorch, Tensorflow Proven ability to propose/architecture solutions to novel data science problems, as evidenced by Kaggle competition entries, thesis research, blog posts, publications or similar In depth understanding of core machine learning concepts and latest deep learning methodology Experience working with big data processing technologies such as Hadoop technologies Proficiency in cloud computing/ high performance computing used to experiment with Statistical/AI models Experience with structured and/or unstructured databases such as SQL Familiarity with standard data science libraries such as pandas, numpy, scipy, etc. Experience with version control tools such as Git  ABOUT YOU Self-starter Pragmatic and results driven Team player with a passion for AI and innovation Adaptable to change and able to drive change Personable, open and approachable  ABOUT ATTRAQT Attraqt powers exceptional shopping experiences for over 300 of the world’s leading brands, manufacturers and retailers with a set of API-enabled, algorithm-driven, intelligent SaaS services covering personalisation, search, navigation, merchandising, recommendations and internationalisation. E-commerce is an exciting growth business, part of a wave of retail digital transformation.  We pride ourselves on our core values of pioneering, better together and data-led and you can see them in action in all aspects of our everyday work. We foster an open, trusting and collaborative working environment where everyone has the opportunity to succeed and shine, and where excellence is rewarded.  Attraqt is packed with motivated, creative and commercially minded people from a wide variety of backgrounds. With a large global footprint, you could bump into a member of our team in London, Paris, Amsterdam, Sofia or even all the way over in Sydney! Our team is diverse and cosmopolitan with a finger on every pulse when it comes to industry knowledge and global developments across the e-commerce space, it's in our DNA. If this excites you, then you’ve come to the right place.  By applying for this position, you are agreeing to our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Medior Consultant Sustainable Industrial Transformation
summary: You will work on diverse assignments that may vary from data gathering and analysis, industry research, writing reports, participating in proposal writing,…
description: What will you be doing? Our society, including the energy sector and the (chemical) industry is in a transition towards the use of renewable feedstock and energy, introduction of circularity and carbon capture and re-use. The group Sustainable Process & Energy Systems (SPES) based in Delft, the Netherlands, works on these transitional topics with a fast-growing diverse and international team of about 65 employees. We work for and with (renewable) energy and chemistry companies and in a network of international knowledge partners. In order to achieve the 2050 European energy and climate sustainability goals for renewable energy, a multi-energy approach on energy generation and conversion is required. In our lab and offices in Delft a dedicated and highly motivated team of researchers, domain experts and consultants is working on accelerating the market uptake of innovative technologies to support the transition towards a Sustainable Industry. We are currently looking to expand the team with a highly motivated innovator, someone with a strong scientific and/or engineering background.  You will work in various and diverse projects working towards a sustainable chemical industry, and support the acquisition thereof. Projects may vary from co-funded innovation projects with national and international consortia to business client assignments. You will work on diverse assignments that may vary from data gathering and analysis, industry research, writing reports, participating in proposal writing, presenting to clients, making technical or economical models or conceptual design of pilots for novel sustainable technologies. What do we require of you? You are an enthusiastic person and able to combine the analytical focus of a scientist with the problem-solving capacity of an engineer, with a drive to develop innovative solutions to technically challenging problems, by combining the right mix of intellectual curiosity and a pragmatic approach. You are a strong team player, and are highly motivated to work in a diverse international team working towards innovative solutions for a more sustainable economy. You are proactive, solution-oriented, result-driven, communicative, and have excellent interpersonal and reporting skills. You are flexible and able to adapt and integrate different approaches in order to solve the challenges of the industry.You have a growth mindset and are prepared to follow a steep learning curve and develop yourself. Other knowledge and skills you bring to TNO: M.Sc. in e.g. chemical engineering, process technology or equivalent; a PDEng or PhD degree would be an advantage; Domain knowledge of the energy transition, processes in the chemical industry such as refining operations, production of base/ bulk chemicals, and sustainability issues; 3 to 6 year of working experience in the chemical industry; Hands on experience with one or more of the following processes or technologies: hydrogen production, electrochemistry, CO2 capture and utilisation, biomass conversion, plastics recycling, renewable power production, energy storage, energy efficiency, (synthetic) fuels, chemicals production; Experience in the evaluation of technologies, analyzing results, using various software tools to support analysis of technology options based on economics and environmental indicators, presenting and reporting; Experience/enthusiasm to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment; Good mastery of the English language, both verbal and written. Willingness to learn Dutch. What can you expect of your work situation? At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. We are an equal opportunity employer and recognize the value of a diverse workforce.You work with people who will challenge you: who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters: impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer. What can TNO offer you? Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 3800,- and € 5800,- (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.  TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect: An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field; Being part of a highly skilled team, working in close collaboration with a large number of colleagues with different expertise; Support for personal growth; A challenging work environment with ample opportunity to learn and develop, as well as to shape one’s role; The opportunity to contribute to the energy transition and work towards system changes at large scale; 28 days annual leave and 5 compensation days under the reduction in working hours scheme (ATV, arbeidstijdverkorting) on a full-time basis; Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues. That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly; Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home; The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs; A good pension scheme; Travel allowance or a bike; Extensive relocation package for international candidates. Read more about tailoring your benefits package Application process You can apply till the 5th of April. The first round of interviews is scheduled on the 16th of April. The second round of interviews is scheduled for the 21st of April. The process comprises at least two (selection) rounds. First two interview rounds and after a positive selection, we will finish off the process by discussing terms and conditions of employment. We try to complete the interviews and assessment within 4 weeks. Has this vacancy sparked your interest? Then please feel free to apply on this vacancy! For further questions don’t hesitate to contact us.  Recruiter: Anne-Maartje Uijl- Meijman, den Mobile phone: +31 (0)6-469 66067 LinkedIn: https://nl.linkedin.com/in/annemaartjedenuijlmeijman  Hiring manager: Bastian Bes, de Phone number: +31(0)6-29906808    Note that applications via email and third party applications are not taken into consideration.

title: Senior/Scientist Non-Clinical Bioanalysis
summary:
Genmab A/S is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy.
Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with you application on…
description: Genmab is focused on the creation and development of innovative and differentiated antibody products, with the aim of improving the lives of cancer patients. Role The Bioanalytical Science team develops bioanalytical strategies to support the pre-clinical and clinical development of Genmab’s formats and compounds. We design, execute, interpret, and validate bioanalytical methods (Pharmacokinetic, Pharmacodynamic and Immunogenicity assays) and perform bioanalysis activities for both regulated (GLP, GCP) and non-regulated (mouse studies, exploratory toxicology, and dose range finding) studies. As such, we provide a strong foundation for informed decision-making at critical points throughout our entire drug development program. As a (Senior) Scientist Non-Clinical Bioanalysis within the Bioanalytical Science team, you will work on compounds in pre-clinical development stages. You will be part of the cross-organization Non-Clinical Safety sub-team for several programs and be responsible for the bioanalytical method strategy, mainly focusing on PK and binding ADA (bADA) methods. As such you lead the development and validation of ligand binding assays used by internal and external parties such as Contract Research Organizations (CROs). You will work closely together with a team of technicians to coordinate and report the sample assessment of regulated (GLP) and non-regulated studies. To achieve this, you keep yourself up to date with latest developments in the field, such as novel technologies and regulatory requirements within the bioanalytical field. You will collaborate with CROs and internal stakeholders, transfer methods, write protocols and record scientific results in publications, regulatory documents, product development records and patents. Responsibilities You oversee development and validation of ligand binding assays to measure pharmacokinetic (PK) and anti-drug antibody (ADA) responses in biological matrices. These methods are used in support of Genmab’s preclinical studies enabling IND filing. You will coordinate and report the sample assessment of non-clinical studies. You take responsibility for bioanalysis within multi-disciplinary project teams. You will author necessary documentation and transfer methods to external parties (CROs). You will ensure compliance with regulations and guidelines, i.e. GLP, FDA, EMA and ICH. You act as a primary contact for external parties (validation, managing timelines, troubleshooting, analysis, etc.). You will keep the department up to date with the latest relevant scientific information regarding immunology, bioanalysis, and regulatory documents. Requirements You have a finished PhD degree and at least two years relevant experience in bioanalytical method development and validation. Alternatively, you hold a MSc degree with at least five years relevant experience in bioanalytical method development and validation. You have a proven track record in the development and troubleshooting of immunological and bioanalytical assays. You have experience in method development to evaluate unwanted immunogenicity. You have experience with regulatory bioanalysis and knowledge of relevant guidance documents as well as GLP experience. You are flexible, well-organized and can lead several projects at once, and you are able to work to tight deadlines. You have experience in managing Contract Research Organizations. You have excellent relational and communication skills in English (Dutch is an advantage, but not required). In case you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to Recruiter Mark Stickland at ext-fts-mst@genmab.com Genmab employees work with determination and with respect for each other, consistent with our core values, to achieve our common goals. We give individuals and teams the autonomy to drive development of innovative products and solutions, knowing that integrity is a core value throughout our company. Genmab will offer the successful application a challenging position, where the right candidate will have the opportunity to work with highly specialised people across functions in an informal, multicultural culture, all aiming to make a difference for cancer patients.  Teamwork and respect are central pillars of Genmab’s culture and we therefore ensure an inclusive, open, and supportive professional work environment across our international locations. We believe that fostering workplace diversity across social, educational, cultural, national, age and gender lines is a prerequisite for the continued success of the company. We are committed to diversity at all levels of the company and strive to recruit employees with the right skills and competences, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, etc. Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands; Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in this location is to offer a temporary agreement for one year, followed by a contract for indefinite time regardless of seniority. Genmab A/S is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with you application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy .

title: (Sr.) Scientist Bioanalytics
summary: On the other hand, Bioanalytics is responsible for performing routine sample analyses and reporting the derived data thereof, using the aforementioned developed…
description: Location: Amsterdam (Netherlands) Job category: Bio-analytics  uniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. In doing so each function in uniQure is directly or indirectly responsible for the lives of patients. This responsibility should be part of our day-to-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.  Bioanalytics is a functional group within the Research and Development department. The main responsibility focuses on providing support to Pre-Clinical Research and Development, Clinical development and beyond (MAA/BLA). On the one hand, as part of these supporting activities, Bioanalytics is responsible for the development, qualification, validation and implementation of bio analytical methods that are used to monitor product efficacy (biological activity) and product safety. On the other hand, Bioanalytics is responsible for performing routine sample analyses and reporting the derived data thereof, using the aforementioned developed/qualified assays as part of Pre-Clinical Research and Development studies.  For the evaluation of therapeutic efficacy during Non-/clinical phase, the availability of relevant analytical methodologies which are based on pharmacodynamic biomarkers is essential. However, the establishment of those assays is not trivial. For many indications, and in particular for CNS indications, biomarker-based readout of therapeutic efficacy is made complicated by practical and scientific limitations. These, among others, include scarcity of relevant clinical samples as well as limited understanding of the full molecular pathobiology of disease.  Within the Bioanalytics team, the Scientist Bioanalytics is responsible for the development, qualification and validation of biomarker-based analytical methodologies for each targeted indication. Establishing these methodologies will require alignment with other departments within research- and preclinical stages all the way to clinical stage. The Scientist will work in close collaboration with all functionalities involved in the development of uniQure’s gene therapies from proof of concept (PoC) to clinical phase, e.g., research, non-clinical development and clinical development. In order to succeed the Scientist should have profound understanding of biochemical and bioanalytical methodology and have experience with developing biomarker assays.  Main Purpose of the job  To ensure availability (in-house, outsourced or partnered) of the biomarker‑based bioanalytical methodologies. To closely interact with pre- and clinical departments to align on the implementation of the corresponding bioanalytical methodologies  Qualifications  PhD in a life-sciences related field, preferably with focus on CNS indications. Proven scientific background, preferably within a clinical context. Profound understanding of molecular pathobiology, preferably in CNS indications. Affinity with bio-analytical methodologies, preferably in the area of biologics, gene therapy or vaccines.  Competencies  Integer: accurate, dependable. Detail oriented: strong analytical skills, scientifically critical mindset. Proactive: Goal-driven with awareness of timelines. Co-operative: ability and drive to work within an interdisciplinary (project) team. Communicative: able to network, able to establish liaisons with external parties, able to liaise between academic and commercial frameworks.

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Als Data Scientist werk je aan big data oplossingen die onze klanten een stap verder brengen richting data-gedreven werken.
Wat ga je doen als Data Scientist?
description: Datavibes groeit! Maak deze groei mee en zet nu de volgende stap in je carrière! Onze klanten blijven ons overspoelen met interessante opdrachten, en daarom zijn wij op zoek naar uitbreiding van ons team. Ben jij de Data Scientist die we zoeken? Wat ga je doen als Data Scientist? Als Data Scientist werk je aan big data oplossingen die onze klanten een stap verder brengen richting data-gedreven werken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het vinden van antwoorden in enorme hoeveelheden data. Je bent bezig met het opschonen, op orde brengen en organiseren van het data platform. Hierdoor breng je de data op een ander niveau en ben je in staat om modellen te ontwerpen waarmee analyses en voorspellingen gedaan kunnen worden. Ook ben je in staat om processen op het data platform te automatiseren en kun jij hiermee antwoord geven op de vragen van de business. Een Datavibes Data Scientist is hands-on, en is in staat data te modelleren en te automatiseren door inzet van technieken zoals Machine Learning. Heb jij passie voor data, programmeer ervaring, ben je een goede communicator en actie gedreven? Dan ben jij de Datavibes professional die wij zoeken. Jouw Profiel HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau Minimaal vijf jaar hand-ons ervaring met het ontwikkelen van data gedreven oplossingen Kennis en ervaring van SQL/NoSQL om complexe databronnen te analyseren en transformeren Ervaring met werken met grote hoeveelheden ruwe, ongestructureerde data Kennis en ervaring met Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Predictive Modelling en Statistische modellen Je bent bekend met relevante programmeertalen zoals R en/of Python Je hebt ervaring met (cloud) omgevingen en systemen als AWS, Azure, Hadoop, ElasticSearch en Spark Bekendheid met methodieken zoals SCRUM/ Agile Jouw Competenties Leergierig en analytisch sterk Flexibel en pragmatisch Uitstekende sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Proactief en resultaatgericht Wat wij jou bieden Goede balans tussen werk en privé Sociale collega’s opererend in een informele, professionele werkomgeving Uitdagende projecten bij toonaangevende opdrachtgevers binnen Nederland Vast dienstverband Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden o.a.: Uitstekend salaris Compleet arbeidsvoorwaarden pakket Individuele bonusregeling (tot 50% van het jaarsalaris) Professionele hulpmiddelen Leaseauto, laptop en telefoon naar eigen keuze Wie we zijn: Datavibes! Datavibes is een jonge gepassioneerde, frisse organisatie die met enthousiasme en daadkracht expertise bij klanten brengt. Datavibes heeft gekozen voor de cellenfilosofie. De cellen (units) zijn nooit groter dan 10-12 medewerkers. Dit resulteert in een platte, pragmatische, persoonlijke en responsieve organisatie. Binnen Datavibes is iedereen actief betrokken en is niemand een nummer. Er is oprechte interesse in de mens achter de professional. Plezier en professionaliteit gaan hand in hand, resulterend in een cultuur gebaseerd op vertrouwen, ondernemerschap en trots. Een Datavibes professional is een trotse professional.

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Sound understanding of SQL fundamentals and past experience with data warehousing, data modeling and schema design.
We might be looking for YOU!
description: Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Engineer to join us! Full-time · Amsterdam Who are we? We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions all over the world. Our technology lets users easily book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks, and more faster than ever. We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as a Data Engineer, send us your CV. We might be looking for YOU! Our values Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other. Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together. Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart; take responsibility and push forward. Life at Tiqets What you will do Tiqets is positioned for explosive growth in the post-pandemic world, and we're looking for Data Engineers to help us scale our Data Platform for the future. As a Data Engineer you will be involved in designing and building out much of the core Data Platform being used by the company. You will be working closely with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers as well as Product and Marketing teams to understand their needs and architect systems to solve these needs. You’re a Data Engineer with a passion for architecting resilient and reliable data systems. You obsess over data quality and operational excellence, build clean and efficient Data Pipelines, and constantly look for ways to make systems better. You see the value in being a data-driven organization. You’re curious about new technologies, both open-source and SaaS. You like to work in a fast-paced environment and iterate quickly while continuing to build for the medium and long term.  Responsibilities Work closely with other Data Engineers on the team to architect, build and improve our Data Platform and analytics infrastructure Design and implement fault-tolerant, resilient ELT/ETL pipelines using open source tools like Airflow or hosted AWS/SaaS services Build monitoring tools to help meet our data quality/availability SLAs and ensure high-availability for our infrastructure Ability to work independently without active supervision, and take full ownership of what you build Support Data Scientists and Data Analysts on the team to productionize their workflows, while building tools and infrastructure to improve their speed and effectiveness  Minimum qualifications Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, or other relevant technical education. 2+ years experience working as an Engineer on data-intensive applications, architecting large-scale production systems Substantial experience with Python and other scripting languages with a track record of writing clean, efficient code Experience using core Data Engineering technologies like Airflow and DBT  Reasonable understanding of relational databases like PostgreSQL, as well as Data Warehousing technologies like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.  Sound understanding of SQL fundamentals and past experience with data warehousing, data modeling and schema design DevOps mindset; experience deploying applications using technologies like Kubernetes and Docker on AWS  Nice to Have Experience AWS services like Kinesis, Lambda, Glue, Athena Business Intelligence tools like Looker, Tableau, Data Studio Machine Learning technologies like AWS Sagemaker and MLflow SaaS tools like Segment, Fivetran, Stitch, Snowplow Experience with event pipelines and real-time streaming use cases Experience in the e-commerce domain   Our Data Engineering Stack AWS  Python  Airflow  Redshift  DBT  Looker Perks & Benefits at Tiqets Young, dynamic, international working environment Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scaleup 20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide Annual company getaway to undisclosed location Health insurance Tiqets learning academy: skill lab, group & individual learningTuesday's Pizza & beer sessions Friday drinks Visa sponsorship Summer party Competitive salary and paid holiday leave Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more Pension scheme and travel compensation Everyone - employed at Tiqets will receive a monthly contribution for working from home Everyone - employed at Tiqets can reimburse home work space necessities Meet the Team

title: Senior Data Analist
summary: We werken aan een nieuwe sterke basis waarmee we versneld verder gaan bouwen aan data-inzichten, automatisering, dashboarding en data-intelligentie.
description: Hoofddorp - In deze rol als senior data analist werk je mee aan het opnieuw neerzetten van de gehele B2B datastructuur voor de afdeling B2B Sales Data & Insights. Jij gaat meedenken en meebouwen aan de nieuwe manier waarop wij Business Intelligence benaderen.  Er zijn al grote stappen gezet maar het werk en onze wensenlijst is nog lang niet afgerond. We werken aan een nieuwe sterke basis waarmee we versneld verder gaan bouwen aan data-inzichten, automatisering, dashboarding en data-intelligentie.  Het team Sinds een aantal maanden is het mediabedrijf Sanoma geïntegreerd in het mediabedrijf DPG Media (nu het grootste mediabedrijf van Nederland). Je wordt onderdeel van het nieuw gevormde Data & Insights team waarin data experts van beide bedrijven samen zijn gekomen. In ons team werk je samen met 2 collega senior data analisten, 4 dashboard analisten / developers en 3 business analisten. Ons doel als team is om structurele, efficiënte oplossingen te creëren waarmee we een maximale impact realiseren op de bedrijfsdoelstellingen. Hiervoor werken we nauw samen met oa. het CRM team, Pricing team, de Finance afdeling, het DCC (Data Competence Centre), onze Data Scientists en onze collega BI teams Product en DPG België  Wat ga je doen Je speelt binnen het team een sleutelrol in de nieuwe benadering van Data & Insights. Samen met je collega analisten draag je zorg voor de nieuwe data back-end structuur waarop wij al onze oplossingen en processen bouwen en ben je betrokken bij de nieuwste ontwikkelingen rondom het structureren en verwerken van de data. Ook zal je de sales afdeling en sales directie ondersteunen met analyses voor actionable & strategische inzichten. Zo kan er betere sturing worden gegeven op operationeel en strategisch niveau. Verder houdt je je bezig met:  de afstemming met het Data Competence Centre team aangaande de inrichting en verwerking van de databronnen. het plannen, prioriteren en opvolgen van nieuwe inrichtingsvraagstukken aan ons data warehouse. het meewerken aan complexe analyse vraagstukken vanuit de business. het proactief zoeken naar relevante inzichten in de grote hoeveelheden data waarmee we betere sturing en besluitvorming mogelijk maken.  Wij bieden  Een goed salaris afhankelijk van leeftijd en ervaring. Een 36-urige werkweek. Laptop en/of telefoon van de zaak. Keuzebudget van 12% (waarvan 8% vakantiegeld). Werken met de nieuwste stack. 24 vakantiedagen, met optie tot bijkopen. Jaarlijkse winstregeling (o.b.v. resultaat van de organisatie). Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden d.m.v. opleidingen, trainingen en certificaten. Kennisdeling vanuit onze tech collega's.  Nog meer redenen om bij DPG Media te willen werken  Bij DPG Media werken we voor meer dan 90 sterke nieuwsmerken, magazines, televisieprogramma’s, radiostations en online services zoals Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, VTM en meer. We bereiken maandelijks ruim 90% van de Nederlanders en 8 op de 10 Vlamingen.  We bieden je een professionele werkomgeving waarin we vrijheid enorm belangrijk vinden. We geven je alle ruimte om aan je toekomst te werken door het aanbieden van workshops en trainingen. Voel je vrij om bij ons ondernemer, leerling en teamspeler te zijn, en vooral om jezelf te zijn. Bij DPG Media is iedereen welkom. Dus solliciteer, wat je achtergrond ook is. Er staan ruim 5.500 slimme collega’s te popelen om je op te nemen in een team, of dat nou een projectteam, een pubquizteam of een sportteam is.  Ontdek wat wij je te bieden hebben of leer onze tech organisatie kennen! En, als je toch bezig bent, vind je ons ook op LinkedIn en Twitter.  Wie ben jij WO werk- en denkniveau, er wordt van je verwacht dat je zelfstandig complexe problemen kan oplossen & op strategisch niveau meedenkt over te ontwikkelen oplossingen. Sterke query skills; dagelijks ontwikkel je en doe je custom analyses met onze back-end & front-end data tools (oa. Amazon, Redshift, Qlik Sense). Bij voorkeur SQL-ervaring. Goede basis kennis over (Big) Data oplossingen & tools. Gedegen business kennis; je bent nauw betrokken bij de bedrijfsvoering dus je moet plezier hebben in het inhoudelijk willen doorgronden van de advertising business. Qua persoonlijkheid is het vooral belangrijk dat je oprecht, zelfstartend en praktisch ingesteld bent.  Als hét grootste mediabedrijf van Nederland staan we open voor alle talent in de maatschappij. Wij roepen kandidaten met een diverse achtergrond in de breedste zin van het woord dan ook op om te solliciteren op deze functie. Juist door de verschillen tussen collega’s ontstaan verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En dat past dan weer heel erg goed bij ons als organisatie. We zijn benieuwd wie jij bent en welke kwaliteiten en ervaring jij meebrengt.  Word jij binnenkort onze nieuwe collega? Solliciteer dan nu! Eerst nog wat meer weten? Ik beantwoord graag je vragen via mark.van.dommelen@dpgmedia.nl. Bellen of appen mag ook op +316 83 80 00 59.  Wij doen graag onze werving zelf en wensen niet samen te werken voor de invulling van deze rol

title: Tech Recruiter (in-house - 6 months)
summary:
Filling the roles of Senior DevOps, two Senior PHP developers and a full stack data scientist for the product team.
Then you’re at the right place.
description: Are you looking to make your mark on a platform that touches the lives of millions of people? Then you’re at the right place. It's an amazing time to help our small but mighty team grow as we continue to expand globally. The #1 goal of your role is to build out our Inner Circle dream team by hiring the best, truly engaged, and committed people to accomplish our mission: “Every second a member gets together (currently every 7 seconds)” Your speciality is attracting tech talent, but you do not mind getting your hands dirty on some other roles too. You know where to look and what to do to get the best of the best onboard.  What are your main result area’s? Your primary focus is to grow our small but mighty engineering team with world class matches. Filling the roles of Senior DevOps, two Senior PHP developers and a full stack data scientist for the product team. You create magnetic job posts that attract the best matches. Source effectively for the perfect candidates to grow strong as a team. You know how to proactively source for the (technical) perfect candidates and build momentum to grow our teams fast. Raise the bar in Inner Circle’s selection process to be able to focus on the best. You know how to interview technical talent to only put forward the best. Create a great candidate experience so every applicant will have a positive feeling afterwards. Ensure a magical full funnel experience so each candidate becomes a fan.  What will make you successful Freelance (tech) recruiter, with a track record in start or scale ups, available for 6 months 5+ years of full-cycle technical recruiting experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment including in house experience Experience with hiring senior engineering profiles A passion for building teams and delivering exceptional candidate experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an appropriate blend of professionalism and friendliness Passionate, authentic and ambitious About Inner Circle Inner Circle is a global dating app for like-minded ambitious singles who are serious about dating. We challenge singles to stop aimlessly swiping and up their dating game, to meet their match (and not just any match). With a community of 3,5 million singles in 5742 cities in 27 countries around the world, we help you match based on values and interests, making it easier to meet people on your level. The independent bootstrapped tech company ranked in the FT1000 2020 list as one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe. The company was also the winner of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 in The Netherlands in 2018.  Sounds like your perfect match! Apply today!

title: Expert Data Scientist
summary:
As a data scientist you are on the forefront driving business results by generating data-based insights.
Being a member of a cross functional team, including…
description: Are you inspired to contribute to and have an impact on solving real-world, big mobility problems of today and tomorrow? As a Senior Data Scientist in Bridgestone Data Solutions & Innovation, you will work on real products, data-based insights, leveraging and exploring hundreds of million data points, such as vehicle telemetry, fleet and driver’s behaviour as well as various mobility and telematic data.  Being a member of a cross functional team, including data scientists, data engineers, software developers and product managers, you will be responsible for building up and maintaining a steady inflow of data and making sure that exploration as well as productization of data opportunities will materialize as part of our Line of Business Data Solutions and Innovations. Here’s a little taste of your challenge: As a data scientist you are on the forefront driving business results by generating data-based insights. Data mining and data analyses to generate new insights and open new business opportunities, ensuring the availability of ground truth data with the stakeholder support. Designing a data driven / machine learning product from the bottom up. This includes defining the project goals and understanding the customer problem/journey, carving out the necessary KPIs together with stakeholders, constructing a training/validation and test set, pre-processing the data, employing a machine learning model, and bringing it into production via micro services. Proposing and steering our short- and long-term efforts to exploit new data types and sources, both internally and externally. Coordinate model implementation, monitor and refine launched products Close collaboration with data engineers and analysts to build products and to grow our customer base. Who are you? There is no set route to become our new Data Scientist. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind: You have at least 4 years’ experience in building statistical models, manipulating data sets and made significant contributions to several product launches. You can utilize all kinds of data sources, such as relational databases via SQL, non-relational databases, and any kind of web interface providing structured and unstructured data in json, xml, or any other common data format. Personal must-haves: strong problem-solving skills, analytic mind, achievement orientation, sense of quality, flexible thinking and good communication skills. You are a self-driven team player with entrepreneurial touch and a passion for results. You have profound knowledge and experience with Python or any other object-oriented programming language. You have a deeper understanding and already applied various unsupervised-learning techniques, such as k-mean, Gaussian mixture models, DBSCAN, self-organized maps, or autoencoders, as well as in standard supervised learning techniques like regression, random forests, naive Bayes. In addition you have already designed deep learning models in Keras or PyTorch. You were able to gain insight into and experience with the following frameworks, standards, and software categories: Spark, Azure, or similar. You have experience visualizing and presenting data utilizing Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, or Plotly. What can you expect? An adventure in software product development within a rapidly growing business unit of a globally renowned brand and various opportunities for your professional development. Being part of a team of professional and passionate developers, contributing to building and adapting the technology for our Webfleet Solutions Service Platform. Brilliant minds. Learn from your colleagues – pioneers and experts who are changing the world Different cultures. Our employees come from all over the world, with 55 nationalities and counting Practically Speaking, what's in it for you: Competitive salary. Benefits package in addition to the salary: Retirement and disability pension Life and accident insurance Flexible holiday plan. Birthday off! Plenty of formal training for new joiners + access to LinkedIn Learning. Who are we? The Data Solutions & Innovation is one of our Line of Business within the newly created Business Unit “Bridgestone Mobility Solutions”, headquartered in Amsterdam, and belonging to Webfleet Solutions, a Bridgestone company. This new Business Unit and the Data Solutions & Innovation line of business is forming the core of new digital driven business assets to support Bridgestone on its way of the digital transformation from the world leading tire and rubber company to a brilliant Mobility Solution Provider. Webfleet Solutions is one of the world’s leading telematics solution providers, dedicated to fleet management, vehicle telematics and connected car services. Its main Software-as-a-Service solution WEBFLEET is used by businesses of all sizes to improve vehicle performance, save fuel, support drivers and increase overall fleet efficiency. In addition, Webfleet Solutions provides services for the insurance, rental and leasing industries, car importers and companies that address the needs of businesses as well as consumers. Webfleet Solutions has over 50,000 customers worldwide and services drivers in more than 100 countries, giving them the industry’s strongest local support network and widest range of sector-specific third-party applications and integrations. Our customers benefit every day from the high standards of confidentiality, integrity and availability of our ISO/IEC 27001:2013 certified service, re-audited in November 2018. Webfleet Solutions is part of Bridgestone Europe NV/SA (“Bridgestone”), a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a leader in advanced solutions and sustainable mobility.  Want to join us? If that’s a yes, then please apply to say hi. Complete the online form and attachments in English, please. You can also send your CV and the reference of the position you are applying to us in an email to ana.delacruz@webfleet.com.

title: Data Engineer | Olie & Energie
description: Voor een klant van mij ben ik opzoek naar een Data Engineer. Als Data Engineer ben je voortdurend bezig om het landschap van Big Data optimaal toegankelijk te maken voor Data Scientists en/of Data Analisten. De Data Engineer ontwikkelt complexe queries, niet alleen met het oog op het toegankelijk maken vanuit diverse bronnen maar ook om het genereren en presenteren van de data zo soepel en adequaat mogelijk te laten verlopen. Zo zijn Data Scientists en Analisten maximaal gefocust op de daadwerkelijke analyse. Jij bent verantwoordelijk voor; Vinden van juiste interne/externe databronnen om aan datavraag te voldoen; Combineren en opschonen van data uit verschillende bronnen en deze geschikt maken voor analyse; Waar nodig zorgen voor afscherming van persoonsgegevens in datasets (bijvoorbeeld door maskering, pseudonimisering of anonimisering); Bouwen van data pipelines naar het data lake. Het team van Data Engineers werkt via agile/scrum. Je kunt snel nieuwe dingen leren en flexibel mee veranderen in onze dynamische organisatie. Je hebt lef, een hoog energie niveau en een enthousiaste, positieve instelling. Je herkent jezelf verder in de onderstaande beschrijvingen: Afgeronde opleiding op minimaal HBO niveau (Computer Science, Informatica, of vergelijkbaar); Relevante ervaring (minimaal 2 jaar) in programmeren / scripting (Groovy, Python, Java, Ruby). Kennis van R en Spark zijn een pre; Ervaring met (open-source) omgevingen voor data processing; Vaardig met tools in een Hortonworks omgeving; Nieuwsgierig en creatief; Je bent op de hoogte van de nieuwste technieken van big data; Een proactieve en oplossingsgerichte instelling. Wij belonen jouw inzet met: Een salaris van maximaal €4.700 (bruto op basis van een fulltime werkweek(40u/w), exclusief vakantiegeld); In ieder geval 20 vakantiedagen die je zelf kunt aanvullen met het FlexBudget; Een FlexBudget (minimaal 17,54% van je brutosalaris, met inbegrip van 8% vakantiegeld) waarbij je zelf kan bepalen wat je hiermee doet: extra salaris laten uitbetalen, vrije dagen bijkopen of je pensioen aanvullen; Een goed pensioen bij ABP, waarvan 70% van de premie wordt betaald door Stedin; Zeer uitgebreide trainings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden, we investeren in onze medewerkers; Een goede balans tussen werk en privé; Een laptop en mobiele telefoon. Je kunt ook kiezen voor Bring Your Own Device en zo bijdragen aan onze visie op duurzaamheid; Onbeperkt reizen met openbaar vervoer met een OV vrij-abonnement of een reiskostenvergoeding.

title: Project Lead Bioinformatics & Data Science
summary: With your solid background in bioinformatics you will lead projects on the design of algorithms and pipelines using genomic data as well as phenomic data.
description: Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of cut flowers, bulbs, tropical plants, pot plants, bedding plants and perennials. For our Research department in De Lier we are looking for a Project Lead Bioinformatics & Data Science. Job objective Our organization grows and flourishes. This results in a fast-changing and, therefore, challenging environment. As a Project Lead Bioinformatics & Data Science you will strengthen our Trait Genetics group which is part of the research department. With your solid background in bioinformatics you will lead projects on the design of algorithms and pipelines using genomic data as well as phenomic data. Your will also wrap up these pipelines into solutions for end-users and be responsible for setting up, developing and maintaining the IT solutions for our Trait Genetics team. Collaboration is an important feature of the job, and you will work closely with scientists within Trait Genetics as well as other expertise groups such as Trait Discovery, Plant Physiology, Phytopathology and Breeding. You will report to the Technology Lead Trait Genetics in De Lier. Your tasks and responsibilities Design, improve and maintain innovative software solutions for large data challenges within research. Lead projects on developing pipelines for computer vision (preprocessing, segmentation, machine learning, deep learning, GAN etc), genomic analyses and routine molecular breeding. Make tools and pipelines available for routine application through automation or for end-users through web-apps or Notebooks. Perform scouting activities for novel tools and technologies. You are expected to collaborate closely with other research teams (mainly Computational Biology, Plant Physiology, Trait Discovery, and Phytopathology) and manage relationships with stakeholders such as Breeding and IT. Your profile PhD in a relevant field in biology with a strong computational focus (for example bioinformatics, applied mathematics, data science) and preferably >2 years experience in industry. You have a thorough understanding of the Linux operating system and are proficient in coding in Python and R (other programming languages are nice to have). Proven experience in large-scaled NGS data analysis and advanced computer vision applications preferably using various deep learning approaches. Experience with DevOps (Kubernetes, Docker), databases (SQL), pipeline tools and workflow management (Snakemake) and cloud computing. Experience with web-apps such as Dash and RShiny is preferred. Ability to work independently as well as in fast-paced multidisciplinary teams. Inquisitive, innovative and critical mind-set and a creative and pro-active attitude. Excellent written and oral communication skills which are tailored to the target audience. Excellent command of English and willingness to learn Dutch. We offer Dümmen Orange has great global ambitions. Innovation, technology and quality are high priorities. This results in a challenging working environment in which you can develop yourself. Dümmen Orange offers its employees plenty of room for personal growth and development. We have an informal and easy accessible working environment in which cooperation is very important. Dümmen Orange Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of flowers and plants. Its annual turnover is about 350 million euro. The company employs over 7.300 employees worldwide. In addition to a large marketing and sales network, Dümmen Orange has a diversified network of specialized production sites. The key to Dümmen Orange’s success is a broad and deep product range, supported by a global supply chain. The company embraces its social responsibilities and invests in the health, safety and personal development of its staff. Your application Click on the button below to apply for this job. If you have questions about the job, you can contact Camillo Berenos (Technology Lead Trait Genetics), via +31 174 530 100. Acquisition with reference to this advertisement will not be appreciated. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Kerstpakket Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Zorgverzekering Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr

title: Data Engineer
summary: You will work closely with other developers, analysts, product owners and data scientists to build great solutions to help teams have the right insights.
description: Company Description  We are on a mission to be the easiest and most reliable way to arrange home services, connecting homeowners with qualified service professionals. We operate the market-leading brands in France (Travaux.com) and the Netherlands (Werkspot.nl) and expanding in Italy (Instapro.it). Our Product, Technology & UX department consists of approximately 100 talented professionals, deeply passionate about creating beautiful digital marketplaces.  Job Description  The team The Data Engineering team consists of engineers and a product owner. Our mission is to make reliable data available to the entire organisation. We firmly believe in Agile principles and autonomy. Transparency, ownership and curiosity are our core values. We work in two different locations (Amsterdam, Netherlands and Aix-en-Provence, France) and once it is safe again, we will meet each other face-to-face frequently. As such, the job offer is open in both offices. The role As a Data Engineer at Werkspot, you will be responsible for designing, building and maintaining our data pipeline and data models, keeping scalability in mind. We put an emphasis on data modeling using DBT and the business best practices. You will work closely with other developers, analysts, product owners and data scientists to build great solutions to help teams have the right insights. Technologies you’ll use Our modern stack includes Data Build Tool (DBT), AWS, Stitch ETL and Looker. We follow Dimensional Modeling guidelines and automate our pipeline using Gitlab CI/CD.  Qualifications  What we expect from you Professional experience with SQL and BI tools (2+ years) Good understanding of Data Modeling (e.g. Kimball) Experience with at least one programming language (preferably Python) You are a team player who contributes to a collaborative atmosphere You apply software engineering principles to your projects by writing maintainable, testable and documented code You follow the latest Data Engineering developments, and are excited about learning new technology You are reliable, communicative and business minded  We offer you A great working environment in the center of Amsterdam (once we go back) Flexible working hours and remote working to accommodate personal needs A competitive salary Personal growth budget and time for attending training courses and conferences Relocation budget if coming from abroad (once it is safe) 25 days of annual leave Pension arrangement Lunch allowance, fruit, and coffee Commuting reimbursement Free fitness in our building Frequent and fun events with the entire company to celebrate achievements and milestones Werkspot is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees.  Additional Information  How we are organised: Our Product, Technology and UX department currently consists of 4 tracks and approximately 100 professionals, from all over the world: Brazil, Canada, India, France, Greece, Ireland, Israel, Italy, The Netherlands, South Africa, Paraguay, Poland, Portugal, Russia, Spain, Turkey, the UK, and the USA. Each track focuses on the most valuable opportunity within their given scope. Within the tracks, multidisciplinary product development teams collaborate on achieving the goals that they set and commit to each quarter. We approach our decisions in an experiment-guided and Agile way: we validate new directions using a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods. Our shared values: We believe our success starts with sharing the same values when it comes to how we work. These values are the foundation of everything we do, and you’ll experience them on a daily basis. Our values are: Be stronger together; Aim high; Take ownership; Be transparent and respectful; Be open-minded and curious; Embrace diversity; Focus on our customers. The company culture in our organisation is very open and inclusive; we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Special note related to COVID-19 We will be hiring mostly through online video interviews. In-person interviews can be scheduled for candidates in the Amsterdam area, with the agreement of both parties. The position is based in Amsterdam and requires relocation to the Netherlands. Note that in-line with the current government (RIVM) recommendations, we are currently working from home. We will do our best to make the on-boarding as smooth as possible and help you get up-to-speed. Is this for you? Send your resume with a brief explanation of why you are highly motivated by this role. You can apply via the “Apply” button or by sending your information to Samy Bouras, Data Lead at Werkspot, Travaux and Instapro. We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Data (DevOps) Engineer
description: Opleidingsniveau HBO, WO Aantal uren 36 uur Vakgebied Innovatie (IT) Salarisindicatie € 2973 - € 5169 p.m. Solliciteer vóór 30 maart 2021 Contractvorm Onbepaalde tijd Jouw functie Gemeente Rotterdam is flink aan het investeren om onze organisatie meer datagedreven te maken. Ons programma Data Gedreven Werken (DGW) wordt momenteel geïmplementeerd en verder opgeschaald. Vanuit het programma is de laatste tijd geïnvesteerd in nieuwe technologie en is er bovendien een nieuw team gevormd: Advanced Analytics.
