Je vertaalt inzichten naar verbeter- en innovatievoorstellen, inclusief krachtige, data-gedreven onderbouwingen; Je pakt warehouse overkoepelende onderwerpen op zodat synergie tussen logistiek en andere afdelingen wordt gevonden; Je presenteert je voorstellen aan alle stakeholders, zoals het MT, de diverse afdelingen en teams alsook onze logistieke partners; Je voert de projecten uit, van start tot finish en houdt daarbij alle stakeholders aan boord; Je ontwikkelt dashboards die zicht en grip op warehousing vergroten; Je inspireert, adviseert en challenged jouw omgeving binnen en buiten Smartphonehoesjes; Je bent vooruitziend en kleurt daarbij onze roadmap, zodat Smartphonehoesjes voorop blijft lopen in de markt.  Hoe ziet het logistieke team eruit? Je komt in een geweldig logistiek team te werken, samen met Wouter (Logistiek Manager), Berend, Dyon en Astrid (Logistiek Coördinatoren). Daaronder vallen 5 teamleiders, 8 voormannen en zo’n 100 magazijnmedewerkers.  Wat krijg je van ons? Geld; Je werkt bij één van de snelst groeiende e-commerce bedrijven van Nederland; Je krijgt, maar dan moet je wel écht op vakantie gaan en ons niet meenemen, 26 vakantiedagen op basis van 40 uur; Een aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling voor als je later oud bent; Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng, heb je een tof idee? Bring it on! Tafelvoetbal, pingpong en FIFA; Drankjes op de vrijdagmiddag en legendarische bedrijfsuitjes.    Je hebt een HBO of universitaire opleiding; Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie binnen logistiek of Supply Chain, bijvoorbeeld als Data Scientist, Data Proces Manager, Data Consultant, Business Analist of een andere functie waarin je met data hebt gewerkt; Superskills in tools als spreadsheats, Tableau, BigQuery, Power BI en Data Studio; Kennis van R, Phyton, SQL en databases; Beschikt over analytisch vermogen om processen snel eigen te maken en te doorgronden; Je kunt snel schakelen binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is; Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden zodat je verschillende afdelingen bij jouw project weet te betrekken.

title: Assistant Professor Food Safety
summary: The research focus is on quantitative analyses of 'Big Data', field data and omics data in the context of (molecular) epidemiological studies to mitigate animal…
description: The Assistant Professor position falls within the research theme Food Safety (veterinary quality control, quality assurance). The research focus is on quantitative analyses of 'Big Data', field data and omics data in the context of (molecular) epidemiological studies to mitigate animal/food-associated human health risks. The candidate contributes to research and development of innovative ways for assessing zoonotic risks, including antimicrobial resistance, for human health in the livestock/food production chain, based on diverse and complex sources of data. For instance, microbial genomic data generated within the context of epidemiological studies can be used to explore transmission routes of specific pathogen strains or even the patterns of microbe-host signals within and between human, animal and environmental sources. Routinely collected data at livestock primary production and at food processing are expected to become increasingly important in quality control and assurance, especially when they can be related to health risks for the consumer, animal health and welfare. Routinely collected data can also support the improvement of existing and development of novel decision rules and algorithms in the context of process safety. Profiel We are looking for an enthusiastic Researcher (PhD, preferably with several years of postdoctoral research experience), who has a demonstrable interest in food safety within a context of (molecular) epidemiology and (veterinary) public health. Someone with expertise in microbiology & One Health as applied to foodborne zoonoses, antimicrobial resistance and emerging threats, such as a Veterinarian, Biologist, environmental or public Health Scientist, or similar, with expertise in epidemiology and microbial risk assessment. The candidate must be a team player with a professional network in the food safety and livestock-producing sector, who feels confident taking initiatives and working in multi-disciplinary and international teams. In addition the candidate is able to inspire both students and colleagues. Project acquisition, management and teaching experience are an advantage. Aanbod We offer a temporary position (0.8 - 1.0 FTE) for a period of one year. In case of a good performance, an indefinite employment is one of the possibilities. The gross salary - depending on previous qualifications and experience - ranges between €3,637 and €4,978 (scale 11 according to the Collective Labour Agreement Dutch Universities) per month for a full-time employment. Salaries are supplemented with a holiday bonus of 8% and a year-end bonus of 8.3% per year. In addition, Utrecht University offers excellent secondary conditions, including an attractive retirement scheme, (partly paid) parental leave and flexible employment conditions (multiple choice model). More information about working at Utrecht University can be found here.   Over de organisatie A better future for everyone. This ambition motivates our scientists in executing their leading research and inspiring teaching. At Utrecht University, the various disciplines collaborate intensively towards major societal themes. Our focus is on Dynamics of Youth, Institutions for Open Societies, Life Sciences and Sustainability.  The Faculty of Veterinary Medicine has a unique position in the Netherlands. Not only is this the only institution where veterinarians are trained, researchers are also working together on innovative scientific research. In addition, the faculty provides specialist clinical care in the largest academic veterinary hospital in Europe. Thanks to this position, the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine is a point of contact for all veterinary matters, both nationally and increasingly internationally. The faculty employs approximately 900 veterinarians, scientists and support staff and counts 1.500 students.  IRAS is an interfaculty research institute within the Faculties Veterinary Medicine, and Medicine of Utrecht University. Its mission is to provide education and research on the human and environmental health risks of exposure to potentially harmful agents in the environment where research takes place within the domains of toxicology, environmental epidemiology and veterinary public health.  Aanvullende informatie For more information about this position, please contact: dr. L. Smit (Associate Professor), via l.a.smit@uu.nl.

title: Senior Data Scientist
summary: In close collaboration with our customer’s engineering teams and domain experts, you create value from data and transform companies to becoming data-driven…
description: Job Description  As a hands-on Senior Data Scientist within WAES' Data Science and Data Engineering Community, you design models and develop algorithms to create groundbreaking new products and solve fundamental high-impact problems of strategic importance. In close collaboration with our customer’s engineering teams and domain experts, you create value from data and transform companies to becoming data-driven organizations.  As a Senior Data Scientist at WAES you: Work on long-term projects at highly dynamic and fast-paced organizations in the Netherlands; Create digital products out of data that would have never been invented without you; Provide insights that allow multinational organizations to make data-driven strategic decisions; Have the opportunity to work at different organizations to solve different sorts of challenges; Continuously develop both yourself, the people around you and the data insight for the better;  Qualifications Practical MSc or Ph.D. with excellent results in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Econometrics or similar; Deep understanding of neural networking, deep learning, data mining, artificial intelligence, and statistical model programming; 3+ years hands-on Python experience in the commercial project; Solid experience with open source big data technologies and platforms (i.e. Hadoop & Spark, MLFlow, Tensorflow). Working with graph databases and tools is an additional advantage; Excellent understanding of machine learning applications & algorithms, both supervised and unsupervised. Knowledge of Isolation Forest and/or NLP techniques is an additional advantage; Experience working with cloud solutions like AWS, GCP or Azure is a must; Native working in agile development environments, working cross-team and cross-project; Strong communicator, passionate about the field and your project, able to bring concepts and result clearly across to multiple stakeholders;  Additional Information  WAES is a Dutch Software consultancy company, specialized in large-scale cloud development. Our mission is to build a strong team of Senior Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Developers and QA Automation Specialists from all over the world who can solve our clients' toughest challenges. With 60+ talented consultants, we are helping our clients with high-quality tech solutions in healthcare, logistics, fin-tech, high tech, and several other domains.  WAES is a growing company, and we are striving to become the most well-known tech house in the Netherlands. As continuous learning and new technology is a part of our everyday life, you will work in a dynamic and fast-moving environment.

title: PhD candidate
summary:
We offer a clear and inviting career path to young and talented scientists with the ambition to grow.
Expertise through your field of study in particular in…
description: Vacaturenr. 21-113 Functie-categorie PhD-posities Omvang (fte) 1.0 Extern/intern Extern Locatie Leiden Geplaatst op 4 maart 2021 Sluitingsdatum 31 maart 2021  Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science in collaboration with Leiden University Medical Centre is looking for a PhD candidate for “Machine learning to enhance temporal coding for cochlear implants” project Project description Over 5% of the world's population suffers from hearing loss. Today, for deaf and severely hearing impaired people, cochlear implants (CIs) are the standard treatment. However, CIs have a limitation in properly transmitting detailed temporal information from the sound to the auditory nerve. This manifests itself in difficulties with speech understanding with background noise, tonal languages, directional hearing and music perception. TEMPORAL is a joint project with the Leiden University Medical Centre (LUMC) that aims to develop improved speech coding strategies for the CI speech processor that better transmits temporal information to the auditory nerve. To do this, a combination of three techniques will be used: computer modeling, artificial intelligence (AI), and patient-centered research. These new speech coding strategies will lead to improved perception in the difficult listening situations. Key responsibilities You will focus on using state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques for tuning configurable parameters of the CIs to better approximate the spike trains that normally transmit the information to the brain. You will use nonlinear optimization through evolutionary algorithms and develop suitable loss functions for spike trains and noise handling. Appropriate machine learning and cross-validation techniques will be developed in this research too, for assuring generalizability of the results. During the project, you are expected to write the research articles that together will form the basis of a thesis to attain a PhD degree (dr.) at Leiden University. The PhD student will participate in the education and supervision program of the Leiden Graduate School of Science. Selection criteria A MSc or equivalent degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence or a similar field; Expertise through your field of study in particular in machine learning, evolutionary computation, nonlinear optimization, multiple criteria optimization, simulation, deep learning, and audio data analysis; Excitement about working in an interdisciplinary team with clinical experts and medical device experts; Excellent proficiency with Python and C++; Matlab will also be useful; Excellent communication skills and interest in the interdisciplinary character of the project and the required ability to communication between computer science and the medical side as well as the medical device production company; Creative thinking and highly motivated; Excellent proficiency in the English language. Our organisation This PhD position is part of the Health Holland TEMPORAL project that combines computational modelling, state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques and patient testing, to develop a new speech coding strategy which allows for better neural encoding of temporal fine structures. This will lead to improved perception of music and tonal languages, improved speech understanding in (fluctuating) noise and enhanced directional hearing, with either two CIs or a CI and a contralateral hearing aid (bimodal hearing). In total, this project will be recruiting 2 PhDs to be based at LUMC (see open positions at the LUMC site) and 1 PhD to be based at LIACS as advertised here. LIACS supervisory team will consist of Prof. dr. Thomas Bäck and dr. Anna V. Kononova. Both are experts in evolutionary computation and machine learning. The Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science is the Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science Institute in the Faculty of Science of Leiden University. We offer courses at the Bachelor and Master of Science level in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, ICT in Business, Media Technology, and Bioinformatics. According to an independent research visitation, we are one of the foremost computer science departments of the Netherlands. We strive for excellence in a caring institute, where excellence, fun, and diversity go hand in hand. We offer a clear and inviting career path to young and talented scientists with the ambition to grow. For more information about LIACS, see the website. At the Leiden University Medical Center, we continuously work on improving patient care. We invest in ground-breaking, international research and work with the latest equipment. Together with our team of doctors, medical specialists, teachers, academic researchers and supporting staff, we aim for the best quality in health care, education and international research. And we need you to realize our goals! Terms and conditions We offer a full-time temporary position for initially one year. After a positive evaluation of the progress of the thesis, personal capabilities and compatibility the appointment will be extended by a further three years. Salary range from € 2.325,- to € 2.975,- gross per month (pay scale P in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities). Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development and sabbatical leave. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break. All our PhD students are embedded in the Leiden University Graduate School of Science. Our graduate school offers several PhD training courses at three levels: professional courses, skills training and personal effectiveness. In addition, advanced courses to deepen scientific knowledge are offered by the research school. Diversity Leiden University is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from members of underrepresented groups. Information Additional information about the PhD position can be obtained from the member of the supervision team, Anna Kononova, email a.kononova@liacs.leidenuniv.nl Application You can apply for this PhD position no later than March 31th, 2021. Your application should include pdf-versions of a Curriculum Vitae, a Letter of Motivation, and an MSc diploma with transcripts (courses + grades). To apply for this vacancy, please send an email to jobs@liacs.leidenuniv.nl. When applying, please use the following subject: “vacancy number – your name”.

title: Data Analyst
summary:
Collaborate with engineers, data scientists and product managers to test, iterate, and measure impact of proposed solutions.
We can't wait to meet you!
description: This is Adyen We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen. Data Analyst We are looking for an enthusiastic colleague to join our team in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be looking to leverage our Big Data infrastructure to deliver actionable insights both internally and externally. This is a very dynamic role that will have you wearing multiple hats throughout your week. You could be the technical master working side by side with data scientists on machine learning projects, the BI master that builds out dashboards for internal insights or the product master that helps shape the products we offer in a data driven way. We will try to help you find your most effective path that will leverage your skills and interests. What you'll do Optimize payment processing quality for the benefit of our full client base Building the backend for and delivering insights for your team or Adyen's merchants Collaborate with engineers, data scientists and product managers to test, iterate, and measure impact of proposed solutions Connect with a diverse set of merchants worldwide, and gain an in depth understanding of the most complex problems facing the FinTech world today Performing analyses for any internal team within Adyen if the need arises Provide our Sales and AM teams with relevant insights to close deals or drive new volume within existing markets. Who you are Have an entrepreneurial spirit Strike good balance between technical and commercial understanding Excellent in communication of complex data or technical functionality with commercial or client teams Familiar with data analysis languages such as Python (preferred), R or Matlab Feel comfortable writing queries in SQL Experience with big data tooling i.e. Pyspark / Hadoop / Airflow is a big plus Experience with BI tools, Looker specifically is a plus Experience in the FinTech industry is a plus Who we are Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Casper, Bonobos, and Spotify. Ready to meet us? If this role looks like your next challenge, apply by clicking the below link. We can't wait to meet you!

title: Statistician
summary: New product development and R&D support: DoE and analysis, answering miscellaneous queries to support data scientists.
description: Job Type Contract  Location Amsterdam  Area Netherlands  Sector Big Data & Analytics  Salary Market related  Start Date ASAP  Job Ref KW-Stat  Description Templeton and partners are seeking a Statistician for our global client in Amsterdam to work on: Subsidence-forecasting: Quality-checking and bug fixing of existing python code, development of new modules Corrosion modelling: Improvements to existing methodology New product development and R&D support: DoE and analysis, answering miscellaneous queries to support data scientists  Requirements Solid grounding in Maths/Stats – MSc at least, PhD preferred Ability to develop Bayesian stats methods Knowledge of Design and analysis of research experiments Coding experience, preferably Python, (but R or Matlab experience would give someone a head start), experience of Agile ways of working would help Ability to relate to customers, understand issues and communicate

title: Senior Software Engineer, Data
summary:
Experience building and optimizing "big data" data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
You will be responsible for extending and optimizing our data…
description: At Everon, we make expansion into EV charging easy and profitable, now and in the future. With a focus on the larger movers and forces in the industry, Everon is the world's premier cloud-native and multi-tenant Platform-as-a-Service. Built from the ground up to be global, future proof, API-first and highly scalable and secure.  EV Charging is becoming a bigger player within the public infrastructure of many countries around the world. The extensive amount and richness of EV data we have been collecting so far, when processed and analyzed properly, can greatly support our business decisions, and - if surfaced properly through our platform - can further shape the global EV charging market.  As Senior Data Engineer you will join our Data team which is composed of skilled engineers and data analysts focusing on expanding the data capabilities of the Everon platform. This team is making EV charging data driven, intelligent and more attractive by providing actionable insights.  Your role will heavily focus on design and building technically sound software systems in the "big data" domain. You will be responsible for extending and optimizing our data pipeline architecture, optimizing data flows, data extraction, transformation and processing. We expect you to work closely with all the stakeholders (in technology and product management) and collaborate efficiently within the team to identify existing and potentially new data sources, establish target architectures and deliver required initiatives and work in time and with high quality.  Main responsibilities: Design and implement large-scale software systems in a "big data" environment Optimise all stages of the data life cycle, from initial planning, to ingest, through final display and beyond Design, build and support data processing pipelines and APIs Architect and build data pipelines to optimize for performance, data quality, scalability, ease of future development, and cost Assemble complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements Design and build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using GCP 'big data' technologies and beyond Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs Collaborate closely with Data Analysts and Data Scientists to work out new and innovative solutions as well as develop plans to incorporate and enhance data science practices Display sense of ownership over assigned work, requiring minimal direction and driving it to completion Remaining up-to-date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your outputs.  Experience we expect you will bring: 4+ years of experience in Data Engineering role 7+ years of overall experience as a Software Engineer (you bring excellent software engineering skills and knowledge of the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies) Good experience programming in Java Deep experience in building highly scalable, distributed services, capable of handling large amounts of data Experience building and optimizing "big data" data pipelines, architectures and data sets Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management Experience in designing and building machine learning algorithms and systems Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. Experience with GCP cloud services: Big Query, PubSub, Dataflow Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc. Experience in mentoring other team members in development best practice and methodologies Ability to work in a team environment that promotes collaboration Curiosity, open-mindedness, drive, and a proven ability to work independently or as part of a team  Our offer to you: In addition to collaborating with a dynamic group of top industry and subject matter experts, we will provide you a competitive salary and the following benefits: option to work from home partially, high-end laptop + related equipment, contribution to private pension fund, discounted health insurance, 25 days holiday (unpaid leave possible) and home-office travel compensation.  Our well-connected modern office in Amsterdam (in a super sustainable building) always has free fruit and great coffee available. We will actively encourage your growth in the business and will support you (mentoring, training budgets) to realize your goals whilst you make your mark on this evolving industry.  About us: We're building a team of problem solvers and makers. People with a proactive attitude and the drive to change the future of mobility. From developers to designers, managers and specialists; our office welcomes professionals from different backgrounds and values diversity as a strength. We currently have over 140 people working with us from 33 different nationalities. Together we make a global platform, powered by data-driven services.  Are you ready to join our mission? Build a platform, cut emissions, change the future.

title: Analytical Support Supervisor
summary:
Prepare data overviews and reports, including interpretation of results.
Executes experiments and prepare data overviews and reports, including interpretation…
description: Location: Amsterdam (Netherlands) Job category: AD - Product Analyt Dev't  uniQure is dedicated to bring innovative therapies or unmet medical needs to patients. In doing so each function in uniQure is directly or indirectly responsible for the lives of patients. This responsibility should be part of our day-to-day working life by (i) living up to high quality standards and (ii) recognizing the sense of urgency in areas of high medical need.  Purpose of the role  The Analytical Support Supervisor will be part of the Product Analytical Development (PAD) group. The Analytical Support Supervisor will focus on planning, execution and reporting of laboratory activities. The core tasks will be focused on planning, designing, executing and reporting experimental work, data analysis trending, and reporting, SOP/Documentation writing.  Place in the Organization  The PAD Group is embedded within the Analytical Development department, which also consists of Bio-Analytical Development (BioAD), and Drug Product Development (DPD). The Analytical Support Supervisor will be a contributor to the activities of PAD group with a specific attention toward the critical activities of the PAD group:  Developing, qualifying and transfer of product-specific assays to be used for release testing, stability testing, and extended characterization. Providing analytical support to DPD and PD (Process Development) activities by ensuring consistent and timely execution of standardized platform product characterization assays, including data review, storage and trending. Integrating new program products into uniQure analytical platforms, to ensure timely progress of transfer and regulatory filing efforts.  The Analytical Support Supervisor reports to the Analytical Development Senior Scientist /Team Lead.  Key result areas (major duties, accountabilities and responsibilities)  Independently plan own and team laboratory work to ensure maximum efficiency while ensuring alignment with overarching deliverables and laboratory resource utilization (e.g. use of lab equipment) Coordinate planning, scheduling activities of technicians within the team communication and alignment with internal stakeholders. Executes experiments and prepare data overviews and reports, including interpretation of results. Suggest next steps in experimental design including rationale for suggestions Drafts and reviews laboratory and technical documentation relevant to assay execution (Electronic Lab Notes, SOPs), assay development, qualification, transfer, troubleshooting or other PAD relevant studies (protocols, reports, position papers and memos) Collect, and store experimental data sets and document analytical results to ensure maximum traceability Prepare data overviews and reports, including interpretation of results. Suggest next steps in experimental design including rationale for suggestions Ensure training of technicians on relevant analytical methods and laboratory and data recording practice Ensure all laboratory activities are performed according to applicable protocols, and follow safety and quality procedures to ensure a safe working environment and high data quality Notify superior of all observed deviations in a timely frame and provide input on the possible cause of the deviation and proposed remediation plan. Improvement of skills and knowledge necessary to successfully support assigned tasks and projects through training and independently. Continuously improve and update her/his area of expertise. Provide improvement suggestions and support the improvement implementation.  Qualifications & Skills  Minimum of BSc in a Life Sciences-related field with 10 years or MSc with 4-6 years of working experience in a biotech or pharma company . Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with aseptic cell culture techniques (e.g. insect and human cells) Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with relevant molecular biology techniques (e.g. (q)PCR, DNA electrophoresis) Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with biochemical analyses (e.g. protein electrophoresis, western blotting, ELISA) Solid experience in supervising and motivating a team of technicians and organizing laboratory activities in a clear and structured way Experience in assay design and trouble shooting Solid experience in writing technical documentation (SOP, Protocols, Reports) and review of analytical data and laboratory notebooks (e.g. ELN) Working experience in a regulated setting (GxP) and awareness of GxP pharmaceutical regulations is highly recommended Experience in viral vaccines or gene therapy is a plus Computer software skills including Microsoft Office Strong interpersonal and communication skills in English, written and verbal including presentation of technically complex data  Core competencies  Detail oriented: strong analytical skills, high level of understanding of assay principles, ability to critically analyze and present complex data sets Thorough: ability to set up and carry out tasks with an eye for completeness (e.g. results achieved according to self-prepared protocols, results compiled in clear overview and proposal for follow up experiments) Analytical Thinking and Problem Solving: signals problems, recognizes important information, traces possible causes of problems, thinks about and implements new working methods or new applications, brings forward and implements original solutions for problems related to the department and function Planning and organizing: ability to plan own and other’s work to achieve results in a timely way while ensuring the highest standard of quality, discuss with others to align planning of multiple complex activities simultaneously, scheduling activities with technicians within the team and help team members with their planning. Ability to effectively adapt and support re-prioritization of activities and goals in a fast paced environment Co-operative: ability and drive to work within and across teams, good written and spoken communication skills, ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced environment. Self-aware. Soft Skills: dependable, proactive, motivated, flexible

title: Dataverwerking Specialist
summary:
Je bent een belangrijke schakel tussen leveranciers en afnemers van data.
Je hebt tenminste 5 jaar relevante werkervaring op gebied van data en processen.
description: Locatie: Kampen Ons team Data & Intelligence heeft een belangrijk doel, namelijk ervoor zorgen dat de gegevens ten behoeve van onze processen worden verzameld, gestructureerd vastgelegd en middels een vertaalslag van data naar informatie ter beschikking worden gesteld aan datagebruikers. Daarbij streven wij een hoge datakwaliteit na. Hierdoor kunnen wij de aansturing van onze bedrijfsprocessen en daarmee onze prestaties, continue verbeteren. Data & Intelligence is een team in opbouw en bestaat uit de onderdelen DataOps, Data Handling en Intelligence. Rollen als Data Scientists, Data Engineer, Data Analist en Datakwaliteit Specialist komen voor. Voor Data Handling zijn wij op zoek naar een Dataverwerking Specialist. Door het verder professionaliseren van Data & Intelligence zetten we een volgende stap naar een lerende datagedreven organisatie die TLN wil zijn..  Ben jij iemand met veel ervaring op gebied van Data Handling? Dan moet je haast wel enthousiast worden om een bijdrage te leveren aan deze nieuwe en uitdagende ontwikkeling. Wie zijn wij? Je kent ons nog wel. De kans is groot dat wij er voor hebben gezorgd dat je je schoolboeken kreeg. Ontzorgen van het onderwijs en een leven lang leren leuker en beter maken zitten diep in ons DNA. Ruim 80 jaar zijn wij de grootste educatieve dienstverlener in Nederland. Elk jaar leveren we meer dan 12 miljoen studieboeken, 4 miljoen digitale licenties en verschillende studiematerialen aan leerlingen en studenten van het vo, mbo, hbo, wo.  We werken met ruim 300 betrokken medewerkers verspreid over onze locaties in Kampen, Emmen, Amsterdam en België. Of in 1 van onze 5 winkels in de grote studentensteden. In de zomer komen nog eens 2.500 studenten vakantiewerk bij ons doen in Kampen en Emmen. Een echte zomerse topdrukte bij ons dus! Wat ga je doen? We zoeken een enthousiaste nieuwe collega die met praktisch toepasbare kennis en een tomeloze inzet klantgericht werkt. Je krijgt energie van het in teamverband verder brengen van een lerende organisatie. Je bent gewend je collega’s actief mee te nemen in een datagedreven mindset. Je gaat actief bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling en uitvoering van de bedrijfsstrategie met behulp van op data gebaseerde inzichten en adviezen. Je zorgt ervoor dat de organisatie beschikt over volledige, betrouwbare en toegankelijke data. Je bent een belangrijke schakel tussen leveranciers en afnemers van data. Je bent ervoor verantwoordelijk dat verzamelde en gecontroleerde data, zoals productdata en klantdata, op de juiste manier worden geïnterpreteerd en verwerkt waardoor correcte en betrouwbare data ingezet kan worden bij de uitvoering van onze businessprocessen en ter beschikking gesteld aan onze interne en externe klanten. Wat vragen wij van je? Je werkt en denkt op HBO-niveau Je hebt tenminste 5 jaar relevante werkervaring op gebied van data en processen. Ervaring in de uitgeverijbranche heeft een sterke voorkeur. Je hebt een brede kennis van Productdata en/of Relatiedata. Je bent goed op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van Masterdata Management, Metadata Management. Je bent bekend met interfacestandaarden zoals XML, ONIX of ECK. Je kunt zelfstandig werken. Je kunt gemakkelijk schakelen tussen verschillende werkzaamheden. Je weet daarbij het overzicht goed te behouden. Je neemt het initiatief. Je bent in staat het voortouw te nemen bij het doorvoeren verbeteringen op het gebied van data. Je bezit extra kennis en ervaring op gebied van IT, Finance, e-Commerce of Procurement. Je hebt ervaring met agile werken of het werken in projecten Wat bieden wij jou? We vinden goede en tevreden medewerkers erg belangrijk. Daarom hebben wij prima arbeidsvoorwaarden: Een uitdagende functie voor 28-32 uur per week Een salaris van minimaal € 2.600,- bruto per maand en maximaal € 3.800,- bruto per maand op fulltime basis afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring Goede en flexibele secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden conform de CAO en het TLN Kompas. Onbeperkte toegang tot e-learning mogelijkheden, jouw ontwikkeling heb je bij TLN in eigen handen Geïnteresseerd? Stuur ons dan jouw CV met een korte en pakkende motivatie.

title: Data Scientist voor zuivelspecialist
summary:
Deze data analyses vormen de basis voor het nemen van gedreven beslissingen.
Aantoonbare ervaring met grootschalige data analyse, in het bijzonder gebaseerd op…
description: Activiteiten binnen dit bedrijf zijn onder andere het certificeren van kwaliteitssystemen, het toezicht op private kwaliteitseisen en het uitvoeren van laboratoriumanalyses. Momenteel zijn zij op zoek naar een Data Scientist voor het team Innovatie & Business Development. Binnen deze functie zal je managementparameters voor de melkveehouderij en zuivelindustrie modelleren en nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen. Dit gebeurt aan de hand van meetresultaten zoals infraroodspectrum en bedrijfsmetadata. Hiermee verklaar je de veiligheid, kwaliteit en duurzaamheid van processen en de zuivelketen. Deze data analyses vormen de basis voor het nemen van gedreven beslissingen. Vanuit deze functie kan een sleutelrol worden vervuld in data gedreven innovaties in managementinformatie voor ketenpartners, risicoanalyse, bedrijfsoptimalisatie en kwaliteitsborging. Tijdens deze werkzaamheden wordt er doorlopend overlegd met interne organisaties, klanten en leveranciers.  Functie-eisen  Academisch werk- en denkniveau;  Aantoonbare ervaring met grootschalige data analyse, in het bijzonder gebaseerd op MS SQL standaarden;  Ervaring met R en/of Matlab en PLS Toolboxing;  Je kan klantgericht, initiatief en projectmatig werken;  Affiniteit of belangstelling voor de zuivelsector en instrumentele analysemethoden;  Affiniteit met Big Data technologie, IoT, kwantitatieve risico analyse, economische impact en duurzaamheidsvraagstukken.  Aanbod  Marktconform salaris, op basis van jouw competenties en ervaring;  26 vakantiedagen;  Voldoende opleidingsmogelijkheden;  Flexibele werktijden en reiskostenvergoeding;  Collectieve pensioenregeling en bedrijfsfitness;  Je levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan de zuivelketen en de verdere groei van de organisatie;  Een positie in een professionele en informele werkomgeving

title: Shiny Developer / Data Scientist
summary:
Als Shiny Developer / Data Scientist werk je mee aan het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van datagedreven applicaties.
Waar zijn wij naar op zoek?
description: Als Shiny Developer / Data Scientist werk je mee aan het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van datagedreven applicaties. Je vindt het kicken om jouw kennis van R en Shiny in te zetten om prototypes te ontwerpen en om te zetten in werkende software producten. Jouw applicaties maken onderdeel uit van ons Shintō Analytics Platform en hebben de potentie om op te schalen naar meerdere organisaties en gebruikers. Waar zijn wij naar op zoek? Je hebt een (universitaire) opleiding bij voorkeur op het vlak van Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie of een andere opleiding met een sterke analytische en statistische basis. Je hebt kennis van standaard modellen en algoritmes Je hebt ervaring met Shiny, Shinydashboard en R (https://shiny.rstudio.com/, https://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/) Je weet hoe je gebruik kan maken van HTMLWidgets in Shiny (http://www.htmlwidgets.org/) Je snapt het in Shiny gebruikte ‘reactive programming model’ (https://shiny.rstudio.com/articles/reactivity-overview.html) Je hebt kennis van onderliggende technologie componenten: Javascript, Bootstrap, HTML en CSS. Je hebt ervaring in het consumeren van beschikbare RESTful services op ons platform. Wat je gaat doen: Ontwikkeling van een R package om op een elegante wijze rijke Shiny CRUD formulieren op het Shinto Labs platform te implementeren. Ontwikkeling en onderhoud van onze Shiny gebaseerde digitale datagedreven applicaties voor verschillende klanten. Ons platform is breder dan R en Shiny, een andere deel van het engineering team ontwikkelt standaard backend services waarmee we vanuit Shiny integreren. Uiteindelijk meedraaien in onze Design Sprints waarin je samen met de Sprint Master in 5 dagen van challenge naar gevalideerd prototype gaat werken! Wat wij inspirerend vinden: Grote mate van vrijheid en eigen verantwoordelijkheid Lean, Scrum, Kanban, Design Sprints, Design thinking Git, Docker, REST, Swagger, SQL, NoSQL, Azure Maatschappelijke vraagstukken oplossen Welke competenties breng je mee: Zelfstandig werken, resultaat gedreven Meedenken en samenwerken Initiatief en flexibel van geest Analytisch vermogen Zelfontwikkeling en open staan voor nieuwe technologiën Wat hebben wij je te bieden? Wij zijn geen uren fabriek maar werken aan kickass datagedreven applicaties Klein team met ervaren en gedreven professionals met track record in Silicon Valley Gave maatschappelijke vraagstukken waarmee we de wereld mooier, veilige en schoner kunnen maken Grote mate van vrijheid, eigen verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen inbreng Investeren in jouw kennis en ontwikkeling Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden Interesse? Stuur je CV en motivatie naar Bart Rossieau via human@shintolabs.nl

title: eLIMS Configurator/Assistant Scientist
summary: You will be a point of contact for the relevant stakeholders such as our Release & Stability Coordinators and stability scientists.
description: Functie  We are searching for a suitable candidate to reinforce our eLIMS coordination team as eLIMS configurator with main focus on support to our eLIMS coordination process. As eLIMS configurator you are responsible for translating documents, like stability plans, specification sheets and sample plans to clear eLIMS Master Data and configurations. You will be a point of contact for the relevant stakeholders such as our Release & Stability Coordinators and stability scientists. You are able to work in an ever-changing environment with short timelines and identify future improvements (e.g. new systems like Smart QC and BSI) and help to implement them. You can work closely with your fellow coordinators and together bring the team to the next level.  Your main tasks and responsibilities will be: Accountable for the proper translation of the relevant documents to eLIMS Master Data  Build eLIMS Master Data and ensure the right quality  First point of contact for key stakeholders  Acts as subject matter expert for Quality during regulatory inspections, internal and external GMP-audits.  Ensure compliance with quality standards (GMP) and production schedules.  Functie eisen  MLO-4 or HLO, affinity with medical products and experience with quality and laboratory systems such as cGMP, SAP and LIMS are strong advantages.  Detailed and Careful.  A minimum of 3 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry is required  Experience working in a Quality driven environment, GMP experience is a pre  Able to translate input from many different stakeholders into a concise and clear document/ process.  Experienced with laboratory management systems or at least highly developed computer skills.  Affinity with relational databases .  Well-developed interpersonal skills and able to build strong relationships .  Highly proficient in spoken and written English. Dutch is considered a strong plus.  Aanbod  A great job opportunity within a dynamic company in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points.  Sollicitatie Procedure  Contactpersoon voor deze functie is Sen Kösters, bereikbaar op telefoonnummer 023 55 78 529 of via e-mail: sen@xdes.nl Kenmerk: 9732.

title: Assistant Scientist Analytical Biochemistry
summary:
Further responsibilities include data analysis, reporting, oral presentation as well as documentation (e.g. CofAs and trending reports).
What will your job be.
description: What will your job be As an Assistant Scientist Analytical Biochemistry you will be responsible for a range of activities focused on biophysical and analytical vaccine characterization. Your key responsibilities:  You perform sample analysis for internal and external stakeholders using several analytical and (molecular-) biochemical methods Examples of techniques that you will use are qPCR, ELISA, Biological assasys, UPLC, CE and DLS You will not only perform routine based lab work (50%), but also focus on developments in automation to investigate possibilities to automate work in future Moreover you are responsible for instrument maintenance and troubleshooting Further responsibilities include data analysis, reporting, oral presentation as well as documentation (e.g. CofAs and trending reports) What are we looking for For the position of Assistant Scientist Analytical Biochemistry we are looking for enthousiastic candidate with an all-round biochemical profile and strong affinity for robotics. Furthermore you meet the following qualifications:  MBO+, or HBO in Biochemistry, Biophysics and/or protein chemistry or related fields Knowledge of e.g. QPCR, ELISA, Biological assays, UPLC, CE, DLS Affinity for software, robotics and automation Experience in good documentation and quality systems are preferable You have an agile and resilient personality, a curious mindset, and you are able to prioritise tasks and work independently What do we offer Long term position, which starts with a 6 months contract at CheckMark Salary indication from €2600,- gross per month based on a full-time position Full-time position, where 32 hours a week is negotiable Dayshift Where will you work Pharmaceutical company specialised in the development of vaccines.  More information Jurjen Wilschut 088 00 211 22 jurjen@checkmark.nl Sebastiaan Loriaux 088 00 211 26 sebastiaan@checkmark.nl Ref.nr: 6925

title: Software Engineer, Data
summary: Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
description: At Everon, we make expansion into EV charging easy and profitable, now and in the future. With a focus on the larger movers and forces in the industry, Everon is the world's premier cloud-native and multi-tenant Platform-as-a-Service. Built from the ground up to be global, future proof, API-first and highly scalable and secure.  EV Charging is becoming a bigger player within the public infrastructure of many countries around the world. The extensive amount and richness of EV data we have been collecting so far, when processed and analyzed properly, can greatly support our business decisions, and - if surfaced properly through our platform - can further shape the global EV charging market.  As Data Engineer you will join our Data team which is composed of skilled engineers and data analysts focusing on expanding the data capabilities of the Everon platform. This team is making EV charging data driven, intelligent and more attractive by providing actionable insights.  Your role will heavily focus on data extraction, transformation and processing, building high quality and technically sound data solutions, whilst assisting data analysts in building and optimising our products. We expect you to work closely with all the stakeholders (in technology and product management) and collaborate efficiently within the team to identify existing and potentially new data sources, contribute to target architectures and deliver required initiatives and work in time and with high quality.  Main responsibilities: Implement complex software systems in a "big data" environment Create and maintain optimal data pipeline setup Work closely with multiple engineering teams on event sourcing and event streaming concepts and implementation Assemble complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using GCP 'big data' technologies and beyond Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems Display sense of ownership over assigned work Remaining up-to-date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your outputs.  Experience we expect you will bring: 3+ years of experience in Data Engineering role 5+ years of overall experience as a Software Engineer Good experience programming in Java Experience building and optimizing "big data" data pipelines Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable "big data" data stores Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases Experience with GCP cloud services: Big Query, PubSub, Dataflow Previous experience with: Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc. is a bonus Big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc. is a bonus Ability to work in a team environment that promotes collaboration Curiosity, open-mindedness, drive, and a proven ability to work independently or as part of a team  Our offer to you: In addition to collaborating with a dynamic group of top industry and subject matter experts, we will provide you a competitive salary and the following benefits: option to work from home partially, high-end laptop + related equipment, contribution to private pension fund, discounted health insurance, 25 days holiday (unpaid leave possible) and home-office travel compensation.  Our well-connected modern office in Amsterdam (in a super sustainable building) always has free fruit and great coffee available. We will actively encourage your growth in the business and will support you (mentoring, training budgets) to realize your goals whilst you make your mark on this evolving industry.  About us: We're building a team of problem solvers and makers. People with a proactive attitude and the drive to change the future of mobility. From developers to designers, managers and specialists; our office welcomes professionals from different backgrounds and values diversity as a strength. We currently have over 140 people working with us from 33 different nationalities. Together we make a global platform, powered by data-driven services.  Are you ready to join our mission? Build a platform, cut emissions, change the future.

title: Senior Scientist/Principal Scientist Biomarker Lead
summary:
Responsible for the translation of preclinical data in expectations for clinical data.
Manages Biomarker scientists and project coordinators if applicable.
description: Janssen Vaccines & Prevention, one of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, is dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health. Our teams focus on the discovery, development, manufacture and marketing of vaccines and antibodies to protect people worldwide from infectious diseases. In our organization, entrepreneurial people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points. In order to strengthen our team we are continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value to Janssen. The offices of Janssen Vaccines & Prevention are located in Leiden. For our Viral Vaccines department, we are currently seeking a fulltime Senior Scientist/ Principal Scientist - Biomarker Lead Department/Project: The viral vaccine group is working on the discovery and early development of vaccines for viral infectious diseases. Candidates that pass the pre-clinical evaluation and fulfill criteria of manufacturability will be tested in humans for safety and immunogenicity. Job Description: Each vaccine development program is supported by a biomarker lead that heads an immuno team in which the required experts are present to execute the immuno strategy. The Biomarker lead will be: Responsible for maintaining excellent knowledge on immunology with emphasis on the fields relevant for vaccines Defining the immune parameters that should be measured in human trials Leading a multidisciplinary team that will provide go/no go and selection immune criteria for the next phase of clinical development Expected to maintain excellent knowledge of competition and maintain appropriate network relationships with experts in the field Responsible for the translation of preclinical data in expectations for clinical data Responsible for the clinical immunological content of regulatory documents Manages Biomarker scientists and project coordinators if applicable A member of the Compound Development Team.  Qualifications  Qualifications: Education: Ph.D. in (medical) biology or medicine on a research topic in Immunology.  Specific Knowledge: Excellent and state-of-the-art knowledge of immunology relevant for vaccine development. Experience: At least 2-5 years of experience working in an academic or biotechnology/pharmaceutical environment on immunological biomarkers.  Competences: Demonstrated written and oral communication skills in English Excellent analytical skills Problem-solving oriented Pro-active and “can do” mentality What’s in it for you…? “Caring for the world, one person at a time…” As an employee, we consider you as our most valuable asset. We take your career seriously. As part of a global team in an innovative environment your development is key and our day-to-day responsibility. Through e-university, on the job training, various projects and programs, we ensure your personal growth. Our benefits make sure we care for you and your family now and in the future.   Primary Location Netherlands-South Holland-Leiden- Organization Janssen Vaccines & Prevention BV (8852) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2105906731W

title: Data Engineer - Attractions
summary:
Solving issues with data and data pipelines, prioritizing based on customer impact.
End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines…
description: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners, and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Booking.com is looking for data-savvy professionals to join our team. As a Data Engineer, you will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to ensure we have high-quality data to power our business in all departments. Decisions for every part of our business - from the front end experience to performance marketing to partner products - are driven by petabytes of our data via MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. Your challenge will be to make sure we can utilize our petabyte-scale data even more effectively to support business decisions and improve our products. Joining a cross-functional team of developers, designers, data scientists, and product owners, we invite you to help us crunch the data to ensure our place as the planet’s #1 accommodation site.  The Trips business unit that Attractions is part of, will bridge the Booking.com of today with the Booking of tomorrow, leading the evolution of Booking.com from a single-product company to a multi-product offering company with an unprecedented, personalised travel experience at the heart of its success. At Booking.com we’re working to seamlessly connect every aspect of travel, and the Attractions team is one of the cornerstones of our connected trip vision. We’re a new Business dedicated to helping travellers discover and book things to do around the world. To do this, we need to build a marketplace with the world’s broadest selection of bookable things to do, and effortlessly match the right activity to the right person at the right time. Our goal is to offer travellers the widest choice and the best customer experience, no matter what tour, activity, or attraction they choose. B.responsible As a Data Engineer, you’ll join Attractions to work alongside curious, fast-paced, and focused people. You are responsible for creating and executing on a vision to have performant, high quality, and scalable data pipelines. You will be responsible for, and have the agency to replace the current ad-hoc data solutions with strong foundations built on modern technologies that will make it easy to store real-time customer interactions and make it accessible for data consumers later on. Being a team player is a must, since you will be working together with others to answer questions and address requests from a variety of stakeholders, such as the development team of Attractions as well as the team responsible for providing the teams and business with data solutions. Important Aspects Of The Job Include: Rapidly developing next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance data pipelines Solving issues with data and data pipelines, prioritizing based on customer impact End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines Experimenting with new tools and technologies to meet business requirements regarding performance, scaling, and data quality Providing tools that enhance data quality company-wide Providing self-organizing tools that help the analytics community discover data, assess quality, explore usage, and find peers with relevant expertise Acting as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences Contributing to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts B.skilled We are looking for driven Data Engineers who enjoy solving problems, who initiate solutions and discussions, and who believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools. The ones that fit us best are the people who match the following requirements: Minimum of 3 years of experience in the field, using 1 or more server-side programming languages - preferably Java, Scala, Perl, etc. Must have experience with building data pipelines in distributed environments with technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, MySQL, Oozie, Kafka & Kubernetes Technologies that are a plus: HBase Argo, Flink, KSQL, CQL & Cassandra are a plus Demonstrable experience with SQL, HQL, CQL, etc. Hands-on experience of developing in and contributing to open-source data technologies, such as Hadoop Experience in working on systems on a large scale Good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts Preferably a university degree in Mathematics or Software Engineering Team player and demonstrated stakeholder management skills: ability to explain complex issues in a way that can be easily understood by a variety of stakeholders Good communication, written and spoken B.offered An opportunity to contribute to a high scale, complex, world-renowned product, and seeing the real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide Be part of a truly international fast-paced environment and performance-driven culture Various opportunities to grow technically and personally via side projects, hackathons, conferences, and your involvement in the community Full relocation support for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating 300+ Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone! Headquarters located in one of the most dynamic cities in Europe: Amsterdam A performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world With over 70 different nationalities within the technology department alone, you will be able to absorb new skills and grow your career in a multicultural environment We value the diversity of all types and in an open, dynamic workplace. This has been a pillar at Booking.com since day one, and something we continue to strongly believe in and build today. Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Pipeline Enablement Breeding Associate
description: Pipeline Enablement Breeding Associate     Purpose of the role  The role is responsible for supporting vegetable breeding programs with most advanced breeding practices to ensure success in breeding, through collection of genotypic data, planning of needed crossing blocks, and preparation of data for pipeline advancements. This position will be collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of vegetable breeders, horticulture research specialists, breeding operations and data scientists to deliver creative solutions to complex business problems using advanced field operations, equipment, analytics, and cutting edge automation techniques. Key deliverables include: (i) enable decisions that drive pipeline advancement and placement; (ii) deliver our integrated product system commercial portfolios to address market needs with the highest data quality.  This position will be based in Wageningen, the Netherlands. Your Key tasks & Responsibilities: Effective collaboration with breeding operations to generate needed crossing blocks and quality data for product advancement and efficient functioning of the breeding programs, drive quality data collection and entry into enterprise systems. Together with Breeding Operations you ensure successful planning and the most accurate prioritization in the day-to-day operations at the station, including planning for temporary workforce Collects high quality phenotypic and pipeline data and performs all analyses necessary to drive pipeline advancement, support crop placement. Collaborate with the Trial Officers/commercial breeders, in needed data collection and analysis for any off-site breeding managed from the site. Assist in filling dashboards and metrics for various KPIs. Leverage metrics applications and quality control processes to realize accuracy, efficiency and expanded improvements to protocols Proactively identify opportunities to assist in improving established procedures, and lead troubleshooting activities through root cause analysis and troubleshooting techniques. Contribute to developing Breeding specialists through effective leadership focused on people and organizational needs. Ensure that team members follow all applicable local and Bayer Internal policies and programs including but not limited to HSE, QMS, regulatory and compliance protocols, and business conduct protocols.  Who are you? Education: B. S in Plant Breeding, Crop Science or related field with 5+ years of experience. If you have lesser work experience you can balance this with an higher education like a Master or PhD. Passionate about breeding vegetable crops within an R&D organization. Experience with breeding brassica, beans, spinach or related open field crops. Demonstrated abilities to develop breeding project plans, analyze and interpret breeding data. Ability to perform successfully in a fast-paced, dynamic, team-based environment. Manages multiple projects and priorities. Experience with IT and data management systems. You can translate data into presentable information to support discussion. Capacity to communicate and work effectively with all management levels in a multi-cultural organization. Strong strategic and analytical skills and understanding of how to apply them to achieve business results. You hold a Dutch Citizenship or you have a valid working visa. What Bayer offers you At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change.  Bayer Crop Science employees benefit from good employment conditions, such as: Excellent competitive salary; An additional 8,33% holiday allowance; 25 days of annual leave; A solid retirement plan; Plenty of challenges and international opportunities to learn and develop yourself; An informal and professional atmosphere.  Interested in this position? Reach out to us by clicking the ‘Apply’ button! In case of any questions you can contact Luuck van Kooten via Luuck.vankooten.ext@bayer.com. We kindly request you to apply through our career page.  #LI-BNL  Locatie: Nederland : Nederland : Wageningen  Divisie: Crop Science  Referentiecode: 366586

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Jij bent gek op data, communiceert makkelijk en deelt verkregen inzichten graag met anderen.
Hiermee helpen wij onze opdrachtgevers bij het maken van meer data…
description: Junior/Medior Data Scientist Ben jij op zoek naar ‘een volgende stap’ in je carrière en wil je binnen de Data Science graag meer leren over Algoritmes, Machine Learning en Voorspellende Modellen? Dan komen we graag met je in gesprek! Jij bent gek op data, communiceert makkelijk en deelt verkregen inzichten graag met anderen. Je wilt graag betrokken zijn bij nieuwe Data Science projecten voor toonaangevende bedrijven in Nederland. Je toekomstige werkdag is nooit hetzelfde. Je zit vaak bij de klant en als Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit ven een team van Data Scientists en Database Marketeers, die complexe data vertalen naar actiegerichte inzichten. Hiermee helpen wij onze opdrachtgevers bij het maken van meer data-gedreven beslissingen en dragen zo bij aan de commerciële doelstellingen van een groot aantal toonaangevende bedrijven. Je hebt zelf de kans binnen ons bedrijf je carrière vorm te geven. Je gaat methodes, modellen en algoritmes creëren ter verbetering van klantcommunicatie en CRM strategieën. Jouw input zorgt voor meer inzicht in de doelgroepen van de opdrachtgevers. Als Data Scientist houd je je bezig met projecten rondom customer segmentation, profiling, predictive modeling, next best offer etc. Kortom je maakt het verschil! Wij bieden naast waanzinnige collega’s en mooie projecten, een goed salaris en perfecte secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Binnen een organisatie waar egen initiatief en nieuwe ideeën toegejuicht worden. Wat neem jij mee? Een HBO/WO diploma, bij voorkeur richting Data Science, Informatica, Econometrie of Wiskunde; 0-2 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie; Basiskennis van SQL, Python, Python R en Google Analytics. Ervaring met of kennis van CRM, AI en Machine Learning is een pre; Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en een toegankelijke persoonlijkheid; De bereidheid om geregeld bij de klant op locatie te werken. Hebben we je interesse gewekt en wil je meer weten? Neem dan contact op met Jeroen Schipper. Jeroen@Onearrow.nl 06 19414934 Of solliciteer direct!

title: Data Proces Analist
summary: Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring met data en proces analyse, bijvoorbeeld als Data Scientist, Data Proces Manager, Data Consultant, Business Analist of een andere…
description: Procesverbetering dankzij data-analyse. Jij trekt als Data Proces Analist de verantwoordelijkheid naar je toe om – vanuit een consultancyrol – bedrijfsprocessen van klanten een kwaliteitsimpuls te geven.  Alle digitale bewegingen van klanten en bedrijven laten hun sporen achter. Dat klinkt voor jou als Data Proces Analist als het begin van iets moois, want met die data leg jij het fundament voor betere bedrijfsprocessen. Dat doe je voor bekende corporate organisaties en grote spelers binnen het mkb-segment. Samen met de klant zoek je naar mogelijkheden om klanttevredenheid te verhogen, kosten te reduceren en doorlooptijden te verkorten. En je zorgt voor een kwalitatief sterk en gedegen proces. Dit ga je doen: bespreek vanuit jouw rol als consultant de verwachtingen met de klant. reconstrueer processen, verzamel data en kom tot inzicht over hoe processen lopen. vertaal data naar processen en zoek naar factoren waar je invloed op uit kunt oefenen.  Werken bij MLC MLC in Leusden heeft al 30 jaar een sterke eigen cultuur, die we omschrijven als sociaal ondernemend. Wij transformeren organisaties naar een optimale digitale procesomgeving waarbij de mens in zijn kracht staat. In een optimale digitale procesomgeving is het primaire proces zo efficiënt mogelijk ingericht om hiermee Operational Efficiency te bereiken. Daarnaast draagt iedere medewerker écht bij aan de behoefte van de klant om zo Customer Excellence te realiseren. Transparantie en duurzaamheid om aan te tonen dat je als organisatie daadwerkelijk In Control bent staat hierin centraal. Bij MLC werken zo’n 30 ’procesdenkers’. Jij werkt als Consultant in teams met wisselende samenstellingen voor toonaangevende klanten in verschillende branches, die meestal gevestigd zijn in de randstad. Denk aan woningcorporaties, overheidsinstellingen en zakelijke dienstverleners, zoals banken, verzekeraars en energiemaatschappijen. Vaak werk je samen met onze klanten aan meerdere projecten tegelijk, je bent dan ook meestal te vinden bij de klanten voor wie je een project draait.  Jouw verdienste Dat zijn in de eerste plaats de tevreden klanten waar jij als Data Proces Analist voor zorgt. Daarnaast krijg je op basis van een 40-urige werkweek het volgende: een marktconform bruto maandsalaris passend bij opleiding en ervaring. flexibele werktijden. een bijdrage aan je pensioen. de mogelijkheid om gedeeltelijk vanuit huis te werken. 28 vakantiedagen en extra vrije ‘loyaliteitsdagen’ als je langer dan 3 jaar bij ons werkt. een winstdeling aan het einde van het jaar, deze kan oplopen tot een dubbel maandsalaris. een mobiliteitsvergoeding die je kunt inzetten voor een leaseauto, OV-kaart of reiskostenvergoeding. volop doorgroeimogelijkheden om nog beter te worden in wat je doet.  Jouw profiel In deze baan als Data Proces Analist werk je op het snijvlak van data-analyse en consultancy. Dat vraagt om een bèta-achtergrond met de mindset van een consultant. Het betekent dat je inhoudelijk sterk voor de dag komt en op niveau met de klant kunt communiceren. Je hebt een resultaatgerichte drive waarmee je anderen overtuigt en meekrijgt. Laten we het houden op ondernemerschap, waarbij je de volledige verantwoordelijkheid over projecten hebt. Naar buiten toe geef jij het visitekaartje af voor MLC, intern zorg je voor een uitstekende propositie. Jouw profiel is compleet met: een hbo-diploma of hoger, richting een bedrijfskundige opleiding, waar wiskunde en statistiek kernvakken waren. minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring met data en proces analyse, bijvoorbeeld als Data Scientist, Data Proces Manager, Data Consultant, Business Analist of een andere functie waarin je met data hebt gewerkt. kennis van: o predictive analytics (tooling als R, Phyton) o BPM o process mining o RPA o SQL en nog beter Relationele Databases kennis van de basis van onze dienstverlening: o BPM o Lean o Six Sigma o Continu Verbeteren o Klantreizen  Stap binnen bij MLC Sta jij aan de wieg van kwalitatief goede bedrijfsprocessen? Reageer dan in ieder geval op de vacature van Data Proces Analist. Mail je cv en motivatie naar werkenbij@m-lc.nl, dan laten we je zo snel mogelijk weten of jij degene bent die we zoeken. Neem contact op via 035 548 65 65 als je nog vragen hebt over deze vacature.  Na jouw sollicitatie Om er zeker van te zijn dat we bij elkaar passen, leren we je graag in 2 of 3 gesprekken beter kennen. Het eerste gesprek heb je met onze directeur(en), de volgende gesprekken met directe collega’s. Tijdens de laatste gesprekken vragen we je om een presentatie te geven over resultaten die je eerder hebt behaald. Zijn we overtuigd? Dan volgt een arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek, waarin we jou een aanbod doen.  Acquisitie n.a.v. deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Solliciteer direct

title: MBE (Molecular Beam Epitaxy) Engineer - Quantum team
summary:
Experience with programming/scripting, e.g. using Python, for data extraction and analysis.
Are you looking for an exciting role as part of a global team of…
description: Are you looking for an exciting role as part of a global team of physicists, material scientists, engineers and software developers defining the new field of Quantum Computing? Microsoft is researching the future of Quantum Computing, including theory, hardware, and software. We are on the cusp of an accelerated effort in quantum computing and this position is an opportunity to get in at the start of this new intense phase. Position available in Delft (Netherlands). Responsibilities You will join a team of researchers and engineers dedicated to push the state-of-the-art materials development in epitaxy of heterostructures made of dissimilar materials at the nanoscale. The role includes hardware & maintenance, as well as process development. You will be responsible for hands-on hardware maintenance, in-vacuum hardware upgrades and establish most efficient work protocols for a unique, advanced, multi-chamber custom-designed molecular beam epitaxy cluster tool. You will work in close relations with vendors and technical support and be able to execute all necessary MBE maintenance and repairs tasks, both autonomously and as part of a group. You will systematically plan and execute and optimize calibrations and growth processes, using design of experiment principles and in-situ characterization/ monitoring. You will be able to generate, populate and maintain a complete growth database. Qualifications Min. MSc. in engineering, applied physics or materials science At least 3 years of proven hands-on experience operating and maintaining a molecular beam epitaxy system and independent UHV hardware maintenance. This includes demonstrated knowledge of materials science, cryogenics, UHV mechanical (design, installation, maintenance), electrical engineering (various sensors, PIDs), robotic process automation, plasma, electron guns, RHEED, mass spectrometer, ion/turbomolecular/cryo- pumps, sensors, leak-checking Ability to deliver products with strong emphasis on the satisfaction of customers’ performance requirements Proven successful design and implementation of specialized/customized UHV hardware supported by planning, scheduling, and controlling skillsets Knowledge and proven experience with contamination control, maintenance/ openings, repairs, fault diagnosis and resolution using, e.g. failure mode and effects analysis methodology Proven process engineer experience on a(n) MBE with a detailed track-record of successful growth process and calibrations, database management, design of experiment Knowledge and experience with some standard ex-situ characterization tools, as e.g. optical microscopy, SEM, AFM, XRD, PL, Hall measurements Experience with programming/scripting, e.g. using Python, for data extraction and analysis Ability to work in a diverse group and contribute to an inclusive culture, alongside other team members who have a wide range of technical skills Thrives in a collaborative environment The ideal candidate would also possess the following skills/experiences: Industry experience Experience in III-As, -Sb, -P or II/IV/VI crystal growth Experience with nanoscale compound semiconductor growth, plasmas and metal epitaxy Experience with 3D solid modeling, CAD Experience with Systems Engineering  To apply, please include CV and a list of three references. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender, identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form (https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/accommodationrequest).  #quantum #QuantumHardware  MICROSOFT BACKGROUND CHECK:  Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. title: Medior Data Science Consultant
summary:
You have developed capabilities with data modeling and complex big data analyses.
On a typical project you work together in a team that usually consists of a…
description: As a Data Scientist at Avanade, you work with passion to solve complex business problems with machine learning and advanced statistical methods. You will be involved into development of real-life predictive solutions and algorithms as well as working with clients to resolve their advanced analytics requirements. As a consultant, you will also require business analyst skills, as you will be expected to analyze and scope client’s requirements to propose and design the solution.  In this role, you will have knowledge of machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistical algorithms and solutions using R and Python. You will work with our clients to define the analytics solution architecture from a pragmatic standpoint.
