Furthermore, you:  Provide technical support during development, commercial launch or problem solving for a given API or drug product. Development and validation of new analytical methods (e.g. HPLC, GC, dissolution). Testmethod transfer and trouble shooting of existing analytical methods. This includes review and writing of technical development reports and regulatory documentation. Oversee a variety of analytical aspects including the meaning of analytical data from various sources. Manage (Senior) Laboratory Technicians during execution of their tasks during the projects. What are we looking for For the position of a Senior Scientist Analytical Chemistry we are looking for you when you have: Master or PhD with a specialization in Analytical Chemistry At least 5 years relevant work experience Experience in Pharmaceutical industry Experience with method development using techniques like: HPLC, GC, Dissolution Familiar with CMC, Pharmacopeia, ICH and/or GMP Strong communication skills Excellent writing and speaking skills in English and Dutch. A valid working permit for the Netherlands. What do we offer Long-term employement starting contract via CheckMark Labrecruitment until the end of the year Salary indication from €3900,- based on fulltime, depending on experience Fulltime employement (40 hours/week), 32 hours/week is discussable Where will you work An international pharmaceutical company. This department has a global focus.  More information Jurjen Wilschut 088 00 211 22 jurjen@checkmark.nl Ref.nr: 6985

title: Data Scientist voor Realtime Data
summary:
Naast data in rest, analyseer je ook data in motion.
Uiteindelijk wordt deze data geanalyseerd en teruggekoppeld, waarna een oplossing geboden wordt voor de…
description: Bij deze organisatie is het belangrijk om zowel data in rest, als data in motion te kunnen verwerken tot inzichten. Door het realtime verwerken van flexibele, grote volumes data wordt de businesswaarde van de klanten groter. Met behulp van Redhat JBoss Data Visualisatie voeg je data samen vanuit opgeslagen databases, Excel sheets en file systems. Met behulp van Redhat JBoss combineer je data uit SalesForce, SAP of Oracle met DataWareHouse, Hadoop Data Lake of Twitter en Facebook. Vervolgens stel je deze data realtime beschikbaar.  Naast data in rest, analyseer je ook data in motion. Deze data is afkomstig van sensoren, mobiele apparaten of transactiesystemen. Uiteindelijk wordt deze data geanalyseerd en teruggekoppeld, waarna een oplossing geboden wordt voor de data vraagstukken. De technieken waarmee je werkt zijn divers, zoals Java, Scala, Python, R, Spark, ElasticSearch en Hadoop. Ook werken ze veel met AWS, Azure en Google Cloud Platform.  Als Data Scientist werk je aan verschillende projecten en ben je betrokken bij het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van data projecten. Dit doe je in een Scrum team. Daarnaast krijg je volop de ruimte om jezelf op professioneel en persoonlijk vlak te ontwikkelen. Je krijgt naast een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheden.  Functie-eisen  Een afgeronde WO opleiding in de richting van Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning of Artificial Intelligence;  Ervaring met Data Science of AI;  Kennis en ervaring van Java, Python, Scala en R;  Kennis van Cloud; AWS, Azure of GCP;  Kennis van Spark, ElasticSearch en Hadoop is een pré;  Een leergierige en betrokken houding.  Aanbod  Een salaris tot wel €6500,- per maand;  Bonus dat kan oplopen tot een paar maandsalarissen;  Een goed pensioen;  Studiebudget van €4000,- per jaar;  Mobiliteitsbudget dat kan variëren tussen de €700,- tot €1010,-;  Onkostenvergoeding;  8 Studiedagen per jaar;  Vakantiegeld;  Laptop/telefoon van de zaak;  27 vakantiedagen;  Parttime werken + thuiswerken;  Maandelijkse borrels, teamactiviteiten en de jaarlijkse skireis.

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Je modelleert en ontwerpt data flows voor een metadata gedreven modern data warehouse.
Het data team van monetair bestaat uit 4 data engineers, een tester en in…
description: Kritische financiële informatie ontsluiten in een splinternieuwe Cloud-omgeving als data engineer bij DNB. Jij hebt impact DNB maakt zich sterk voor een betrouwbaar financieel stelsel en als Data Engineer kun je hier een belangrijke bijdrage aan leveren! DNB heeft een ambitieuze digitale strategie en is in dit kader bezig met grote initiatieven op het gebied van ICT. Jij werkt hieraan mee door het ontwikkelen van een moderne Cloud-omgeving voor het ontsluiten van data. Dit helpt ons verder bij het data gedreven werken en hierdoor kunnen wij onze rol als Centrale bankier van Nederland nog beter vervullen. Zo doe je dat als Data Engineer bij DNB Als Data Engineer speel je een sleutelrol om data van de interne bronnen te ontsluiten naar de monetaire afdelingen. Deze data omvat kritische financiële informatie die beschikbaar gesteld moet worden voor de operatonele teams en voor analyse doeleinden. Je wordt onderdeel van een agile BizDevOps team waardoor je een veelzijdige functie hebt. Het team is momenteel bezig om een geheel nieuw omgeving neer te zetten in de Cloud. Dit biedt alle mogelijkheden om mee te werken aan de nieuwste ontwikkelingen! Wat ga je precies doen? Je modelleert en ontwerpt data flows voor een metadata gedreven modern data warehouse. Je werkt in een BizDevOps team nauw samen en je beheert de opgeleverde toepassingen. Je blijft op de hoogte van de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen je vakgebied en neemt initiatief om dit op relevante momenten naar voren te brengen dan wel toe te passen, bijvoorbeeld in onze actieve Data Community. Je programmeert mee om de functionaliteit van het modern data warehouse uit te breiden. In samenwerking met de Data Scientist prepareer je data, zodat de Data Scientist aan de slag kan in de Data Analytics omgeving.  Een dag als ontwikkelaar bij DNB Je start je dag met de stand-up. Later in de ochtend heb jij met een collega een afspraak met de Solution Architect om de opzet van het nieuwe datawarehouse door te nemen. Na de lunch werk je aan de backlog items van de huidige sprint, waarbij je voor complexere oplossingen veel met je collega’s spart. Later die middag heb je een refinement-sessie met je team en de product owner. Na de workshop is er duidelijkheid, zijn de prioriteiten helder en is er een juiste inschatting van de backlog items gemaakt. De volgende week start je met een sprintplanning waarin de doelen worden vastgesteld waar je de komende sprint aan zult werken. De dag is omgevlogen! Je hebt nog een laatste online meeting met een collega en de scrummaster om te bespreken hoe jullie een pubquiz gaan organiseren tijdens de online borrel over 2 weken. Hier doe je dat Het data team van monetair bestaat uit 4 data engineers, een tester en in de huidige fase ook een Azure engineer. Zij werken in teamverband samen met de business analisten van het BICC Betalingsverkeer. Gezien de omvang werken we momenteel in 2 gecombineerde teams met elk een scrummaster en 1 Product Owner van de business. Gedurende het sollicitatieproces zal in overleg met jou bekeken worden in welk van de 2 data teams jij het beste tot je recht komt. Beide teams werken in ieder geval nauw samen aan dezelfde producten. Normaal gesproken werk je vanuit ons kantoor in Amsterdam. In de huidige maatschappelijke situatie werkt het overgrote deel van onze medewerkers vanuit huis. DNB zorgt ervoor dat je dit uitstekend kan doen. Denk aan laptop, telefoon en thuiswerkplekinrichting op aanvraag. Zodra de situatie het weer toelaat hopen we iedereen op ons prachtige kantoor te verwelkomen! Dit breng je mee Bij DNB werk je met inhoudelijke professionals. De kwaliteit van je collega’s is hoog. Daarom vinden we het belangrijk, dat jij altijd 100% gaat voor de hoogste kwaliteit en het beste resultaat. Daarnaast ben je multi-inzetbaar, werk je graag samen in een team en hebben collega’s het gevoel dat ze op je kunnen bouwen. Je vindt het belangrijk jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen: vakinhoudelijk, maar ook als mens. Wat breng je verder nog mee? Een afgeronde bachelor of master, bijvoorbeeld in de richting van Informatica of door ervaring een vergelijkbaar niveau. Ongeveer 3 à 5 jaar relevante werkervaring binnen het vakgebied. Exceptionele SQL vaardigheden. Aantoonbare kennis van datamodelleer technieken als Data Vault en Kimball. Programmeervaardigheden in Python. Ervaring met de Microsoft Azure Data Engineering en Analytics stack (ADO, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Synapse Spark pools). Kennis en ervaring met ETL, Codeer, Test en Automation best practices. Meerdere jaren ervaring met Agile werken (bijvoorbeeld Scrum of Kanban). Kennis en ervaring met Informatica Powercenter en SAP Powerdesigner is een pre. Kennis en ervaring met Hashicorp Terraform is een pre. Kennis en ervaring met PowerBI is een pre. Voldoende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk. Dit bieden we je Een 36-urige werkweek - 32 uur kan ook - met werk midden in de financiële en economische actualiteit. Bij een betrouwbare en maatschappelijk betrokken werkgever in Amsterdam, die voortdurend inspeelt op de veranderende eisen van onze omgeving. En die doorlopend innoveert. We staan als instelling midden in de samenleving. Onze mensen zijn gedreven en betrokken bij hun werk binnen een maatschappelijke context. Wij zien een diverse en inclusieve werkomgeving als één van de voorwaarden om als organisatie succesvol te zijn en onze doelstellingen te blijven bereiken. Dit biedt jou volop kansen je verder te verdiepen en nieuwe ervaringen op te doen. In Nederland, maar ook daarbuiten. Je start met een jaarcontract, bij goed functioneren en wanneer de (organisatorische) omstandigheden niet wijzigen is er uitzicht op voortzetting. De overige goede arbeidsvoorwaarden die horen bij deze functie: Een salaris van minimaal € 3.200,- en maximaal € 5.400,- bruto per maand, op basis van een 36-urige werkweek. De uiteindelijke inschaling is onder meer afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring. Een 13de maand en 8% vakantietoeslag berekend over 13 maanden. Pensioenopbouw op basis van middelloon met voorwaardelijke indexatie. Eigen bijdrage in de premie 6,39%. Een volledige vergoeding van je OV-reiskosten woon-werkverkeer. Veel mogelijkheden jezelf door opleiding en training zowel vakinhoudelijk als persoonlijk te blijven ontwikkelen. Een goede balans tussen je professionele en je privéleven. In deze functie is het mogelijk om 4 dagen van 8 of 9 uur te werken. Zo solliciteer je bij DNB 01 - Verstuur je sollicitatie Na het versturen van je sollicitatie ontvang je direct een ontvangstbevestiging per e-mail. Binnen twee weken ontvang je een inhoudelijke reactie op je sollicitatie. 02 - E-assessment Voor de meeste vacatures vragen wij je om een online assessment te maken voorafgaand aan het eerste gesprek. Het assessment bestaat uit cognitieve testen en/of een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst, en kun je gewoon thuis uitvoeren. 03 - Eerste gesprek Tijdens dit gesprek leren we elkaar beter kennen. Dit gesprek vindt meestal plaats met de manager of een ervaren teamlid van de afdeling waar jouw vacature uitstaat en een recruiter. 04 - Tweede gesprek Wanneer zowel jij als wij positief zijn na het eerste gesprek zien we je graag nogmaals terug. Bij dit vervolggesprek zijn meestal een andere manager uit dezelfde divisie en een (senior) teamlid van de afdeling waar jouw vacature uitstaat aanwezig. 05 - Casus, derde gesprek en/of assessment Solliciteer je op een functie als toezichthouder of beleidsmedewerker? Dan wordt het eerste of het tweede gesprek vaak gecombineerd met het maken van een schrijfopdracht of een case study. Dit hoor je uiteraard ruim van tevoren. Afhankelijk van het niveau van de functie kan er nog een derde gesprek met de divisiedirecteur en/of een functiegericht (extern) assessment plaatsvinden. 06 - Arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek Past DNB bij jou? En ben jij de juiste persoon voor de functie? Dan doet de recruiter je een contractaanbod tijdens het arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek. DNB valt als overheidswerkgever onder de Wet normalisering rechtspositie ambtenaren (Wnra). Dit bekent dat medewerkers van DNB de ambtenarenstatus krijgen. Dit wordt tijdens het arbeidsvoorwaardengesprek toegelicht. 07 - Screening Na de arbeidsvoorwaardelijke overeenstemming volgt een screening. Het specifieke screeningsprofiel vind je terug in de vacaturetekst. Hier kun je meer informatie vinden over de screening. 08 - Welkom bij DNB Na het ondertekenen van je contract heten wij je van harte welkom bij DNB! Dit doen we met een introductieprogramma, waarin je kennismaakt met onze organisatie en je nieuwe collega’s. Het interactieve programma bestaat onder andere uit twee introductiedagen. Vorige Volgende Solliciteer nu! Wil jij als Data Engineer werken met impact? Solliciteer dan direct op deze vacature! Als sollicitatie ontvangen we graag uiterlijk 29 maart 2021 een motivatiebrief en je complete cv. Voor de justitiële screening is deze functie ingedeeld in profiel 2a, meer informatie over de screening vind je op de pagina Over ons > Sollicitatieproces. Deze vacature is bedoeld om op te solliciteren, niet voor acquisitie.

title: Research Associate New Antibody Products Research (T-Cell) 6 month contract
summary:
Genmab A/S is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy.
Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with you application on…
description: Genmab is focused on the creation and development of innovative and differentiated antibody products, with the aim of improving the lives of cancer patients. The Role We are looking for a Research Associate within our New Antibody Products Research (NAPR) team. You will be a member of project groups working on developing therapeutic knock-your-socks-off antibodies. You will be responsible for a broad set of in vitro experiments to study our antibody products' mechanism of action and anti-tumour activity. Please note that this is a contract of 6 months. Responsibilities You will work in a team of Scientists and Research Associates dedicated to discovering therapeutic antibody products. With your up-to-date knowledge of, and experience within assays in the field of immunology, tumour biology, cell biology, molecular biology, and protein biochemistry, you are responsible for the accurate execution of experiments in assigned research studies. You document and process test results, draw conclusions and report these to the team. By investigating the mechanism of action of our antibodies, you contribute to the selection of clinical candidates. Requirements You have a completed HLO or MSc education in a relevant life science subject. You have 2-3 years of relevant work experience within immunology and cell biology. Knowledge of and work experience with the isolation of cells from the blood is preferred. Experience/knowledge of human T-cell biology and suppressive immune cells is advantageous. You have experience in immunology or tumour biology, and you are motivated to expand your knowledge and skills. You have experience with flow cytometry, ELISA, and functional cellular assays. You can run several experiments in parallel and can work flexibly. You have professional business level English language skills, both written and verbal. You have a 'can do' mentality, are enthusiastic, goal-oriented, efficient, accurate, and enjoy working in a team. You take the initiative, set high-quality standards, and keep a close eye on ways to improve your work. You are driven to work together on the development of a new generation of medicines. In case of any questions please email Arma Muksinovic on:( ext-fts-amu@genmab.com ). Genmab employees work with determination and with respect for each other, consistent with our core values, to achieve our common goals. We give individuals and teams the autonomy to drive development of innovative products and solutions, knowing that integrity is a core value throughout our company. Genmab will offer the successful application a challenging position, where the right candidate will have the opportunity to work with highly specialised people across functions in an informal, multicultural culture, all aiming to make a difference for cancer patients.  Teamwork and respect are central pillars of Genmab’s culture and we therefore ensure an inclusive, open, and supportive professional work environment across our international locations. We believe that fostering workplace diversity across social, educational, cultural, national, age and gender lines is a prerequisite for the continued success of the company. We are committed to diversity at all levels of the company and strive to recruit employees with the right skills and competences, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, etc. Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands; Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in this location is to offer a temporary agreement for one year, followed by a contract for indefinite time regardless of seniority. Genmab A/S is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with you application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy .

title: Data Engineer Azure
summary:
Als Data Engineer sla je de brug tussen o.a. de data scientists en IT.
Dit doe je bijvoorbeeld door middel van het toepassen van data management technieken…
description: Jouw Skills Je bent in het bezit van een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in IT Je hebt als ervaring en ruime kennis van zowel relationele SQL als document georiënteerde NoSQL databases Je hebt kennis van data concepten zoals Data-Warehousing, Operational Datastores, Data-Lake, Data Virtualisatie, Data Mesh en Data-Hub Je hebt kennis van integratie concepten als ETL, ELT, EDA, EAI en Data-Pipelines Je hebt kennis en ervaring met object georiënteerde / scripting talen Je hebt basis kennis van analytics Je hebt basis kennis van de Azure Cloud Je hebt kennis en praktische ervaring met een of meerdere van de volgende Azure Services: Azure Databricks, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid / Hub, Azure Storage, Azure SQL service, Azure CosmosDB, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps Wat wij jou kunnen bieden Een uitdagende functie binnen een dynamische organisatie waar innovatie hoog in het vaandel staat Een lange termijn uitdaging waar je zelf vorm aan kunt geven Een inspirerende, professionele en informele werkomgeving met volop ruimte voor initiatieven Bovengemiddelde en flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden Kennisdeling tijdens regelmatige bijeenkomsten met collega’s Internationale conferenties, sportactiviteiten, bierproeverijen en andere leuke bedrijfsuitjes Wat ga je precies doen? Ga jij aan de slag met de laatste technieken op het gebied van data Engineering, zoals bijvoorbeeld Azure Data Factory / Azure Logic Apps / Azure Databricks? Als data engineer bij SynTouch zorg je voor de inrichting en (door)ontwikkeling van de Cloud data-platformen van onze klanten. Als Data engineer bouw je mee aan het fundament van data gedreven organisaties. Met passie optimaliseer je data platformen of bouw je deze geheel vanaf de grond op. Samen met je collega’s zorg je voor een optimale inrichting en werking van de data delivery architectuur, ook zorg je ervoor dat deze consequent in alle projecten wordt toegepast. Zo help je onze opdrachtgevers om hun data-gedreven diensten in de toekomst ook echt te realiseren. Daarnaast hou je jezelf bezig met het ontwerpen, bouwen en onderhouden van kwalitatief goede data-pipelines. Je werkt samen met een dynamisch team van SynTouch collega’s, die zoals jij, enthousiast worden van data integratie. Als Data Engineer sla je de brug tussen o.a. de data scientists en IT. Je onderzoekt, toetst en implementeert nieuwe technieken om data mee in kaart te brengen en te ontsluiten. Dit doe je bijvoorbeeld door middel van het toepassen van data management technieken zoals data-pipelines. In het proces van de selectie en implementatie van nieuwe tools en technieken ben je ook een belangrijke factor. Je neemt het team mee in de data-transitie en helpt zo onze klanten om versneld en slim gebruik te kunnen maken van hun data. Je houdt van pionieren en kunt goed zelfstandig werken. Sterker nog: jij ziet kansen! Je gelooft in de toekomst van datagedreven organisaties en staat ook zelf graag midden in de datastromen. Het communiceren met stakeholders pak je van nature gemakkelijk op. Je bent een teamplayer die gemakkelijk communiceert, serieus is in z’n werk, maar ook van gezelligheid houdt. Passend bij ons motto “Work hard, play hard”. Locatie: Utrecht Deel deze vacature op social media! Heb je nog vragen of ben je benieuwd naar de mogelijkheden voor jou binnen SynTouch? Neem contact op met Shannyth Hoogeveen shannyth.hoogeveen@syntouch.nl 06 2340 2228 Hier ga je werken Jij gaat werken in een team van verschillende jonge talenten, jullie worden begeleid door onze ervaren experts van wie jullie veel kunnen leren. Bij SynTouch is zelfontplooiing erg belangrijk, wij willen jouw springplank zijn voor een mooie carrière. Hierbij hoort natuurlijk veel plezier en teamspirit, samen zorgen we voor succes en vooral veel plezier! 0 Leuke collega’s 0 Procent man 0 Procent vrouw 0 Gemiddelde leeftijd

title: Manager Growth Strategy
summary:
Design new commercial strategy based on insights (interpret results of data scientists).
Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and…
description: Do you want to work on shaping and driving our client’s commercial excellence agenda, focused on realized profitable growth? This role is based in our Amsterdam office. Read on to find out if this job fits – and apply now Your job We are currently looking for a Manager Growth Strategy. You will focus on realizing results together with our leading clients on 3 key market themes: Seamless Customer Experience - Focused on customer experience strategy and -transformation, leveraging most innovative digital technologies of today Sales & Commercial Excellence - Focused on commercial excellence strategy definition and sales transformation Pricing & Long-term Profit Optimization - Focused on pricing strategy definition and shaping pricing transformation programs to help C-level realize EBITDA uptake As Manager Growth Strategy you will advise client executives in defining their strategy and targets, assess and analyze alternatives and shape executable action plans. Illustrative examples of activities include: shape value case to define impact of new strategy design new commercial strategy based on insights (interpret results of data scientists) shape transformation program to execute strategy (e.g. how to leverage technology/AI) run workshops with commercial teams to validate strategy assess commercial capabilities & propose improvements  Your team Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology. Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.  Your background Completed Master’s degree Minimum of 6 years (strategy) consulting experience Experience with commercial excellence transformation MBA preferable, not mandatory Enterpreneurial mindset Fluency in Dutch and English required  Our offer Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise. Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including: A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card) An expense allowance Discount on Accenture shares The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week Interesting online training at renowned international universities  Interested? Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you. Questions? Connect with Inge Neuteboom through inge.neuteboom@accenture.com

title: PhD student Analytical Environmental Chemistry (Micro-&NanoPlastic)
summary:
Ensure QA/QC of data produced.
Gather data on potential exposure routes of microplastics for humans.
Plastic pollution scientist Dr. Leslie is co-coordinating…
description: The VU Dept. of Environment and Health is seeking a motivated and talented analytical chemistry MSc graduate in interested in an ambitious multidisciplinary project on human exposure to nanoplastic and microplastic contamination, and earning a PhD diploma.  Location: AMSTERDAM FTE: 1  Job description Microplastic and nanoplastic is one of the planetary pollution problems that affects practically all habitats and species, including Homo sapiens . This PhD candidate's chief responsibility is to develop and apply methods to detect and quantify plastic particles for human risk assessment. The PhD project takes place within the framework of the EU H2020 POLYRISK project with consortium partners from top (immuno)toxicology, public and environmental health, and analytical chemistry research groups across Europe. The PhD candidate has the opportunity to join a team of young and enthusiastic researchers working on various aspects of plastic particle pollution in the vibrant environment of the VU's O|2 Lab Building , also home to POLYRISK partner AUMC-VUmc location MCBI group. Your duties Develop and validate analytical methodologies to detect, identify, and quantify plastic particles in human biological matrices (inter alia) to use in generating an analytical dataset that gives insights into plastic particle exposure and enables human risk assessment. investigate plastic particle distribution in human matrices ensure QA/QC of data produced gather data on potential exposure routes of microplastics for humans inter/transdisciplinary collaborations with other PhD students in the consortium supervise research traineeships and literature theses of master students within the scope of the POLYRISK project provide regular progress updates at POLYRISK project meetings and group meetings disseminate results in peer-reviewed journals and at conferences write and defend a PhD thesis at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam  Requirements Required diploma: MSc in Analytical environmental chemistry, Analytical chemistry or very closely related degree Required expertise: Analytical environmental chemistry, experience with gas (or liquid) chromatography and mass spectrometry, excellent command of the English language and excellent scientific writing skills Recommended expertise: Human biomonitoring and risk assessment What are we offering? a generously funded full-time position (duration 48 months) attractive benefits (see https://workingat.vu.nl/working-at-vu/employment-conditions) a high profile research project in H2020 POLYRISK consortium excellent facilities for research and education research and transferable skills training via the AIMMS Research School https://www.aimms.vu.nl/en/education/phd-programme/index.aspx access to large network via POLYRISK international collaborators the preferred starting date for this position is 1 May 2021 (negotiable)  A challenging position in a socially engaged organization. In accordance with university regulations for academic personnel the gross-per-month salary amounts to €2395 (PhD) during the first year and increases to €2972 (PhD) in the fourth year, based on full-time employment. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.  The appointment will initially be for 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for an additional 3 years. Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as: 8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus solid pension scheme (ABP) contribution to commuting expenses a wide range of sports facilities which staff may use at a modest charge  About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavour – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.  Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.  Diversity We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.  The Faculty of Science The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.  Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.  About the department and the POLYRISK project Department of Environment and Health (E&H) is part of the VU’s Faculty of Science. It aims to understand and inform society on the environmental and human health risks of chemicals. The department is a unique combination of chemists, toxicologists and epidemiologists. We develop methods to discover emerging chemicals characterize their toxicity for the environment, including humans. Plastic pollution scientist Dr. Leslie is co-coordinating the EU H2020 POLYRISK project and leading the analytical chemistry workpackage. Links: https://science.vu.nl/en/research/environment-and-health/index.aspx and https://science.vu.nl/en/research/environment-and-health/projects/polyrisk/index.aspx  Application Are you interested in this position? Please apply via the application button and upload your curriculum vitae and cover letter until March 18, 2021 . Note that job interviews are expected last week of March (online).  Please upload the following information as ONE SINGLE pdf file:  detailed CV - include information on your BSc and MSc studies, language skills, achievements, expertise, analytical chemistry laboratory skills and experience, publications list motivation letter, addressed to the POLYRISK Selection Committee, explaining your motivation and suitability for the position contact details of at least 2 references (names, addresses, emails). reference letter from one of the references academic diplomas and certificates, scanned copies official academic transcript i.e. documents demonstrating your performance as BSc and MSc student over time by listing the course units or modules taken, credits gained and the grades awarded). If you have not completed your MSc degree yet include all grades obtained so far English language skills certificate, for non-native English speakers  Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.  Vacancy questions If you have any questions regarding this vacancy, you may contact H. Leslie (science-related questions):  Name: Dr. H. Leslie (scientific supervisor) Position: Scientist E-mail: heather.leslie@vu    No agencies

title: Consultant – Data and AI (Microsoft)
summary: Preferred if you have been client facing yourself in the project (e.g. data science or data engineering team lead or a solution architect).
description: Would you like to work with clients in solving their most critical business problems with data? Do you have the passion to engage with teams that design, develop and deploy artificial intelligence concepts on data and convert them into actionable insights? Are you energized by a career option when you will work with some of the most advanced tools and technology available on the Microsoft platform to build solutions that will steer digital transformation programs at some of the most biggest brands in business? Then this is the opportunity you’ve been waiting for.  Your Job  As a Consultant – Data and AI in the Accenture Microsoft Business Group (AMBG), you will drive different aspects of advisory work within the team, which include – Consulting: Playing a key role in supporting the team to design custom solutions and value propositions in Data and AI for our clients. You will leverage the vast library of global assets prepared by AMBG to impact client conversations and drive value. Solutioning: Architecting new solutions as responses to formal requests (e.g. RFP) from the client. You will work with cross-domain teams (Microsoft/Avanade/Accenture) including client teams, to cocreate prototypes and drive innovation for the unit Architecture: Responsible for quality and efficiency in delivering projects in Data and AI on the Microsoft Azure Platform, mainly in architect capacity. You will enable clients to sustain and scale products built on Microsoft Platform technology. Thought Leadership: Supporting initiatives that will drive the overall growth of Microsoft based data and AI awareness within the organization via blogs, marketing, RFP response etc. In a nutshell, you’re both strategizing as well as working hands-on the technology and the customer to drive valuable business outcomes!  Your Team  You will be joining one of the fastest growing areas within Accenture. AMBG is a unique partnership between Accenture, Avanade (the number 1 partner of Microsoft), and Microsoft itself. We established AMBG to bring a new level of investment and collaboration across the three companies. You will be part of a global network with the opportunity to build enterprise-wide, industry-specific solutions, leveraging the Microsoft platform. You will have the ability to harness the unparalleled capabilities, global scale and solution development of three powerhouse teams: Accenture’s broad industry expertise, Microsoft’s powerful digital technologies and Avanade’s specialization in the Microsoft ecosystem.  You will work in a core team with a startup mentality that has the passion and the drive to create something new every day. At the same time, the team will rely on your contribution to become an agent of positive change for Accenture.  Your Background  Degree: Bachelor or Master’s degree in computer-science or engineering or mathematics or associated techno-quantitative fields Bonus points if you also have a business administration degree Methodology: At least 3-5 years of hands-on experience in applying machine learning and other advanced analytics techniques in AI, using either open source technologies like Pytorch, Tensor Flow or based on Microsoft Azure Platform technology  Technology: Applied understanding of the Microsoft Azure Platform ecosystem for Data and AIIn-depth knowledge of Data & AI related services in Azure like: Azure Machine Learning Studio, Azure Databricks, Cognitive Services, Bot Framework, and/or Azure data warehousing services etc. Bonus points if you have obtained one/combination of Microsoft certifications: Azure AI engineer, Azure Data Scientist, Azure Data Engineer  Projects: A minimum of 3 years of demonstrated experience of delivering projects where you have applied one or more of the methodology and technology highlighted above in a client environment and you are able to quantify the outcome of the data or AI project delivered. Preferred if you have been client facing yourself in the project (e.g. data science or data engineering team lead or a solution architect) Presales/solutioning: Experience of having worked on RFP responses, technical demonstrations and proof of concepts, preferably with client facing consulting experience. You are fluent in Dutch and English; Good communication skills; ability to tailor your message and language to audience Strong analytical skills: ability to translate complex business requirements in a solid advice to the customer Ability to work in dynamic, cross functional teams within Accenture and its ecosystem Bonus points if you can demonstrate experience in Design Thinking and Agile Scrum methodologies  Our Offer Accenture is an incredible place to work, keep learning and increasing your Technology Quotient (TQ) and business acumen. By joining AMBG, you have the opportunity to shape customer conversations and deliver projects by working with international, multi-disciplinary and cross functional teams, at the cutting edge of innovation, empowered by Microsoft.  Furthermore, Accenture offers you a unique environment in which you can advance your skills through comprehensive training opportunities, professional development and certification support, as well as learning from, with and to others (like mentoring) in a diverse and cross functional team. Plus, it gets even better with the excellent employee benefits we offer: A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card) A personal learning budget Discount on Accenture shares Possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week  Interested Are you ready to take the next step in your career? To help clients transform digitally, empowered by advanced analytics and artificial intelligence, based on the Microsoft platform? Then apply now!  Questions? Connect with Annick van Kerkum, annick.van.kerkum@accenture.com

title: Climate Change Adaptation Specialist
summary:
Strong quantitative skills in terms of analyzing and processing large data sets;
You will be member of a larger team of scientists within and outside Wageningen…
description: Are you a hardworking researcher with strong quantitative skills and knowledge of climate change impact assessments and adaptation development? Do you have the ability to deploy simulation models especially in crop production and water resources for climate impact assessment and adaptation development? Perhaps this position can be the ideal job for you!  For our team Climate Resilience at Wageningen Environmental Research, we are hiring a Climate Change Adaptation Specialist. You will work on topics such as: climate change impacts on water availability and food production around the world; adaption to climate change in food systems; resilience to climate variability and change.  You will primarily analyse climate data and quantitively assess the impacts of climate change on water availability and food production using agricultural, hydrological and/or water resources models. Based on the model analyses you will craft adaptation strategies and pathways, and assess their effectiveness and robustness using both quantitative and qualitative analytical tools.  You will participate and contribute to international projects, including projects in East Africa and South/South East Asia. You will actively engage with various partners and clients from governments, NGOs and commercial enterprises You will contribute to the acquisition of a sustainable project portfolio. Your project results will be disseminated through client oriented reports and possibly papers in peer-reviewed journals and conference proceedings; using popular media is encouraged. You will be member of a larger team of scientists within and outside Wageningen UR working on this topic. We offer excellent terms of employment. A few highlights from our Collective Labour Agreement include:  working hours that can be discussed and arranged so that they allow for the best possible work-life balance; the option to accrue additional holiday hours by working more, up to 40 hours per week; sabbatical leave, study leave, and paid parental leave; there is a strong focus on vitality and you can make use of the sports facilities available on campus for a small fee; a fixed December bonus of 3%; excellent pension scheme.  In addition to these first-rate employee benefits, you will of course receive a good salary. We offer, depending on your experience, a competitive gross salary of between €3.336,- and € 5.183,- for a full-time working week of 36 hours, in accordance with the CLA Wageningen Research (scale 11). The appointment is for minimally 32 and maximally 36 hours per week, for a period of 24 months. In case of good functioning and if future research financing allows, there is a possibility for a permanent position after 2 years.  WUR encourages internal advancement opportunities and mobility with an internal recruitment policy. There are plenty of options for personal initiative in a learning environment, and we provide excellent training opportunities. We are offering a multi-faceted position in an international environment with a pleasant and open working atmosphere.  Coming from abroad We are the #1 research centre for life sciences in the domains of agriculture, environmental science and food. The themes we deal with are relevant to everyone around the world and Wageningen, therefore, has a large international community and a lot to offer to international employees. Applicants from abroad moving to the Netherlands may qualify for a special tax relief, known as the 30% ruling. Our team of advisors on Dutch immigration procedures will help you with the visa application procedures for yourself and, if applicable, for your family.  Feeling welcome also has everything to do with being well informed. Wageningen University & Research's International Community page contains practical information about what we can do to support international employees and students coming to Wageningen. Furthermore, we can assist you with any additional advice and information about helping your partner to find a job, housing, schooling, and other issues. The mission of Wageningen University and Research is “To explore the potential of nature to improve the quality of life”. Wageningen University and the specialised research institutes of the Wageningen Research Foundation have joined forces in contributing to find solutions to important questions in the domain of healthy food and living environment.  With its roughly 30 branches, 6.500 employees and 12.500 students, Wageningen University & Research is one of the leading organisations in its domain. A coordinated approach to problems and the cooperation between various subject areas are at the heart of Wageningen’s outstanding approach. WUR has been named Best Employer in the Education category for 2019-2020.  The Climate Resilience team Climate change will impact every aspect of society and nature. Analysing present and future trends to assess impacts on all sectors of society is essential for the development of solution-oriented management and policy options. Policy makers at every governmental level as well as managers in both small and large private companies seek solutions to protect their assets from the adverse effects of climate. Beyond that, they often also seek to gain from the opportunities offered by climate change and to connect any interventions with non-climate issues to seek synergies and efficiency improvements. The Climate Resilience team has built up a considerable track record in this complex field, studying interactions between hydrology, land cover and land use (including urban environments) and climate (change) in the Netherlands and worldwide. Our main areas of interest are climate resilient cities, climate information services and nature-based solutions for climate adaptation. • a university degree (MSc) in agricultural sciences, environmental sciences, climate sciences or earth sciences. A PhD is preferable; strong quantitative skills in terms of analyzing and processing large data sets; at least three years of proven experience with modelling impact of climate change on water resources, and/or at least three years of proven experience with modelling impact of climate change on agricultural production; proven experience in climate change adaptation project development and implementation; demonstrated experience with project acquisition; customer-oriented attitude; excellent writing and oral communication skills in English for diverse audiences; ambition to publish future work; a great teammate who can work independently and who also communicates well with colleagues, partners and (potential) clients and research funding agencies. Desirable requirements include: experience with any of the models we already use (LPJmL, VIC, WOFOST, CERES, CropSyst, SWAT); experiences with downscaling methods; experience with the visualisation of impact assessment results to facilitate communication to partners; experience with GIS, R, Python. To learn more about this vacancy please contact Rutger Dankers, researcher, rutger.dankers@wur.nl, tel: +31317487506; Confidence Duku, researcher, confidence.duku@wur.nl; tel: +31317486551; or Annemarie Groot, team leader Climate Resilience, annemarie.groot@wur.nl; tel: +31651716934  For questions about the procedure, you can contact Edgar Tijhuis, corporate recruiter, edgar.tijhuis@wur.nl  Do you want to apply? You can apply directly by uploading your motivation letter and CV, using the apply button on the vacancy page on our website which will allow us to process your personal information with your approval. This vacancy will be listed up to and including 22 March 2021. We will schedule the first interviews two weeks later.  Equal opportunities Wageningen University & Research (WUR) employs a large number of people with very different backgrounds and qualities, who inspire and motivate each other. We want every talent to feel at home in our organisation and be offered the same career opportunities. We therefore especially welcome applications from people who are underrepresented at WUR. For more information please go to our inclusive webpage. A good example of how WUR deals with inclusiveness can be read on the page working at WUR with a functional impairment.

title: Sales Manager - Europe
summary: Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine,…
description: LOGEX is hiring a Sales Manager - Europe Healthcare is one of the world’s fastest developing industries, and, like in other fields, there’s great potential to employ insights gained from (big) data and technology to improve quality and affordability. LOGEX delivers analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision making in every area of healthcare — from operations and finance, to clinical and patient outcomes. Through our mission of turning data into better healthcare, we empower and bring clarity to decisions that lead to improvements in healthcare costs and outcomes. The right people make this all possible. To further support our mission, LOGEX is currently looking to hire a Sales Manager. DRIVEN BY DATA, POWERED BY PEOPLE Data is at the core of the solutions we offer, but people are at the heart of everything we do. Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics – are values for building long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with all our customers. THE CHALLENGE To reach our potential as LOGEX Life Science we are looking to grow more through international sales. We are looking for someone who is able to work proactively in seeking and creating new sales opportunities in LOGEX’s areas of focus. By doing so we are seeking to build and expanding our international network to sell our solutions at an international level. As a Sales Manager your mission is to get awareness of the capabilities of LOGEX Life Science in Europe. You will be able to convince pharma of our added value. Furthermore, it is important you develop and nurture strong client relationships. With the Life Science team you will build an international network by selling our products on a multinational level and create brand awareness through networking.  Experience & skills You have more than 7 years of relevant work experience You have experience in working with pharma; You have a proven record of sales results and a structured way of working; You have a pragmatic ‘can-do’ mentality; You have a strong drive and want to have an impact on the business; You have a commercial mindset and build relationships easily; You are fluent in English. We offer A challenging and alternating job where you’re not only offered the opportunity to excel quantitively, but also develop new products that anticipate on the specific problems in healthcare; Besides excellent working conditions, a vibrant working environment in a young, international, enthusiastic and talented team where hard work and having fun go hand-in-hand. We have weekly drinks and regularly fun team activities; Training and coaching; The opportunity to have a valuable social contribution to optimize the healthcare of the Netherlands and the rest of Eurpe. Interested? We would like to tell you more about this exciting opportunity! You can apply by the below button and upload your motivation letter and CV. For more information or if you have any questions you can contact Dafna Elkabas via dafna.elkabas@logex.com. Please send your application in English.

title: Data Scientist / Project Manager – CTRM System Implementation
summary:
1-2 years of managing a team of analysts / data scientists.
The data scientist / project manager position is part of the Commodity Risk Management function…
description: Kraft Heinz, The Company As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people. Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.  Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration  We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage. As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day. Job Description About the Position The data scientist / project manager position is part of the Commodity Risk Management function within KHC Global Procurement team. The role is responsible for deploying a Commodity Trading and Risk Management digital solution for KHC global portfolio of commodities. It is a key position that will play a critical role in progressing the function to the next level of advancement via implementation of best-in-class digital capabilities. The position will have an opportunity to be a part of a large organizational transformation of KHC’s Commodity Risk Management business processes and tools. The candidate will have an opportunity to participate/lead the implementation of the future-state KHC Commodity Risk Management platform on the cloud and manage related enhancement projects. Reporting to the Global Head of Commodity Risk Management you will be working in a high performing team, alongside peers always trying to reach the next level.  In brief, you will be responsible for: Project Management Represent Commodity Risk Management as a core member of a broader cross functional project team that includes members from third party solution provider and implementation partner, internal KHC Finance and IT teams to successfully deploy the new Commodity Trading and Risk Management digital solution on time and on budget. A hands-on IT Project manager, able to write functional specs, test cases, perform testing, write training guides, conduct user-training workshops etc. Able to translate business challenges into technical requirements. Dive deep into details of the system applications to ensure quality, while understanding the big picture objectives of the project. Lead and perform business problem definition and solution modeling with the objective of keeping it as simple and efficient to use for business key users as possible. Lead the implementation of upgrades, new releases, and new functionalities of Commodity Trading and Risk Management System, as needed. Candidate will be responsible for becoming an internal expert in the future state KHC Commodity Trading and Risk Management platform. Data Analytics Develop and leverage a deep understanding of Kraft Heinz global commodity portfolio spend by business unit by commodity, coverage strategies and market fundamentals. Design routines to deliver timely, rigorous, and accurate reporting and analysis of exposures, risks, costs, purchase price variance, and inflation etc. to support business decision making and strengthen the control environment. Support month-end and quarter-end close process, in conjunction with the global and regional procurement finance teams, to generate timely and accurate team results for subsequent consolidation and reporting to the key leadership stakeholders. Work closely with the entire global procurement team, risk managers and procurement finance teams to ensure that annual standards are appropriately set. Supports commodity team with timely preparation for weekly/bi-weekly/monthly meetings with respective stakeholders. Support ad hoc reporting requirements and/or special projects. Process Standardization/Optimization : Lead regional and global process standardization initiatives. Continuously improve analytical capability, developing and deepening understanding of commodity exposures and drivers within it. May also facilitate the development of cost models where possible to identify commodity costs that may not have been currently clearly broken out from total purchase price. Interface with regional and corporate functions across procurement, finance, accounting, and treasury to understand and analyze hedging activity impacts across the business and program expansion opportunities. This includes developing tools and metrics to provide better insights into the hedging activities and key performance drivers for the team. Compliance Monitoring : Facilitate and oversee effective and consistent compliance and controls, both internally and externally, while ensuring financial integrity of the Commodities Spend Data. Provide constructive challenge to risk managers to ensure they are compliant to approved coverage strategies. Oversee daily mark-to-market value on existing commodity hedges, perform value-at-risk and market volatility analysis on uncovered portion of global commodity portfolio. Qualifications  Hard Skills ! Please note that you need to have a Working Permit for either EU or the US to proceed for this position. Please make sure you put your nationality on your resume. Unfortunately, we cannot proceed with candidates who need support for a working permit. Education. Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, business, finance, mathematics, economics, supply chain, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred. Work Experience. Minimum 5 years in a similar field with a global CPG company or with a global consulting company that specializes in large scale digital system implementations for CPG companies Knowledge/Abilities Must Have Hands-on experience of deploying at least one of the leading CTRM solutions such as SAP Commodity Module, Open Link, Triple Point, EKA Software, Kiodex etc. Advanced knowledge of Tableau data visualization software suite Advanced knowledge of MS Office including ability to create pivot tables and macros. Ability to design and employ a solid change management plan to ensure high user engagement, acceptance, and adoption of newly implemented digital capabilities Ability to deal simultaneously and effectively with many global stakeholders Sense of urgency to meet deadlines in a highly dynamic and fast-paced environment Detail orientation to ensure data accuracy under time pressure to deliver. Experience managing vendors and consultants. Desirable Understanding of basic commodity risk management techniques. Working knowledge of any of the following platforms – Bloomberg, Reuters, Fact Set, Future Source. 1-2 years of managing a team of analysts / data scientists Language Knowledge. English  Professional Attributes Communication Skills At Kraft Heinz you will easily be exposed to senior management, no matter your level. Therefore, it’s important you have excellent communication skills, to deal with all kinds of different stakeholders. Confident / Ability to give pushback You are a go getter, you are not easily thrown off your game, not even when you get resistance. Resilience You can bounce back after a disappointment or set back, big or small. And always continue to move onward & upward. Ability to Simplify We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex challenges. Commercial Sense You do not only want to win ; you hate to lose . You are always seeking for opportunities to expand your business and create more savings, while over delivering your targets. Analytical We are a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your strong analytical mindset. Result driven You do not only focus on your own results, but always do what is best for the company. Curiosity, positivity & enthusiasm You are curious, positive, and enthusiastic. People know you as the driver of the team. Time management skills Time management has no secrets for you. You are organized, structured and always have an overview of all the deliverables. You know how to bring multiple projects to a successful ending within the given timeframe. Networking skills You can be interesting and interested in business conversations, motivating people to want to be in your network. The stronger the network you have, the more easily you can get things done. You, highly aware of that, are constantly expending your network. Empathy – listening to the customer You are known for your empathy. You listen more and talk less, and therefore truly understand your customer. With that mindset you create commercial chances to optimize the customer experience. High pressure You do not get easily stressed by pressure, on the opposite, a demanding and dynamic environment is what keeps you energized. Team player Achieving results is nice but achieving results with the team is simply the best. You are a team player, which means you are sometimes a leader, sometimes a follower but always working towards the same common goal together with your teammates. What we offer you / You deserve An ambitious employer: we only want to be the best for you. A fast career track like only few other companies can match. A competitive salary and excellent bonus structure (above market). Permanent contract: for we believe in doing big bets on people. Reimbursement travel expenses. Always room for new ideas; if you have an excellent idea, please let us know and we can set it in action! Location(s) : Chicago, US or Amsterdam, NL Location(s) Amsterdam

title: Senior Consultant Data & Analytics
summary:
Ga je liever zelf aan de slag met de data van de klant, bijvoorbeeld de data doorgronden en combieren?
Je boekt resultaten door inzichten uit data te verbeteren…
description: Wil jij klanten helpen om de optimale treinlengte te bepalen voor personenvervoer op elk moment van de dag? De personeelsplanning analyseren van de duur dat een mammoettanker voor bevoorrading gemiddeld in de haven zal liggen? Voor een groot retail bedrijf voorspellen hoeveel werknemers ze per dag in moeten zetten op elke vestiging? Maar bijvoorbeeld ook bedrijven hun marketing & sales te vergroten door een klantwaardemodel voor het op te zetten? The best way to predict the future is to Invent it! Wij helpen klanten met het beantwoorden van belangrijke en complexe vraagstukken. Dat doen we onder andere door het bouwen van concrete Minimum Viable Products en door klanten ‘the art of the possible’ te laten zien.  Naar vacatureoverzicht Senior Consultant Data & Analytics Zet in favorieten Deel deze vacature Zet in favorieten Deel deze vacature IDE Data Business Data Strategy | Telecom, Transport & Distributie, Publieke sector, Aerospace en Defensie, Automotive, Consumer Products en Retail, Banken en Kapitaalmarkten, Utilities, Verzekeringen, Electronics en High Tech, Gezondheidszorg en Life Sciences, Manufacturing en Industrial Products, Media & Entertainment, Natural Resources | Full time Vanwege onze ambitie om te groeien hebben we op dit moment vacatures open voor Junior, Senior en Managing Consultants. Jouw uitdaging als Senior Consultant Data & Analytics Je helpt klanten op basis van analyse, kennis en creativiteit een toekomstbeeld te schetsen dat ten grondslag ligt aan verandertrajecten. Hierbij ben je de schakel tussen de klant en de Data Scientist en spreek je zowel de taal van de business, als van de Data Scientist. Je ontwikkelt strategieën die gebaseerd zijn op gegevensanalyse en je helpt organisaties te transformeren. Verder breng je potentiële problemen en verbetermogelijkheden in kaart bij een klant. Zo komen we samen met de klant tot oplossingen waar ze zelf nog nooit aan gedacht hadden. Je boekt resultaten door inzichten uit data te verbeteren en door structuur en governance aan te brengen. Je geeft klantervaringen (Customer Experience) gerichter vorm. Je verbetert dienstverlenings- en handelskanalen en ziet de mogelijkheden om ze verder uit te breiden. Je integreert en optimaliseert verschillende kanalen op het gebied van marketing performance. Verder streef je ernaar om bij klanten operationele processen en businessmodellen verder te verbeteren. Wat je verder zoal gaat doen? Je gaat interviews afnemen bij mensen in verschillende lagen van de organisatie om inzicht te krijgen in het probleem. Je stelt hypotheses op aan de hand van je bevindingen. Deze vormen de input voor een collega Data Scientist die ze gaat toetsen. Je interpreteert resultaten van analyses samen met je collega Data Scientist en vervolgens bespreek je deze resultaten met de organisatie. Door je eigen expertise over de markt en de kennis die aanwezig is bij de klant ga je vervolgactie definiëren. Deze acties zijn gericht op het realiseren van de potentiële waarde geïdentificeerd tijdens de analyses. Je gaat processen zo optimaal mogelijk inrichten in een dashboard. Je streeft ernaar dat het dashboard zoveel mogelijk overeen kan komen met de KPI’s van de organisatie van de klant. Je houdt rekening met de belangrijkste principes van Data Governance. Ga je liever zelf aan de slag met de data van de klant, bijvoorbeeld de data doorgronden en combieren? Ben jij goed in het opzetten van analyses en modellen? Dan past de rol van (Senior) Data Scientist wellicht bij jou. Wat jij ons brengt Je bent nieuwsgierig, durft anders te denken en je hebt echt een visie op het vakgebied. Bovendien heb je het vermogen om complexe vraagstukken snel te analyseren en nieuwe, scherpe inzichten en oplossingen te genereren. Ondanks dat je al de nodige ervaring bezit, ben je nooit uitgeleerd. Verder ben je een teamspeler en neem je graag initiatief. Je kunt zelfstandig een koers varen en je gaat altijd voor het beste resultaat. Wat je nog meer met je meebrengt? Een afgeronde WO Master opleiding met uitstekende studieresultanten. Opleidingen die goed aansluiten zijn bedrijfseconomisch georiënteerd met kwantitatieve vakken, zoals statistiek en/of modelleren. Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring, hierbij is ervaring in consultancy is een pré. Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, Duits is een pré. Je hebt een flexibele instelling en bent bereid om opdrachten in het buitenland te vervullen. Heb je minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring, bij voorkeur als consultant? Dan is het ook mogelijk om te solliciteren als Managing Consultant. Hier werk je mee aan het definiëren van nieuwe projecten en je geeft hierbij richting aan het Data & Analytics gedeelte. Wat je naast bovenstaande punten nog meer met je meebrengt? Je hebt de nodige ervaring opgedaan als leidinggevende, binnen deze rol ga je namelijk ook grote projecten aansturen. Je hebt een groot netwerk en je breidt deze graag verder uit. Je hebt ervaring met Sales waardoor je nieuwe kansen spot voor het uitrollen van nieuwe projecten. Je bent een expert op het gebied van Data & Analytics. Wat motiveert jou? Bij Capgemini Invent wordt je gedrevenheid beloond, er is veel ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. We staan bekend om onze op maat gemaakte groeipaden, onze individuele begeleiding en onze trainingen zowel on-the-job als op onze Capgemini University in Parijs. Er zijn veel doorgroeimogelijkheden vanuit deze Senior Consultant rol. Wat wij jou bieden Samen met het team werk je in een dynamisch werkveld dat volop in ontwikkeling is. Je werkt aan uitdagende projecten, complexe vraagstukken om kwantificeerbare waarde toe te voegen bij een klant. Het project stop niet bij het aanleveren van inzichten: je helpt de klant echt transformeren zodat ze klaar zijn voor de toekomst. Binnen het team Insights-Driven Buisiness Innovation houden we elkaar scherp, maar we staan ook altijd voor elkaar klaar om te helpen en voor kennisdeling. Het team is grotendeels zelf organiserend en is bereid om samen nét dat beetje extra te leveren bij de klant. Het mooie is dat we binnen ons team en in samenwerking met de ‘AI Garage’ alle capaciteiten in huis hebben om de oplossing ook echt te maken. Op die manier heeft Capgemini Invent een goede reputatie opgebouwd voor data science opdrachten en heeft zo grote klanten aan zich weten te binden met interessante vraagstukken. Wat we verder nog bieden? Uitstekende faciliteiten om flexibel te werken, inclusief een laptop en een telefoonabonnement; premievrij pensioen, je hoeft geen bijdrage te doen in het basis schema; een vast contract met marktconform salaris passend bij jouw functie en ervaring 26 vakantiedagen per jaar en de mogelijkheid om vakantiedagen bij te kopen; een vergoeding voor je reiskosten. Deze mobiliteitsvergoeding kun je inzetten voor een leaseauto, NS businesscard of bruto laten uitkeren. Ben jij de nieuwe Senior Consultant Data & Analytics? Deins jij niet terug voor een uitdaging en help jij organisaties graag bij al hun complexe vraagstukken? Dan zien wij jouw sollicitatie graag tegemoet. Benieuwd naar meer informatie over Capgemini en onze mensen? Dat lees je op werken bij Capgemini.

title: Fulfilment Optimization Director (Multi-node Director)
summary: 5+ years hands-on experience working with analytics in a Supply Chain Environment; understands Analytics tools and is able to partner with data scientists, but…
description: Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accountants, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day. NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game. The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide — making the impossible happen every single day. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR As the Fulfilment Optimizaion Director (Multi-Node Fulfilment) you always start with the consumer in mind. You will be responsible to build and execute our Multi-node strategy across Operations & Logistics in EMEA with a sharp point on enabling the information flow through data and analytics. To serve our consumers across EMEA in the best possible way we are building a new network that enables us to deliver to the consumer when, where and how they want Nike’s Product with a primary focus on the Digital Consumer. You understand Nike’s consumer needs and you can translate those needs into developing and running a state of the art Multi-Node fulfilment network based on Data, Analytics and Insights. You get excited by building and running automated, algorithm steered, demand driven, flexible, solutions that enables dynamic positioning and managing of our inventory in the right location across the Multi-Node fulfillment network. In this role you are a core member of the Multi-Node Fulfillment Leadership team as well as part of the wider EMEA Marketplace Operations Leadership team. You play a role that spans across Marketplace Operations and Logistics. WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON You will be the vocal point for the Multi-Node fulfilment strategy both on building it and running it in EMEA through a cross-functional team. You will accountable for an optimal inventory utilization across the multi-node network to balance cost and service while increasing stock turn. Aligning inbound and outbound with capacity, demand plans and EMEA Inventory strategy. You will lead the development, implementation and running of innovative and analytical capabilities to deliver end to end automated solutions to flow and deploy inventory across the Multi-Node network with a focus on building the Intelligence and Analytics through algorithms, AI and Machine Learning. You will also lead and grow a small team of Supply Chain and Analytics experts through the Nike Leadership Defined Model (Grow Yourself, Grow Together, Grow The Business). Building, nurturing and growing their Analytics and Supply Chain skills. WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH You'll sit in the Multi-Node fulfillment team, but because of the nature of this work you will partner with and across many different Functions in EMEA and Nike Global. You will closely work with our Operation Teams in Digital, Capability Building and Logistics. Cross-functionally you'll work closely with Partners in Nike Digital Commerce, Analytics, Technology and Demand Supply Management. You will need to be comfortable being a servant leader, managing relationships on multiple levels and prioritising in a matrix organisation. WHAT YOU BRING A minimum of 10+ years Supply Chain, Allocation, or Planning, experience in a Retail, FMCG or Consumer Goods business 5+ years hands-on experience working with analytics in a Supply Chain Environment; understands Analytics tools and is able to partner with data scientists, but also with business and supply chain teams to translate analytics into insights Experience with multi-node supply chain, where you have made practical business impact, applying commercial judgment and critical thinking Thorough understanding of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, as well as Supply Chain Analytics Strong history of leading multi-functional agile teams utilising data science, machine learning algorithms and/or statistical modelling Proficiency working with technology teams, to develop and sustain solutions Demonstrated ability to work in a large, matrixed organization, influencing others and building strong cross-functional relationships Collaborate partnerships to both deliver projects and drive cultural change in an organisation Bias for action, commitment to results while demonstrating positive attitude and passion Track record helping analytics professionals grow NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world. NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Associate Director Statistics - Ophthalmology / Gene Therapy
summary:
Serves as a role model, and mentor to statisticians and other scientists.
Demonstrates sophisticated data analytic expertise based on a foundation of…
description: Janssen Research & Development, LLC., a Johnson and Johnson Company is hiring an Associate Director, Biostatistics to support the development of compounds for our Immunology portfolio. We discover and develop innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. In this highly visible role, the Associate Director provides lead support for the design, execution, analysis, interpretation, and reporting or communication of data. This position takes a leadership role in the input for clinical development plans. Identifies and assists in the implementation of innovative statistical approaches. Represents Statistics & Decision Sciences (SDS) cross-functional and intra-departmental teams and working groups. Expertise: Has an established track record of problem-solving and troubleshooting including significant regulatory and decision-making support at a program level. Demonstrates sophisticated data analytic expertise based on a foundation of statistical principles and a strong track record of applied experience leading to successful support of multiple programs. Is effective in the use of relevant computational tools for study, experiment, or trial research objectives. Applies sophisticated statistical methodology in assigned projects, such as clinical trials, with demonstrated coordinated disease/scientific/functional area understanding and health authority acceptability. Quality and Compliance: Follows organization and company standard operating procedures in timely fashion, such as training and project time accounting. Understands and aligns with relevant regulatory guidance. Takes ownership for the quality and timeliness of project results, as assessed by partners such as the project team, the clinical trial team, and the Statistics Area Head. Follows standard methodologies for Data Integrity. Drug Development: Demonstrates detailed knowledge of pharmaceutical research and development strategies and execution. As a leader providing SDS support to experimental design, modeling, analysis planning, analysis execution, interpretation and statistical communication. Is accountable as a point of contact leader for a specific project or program and the management of all related project/program results. Is an established leader for providing input to team for optimising study or trial designs in line with study or indication level objectives, and supports scenario simulations and sample size calculations based on relevant technical and scientific disease functional knowledge. May serve on the SDS TA team led by the Global Statistical Sciences TA Head. Innovation: Leading in an area of technical expertise with a track record for suggesting, evaluating and implementing successful alternative or innovative ways to statistical methods or business processes.
