Daarbij wordt tevens invulling gegeven aan het vertalen van de maatschappelijke opgave van de ketenpartners binnen de justitiële keten naar een ketenstrategie voor de Justitiële Informatiedienst welke zowel in- als extern gedragen wordt. De directie Ketenstrategie signaleert, analyseert, evalueert en doet dit op proactieve en transparante wijze en gericht op lerend vermogen. Dit alles vindt plaats in een turbulente omgeving met o.a. een ontwikkeling naar gedigitaliseerde (strafrecht)ketens. De directie Ketenstrategie denkt mee, draagt bij aan het bepalen van de strategische richting van de organisatie en realiseert de strategische doelen. De directie geeft daarmee richting aan de overige onderdelen van Justid. Ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid - Justitiële Informatiedienst Een veiliger en rechtvaardige samenleving....Het klinkt zo simpel, maar het is wel dé uitdaging van het ministerie van Justitie en Veiligheid. Waarvoor staat Justid? Oké, de kans is aanwezig dat je onze organisatie nog niet kent. We zijn een slimme en unieke organisatie die zorgt dat de ene hand van justitie weet wat de andere doet. Met onze ICT-systemen zorgen we er voor dat zeer belangrijke gegevens duurzaam digitaal beschikbaar zijn voor onze klanten binnen het ministerie. De klanten waar we voor werken, ken je wel. Dat zijn de politie, het openbaar ministerie, de Rechtspraak, Raad voor de Kinderbescherming, IND, etc. Juist omdat wij met al deze klanten te maken hebben, spelen wij een cruciale rol in de informatievoorziening tussen deze partijen. Wat doet Justid? Vingerafdrukken, informatie over een strafverleden of de geldigheid van een verblijfsvergunning, informatie voor slachtoffers en burgemeesters wanneer een dader weer vrijkomt… slechts een handvol voorbeelden van informatie die wij, via onze slimme voorzieningen, beschikbaar stellen. Informatie die strikt vertrouwelijk is en met veel zorg moet worden behandeld. Het is namelijk van groot belang dat de juiste en volledige informatie tijdig beschikbaar is voor bevoegden. Door slim gebruik te maken van bestaande technologie en door innovaties en creativiteit te stimuleren, maken wij dit mogelijk. Natuurlijk in nauwe samenwerking met onze klanten -organisaties binnen Justitie en Veiligheid- die grote maatschappelijke belangen behartigen in de samenleving. Dat maakt ons werk extra uitdagend en uniek.

title: Medical Scientific Expert
summary: You prepare and deliver presentations for sales force training programmes and other materials and briefing sessions, ensuring scientific data and medical…
description: Site Name: Netherlands - Amersfoort Posted Date: Feb 10 2021  As Medical Scientific Expert (MSE), you will gain scientific insights and provide authoritative opinion within a therapeutic area on medical, scientific and ethical matters to support GSK NL, enabling the evidence-based use of GSK vaccines and compliance with the relevant requirements (e.g. CGR, Geneesmiddelenwet, and EU Directives). You will effectively develop strong strategic relationships with key experts and external organizations to ensure that GlaxoSmithKline is seen as a leading voice and important stakeholder within the specific therapeutic area of vaccines in the Dutch healthcare environment. You will co-ordinate and utilize specialist knowledge with brand aligned colleagues in formulating and implementing short- and long-term medical strategy to create optimal benefit for patients. Your responsibilities: Provide expertise to internal and external stakeholders to ensure their informed decision are based on latest scientific data & knowledge You have a key role in the planning and development of medical, promotional and educational campaigns and (multichannel) materials, including ensuring the medical accuracy and compliance with the product license and the relevant Codes of Practice You work closely with marketing, commercial, market access, regulatory, and clinical colleagues on pre-launch planning, including strategic evidence planning, evidence generation and external expert engagement plan. You are responsible for coordinating GSKs response to complaints from bodies such as the IGJ or CGR – this will typically involve engaging members of the extended brand team e.g. brand manager, regulatory affairs manager, pharmaceutical quality manager You provide analyses and reviews of GSK products, therapy areas and competitor products, making recommendations, which assist marketing in the determination of current and future strategic direction. Provide Medical advice and training in all aspects of GSK’s business for the vaccines area Be a spokesperson at external scientific events and provide compelling presentations on scientific know how in the field of vaccinology and infectious disease control. Maintain an open and trustful work environment where constructive feedback is used as a tool to support each individual and provide opportunities to develop and evolve. You develop scientific tools (eg scientific platform content, presentation of new data, therapy area reviews, product monographs, slide sets, training packages etc) as appropriate to business and customer needs. Input into the defense of complaints made by competitor companies, medical professionals or regulatory authorities against GSK promotional statements or activities. You prepare portfolios of data and input into product submissions for influential bodies such as the ZorgInstituut, Gezondheidsraad, RIVM, GGD. You ensure the medical information department is up to date on new products/campaigns and commercial issues by leading training and factsheet management and by giving advice on complex issues. You prepare and deliver presentations for sales force training programmes and other materials and briefing sessions, ensuring scientific data and medical concepts are understood and promotional strategy is consistent with scientific data. For vaccines sponsored studies, you serve as Local Medical Lead (LML) and provide local support to the study design; provide medical/scientific leadership to the local study conduct team and manage all local medical activities required before study start, during the study and after study completion and analysis; provides input on local risk management activities and medical oversight on study quality. Specific Activities Non-promotional Activities Develop networks in the therapeutic areas across the Netherlands and GSK as a whole. Contribute to the development, attend and present at appropriate meetings (advisory board meetings, scientific workshops, investigator meetings, expert meetings, and CME meetings). Develop and maintain up-to-date knowledge of the therapy areas by reviewing the literature, discussions with key opinion leaders and key stakeholders, participating in cross functional interactions, attending scientific congresses, etc. Supporting scientific research and clinical studies (GSK sponsored/supported). Ensure the right approval processes of GSK supported studies (ISSs), and the follow up during the life cycle of the research project. Leading the management of Grants&Donations Ensure the approval process and proper documentation, contracts and payments of G&Ds. Follow the procedures and follow up after the approval of the G&Ds. Medical review adverse events and pharmaceutical quality issues To provide relevant input into Area-specific clinical development strategies for regional Phase IV clinical plans or market access studies. When Medical Doctor: review of sentinel events in clinical studies. Participate in LIRCs to review the medical impact of the quality related issues. Key role in the areas of Scientific communication, Medical Governance, risk & issues management. Li-GSK Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Scientific Master required in Life-Sciences, Medical or Pharmacy degree or equivalent, with an advanced degree and/or certification preferred. Significant experience in a role successfully engaging in scientific exchange with external experts. Excellent presentation and teaching skills to represent the company in a professional manner at medical, scientific and public events. Fluent in Dutch & English Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics it would be a plus: Preferably a MD, BIG-registered, or life scientist with PhD and scientific expertise within specific therapy area and/or Pharmaceutical Physician NVFG. Experience in vaccinology, immunology and/or infectious diseases Medical background and a working knowledge of the legal and regulatory environment for medicines promotion & scientific communication. Clinical development of medicines experience is a plus. Why GSK? Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust. At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution. We provide a supportive working environment, and a range of development challenges and opportunities. We also offer competitive benefits and compensation packages designed to attract and to retain the very best. If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US). GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class. Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

title: Python/Data Engineer
summary:
Collaborate with domain experts, analysts and data scientists to solve data challenges.
Knowledge of data modeling and data warehousing concepts.
description: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the data team at Matrixian Group, who will help design and develop the pipelines and algorithms to build and extend features in the Matrixian Platform. You will work with fellow data engineers to maintain and improve our infrastructure to collect, structure, improve and share data with downstream and client-facing applications for Real Estate, Address Intelligence and Urban Intelligence. Full-time · Amsterdam About the job role As a data engineer you'll work on data collection, data pipelines, ETL, databases, and APIs. You'll help further develop our Cloud and data center hosted infrastructure. Your work is instrumental to keep our complex, distributed platform resilient to data integrity issues, service disruptions and free from vulnerabilities. You will structure our data so it flows efficiently and securely through the data pipelines to meet client SLA’s and security standard requirements. Your passion is to work with the latest and greatest technologies that make working with large amounts of data easy. You are pro-active in keeping yourself up to date and are always looking for ways how to apply new technologies to our benefit. You will work closely and collaboratively in an Agile environment with our data scientists/analysts, Platform development engineers and product teams to take Matrixian data services from conception to production deployment. Job elements Collaborate with domain experts, analysts and data scientists to solve data challenges Apply data modelling methodologies and contribute to a robust data platform Design, develop, and test new data-related features for our platform Design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines Monitoring the already established data pipelines Create high-quality code that is scalable, reliable and reusable Optimize data pipelines and workflow to maximize operational performance and efficiency Give input on how to improve the scalability and security of our data platform Enable and run data migrations across different databases and different servers Manipulate, process and extract value from large disconnected datasets Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.   Requirements Strong programming skills in Python In-depth knowledge of data manipulation and transformation Hands-on experience building complex ETL data pipelines Experience in setting up/maintaining both SQL as well as noSQL databases Skilled in use of deployment and provisioning automation tools e.g. Docker Strong expertise/background with Linux Knowledge in security, authentication and authorization e.g. LDAP Knowledge of data modeling and data warehousing concepts Experience with version control/Git Strong written and verbal English communication skills Experience in Agile/Scrum Teamplayer Responsible Flexible Must-have skills MongoDB ElasticSearch MySQL Python 3.7 & 3.8 Experience with at least two of these Python packages: FastAPI, Flask, Requests, BeautifulSoup, Selenium Experience with at least two of these Python libraries: asyncio, concurrent futures, multiprocessing, threading Git / Version control Docker CI/CD Bash Linux Apache Airflow Web scraping What we offer Good salary 25 holidays 8% holiday pay Lots of responsibility, independence and room for initiatives and possibilities to make your mark

title: Postdoc position in computational imaging for industrial quality control
summary:
CWI is an internationally oriented institute, with 160 scientists from approximately 30 countries.
Our research group is developing the next generation of 3D…
description: Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) has a vacancy in the Computational Imaging research group for a three-year position, on the subject of Real-time analysis of volumetric data acquired from X-Ray imaging. Job description The Computational Imaging group is looking for a motivated postdoctoral researcher with an interest in machine learning technologies for real-time analysis of 3D volumetric data. The postdoc candidate will participate in the project “Universal Three-dimensional Passport for process Individualization in Agriculture (UTOPIA)". The goal of the UTOPIA project is to research and develop a next generation in-line 3D X-ray scanning of agricultural products. UTOPIA combines the expertise of CWI on 3D image reconstruction and machine learning with in-depth knowledge on agricultural products from Wageningen University and Utrecht University and industrial partners in high-volume production systems for processing fruits (GREEFA) and poultry (Meyn). The postdoc position will advance state-of-the-art machine learning based feature detection techniques, with the aim to extract morphological information from the 3D internal representation of a food product. By linking morphological information to functional properties, real-time decisions related to quality control can be made during processing of the product. Requirements Candidates are required to have a PhD degree in computer science, mathematics, electrical and electronic engineering, or related fields. Candidates are expected to have a keen interest in computational imaging and a proven knowledge in machine learning for image processing, and to have an excellent command of English. Terms and conditions The terms of employment are in accordance with the Dutch Collective Labour Agreement for Research Centres ("CAO-onderzoeksinstellingen"). The gross monthly salary for an employee on a full time basis, depending on relevant work experience, ranges from € 3,653 to € 4,452. The appointment will be for a period of three years. Employees are also entitled to a holiday allowance of 8% of the gross annual salary and a year-end bonus of 8.33%. CWI offers attractive working conditions, including flexible scheduling. Please visit our website for more information about our terms of employment: https://www.cwi.nl/jobs/terms-of-employment Information and application Applications should include a detailed CV, a motivation letter, and a digital copy of the PhD thesis. The application deadline is April 1st, 2021, but the application process may close sooner if a suitable candidate is found. For residents outside the EER-area, a Toefl English language test might be required. For more information about the vacancy, please contact Dr. Tristan van Leeuwen, email: t.van.leeuwen@cwi.nl For more information about CWI, please visit www.cwi.nl or watch our video about working at CWI. Diversity code CWI encourages a diverse workforce: we endeavour to develop talent and creativity by bringing people from different backgrounds and cultures together. We recruit and select based on capabilities and talent. We strongly encourage everyone with the appropriate qualifications to apply for the vacancy, regardless of age, gender, origin, sexual orientation or physical abilities. About CWI Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) is the Dutch national research institute for mathematics and computer science and is an institute of the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO). The mission of CWI is to conduct pioneering research in mathematics and computer science, generating new knowledge in these fields and conveying it to trade, industry, and society at large. CWI is an internationally oriented institute, with 160 scientists from approximately 30 countries. The facilities are first-rate and include excellent IT support, career planning, training, and courses. CWI is located at Science Park Amsterdam that is presently developing into a major location of research in the natural sciences in the Netherlands, housing the sciences of the University of Amsterdam as well as several other national research institutes next to CWI. About Research group Our research group is developing the next generation of 3D imaging – enabling scientists to look further into objects of all kinds. Based on mathematics, algorithms and numerical solution techniques, our approach is interdisciplinary, combining aspects of mathematics, computer science and physics. We pride ourselves on the versatility of our solutions, and our algorithms can be applied to a wide range of imaging in science, medicine and industry. In Computational Imaging, it’s our goal to constantly push the boundaries of research. By combining advanced image acquisition, parameter estimation, and discrete tomography algorithms for example, we are able to develop workflows for 3D electron microscopy at atomic resolution.

title: Product Owner
summary: This includes working with the Twill pricing team and data scientist(s) to bring advanced pricing models and products to accelerate Twill’s growth.
description: Do you want to develop a digital platform that will disrupt the consolidated logistics industry? The Twill vision is to create a world where products & services can flow freely for everyone – and we are just at the beginning of an exciting journey. We want to remove the logistical barriers of international trade (freight forwarding) for small to midsize customers. We need your help to smoothen the customer experience of getting a quotation and ensure that this quotation is what the customer will receive as an invoice. This includes working with the Twill pricing team and data scientist(s) to bring advanced pricing models and products to accelerate Twill’s growth. You are part of a cross-functional, self-managed team, building the product together with software engineers, UX/UI designers, and scrum masters. Moreover, as a data-driven Product Owner, you’ll work closely with business partners in sales, operations, and fellow Product & Tech colleagues. Here’s a little taste of your challenge…  1. Most of all you are responsible for your own domain in customer-facing product development and you will always push people to improve the user journey while making sure it is consistent, reliable, and scalable. 2. You are the front runner of moving a sales-driven industry to a digital sales-driven journey, together with your product owner colleagues. 3. Define and maintain your product backlog, prioritize features based on value, create your product domain vision and strategy, create transparency with stakeholders and development teams. 4. Refine business requirements with development teams: engage both designers and developers in defining and refining epics and user stories. 5. Engage with stakeholders, analyze user behavior and market trends to define what features to maximize value and innovate 6. Be creative in positioning Twill’s pricing strategy in the competitive market and find the right strategic partners and initiatives to accelerate.  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US? You will have the opportunity to make a big impact, having the responsibility for providing an instant quotation to our customers it would be impossible to run Twill. Without you, customers would still need to wait days till weeks before they have negotiated a usually intransparent quotation. Next, we like to have fun at Twill. There is no sense in coming to work every day if you don’t like the people you work with. On top of that, you can expect: A wonderful opportunity to make a big impact on your domain by leading the product prioritization and roadmap. You will be “a spider in the web” and "CEO" of your product(s). Being part of an experienced Product team, which gives you the opportunity to develop yourself further. Daily fresh fruit, lunch, drinks, and the best coffee you could wish for. On Fridays there is breakfast. A great place to work, only 600 meters walking from The Hague Central Station, multiple meeting rooms, phonebooths, ping-pong table, canteen. The right laptop for you. Do you prefer a MacBook Pro or Windows/Linux laptop? You choose. Competitive salary, a performance-based bonus, 30 annual leaves, a mobile phone, travel allowance, home internet contribution, and contribution to your pension scheme.  WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: A successful Product Owner at Twill can’t be defined. There is no one way to go about the work, and everyone is different. Probably you have experienced that yourself already over time. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind: More than 3 years (Scrum) Product Owner experience with developing high volume B2B or B2C e-commerce sites. An advanced Professional Scrum Product Owner certification is preferred. Passionate about product development, methodologies, and tools, plus constantly looking for ways to improve. Smart, hands-on, and creative individual who keeps the customer at the heart of everything you do, while having strong commercial awareness. A strong, well-supported opinion about the future of your domain. Data-driven. Base your decisions and prioritization on facts rather than opinions. Experience with Google Analytics is a must. Experience with user research and A/B testing are pré. Note: You are working, or are eligible to work as EU-citizen, in the Netherlands or Poland.

title: Associated Scientist (senior)
summary: The position requires planning, independency, and performing of experiments, followed by data analysis and reporting and presenting of the data to the…
description: Functie  We are looking for two (senior) technicians who are motivated to work in a multidisciplinary and international environment. Within a team you will be investigating the immunological response to new viral vaccine candidates using small animal models. These vaccine candidates may include vaccines against SARS-CoV2, HIV, or RSV.  Techniques that you will use include ELISA, neutralizing antibody assays to measure virus entry inhibition, ELISPOT, intracellular cytokine staining, in vivo imaging of small animals (bioluminescence and fluorescence), and other immunology and virology-related assays.  The position requires planning, independency, and performing of experiments, followed by data analysis and reporting and presenting of the data to the responsible scientist, and a broader audience.  Functie eisen  HLO or MSc degree in a life science related field  Holder of "artikel 6 or artikel 12" and hands-on experience required.  Experience with immunological and/or virological techniques is required.  Experience working with PBMCs is a nice to have.  Aanbod  A great job opportunity in a multidisciplinary and international environment.  Sollicitatie Procedure  Contactpersoon voor deze functie is Joost Storms, bereikbaar op telefoonnummer 023 55 78 529 of via e-mail: joost@xdes.nl Kenmerk: 9904.

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Banken zijn voor hun kernprocessen afhankelijk van data.
De Data Engineer is dé expert op gebied van data-infrastructuur.
Solliciteer nu en ervaar het zelf!
description: Zonder de Data Engineer geen werkbare data-aanpak bij de bank. Een fascinerende functie die iedere dag het uiterste van je vraagt. Solliciteer nu en ervaar het zelf! Wat maakt deze functie aantrekkelijk voor jou? Je verdient een goed salaris op basis van kennis en kunde; Je komt te werken in een datawalhalla. Wat ga je doen? De Data Engineer is dé expert op gebied van data-infrastructuur. Om alle in- en externe databronnen die een bank gebruikt goed samen te brengen in een bruikbare database heb je heel veel kennis nodig van scripting en programmeertalen. De Data Engineer verzamelt data uit meerdere bronnen en integreert zo zoveel mogelijk in één database (een Data Warehouse). Zonder Data Engineering is het analyseren van alle beschikbare data uit een organisatie niet mogelijk. Het werk van een Data Analist of Data Scientist kan pas beginnen als de Engineer klaar is. Banken zijn voor hun kernprocessen afhankelijk van data. Met name in de Risk & Compliance zijn ze bovendien zeer afhankelijk van de integratie van verschillende databronnen. Om die reden zijn banken doorlopend op zoek naar Data Engineers. De Data Engineer is in zijn dagelijkse werk ook betrokken bij datavraagstukken. Denk aan problemen met datakwaliteit of datagebruik. Van een Engineer wordt doorlopend verwacht dat hij meedenkt over problemen en de daarbij behorende oplossingen op datavlak. Daarbij stelt de Engineer zichzelf regelmatig de vraag: wat heeft de eindgebruiker (de klant) hier uiteindelijk aan? De Data Steward en de Business Analist zijn de voornaamste bewakers van deze datakwesties, maar de Engineer denkt hier zeker in mee en heeft een signalerende rol op dit vlak. Waarom kies jij voor deze functie? Je hebt al een aantal jaren ervaring als Data Engineer. Je technische kennis van databases kent geen grenzen. Een uitdaging is welkom. Je zoekt een markt waar data zo rijkelijk vloeit dat de beheersing van deze stroom een serieuze klus is. Het bankwezen bijvoorbeeld. Door de toenemende hoeveelheid transacties wordt de afhankelijkheid van data met de dag groter. En de data-afdelingen worden met de dag belangrijker. Dit trekt zeer veel professionals aan en dit maakt data-afdelingen van banken tot inspirerende werkplekken waar de passie voor het vak door iedereen dag in, dag uit ervaren wordt. Klinkt aanlokkelijk? Reageer dan zeker! Over het algemeen zijn er een aantal terugkerende functie-eisen voor Data Engineers: Je hebt een HBO/WO diploma op ICT-gebied; Je hebt minimaal twee jaar ervaring als Data Engineer; Je hebt verregaande kennis van programmeertalen zoals SQL; Je hebt ruimte ervaring met ETL-tooling. Waarom kies jij voor Carrierecafe? Carrierecafe streeft naar werkgeluk op de lange termijn. We leren de persoon achter jouw CV graag kennen. Onze recruiters hebben jarenlange ervaring in de financiële wereld en daarom weten we waar jij het beste tot je recht komt. Mogelijk is dat bij de opdrachtgever van deze vacature. Misschien zien we een andere loopbaankans voor je. We helpen je om succesvol te worden op je eigen manier. Carrierecafe communiceert transparant naar jou. We zijn overal eerlijk en concreet over. Voor en ná je sollicitatie. Je toekomstige takenpakket, het beoogde salaris dat daarbij hoort en zelfs je kansen op een openstaande functie, we doen nergens geheimzinnig over. Carrierecafe gaat graag een lange reis met je aan. Eerlijkheid duurt het langst! Dus wil jij succesvol en gelukkig worden op de werkvloer? Kies dan voor Carrierecafe! En natuurlijk hebben we ook secundaire voorwaarden! #LI-DS1

title: Data Science Manager - Digital
summary: As a Data Science Manager, you will lead a team of data scientists in delivering value to our clients while developing our business, skills and people.
description: Accenture Digital - Data Science Manager  Disrupt the way the world works by using your skills to transform Accenture clients in the digital businesses of tomorrow. Unleash your talent and bring business closer to the people they serve via cutting edge digital solutions developed by you. Leave your digital mark on the world.  Data science is in high demand. Accenture is currently looking for an outstanding Data Science Manager to complete the team.  Your impact As a Data Science Manager, you will lead a team of data scientists in delivering value to our clients while developing our business, skills and people. You align client business strategy, KPIs to impact, and data science use cases. You will propose new problem-solving solutions and methodologies; data modelling, analyses & interpretation. You apply the latest algorithms and techniques like deep learning and other machine learning techniques to create client value through insight generation and decision support –then turn these into action (eg. build a recommender system, determine customer segments through clustering, analyze a large text corpus to learn about the writers sentiment, predict the next best action).  You facilitate workshops/interviews to bridge the gap between data analytics and business outcomes. You provide advice to clients by translating analytical solutions into recommendations. You help achieve strategic goals and impact business results.  Your background Master’s degree in a quantitative field (Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Quantitative Marketing) with a specific emphasis on data. 5+ years of hands-on experience in analyzing data through statistical modelling and machine learning to tackle business questions. Excellent communication and presentation skills: able to explain Analytics in non-technical terms to business users (C-level, line managers, etc.) You know your way around statistical software packages (R, SAS, SPSS, etc.), relevant programming languages (SQL, Python, R, C, VBA, etc.), machine learning techniques (Neural Networks, Random Forest, etc.), machine learning solutions (Google Tensorflow, IBM Watson, etc.) and visualization (Tableau, Qlik, D3, etc.) Sharp analytical capabilities combined with the ability to develop and transform concepts into pragmatic and innovative solutions Effective communication in Dutch and English Are you interested? Are your ready to join Accenture as Data Science Manager and change the world around you? Accenture cares about privacy and we process personal data in accordance with our privacy statement. In order to be compliant with our privacy policy, we kindly request you to apply for the position on the Accenture website. For more questions or information about the vacancy please contact Vera Klaasen via vera.klaasen@accenture.com. Innovation is about bringing different people, ideas and perspectives together. As an equal opportunities employer, Accenture welcomes all applications and does not discriminate.  About us Accenture solves the toughest technological challenges through standout strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Working with over three-quarters of the Fortune Global 500, we drive innovation and shape world around us. With expertise in more than 40 industries and all business functions, we deliver ground-breaking outcomes for a new digital world.  Accenture Digital believes every business is a digital business. We use the power of digital to redefine how business serves connected customers and operate connected enterprises. With complete, integrated digital business and technology services Accenture digital delivers game-changing solutions in the real and virtual world. Do you want to know more about a career at Accenture Digital? Visit our website https://www.accenture.com/nl-en/careers/digital or follow us at www.Facebook.com/accenturenl.  We do not only want to impact our clients but also the people around us and the region we work and live in, for example via the local initiatives of our Corporate Citizenship Program. With the right personal coaching and the local and international projects, we offer you can be at your best and shape your career.

title: Clinical Research and Development Lead
summary:
Needs to possess highly effective communication skills and be capable of presenting ideas and data clearly to various audiences.
Posted Date: Mar 10 2021.
description: Site Name: Amsterdam, Rixensart, Wavre, Italy - Siena Posted Date: Mar 10 2021  Are YOU energized by an opportunity to accelerate and deliver a clinical data strategy that drives the opportunity to protect people from infectious diseases? If so, this Clinical Research and Development Lead role could be an exciting opportunity to explore.  As a Clinical Research and Development Lead, you will participate to Phase I-IV Clinical Development activities within a program or group of related programs within the context of the GSK Vaccines process in order to ensure the high quality and on-time delivery of all clinical data that will allow world-wide registration in compliance with the clinical development plan, good clinical practices (GCP), and GSK Vaccines standard operating procedures (SOP). This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following… Participate in Clinical Development activities for a study or a number of studies within a specific program or group of related programs - Design clinical trial protocols, and author clinical study reports and publications of high scientific, operational and ethical standards; Ensure consistency of data within program and across projects; Reporting full accountability to Clinical and Epidemiology Research & Development Project Lead. Bear primary responsibility and accountability for scientific, medical quality, medical/legal and human safety aspects and timeliness of clinical trial synopses and protocols and all clinical trial documents, including the Investigator’s Brochure and the Clinical Study Report. Supervise the study conduct and serve as the accountable for the overall delivery of the clinical trial, analyze and interpret the results as a subject matter expert and assure that results meet the highest standards of quality and ethical conduct. Serve as a scientific and management reference for the project (internally/externally), assuming accountability for the medical/legal and human safety aspects of the clinical study. As a member of the Clinical Project Team, always actively participate and engage within the project matrix, to achieve team objectives. Actively participate in preparing the clinical portion of the regulatory files and the registration process, including labelling. Provides support to Marketing/Business Development throughout product life cycle in order to achieve Company’s objectives. Collect scientific information and review GSK Vaccines project related documents and publications. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: MD specializing in the field of pediatrics, obstetrics and gynecology, infectious diseases, clinical epidemiology, or pharmacoepidemiology. Previous experience in clinical vaccinology is an asset. Minimum 1 year industry experience or minimum 5 years experience working in a scientific or medical institution (prior experience as Principal Investigator, Medical Monitor or commensurate to Clinical Research Scientist position). Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English. Ability to translate scientific skills in the field of vaccines and clinical research into business-driven strategies. Understanding of GCP and ICH guidelines; experience working with Regulatory functions a plus. Ability to work well within a matrix environment, balance priorities, and independently handle multiple tasks through good planning, project administration, organization skills. Ability to critically analyze information, identify strengths and weaknesses of approaches and proactively develop remedial actions to mitigate risks. Effective ability to prioritize tasks and deliver on deadlines, with high performance standards and a commitment to excellence. Knowledge and understanding of vaccines, clinical research, and biomedical research regulation. Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: Strategic thinking skills and achievement oriented. Needs to possess highly effective communication skills and be capable of presenting ideas and data clearly to various audiences. Working knowledge and understanding of causes of infectious diseases, health interventions and the global public health landscape. Sensitivity to the needs of a diversified ethnic groups and ability to build rapport across the spectrum. License to practice medicine and board and/ or professional certification is an asset. Why GSK? Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities: Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk. Managing individual and team performance. Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution. Implementing change initiatives and leading change. Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally Developing people and building a talent pipeline Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen. If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US). GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class. Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

title: Big Data Engineer
summary:
De brug kunnen slaan tussen data, organisatie en data scientists.
We hebben het hele spectrum van het Artificial Intelligence werkveld in huis; business…
description: Wie zijn wij Future Facts is een jong en dynamische AI-specialist (of consultancy bedrijf). Wij geloven in de kracht van feiten. Wij helpen klanten met het realiseren van hun strategische doelen; natuurlijk met behulp, en op basis van data. We hebben het hele spectrum van het Artificial Intelligence werkveld in huis; business consultancy, data science en big data engineering.  Denk je dat je alles al weet en niets meer kunt bijleren op het vlak van Data Engineering, stop dan met lezen, want dan zij wij niet de juiste partij voor jou. Kennisdeling staat namelijk bij ons voorop! Elke vrijdag delen we met elkaar de laatste inzichten en trends van het vakgebied en bespreken we de learnings uit een klantproject of het data-hobby-projectje waar we in onze vrije tijd mee bezig zijn. Dit houdt ons scherp en blijven we gericht op elkaars groei. Door onze ervaring en werkwijze krijgen ook onze klanten de kennis om te sturen op basis van feiten. Zo geven wij samen met onze klanten de toekomst vorm. Jouw rol als Big Data Engineer  We hoeven jou niet uit te leggen dat data de basis is voor Artificial Intelligence-oplossingen. Want door het verzamelen, stroomlijnen, verwerken en analyseren van alle beschikbare data, gestructureerd of ongestructureerd, leg jij de basis voor kwalitatief goede data, bij voorkeur in Azure of AWS. Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in AWS of Microsoft Azure data lakes en analytics services. Bij voorkeur heb je een of meerdere certificaten in de AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty domein of Azure Big Data and Analytics. Hiermee creëer je échte waarde voor onze klanten door het implementeren van big data-oplossingen, vaak vanuit de cloud. Samen met een hecht en ambitieus team van 24 collega's ben je projectmatig bezig bij nieuwe en bestaande klanten verspreid over Nederland. Wij zijn niet gespecialiseerd in één sector, maar zoeken juist de uitdaging op door vele verschillende sectoren te helpen. Er is één bindende factor: bij alle bedrijven maak je direct maatschappelijke impact. Omdat elk project anders is, heeft elke vraag ook een andere aanpak nodig. Samen met je team onderzoek je wat de meest efficiënte werkwijze is, en wat de juiste tooling hiervoor is. Jij kunt vanuit jouw expertise en senioriteit hierin goed adviseren, en hiermee voeg je concrete waarde toe en weet je de klant te verrassen! Naast inhoudelijk meewerken in de projectteams kun je ook junior collega's begeleiden of je specialiseren tot Technical Lead. Aanpak Future Facts:  Wat Future Facts uitzonderlijk maakt in de markt is dat wij niet alleen de modellen ontwikkelen, maar deze ook naar productie brengen en daadwerkelijk implementeren in de cloud-omgeving van de klant. We rusten niet tot alles écht werkt en je de impact ziet van de vaak maatschappelijk-relevante oplossingen, zoals betere doorstroming in de sociale huursector, accuratere levering van postpakketten, het herkennen van aanstootgevende graffiti of snellere reparatie van een internetverbinding. Klik hier voor meer informatie over Future Facts en de klantcases waar we aan werken. Persoonlijke Ontwikkeling: Bij Future Facts staat jouw ontwikkeling centraal en bieden we je volop mogelijkheden om expert te blijven in de snel veranderende wereld van big data. Zo kan je bijvoorbeeld tracks volgen over ethics in AI of certificaten halen van AWS of Azure. Daarnaast hebben we meerdere teamsessies met collega’s of heb je intervisie met een Technical Lead. Kies vooral de methode die het beste bij jou past.  Het team: 24 consultants, waarvan 4 Analytics Translators, 5 Data Scientist en 12 Big Data Engineers. 20% van de Data Scientists en Big Data Engineers hebben een phd op zak. Masters in de Wiskunde, Natuurkunde, Informatica, Computer Sciences of Econometrie. Platte organisatie, iedereen werkt mee in de projecten, ook het MT van Future Facts. Op vrijdag staat kennisdeling centraal in de vorm van de Friday Session, (online) lunches of een-op-eensessies. We vinden het belangrijk dat je echt jezelf kunt zijn en je werk/privé naar eigen wens kunt inrichten. De projecten: De teamgrootte varieert van twee tot vier personen per project. Daarbij komen nog de mensen van de klantorganisatie, omdat we geloven dat dit een belangrijke voorwaarde is voor succes. Meestal werk je aan één project per keer, behalve als jij dat graag anders ziet. De duur verschilt van een paar maanden tot meer dan een jaar. We doen projecten met artificial intelligence, computer vision, Azure-cloud, AWS-cloud, NLP, IoT en Machine learning. Onze cases ontwikkelen we voor verschillende domeinen zoals marketing, finance en customer service en voeren we uit bij een grote diversiteit aan toonaangevende Nederlandse organisaties.  Wat bieden wij Een concurrerend en realistisch salaris, bonus, telefoon en laptop, maar dat is vanzelfsprekend. Het stapje extra doen wij door jou een leasebedrag, privé internet- en onkostenvergoeding te bieden Een afwisselende rol bij een jonge scale-up met projecten in AWS en Azure die echt het verschil maken Een groep vriendelijke, no-nonsens collega’s die behoren tot de beste data professionals van Nederland Naast thuis en bij de klant, een goed bereikbare werkplek in Amsterdam met een prachtig uitzicht over het IJ Ook in deze tijden een ruime keuze uit online Tracks & Trainingen, digitale borrels en sporten op afstand En als alles straks weer kan een gym, dakterras en Danz Café waar je altijd even een praatje kunt maken met je collega’s Wat breng jij mee WO-opleiding in een richting zoals Business Informatics en +4 jaar toepasbare ervaring in big data Je bent gespecialiseerd in Datalakes en Analytics services binnen Azure of AWS Kennis van big data processing (bijvoorbeeld Spark/PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks etc.) Kennis van storage technologieën (bijvoorbeeld HDFS, S3, ADLS, GFS) en kennis van database technologieën (bijvoorbeeld Redshift, Cassandra, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Neo4J, FlockDB) De brug kunnen slaan tussen data, organisatie en data scientists Je hebt een passie voor techniek, data en vooruitgang Vloeiend in een programmeertaal (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL) Goede kennis van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Sollicitatieprocedure 1. Solliciteer Zien we de aansluiting in jouw motivatie en cv? Dan nodigen we je graag uit voor een gesprek bij ons op kantoor. 2. Eerste gesprek We maken kennis met elkaar en zijn benieuwd naar je ambities, drijfveren en achtergrond. Ook toetsen we je technische skills. 3. Tweede gesprek In dit gesprek gaan we dieper in op jouw kernwaarden, bespreken we onze manier van werken en zijn we benieuwd naar jouw verwachtingen van Future Facts. 4. Aanbieding We doen je een passende aanbieding en zullen deze met jou bespreken. 5. Welkom bij Future Facts! De collega's van het Office gaan voor je aan de slag zodat je een warm welkom krijgt.

title: Software Engineer - New Grad 2021 (Amsterdam)
summary: You will work closely with your team and the larger engineering organization to help data scientists and data engineers solve the world’s toughest data problems…
description: Mission We are hiring software engineers who are passionate about architecting, developing, deploying, and operating the Databricks product. As a software engineer, you will collaborate with our world-class engineering team that is building a platform that unifies data science, engineering, and business. This includes teams that span from working on the Spark cluster management to building out collaborative features for data science and machine learning to building services and tools that manage our multi-cloud infrastructure. You will work closely with your team and the larger engineering organization to help data scientists and data engineers solve the world’s toughest data problems. Outcomes Work with a team to deliver features or improve architecture Develop and extend the Databricks product. This includes: writing software in Scala, Python or Javascript and/or interacting with: cloud APIs (e.g., compute APIs, cloud formation, Terraform), with open source and third party APIs and software (e.g., Kubernetes) and with internal APIs. Be responsible for full software development lifecycle - design, development, testing, operating in production Architect solutions to achieve a high level of reliability, scalability and security Communicate effectively with other engineers in the same team, with other teams and with various other stakeholders such as product managers Operate in an Agile development environment Work with PM and design to plan, develop, and iterate on features Competencies Will graduate in Fall 2020 or Spring 2021 with a BA, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject Implementation skills with one or more general purpose programming languages, including Java, Scala, C++ or Python Good knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and OOD/OOP principles A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design About Databricks Databricks is the data and AI company. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks simplifies data and AI so data teams can collaborate and innovate faster. More than five thousand organizations worldwide —including Shell, Conde Nast and Regeneron — rely on Databricks as a unified platform for massive-scale data engineering, collaborative data science, full-lifecycle machine learning and business analytics. Venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco (with offices around the globe) Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

title: Machine Learning Specialist
summary: Accountable for leading and driving Machine Learning projects with data scientist/data engineer to deploy these solutions within the infrastructure.
description: Job Type Contract  Location Amsterdam  Area Netherlands  Sector Artificial Intelligence (AI)  Salary Market related  Start Date ASAP  Job Ref machine learning ams  Description Templeton & Partners is an international IT recruitment agency that specializes in the IT / Digitital transformation market for over 23 years. Accountabilities Accountable for working with business to prepare requirements and technical feasibility study for a Machine Learning/Computer vision related project Accountable for leading and driving Machine Learning projects with data scientist/data engineer to deploy these solutions within the infrastructure Accountable for bringing new technologies into the Client and scoping digital strategy around Machine Learning.  Special Challenges: Building constructive and trusting relationships with mostly remote business stakeholders Dealing with challenges in data acquisition from other parts of the business Working with different vendors to develop understanding of the state-of-the-art Machine Learning / Computer Vision techniques Dealing with a multinational and multilingual work environment  Skills & Requirements:  Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning or relevant areas Proven practical experience with relevant topics in Machine Learning. title: PhD Position on Supporting Climate Change Deliberations via Artificial Intelligence
summary: We are mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption.
description: PhD Position on Supporting Climate Change Deliberations via Artificial Intelligence Apply Now Challenge: AI-based decision support for climate change mitigation Change: Design fair, interpretable, and human-centered AI tools Impact: Trustworthy & unbiased AI support in real-world applications Job description Collective action by all stakeholders (e.g., public administrators, scientists, and citizens) is necessary to tackle a global societal challenge such as climate change. Collective action requires systematic deliberations and negotiations in each step of climate change mitigation and adaptation. Current, largely manual, approaches for deliberation and negotiation are subject to significant pitfalls, including limited participation, information overload, balkanization, and a variety of cognitive biases. The goal of this PhD project to contribute toward the development of a hybrid-intelligence (HI) platform for supporting climate change deliberations and negotiations. The HI deliberation platform will support humans with AI (specifically, via natural language processing, and knowledge representation and reasoning techniques) in tasks such as recognizing the deliberative structure of discussions, clustering and visualizing arguments and perspectives, finding novel objectives, and modeling opinion dynamics over time. This is a PhD position in the Hippo (Hyper-heuristics for interpretable public policy analysis) lab. The core goal of the Hippo lab is to advance multi-purpose decision support using collaborative and heuristic AI methods. You will work as part of an interdisciplinary team between the Interactive Intelligence section in the Intelligent Systems (INSY) department at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) and the Policy Analysis section in the Multi-Actor systems (MAS) department at the Faculty of Technology Policy and Management (TPM), tackling the following major scientific challenges: How can we integrate subjective notions of ethics and fairness into algorithmic design? How can we create an optimality taxonomy to find effective trade-offs in policy search? How can we develop interpretable AI methods to gain public confidence and provide unbiased support in real decision-making contexts? How can we support public policy deliberation via collaborative AI methods? The Hippo lab is a Delft Artificial Intelligence Lab. Artificial Intelligence, Data and Digitalisation are becoming increasingly important when looking for answers to major scientific and societal challenges. In a DAI-lab, experts in ‘the fundamentals of AI technology’ along with experts in ‘AI challenges’ run a shared lab. As a PhD, you will work with at least two academic members of staff and three other PhD candidates. In total TU Delft will establish 24 DAI-Labs, where 48 Tenure Trackers and 96 PhD candidates will have the opportunity to push the boundaries of science using AI. Each team is driven by research questions which arise from scientific and societal challenges, and contribute to the development and execution of domain specific education. You will receive a 5-year contract and will be deployed for AI-related education for the usual teaching effort for PhD students in the faculty plus an additional 20%. The extra year compared to the usual 4-year contract accommodates the 20% additional AI, Data and Digitalisation education related activities. All team members have many opportunities for self-development. You will be a member of the thriving DAI-Lab community that fosters cross-fertilization between talents with different expertise and disciplines. For description of other projects in Hippo lab, visit: https://ii.tudelft.nl/~pradeep/hippo.html Requirements The candidate must have: Completed an MSc degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a field relevant to the PhD research. Demonstrated competence or strong interest in an artificial intelligence topic, preferably, natural language processing, text mining, or social media analytics. Strong programming skills. Good English language and communication skills (written and oral). An affinity with teaching and guiding students. Team spirit and open personality for cooperation with colleagues and co-supervision of students. Conditions of employment TU Delft offers DAI-Lab PhD-candidates a 5-year contract (as opposed to the normal 4-years), with an official go/no go progress assessment after one year. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2395 per month in the first year to € 3217 in the fifth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. For international applicants we offer the Coming to Delft Service and Partner Career Advice to assist you with your relocation TU Delft (Delft University of Technology) Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context. At TU Delft we embrace diversity and aim to be as inclusive as possible (see our Code of Conduct). Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. Challenge. Change. Impact! Faculty Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three disciplines - electrical engineering, mathematics and computer science. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make future-proof. We are also working on a world in which humans and computers reinforce each other. We are mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. There is plenty of room here for ground-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1,100 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment. Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science. Additional information For more information about this vacancy, please contact Pradeep K. Murukannaiah, Assistant Professor, email: P.K.Murukannaiah@tudelft.nl, tel: +31 15 27 82291 Application procedure Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before 4-4-2021 via the application button. Submit as a single pdf file the following documents: Motivation letter (max 1 page) Curriculum vitae (max 2 pages) Names and contact information of 3 referees. Writing sample (e.g., a paper or part of your thesis). A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure. You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post. Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. FACULTY/DEPARTMENT Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics & Computer Science JOB TYPE PhD SCIENTIFIC FIELD Engineering HOURS PER WEEK 32-38 SALARY € 2.395,00 - € 3.061,00 DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION University graduate VACANCY NUMBER TUD00858 Apply Now

title: Coördinator biologische samples (focus biochemie)
summary:
Ervaring met data-review en administratie van samples is een pré.
In deze rol communiceer je veel met collega's (oa scientists) van verschillende afdelingen.
description: Wat ga je doen? Deze vacature is in een belangrijk team binnen dit groeiende, internationale biotechnologische bedrijf. Jij bent in deze rol verantwoordelijk voor de logistiek en bijbehorend papierwerk van biochemische (eiwit) producten. Naast een stuk logistiek, waaronder opslag van de samples en het verschepen naar externe partijen en het zorgdragen voor bijbehorende documentatie. Daarnaast zal je ook data-review uitvoeren van verschillende biochemische analyses, waaronder Capillaire Electroforese (CE) en chromatografie om de kwaliteit van de samples te bewaken. Zodoende is het van belang dat je goede basiskennis hebt van biochemische analyses. In deze rol communiceer je veel met collega's (oa scientists) van verschillende afdelingen. Daarnaast schakel je ook met externe partijen en logistieke partners. Goede communicatieve vaardigheden zijn dan ook belangrijk. Engels is een vereiste, Nederlands is wel een pré. Wie zoeken wij voor Coördinator biologische samples (focus biochemie)? Voor deze vacature zijn we op zoek naar iemand met de volgende achtergrond: Afgeronde HLO opleiding in de richting van biochemie of soortgelijk (stage)ervaring met biochemische technieken, waaronder bij voorkeur Capillaire Electroforese en HPLC of LC-MS. Ervaring met logistieke processen is een pré Ervaring met data-review en administratie van samples is een pré Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in het Engels, bij voorkeur ook in het Nederlands Belangrijk is dat je bewust een stap buiten het laboratorium maakt. Je zal in deze functie zelf geen analyses meer uitvoeren, enkel met de data en de samples werken. Wat kun je verwachten van het bedrijf? Het betreft een vacature in een internationale biotech organisatie die zich heeft toegespitst op het ontwikkelen van therapieën voor verschillende ziektes. Dit bedrijf focust op onderzoek en ontwikkeling en is daarom op zoek naar mensen met goede kennis en een proactieve houding. De organisatie groeit hard en dit biedt ook mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling voor jou als medewerker. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Coördinator biologische samples (focus biochemie) Vaste functie Dienstverband van 40u/wk Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van ervaring. Range van €2500 - €3500 bruto per maand. Over Science@Work Bij Science@Work komen mensen en wetenschap samen. Onze Talent Acquisition Experts zijn allen een gesprekpartner op niveau met een afgeronde laboratorium en science opleiding. Wij brengen talent en werkgevers samen voor vaste – en tijdelijke banen in geheel Nederland. Als gespecialiseerde divisie van een Nederlandse recruitment organisatie met 7 kantoren in de Benelux, hebben wij een groot bereik en nog grotere branche kennis. Science@Work staat gelijk aan kwaliteit en kennis. Waarin Science@Work zich verder onderscheidt zijn de nieuwste recruitment technologieën, bevlogen recruiters en aandacht voor mens en milieu. Zo werken wij sneller, efficiënter én groener. Science@Work werkt voor MLO, HLO en WO professionals in de life sciences, farmacie, voedingsmiddelen, biotechnologie en (petro)chemie in geheel Nederland. Wij bieden vaste en tijdelijke laboratorium en science banen binnen de microbiologie, chemie, analytische chemie, biochemie, sales, quality assurance, medical devices en biomedische laboratorium technologie.

title: Medior/Senior Data Scientist | Online Media | Amsterdam
summary:
Het bedenken van data science gerelateerde oplossingen op basis van de verkregen business vraagstukken.
Ervaring met grote data sets en kennis van diverse Big…
description: Voor een klant van mij ben ik per direct op zoek naar meerdere Data Scientists. Functietaken – Het doen van analyses en het ontwikkelen van modellen. – Het praten met diverse afdelingen om de behoeften in kaart te brengen – Het bedenken van data science gerelateerde oplossingen op basis van de verkregen business vraagstukken – Het ontwikkelen van prototypes en bij gebleken succes het implementeren hiervan – Het presenteren van de resultaten naar de diverse afdelingen toe. – Het toepassen van geavanceerde analysemethoden en machine learning technieken – Het aansturen/begeleiden van de minder ervaren Data Scientists in het team – Het proactief meehelpen denken over mogelijke vebeteringen/toepassingen om de afdeling naar de hoger level te brengen Eisen – Een afgeronde MSc of PhD in een exacte wetenschap – Aantoonbare ervaring met geavanceerde analyse- en modelleertechnieken (regressie, clustering, classificatie, NLP, neurale netwerken – Ervaring met grote data sets en kennis van diverse Big Data programmeertalen en technieken; Spark, Scala, R, Python – Kennis van databses (Hive, Cassandra, Redis) – Ervaring met datavisualisatie – Communicatiefbaardig, proactief, creatief en ondernemend Meer weten? kai@analysepeople.nl

title: Frontend developer React
summary: Together with your team you discuss how to approach the feature requirements and you pair with a backend developer to get the right data.
description: Intro It's an exciting time for us at VIKTOR. After launching our platform in 2016 we are rapidly growing our user base, our team and our developer community. We are hyper-focused to make VIKTOR the low-code development platform for developers, engineers and scientists wanting to automate the boring work and enable them to build awesome products.  To further grow our team we are looking for a talented frontend developer. If you are passionate about building and shipping software that brings job satisfaction to our users and you love working with the latest technologies, then we're eager to get to know you.  What are you going to do  You will work as part of our platform development team to improve our web experience through our React frontend and build new features that will allow our users to automate their daily workflow and allow developers to build apps with your components. You will be working on improving existing features and adding new ones, from the conceptual phase all the way to implementation.  What a day could look like A new sprint has started where you and your team will build a new feature on top of our API. Together with your team you discuss how to approach the feature requirements and you pair with a backend developer to get the right data. You will be spending most of your week on your feature-branch. Tomorrow you discuss with a colleague about a merge request they are working on to reduce request count and keep our interfaces fast. Later this week you attend a meeting with an enthusiastic sales engineer to brainstorm about a new UI component that could be a great power tool for a specific industry, together the two of you sketch the outlines and roughly draw up a business case and plan the execution.  We offer you A flat organizational structure, in which taking responsibility and initiative is encouraged A friendly international working environment where you can get the best out of yourself Opportunity to evolve your role as the company continuous to grow Developer friendly environment, CI/CD, integration and unit tested software An office in the center of Rotterdam, a few minutes walking from Central Station Possibility to work from home if that suits you, also after the pandemic Online Friday afternoon drinks and bimonthly team activities Flexible working hours, plenty of days off Possibility to work part-time (32h)  You are an independent thinker, creative in finding the best solutions You feel comfortable using and learning about technologies like TypeScript, WebSockets, WebGL and REST API's You have at least two years of experience in building web applications using React (or similar such as Vue or modern Angular) You have an academic level of working and thinking, you can reason through some level of abstraction You can guarantee the technical feasibility of UI/UX decisions You can separate the great from the overhyped in the land of frontend You have a European nationality or you live in the Netherlands and you have a valid residence permit (VIKTOR is not a recognized sponsor).

title: Product Manager, ML Operations
summary: As a Product Manager, you will interact with data scientists and other internal stakeholders to discuss how we can further improve on our machine learning…
description: This is Adyen We took an unobvious approach to starting a payments company, building a platform from scratch. Today, we're the payments platform of choice for the world's brightest companies. Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity, of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives, is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen. Product Manager, ML Operations Adyen's Machine Learning Operations team is growing fast, and therefore, we are looking for a product manager to join the team and drive the internal product that serves any Adyen team of their machine learning platform needs. In this role, you will be helping to shape the future of how we use machine learning at Adyen. First and foremost we are looking for someone with a strong background in machine learning and excellent communication and organisation skills. Ideally you have experience delivering technical products and have implemented machine learning models yourself. Also, you understand that writing a model is not the only challenge in bringing machine learning into production. As a Product Manager, you will interact with data scientists and other internal stakeholders to discuss how we can further improve on our machine learning platform offering, and prioritise work based on gathered requirements. This role also includes a great deal of project management and collaboration with the engineering team. You will learn about rules and regulations related to machine learning and evangelise the use of machine learning solutions within the company. What you'll do Understands how machine learning can transform our business and products; Eager to work on product for internal clients (other Adyen teams); Excited to quantify quality in measurable indicators; Wants to make an impact on day to day experience of other developers in the company. Who you are Demonstrable experience with project and/or product management; Well acquainted with machine learning technologies, teams, and organizations; Strong communication skills with experience of interfacing with upper management; Excellent command of the English language, both verbal and written; Experience with legal and compliance challenges around machine learning; First-hand experience training ML models; 3+ years of experience in product and/or managing highly technical teams. Who we are Adyen is the payments platform of choice for the world's leading companies, delivering frictionless payments across online, mobile and in-store channels. It is the only provider of a modern end-to-end infrastructure, connecting directly to Visa, Mastercard, and consumers' globally preferred payment methods. With offices around the world, Adyen serves nine of the 10 largest U.S. internet companies and many worldwide retailers. Customers include Facebook, Uber, L'Oreal, Casper, Bonobos, and Spotify. Ready to meet us? If this role looks like your next step, apply by clicking the below link. We can't wait to meet you!

title: Enterprise Consultant (Data)
summary:
Core - analytics, first and zero party data, advanced marketing analytics, data science, tag management.
The company is headquartered in San Francisco, with a…
description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION: MightyHive is the leading data and digital media consultancy that helps marketers take control. MightyHive delivers sustained results from the ground up through advisory for business transformation, privacy-first data strategy, and digital media services. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, with a team of consultants, platform experts, data scientists, and marketing engineers in 19 countries and 24 cities around the world. In 2018, MightyHive merged with S4Capital plc (SFOR.L), a tech-led new age/new era digital advertising and marketing services company established by Sir Martin Sorrell.  WHAT WE OFFER: Competitive salary + performance based compensation plan Workplace Pension plan Mobile phone plan Working from home reimbursement The Opportunity: Enterprise Consultant, Data, Netherlands Job Responsibilities Offer strategic architectural insight and consultation for a clients' holistic digital advertising strategy - driven by data. Including but not limited to: Core - analytics, first and zero party data, advanced marketing analytics, data science, tag management Edge - ad serving, media planning, media buying, creative strategy and production, decisioning, performance reporting Manage relationships and projects with internal and external stakeholders across multiple large accounts Ensure accountability across project teams delivering quality and timeliness and work to exceed baseline-level content and deadlines across defined scopes of work as well as new opportunities Develop and manage project plans (team member allocation, timeline, budget, deliverables) Develop quality content to communicate project plans, wins, and issues to internal and external leadership Collaborate across client's global teams on the execution of programmatic services projects Support the Account Management Organization to improve service delivery capabilities and identify project growth opportunities Qualifications/Background Sought: Technical expertise with digital analytics platforms (Google Analytics 360, Adobe Analytics) and onsite personalization platforms (Google Optimize 360, Adobe Test & Target) Expertise across programmatic display, video, native, paid search, ad serving, as well as digital advertising reporting, measurement, and attribution tools. Strong grasp of Advanced Marketing Analytics (formerly Cloud for Marketing) techniques such as propensity modelling Technical expertise with the in-scope technology solutions for each client for which they are fulfilling consulting duties, including those outside the Google Marketing Platforms stack Project management experience, including but not limited to Demonstrated ability to lead in-person client meetings or client summits Demonstrated ability to effectively operate independently and in a team environment What you bring to it: 3-5 years of online advertising experience, whether at a consultancy, publisher, agency, trading desk, technology company, or end-advertiser Strong data analysis abilities (e.g. familiarity with Excel v-lookups, pivot tables, and basic functions, knowledge of R/Python very appreciated) Strong analytical and consulting skills, rooted in the ability to draw and communicate insights from multiple data points Excellent consultative approach to developing and managing business relationships Innovative thinker with prior evidence of successfully executing on ideas Ambition to perform unprecedented tasks and obtain new skills, be comfortable with uncertainty and adapt to a rapidly changing environment Ability and desire to scale knowledge and learning to other junior (and at times senior) team members Dutch & English language required Reports to Enterprise Consulting Lead, EMEA  Logistics: Role located across the Amsterdam and Hilversum offices, with the opportunity to work from either location Remote work allowed within health & safety regulations International travel may be required EU citizens only, we will not provide visa or relocation assistance Office hours: 9am-6pm Central European Time

title: Sales Engineer, Central & Eastern Europe
summary: If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you’ll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the…
description: Sales Engineer, Central & Eastern Europe Based in Germany/Netherlands/Poland Remote (good hub) The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you’ll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that. We’ve been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There’s plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure. Your Role: EDB is looking for a, Senior Sales Engineer to join our team of sales engineering professionals. As a Sales Engineer at EDB, you will be responsible for supporting the sales team in all technical aspects of the sales process including presentations, demos, proof of value, pilots, technical workshops, technical account management etc. You will work close with Field & Insides Sales, Partners, Product Management & Engineering to be a conduit of technical requirements to & from EDB to our clients. It is anticipated most of the business will be in Germany and some in the Benelux region.
