description: Research Research Specialist Full time position The basic responsibility is to ensure that Glycostem is performing research according to Good Laboratory Practice (GLP), which are beyond state-of-the-art research activities, performed internally or with external partners from academia or industry. The role entails a broad range of duties and the specific areas of focus will be dependent on the skills and experience of the person holding the role. The research scientist will consult with senior research manager and make recommendations based on research findings and product performance. He/she will create functional strategies and specific objectives for the scientific team and prepare work plans, experimental plans, policies, procedures to support the research activities. The Research Scientist: Is conducting research projects, managed and supervised by senior research manager Is participating in projects supervised by other research managers or scientists Develops personal expertise on specific topics Is familiar to state-of-the-art and beyond laboratory techniques Establishes new techniques or platforms as required Work independently Educate scientific staff such as research technicians and students Seek guidance/leadership from Senior Research Manager and CSO Interact and exchanges information with other external partners and internal project managers and scientists. The research manager will work closely together with the Research and Development managers and scientists, and CSO. Job Responsibilities Process, receive, catalog clinical research samples Management of experiments and sub-projects Lab duty and maintenance of equipment Write, read scientific articles, experimental plans and protocols Run experiments, optimisation of methods, calculating budgets Develop and establish new technologies, as well as detailed protocols, to be implemented in the development and translated to the quality assurance operating procedures of new products Perform experiments following specific protocols Analyze results and write reports Keep updated with scientific developments Prepare presentation for internal and external meetings Contribute to grant and patent writing To attend and present data at scientific conferences Train and educate trainees for laboratory work · Responsibility for special equipment · From time-to-time the senior research manager or CSO may add other projects with focus on development. Education, skills and experience The job as Research Scientist will be held by a person with: PhD in biology focused on immunology, tumor immunology and molecular biology 4+ years of academic or industry experience in research projects Background in advanced laboratory analytical methods in immunology and molecular biology and high level skills on statistics Knowledge of TCR-NK Technology and NK Cell Receptors Experience in CAR expression in NK cells Experience in clinical sample profiling Ability to explain complex scientific details in a simple way yet at the same time have high level discussions with experts in the field Excellent understanding of both written and spoken English language (we are an English-speaking company) Conditions of employment: A permanent contract is offered; Competitive salary Pension premium contribution; Travel allowance or public transport reimbursement; 25 holidays; and Holiday pay. Do you have what it takes? Please apply by sending your cover letter and CV in English to Liana van Genuchten (HR@Glycostem.com). We reply to you within 3 working days. Want to know more? E-mail our HR department at HR@Glycostem.com for more information about Glycostem and the selection process. Recruiters should not contact us. Please be aware that your application means that the information you provide will be shared by and with HR and the employees who are involved with the procedure. In case the procedure with you ends, your application and provided information will be deleted within four weeks after the moment you have been informed. Your name and date of application will be registered in our database for statistical use and status only. By applying you agree with and have taken notice of these conditions.

title: Product Owner - AI/ML
summary:
Excellent data gathering and analysis skills.
As a Product Owner, you will interact with engineers, data scientists and other internal stakeholders to discuss…
description: Fourthline is a leading RegTech scale-up that has been growing massively in the Identity & verification (ID&V) space for the past 3 years. The foundation of this is a product that we are proud of and ready to take to the next level by extensive automation and expert knowledge.  Our mission is to protect the online financial system by using the most innovative technologies to develop the safest and most customer friendly digital KYC solution. We share a love for fighting financial crime and building a beautiful product with a positive impact on the world.  Product Owner AI/ML Fourthline is looking for a passionate Product Owner that wants to build great products with significant value for our enterprise/banking-class partners. Our banking and FinTech partners are the fastest growing companies in Europe and beyond, and we are here to support them. Product Owners at Fourthline are pivotal as we are a product-oriented company striving to create the best in class ID&V products (and more!). The Product Team at Fourthline is responsible for turning the product vision into reality and gaining measurable benefits from products and features your team(s) has released. In the first place we are looking for someone with a demonstrated background in AI/ML and excellent communication and organization skills. You have experience delivering technical products and have implemented AI/ML models yourself. Besides this, you understand that writing a model is not the only challenge in bringing AI/ML into production. As a Product Owner, you will interact with engineers, data scientists and other internal stakeholders to discuss how we can further improve on our machine learning platform offering, and prioritize work based on gathered requirements.  This role reports to the Head of Product located in our Amsterdam office (HQ) and works with an international distributed cross-functional team across Europe (Amsterdam & Barcelona).  As a Fourthline Product Owner, you will Listen to our partners, (AI/ML) engineers, and stakeholders to identify problems that Fourthline is able to solve beyond expectations. Work with (senior) AI/ML engineers that take their work seriously and are able to provide you with good feedback on the roadmap, stories, and feature development. Launch fast and iterate on solutions and services that are easy to integrate. Dive into the data to demonstrate our value and provide a best-in-class experience to our partners. Enable sales in their quest to onboard leading partners in the banking, financial, telecommunications sector where ID&V/Know-Your-Customer/on-boarding procedures are (heavily) regulated. Deliver amazing results quarter after quarter which solves problems and provide 100% customer-centric solutions for the better. Make sure our product meets the highest quality and regulatory standards. Work with the latest standards in security to protect the (online) identities and sensitive data. Work closely with the entire Product team to define the positioning of our product strategy, roadmaps, and execution of new products and features.  You have proven track-record building AI/ML products in a Product Owner - Manager, Consultant, Engineer, or similar role for 4-6 years. An established AI Product Owner with several major cycles(multi-quarter) of using AI, Deep Learning and/or Machine Learning to enhance, improve, create and shape products and deliver them into the production environment. Solid handle on data and modeling technologies, experience working with technically complex domains, architectures and products combined with an ability to drive product discussions in these areas Excellent data gathering and analysis skills Decent knowledge of commonly used machine learning algorithms You identify the right priorities based on collected data and extensive testing that shape the product attributes; are structured and disciplined to stay on course. You are a creative problem solver with a holistic mindset – as you are connecting the dots, structure them, and detail-oriented in describing them. You have experience working with internal and external stakeholders to define and specify product requirements. You are the main go-to person as you become a subject-matter expert over time. We need you to be a great communicator. Both written as well as spoken. We are a team. You are a team player. You are a motivator. An action-oriented motivator to achieve our goals as a team.  Preferred experience/skills: Experience with a startup or scaleup (fast-paced environment); Experience in training classification models and good understanding of what it means to download, preprocess, orchestrate data, create splits; Experience in deploying docker containers with simple APIs; FinTech experience, industry knowledge whilst having worked with regulatory and compliant products before;  At Fourthline, we care about attracting and retaining the best people and that is why we offer Great compensation package, certainly compared to other scaleups/startups; The chance to work at the forefront of cutting-edge technology, teaming with the biggest names in fintech and banking; An opportunity to work for a multinational scale-up that is growing rapidly (1,000% growth over 3 years); Opportunities to match your ambitions: Your ideas will be needed so that together we can become the biggest and best online identity provider in the world (whilst releasing other new products!); 25 days of vacation to recharge your batteries; A workplace in our fun office right next to the beautiful Vondelpark in Amsterdam; Daily catered, fresh and tasty lunch with your colleagues (when allowed again); After-work drinks in our very own bar on Fridays (when allowed again); High degree of collaboration and autonomy; Crucial role in a highly motivated, talented team that will grow a lot; Flat structures and open communication; Ping pong/darts/table football, because it is fun (when allowed again); Four office dogs (current count).  NOTE: For this role we can only consider people that are Amsterdam/Randstad area based (We will not relocate from outside Europe - due to Corona). We will be able to offer sponsorship to those that already hold an HSM status in the Netherlands.

title: Senior Tech Recruiter (Analytics/Data)
summary:
Experience with recruiting wide range of senior and IC hard to fill tech roles (product analysts, data scientists, ML specialists, etc).
What's in it for you.
description: About the team There is an ever growing team of professionals in our People team globally and we are in charge of talent acquisition, onboarding and employee experience, L&D, performance management, and talent brand development. We have a team culture that is highly collaborative and we expect our new team member to contribute proactively to our common projects. We have a lot of freedom and opportunity to choose the tools we need and build out new solutions and practices that will level up the quality and delivery of our teamwork. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to grow their career and change the world together with our super talented team! About the role We are looking for a passionate, purposeful, Senior Talent Acquisition professional with a high level of self-responsibility and drive who would like to join our international recruiting team and build our tech hub in Amsterdam. As a Senior Tech Recruiter you will partner closely with hiring managers across the globe to align on hiring needs, you will keep on improving effective candidate selection process to provide our teams with the best talents, who match Miro's high bar for performance, potential, and our values. Miro is in a hyper-growth stage - we are scaling up rapidly, hence you will be part of building our Amsterdam hub, contributing with your ideas, practices and sharing these exciting times with the team. What you'll do Partner with hiring managers to understand their needs and grow their organization Source, attract and close candidates for multiple senior and IC roles within Analytics/Data domain Proactively identify pain points and implement best practices/ process improvements and tools for attracting and selecting A-players Constantly network with candidates and provide a best in class candidate experience Support the team in participating in talent acquisition events (conferences), networking, HR-marketing activities What you'll need Extensive experience with full-cycle recruiting in a hyper-growth environment Experience with recruiting wide range of senior and IC hard to fill tech roles (product analysts, data scientists, ML specialists, etc) Experience with managing a large amount of stakeholders in a complex organization Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proven abilities to attract passive candidates and build a diverse pipeline through sourcing Ability to use data to tell a story and inform decision making Think critically, adapt easily to changing priorities, optimize their own time and enjoy collaborating What's in it for you Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Travel allowance for your commute Lunch, snacks and drinks provided Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly team activities (even virtually) to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global team Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam About Miro Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 10 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes. At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

title: Business Analytics Specialist
summary:
Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring in het data domein als bijvoorbeeld data-analist, scientist of engineer in relatie tot ICM.
Een greep uit je verantwoordelijkheden:
description: Over de functie In deze functie kom je te werken binnen het nieuw te vormen ICM team. Niemand is je nog voorgegaan in deze functie, je bent dan ook een stevige professional en een bouwer. Je werkt nauw samen met én voor andere teams en het management. Je onderhoudt korte lijntjes met de afdelingen Informatie & Automatisering, Elektronisch Patiënten Dossier en het Business Informatie team. Maar ook met artsen, verpleegkundigen, business controllers en bedrijfskundig managers werk je nauw samen.  Je bent vaardig in het communicatief smaak geven aan data en analyses. Daarbij switch je tussen praktisch en strategisch in 0.01 seconde. Je gaat met je handen in de klei voor wat betreft de techniek, maar zoomt ook uit als dat nodig is.  Een greep uit je verantwoordelijkheden: databeleid en -strategie vormgeven identificeren van waardevolle data (automatische) collectieprocessen van data pre-processen van gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data analyseren van informatie om zo trends en patronen te ontdekken bouwen van (predictive) modellen, reports en dashboards presenteren van informatie met datavisualisatietechnieken ondersteunen en trainen in het interpreteren van data en modellen. Werkomgeving Binnen OLVG zetten we in op ICM. De missie van ICM is om ervoor te zorgen dat we met z’n allen betere capaciteitsbeslissingen en planningen maken door onder andere gebruik te maken van alle data die we tot onze beschikking hebben. Hiermee draagt ICM bij aan groei, innovatie en bovenal meer waarde voor onze patiënten en collega’s in de zorg. Binnen ICM heeft business analytics een belangrijke positie.  Wil je helpen de organisatie een stap te laten zetten op de ladder van data-volwassenheid door verantwoordelijk te zijn voor: echte waarde halen uit data door expertise en advies het bouwen van modellen en analytics die ICM verder brengen het presenteren van informatie met datavisualisatietechnieken en natuurlijk de goeie, ouwe datacollectie, -opslag, -pre-processing en –analyse. Over ICM in OLVG Concreet werkt het ICM intern aan een betere doorstroom van patiënten, waardoor onze collega’s in de zorg minder hollen en stilstaan. Daarnaast zorgen wij, samen met andere afdelingen, voor een balans tussen productie, capaciteit en financiën. Hiervoor wordt onder andere gekeken naar een Hospital Control Center dat als een soort ‘verkeerstoren’ van OLVG moet gaan functioneren. Uiteindelijk zal capaciteitsmanagement samen met onze regiopartners uitgevoerd gaan worden om zo nog betere zorg te kunnen leveren. Het team is in oprichting en daarom sterk in ontwikkeling. Hierdoor heb je de unieke mogelijkheid hier zelf een bijdrage aan te leveren. Als ICM team willen we graag het data-driven pad op en een volgende stap maken naar volwassenheid in dit domein.  Concreter: we willen van ad-hoc en in silo's naar integraal en bedrijfsbreed inzichten halen uit interne en externe data voor uiteindelijk betere capaciteitsbeslissingen. Functie-eisen We verleggen de bekende weg als het bijdraagt aan het resultaat. En bedenken het liefst hoe het nóg beter kan. Op eigen wijze en met elkaar. Daarom rekenen we op jouw enthousiasme en overtuigingskracht om samen te werken aan een data-driven integraal capaciteitsmanagement voor OLVG.  Dit neem je ook mee: een afgeronde WO analytics opleiding. (b.v. data-science, artificial intelligence, econometrie, statistiek, wiskunde of technische bedrijfskunde) minimaal 1 jaar ervaring in het data domein als bijvoorbeeld data-analist, scientist of engineer in relatie tot ICM je hebt ervaring met ICM in ziekenhuizen ervaring met (het implementeren van) relevante stack van (cloud) data-warehousing tot BI-tooling. Waarbij ervaring met ETL tooling, bij voorkeur SAS Data Integration Studio, SAS Enterprise Guide en restful API’s op basis van HL7 FIHR een pre is. ervaring met talen zoals: SQL, R en/of Python en met tools zoals: Excel, PowerBI en/of Tableau je werkt graag in teamverband, maar kunt ook goed zelfstandig werken. Je bent een zelfstarter. Wij bieden Werken bij OLVG betekent werken in hét stadsziekenhuis van Amsterdam. Een werkomgeving waar jij je optimaal kunt ontwikkelen. Want jouw wensen en ideeën doen ertoe. Zo doen we dat bij OLVG.  Daarom bieden we jou: een passend bruto per salarismaand (fulltime) in FWG-schaal 60 cao ziekenhuizen (maximaal € 4.798,-) dienstverband voor de periode van één jaar, met zicht op verlenging voor onbepaalde tijd eindejaarsuitkering van ruim 8% vakantiegeld van ruim 8% 144 uur vakantieverlof goede reiskostenregeling persoonlijk levensfasebudget van 57 uur verlof en de ruimte om te werken aan jouw eigen ontwikkelingswensen pensioenregeling bij PFZW voordeel op jouw ziektekostenpremie met onze collectieve ziektekostenverzekering. Kies uit IZZ of Zilveren Kruis Achmea kortingen op verzekeringen en financiële diensten van Centraal Beheer Achmea korting bij diverse lokale ondernemers, zoals eettentjes, cafés en sportcentra onbeperkt toegang tot e-learnings en ons vitaliteitsprogramma de keuze in arbeidsvoorwaarden die bij jou passen. Zie ons OLVG Meerkeuzesysteem Arbeidsvoorwaarden. Deze arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn op basis van een fulltime dienstverband (36 uur per week).

title: Director Software Engineering
summary:
Examples include large data sets, distributed systems, security aspects, self-healing and auto-scaling.
Your role is to undertake day-to-day management of the…
description: eBay Classifieds Group is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. About the position: As Director of Engineering, you will ensure teams build high quality, globally scalable services. As part of our central product and technology team, you will participate in designing our long term technology strategy and will lead teams executing core parts of it. In the last years we successfully transitioned core pieces of our architecture to globally used, multi-tenant capabilities. Given recent developments there is an appetite to accelerate the approach and thinking. You inspire your engineering teams to think big and develop for scale. The Engineering Director will work directly with product and technology leaders in our Amsterdam headquarters as well as international counterparts. Your role is to undertake day-to-day management of the delivery of centralized data services and products and developing longer term strategy to ensure the best balance between impact and investment. The teams consist of engineers, architects and scientists to which you will provide technical and product leadership on tech/engineering enablers to local business to enhance their local product delivery capabilities Articulate and communicate towards the team’s development plans and capabilities, R&D expenditures, product status and overall goals as the company moves forward in its strategy. Own the intellectual process of researching and analyzing new technologies, capturing and synthesizing information and formulating insightful findings and conclusions. Responsible for cross organizational optimization, scalability and growth at a global level. Be a sounding board for ideas and a center of excellence for all matters relating to current and future technologies. Contribute to strategy for long-term platform stability and world-class architecture Establish strategies around internal vs. external technology investments. Effectively be a great partner, liaise with counterparts to use existing technology where relevant Technology Strategy. Evaluate the current technology landscape (technology stack, products, people, etc.) and recommend a forward-looking, short and long-term technology strategic vision and plan. Lead product innovation process within the Product groups that align to market strategies. Provide reliable technical assessments of potential mergers and acquisitions. Responsible for architecture design strategies to ensure a scalable/product design that meets the needs of the market. Establish an environment that stimulates innovation and creativity and improves customer experience. Build a culture of accountability, quality, agility and high performance that will foster the attraction, development and retention of outstanding product and technical talent. Build premier R&D practices and execution excellence, spanning product specification, change management, software reviews and project management, documentation, product release procedures, portability across operating systems and software quality control. Position and prepare the technology organization for scalable growth – architecture, development, infrastructure, people, processes, roadmaps, etc. Preferred Experience: Consistent track record of leading a development organization of a similar size or larger for an internet, communications or software company known for best in class products and digital transformation. Possess a blend of business and be technically savvy; have a big-picture vision as well as the drive and attention to detail that transforms strategy into action Demonstrated experience with engineering complexities coming with delivery at global scale. Examples include large data sets, distributed systems, security aspects, self-healing and auto-scaling. Deep affinity with various agile processes and cultivating the agile growth mentality. Always up to date with regards to advances in technology and can translate them into business opportunities. The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience leading change management initiatives such as re-architecting, re-deployment and platform building. Proven track record for product delivery: entrepreneurial drive and a demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast paced environment. Experience in working with multiple design centers, consolidating resources and outsourcing technology development. Strong “people” skills with a consistent record of team building as well as motivating and developing staff. Experience with mobile / multi-device development. Able to effectively present information, gain feedback and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients and customers. Ideal Background Business or Science Degree with a technology background (prefer a technical role in past) Experience (7-10 years) with project/program management experience in the online space (preferably e-commerce) Experience working in global organization, with remote partners We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Benefits: Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/our-company/diversity-inclusion/ This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies View our privacy policy View our accessibility info eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Senior Software Engineer Ruby / Amsterdam / Fulltime
summary:
You will join the current team of 5 developers, 5 data scientists and one product owner.
Our client builds a sustainability data platform that is used by…
description: Amsterdam Our client builds a sustainability data platform that is used by investors world wide. The platform allows investors and managers to get meaningful and actionable data that enables them to improve their assets' performance and footprint on the planet.  They have a small but efficient product team and are looking for Senior developers. You will join the current team of 5 developers, 5 data scientists and one product owner.  The stack the is beeing used includes: R, Ruby on Rails, Go, Grape, PostgreSQL, Memcached, StimulusJS and React and is deployed on AWS via a GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline. They use the right tool for the job, with the majority of the code being in Ruby. Our client has what DHH calls the Citadel.  As a Senior Developer you will: Help maintain and extend the platform, by upgrading older components (Currently they are on Rails 5.2, but are planning to upgrade to 6.0) Refactor or write new code, test the code and remove code Bring new ideas that will help deliver more value faster or even rethink parts of the product and processe  Who is the ideal Senior Developer for our Client? At least 4 years of professional web developer experience Excellent knowledge of relational databases Experience with automated testing Object-oriented design Strong communication skills Team player Proactive  You will get extra credits if you have experience with: Experience with AWS Experience with Docker containers Experience with Bootstrap or modern CSS Experience with modern Javascript/ECMAScript 6 Experience with Ruby and/or Rails  What our clients offers you? Gross annual salary up to €75.000 25 days of paid holidays Personal development budget - €2500 per year Free public transport to and from the office inside the Netherlands Free lunch and fruit Flexible hours and the option to occasionally work from home Annual company retreats with the full team

title: Product lead
summary: Begrip en communicatief vaardig met verschillende disciplines en niveaus: designers, developers, data scientists, marketeers, innovatie experts en directies.
description: Wij zijn een corporate innovatie studio. Samen met onze klanten creëren wij nieuwe impactvolle business modellen door snelle executie en resultaten. Werken met Aim is ondernemen: wij combineren ondernemerservaring (onze streng geselecteerde ondernemers), kennis van de markt (de klant) en begeleiding (onze innovatie-coaches, strategen en designers). Wij bouwen business voor bedrijven en organisaties als Pon, Wolters Kluwer en HEMA en zijn sinds 2012 gedreven door één ding: het elke dag beter doen.  Wat ga je doen? Geweldige ideeën verdienen het om te groeien. Maar meestal is het niet het idee zelf, maar de uitvoering ervan die beslist of het een succes wordt of niet.  Als ervaren product lead weet je de brug te slaan tussen de business wereld (innovatie processen en nieuwe business modellen) en tech wereld (digitale technologie- en productontwikkeling). Je bent de expert op dit gebied binnen Aimforthemoon en naar en met onze klanten.  Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de producten die we ontwikkelingen voor onze corporate partners en corporate startups. Door inspiratie, coaching, productontwikkeling -en management weet jij de waarde en groei te vergroten door ervoor te zorgen dat de digitale uitvoering optimaal en datagedreven is. Ook draag je bij aan de de digitalisering van Aimforthemoon en begeleid je en bouw je mee aan producten die hieraan bijdragen.  Je werkt nauw samen met onze design lead en bouwt mee aan een development team en/of samenwerking met externe partijen om te bouwen aan solide digitale oplossingen. Oplossingen die bepalend zijn voor je bedrijfsresultaat en die het leven van de eindgebruiker vereenvoudigen. Oplossingen die passen bij de innovatiefase van een business: van experiment naar prototype naar MVP naar een werkend, schaalbare oplossing.  Wie ben jij? Ervaren professional in online productstrategie en -ontwikkeling Begrip en communicatief vaardig met verschillende disciplines en niveaus: designers, developers, data scientists, marketeers, innovatie experts en directies Strategisch & hands-on aanpakker Tech expert & liefhebber Altijd op zoek naar zakelijke kansen in een snel veranderende digitale omgeving Creatief denker: complexe dingen eenvoudig en inspirerend kunnen maken Ervaring met innovatie / lean / agile methodologieën Ervaring met het faciliteren van sessies op verschillende niveaus Ervaring en affiniteit in de wereld met de wereld van corporate innovatie & venture building Netwerk van goede tech partners en specialisten Teamplayer Wat we bieden? Marktconform salaris Secundaire voorwaarden Onderdeel worden van een hecht en ambitieus team Werk vanuit onze inspirerende Moonshot Studio in Amsterdam met mooi uitzicht en dakterras (uiteraard werken wij virtueel zolang we in lockdown zitten). Een bedrijf dat werkt met mooie klanten (Pon, WoltersKluwer en HEMA) in een startup-manier van werken Community lunches, borrels en teamactiviteiten Veel persoonlijke groeimogelijkheden “Grow and innovate by doing. I believe in the power of execution. Driven by strategy, design, data and creativity." Design lead Max Hoefeijzers

title: Senior Product Analyst
summary:
Analytics Engineering: Collaborate with data engineering to bring analytical data models into production.
Experience working with Payments data is a big plus.
description: We believe in a future where inner cities are free of cars, congestion and pollution. By offering our dockless electrical scooters and bikes as convenient alternatives for short-distance travel, we believe we can make that future possible. Our mission is to thoughtfully design micro-mobility for safety, comfort and durability, improving city life in Europe and beyond.  Founded in Europe, Dott compromises a highly experienced team of inquisitive minds in mobility and tech. What we do today has a tangible impact on tomorrow. We reached our in-house sustainability target of 100% renewable energy, and ensure equitability in our communities through collaborating with city charities, officials and safety boards.  At Dott, we believe data should be at the heart of everything we do. We are looking for someone who embodies that philosophy and who is capable of driving data-centricity throughout the whole organisation. As a product analyst in our externally facing product team, you’ll be a key figure in the development of a frictionless, and highly enjoyable user experience. You’ll work as a spider in the web, collaborating closely with engineers, product managers, data scientists and engineers to drive better decisions.  What You'll Do Driving Decisions: Collaborate with decision makers in product and leadership to design a great user experience Experimentation: Design, execute and analyse product experiments Data Storytelling: Create highly engaging dashboards (in Tableau) and analyses that help decision makers make better choices Data Products: You’re a key contributor to the development and deployment of data science products that drive a better user experience Self-Service: Drive democratisation of data by supporting the construction of a self-service metrics mart, educate and excite colleagues. Funnel and Growth Analytics: Build and analyse product funnels and growth loops to identify improvement opportunities Analytics Engineering: Collaborate with data engineering to bring analytical data models into production What You'll Need Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematic, Physics, CS or a comparable STEM-field 4+ years working as a data analyst Excellent communication skills and able to build clear, compelling narratives You thrive in dynamic high growth environment and are comfortable with ambiguity You’re a creative thinker and problem solver, seeing opportunities where others do not. Fluent in and passionate about SQLExtensive experience building Dashboards with data visualisation tools (we use Tableau) Experience working with Payments data is a big plus Experience with Python is a big plus Experience working with the Google Cloud Platform is a big plus What’s in it for me? Alongside a competitive compensation plan, we invite our employees to participate in our stock option plan. You’ll be part of a collaborative, energetic and international team who enjoy the perks of flexible working hours, medical insurance contribution and fun company events.  Closing & equal opportunities employer statement Come as you are Dott is an equal opportunities employer. We invest in diversity, ensure equality and encourage expression. We have a zero-tolerance policy for harassment, bias or discrimination towards applicants and employees. Want to join us for the ride? Let’s do this right – together.

title: Associate
summary:
Advanced data analytics and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you;
Turning data into better healthcare is our mission.
description: Turning data into better healthcare is our mission. LOGEX is leading the way in healthcare analytics. We empower stakeholders at every level of the healthcare system by bringing clarity to decisions that result into the best possible healthcare. Our solutions transform data into actionable insights, showing exactly where to take strategic action that leads to the best possible outcome at lowest possible cost. Our team of over 300 international experts consists of data scientists, analysts, consultants and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics. We work together to support our customers and build long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with them.  THE CHALLENGE LOGEX receives the operational and financial data of 90% of the Dutch hospitals and converts these with self-developed software into performance benchmarks and financial forecasts. As associate you are responsible for, for example, the benchmarks of performances of medical specialists, the forecasts of the needed care for your hospital and/or making cost-price/calculations for hospitals. But also analyzing the “healthpaths” (from a medical/clinical perspective) with the goal of delivering effective and sensible care is an important part of your activities. Together with our ambitious team of consultants and developers you will develop state-of-the-art analytical models and application that give our clients insights in the complex issues where healthcare professionals struggle with.  Experience & skills Msc degree with a quantative/ beta/ technical background; You have 3-5 relevant work-experience; You’re a real ‘number cruncher’ with excellent analytical skills; Result-driven, with a structured way of working and pragmatic ‘can-do’ mentality; Advanced data analytics and ‘big data’ issues in healthcare excite you; You have a strong drive and want to have an impact on the business; You feel at ease in an informal and professional setting where you get a lot of freedom and responsibility; You speak and write Dutch and English fluently. We offer Besides excellent working conditions, a nice working environment in a young, international, enthusiastic and talented team where hard work and having fun go hand-in-hand. We have weekly drinks and regularly fun team activities; Training and coaching; The opportunity to have a valuable social contribution to optimize the healthcare of the Netherlands. Interested? We would like to tell you more about this exciting opportunity! You can apply by the below button and upload your motivation letter and CV (in English). For more information or if you have any questions you can contact Elise Dijckmeester via elise.dijckmeester@logex.com.

title: Global Digital Tool Product Owner
summary:
Driving common data models across tools collaborating with various data warehousing teams, business process owners and internal customers.
You are a part of.
description: Job Title Global Digital Tool Product Owner Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Support the FP&A digital strategy by owning user requirements, creating user stories for the backlog, and further deploying digital analytics tools delivering actionable insights to steer business performance. You are responsible for Pro-actively managing large groups of cross functional stakeholders as part of reporting and analytics development projects and owning the tools backlog based on their input Closely working with the technical implementation teams, translating the business requirements into project deliverables and ensuring the delivery is on track Interacting with the finance business process owners ensuring that all applicable generated insights are integrated in the tool for one place to access Preparing, attending, taking notes and keeping track of follow ups regarding digital tools Change Control Board (CCB). Understanding the business process of the business domain in order to ensure a tight link of the generated insights to the respective business processes. You are eager to comprehend processes in adjacent domains, beyond the finance domain. Driving common data models across tools collaborating with various data warehousing teams, business process owners and internal customers Being a custodian for a set of tools ensuring process adherence, right version of insights provided and internal customer satisfaction Building an internal network with Business, Market and Functions, other FP&A and Finance pillars, other functions and E2E community inspiring the decision makers to adopt the use of digital reporting and analytics tools While joining efforts with the expert data scientists in the team maturing the tools on the analytics continuum from descriptive and diagnostic towards predictive and prescriptive reducing the need for judgement for the target audience decision makers by challenging stakeholder’s requirements and delivering transparent and reliable insights Starting and delivering initiatives to drive standardized tools that are supporting business processes and harmonize insights delivery across business and markets Evangelizing the tools internally by creating high impact demonstrations, communication and inspiring new developments Interacting with IT, Enterprise information management and other finance systems teams to understand the technical roadmap going forward, align the systems set-up, and problem solvin Setting up and supervizing operational and support activities Participating in driving the digital curriculum, developing the finance teams digital skills You are a part of The Digital CoE within the global Philips FP&A organization. You will report functionally to the Analytics & Tools owner within the Digital CoE. The Digital CoE consists of 18 people with different skills in finance systems and financial insights. The team is supported by IT and enterprise information management teams. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Background in a corporate finance domain (FP&A, accounting, controlling, treasury, etc.), relevant education or proven experience required 7-12 years experience in large scale business intelligence projects, ideally in the finance domain Project management skills, ideally certified PMI PM professional or PRINCE2. Experience in applying agile development methodologies Proven track for the delivery of projects in a complex enterprise environment with cross-departmental relations, in particular end-to-end delivery of business intelligence and analytics projects from ideation to operations Deep understanding of modern business intelligence / analytics concepts and set-up / configuration of data models in those environments. This includes enterprise DWH (e.g. SAP BW), OLAP (e.g. SSAS), ETL (SSIS, Knime, Alteryx), Front end reporting (e.g. Power BI or Qlik), Analytical programming (R, Python) with hands on experience in at least one of the domains. In return, we offer you We encourage you to join a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to explore, especially within the corporate environment of Finance! Experience to be gained in working with highly motivated and skilled professionals in an international setting. Our benefits are very competitive and crafted around your preferences: A market conform salary 25 Days of leave and the possibility to purchase up to 20 extra days off annually A variable bonus based on both Philips results and personal performance Extensive set of tools to drive your career, such as a personal development budget, free training and mentoring Solid company pension scheme and attractive collective health insurance discount Opportunity to buy Philips shares and products with discount Healthy work-life balance Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. #LI-EU Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it. If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com. (Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

title: Technician – Light Microscopy and Image Analysis Specialist
summary: Upon request, you will guide these users in sample preparation, assist with their image acquisition settings, and instruct them how to manage, analyse and…
description: Vacaturenr. 21-093 Functie-categorie Niet-wetenschappelijke functies Omvang (fte) 1.0 Extern/intern Intern , Extern Locatie Leiden Geplaatst op 23 februari 2021 Sluitingsdatum 26 maart 2021  The Faculty of Science, Leiden Academic Centre for Drug Research (LACDR) is looking for a Technician – Light Microscopy and Image Analysis Specialist Project description The Leiden Academic Centre for Drug Research (LACDR) is part of the Faculty of Science. The LACDR is a leading institute that conducts fundamental and strategic scientific research in the field of innovative drug research. The Cell Observatory houses cutting-edge bio-imaging technology aimed at visualizing the dynamic structures of life - from molecule to cell to organism. It is located in the new Gorlaeus building and serves as a meeting place and shared facility for scientists from different institutes of the Faculty of Science, fostering interdisciplinary collaboration. The goal of research at the Cell Observatory is to visualize and comprehend the dynamics of the living cell down to the molecular level, because understanding of these fundamental mechanisms of life is essential for progress in tackling disease. Over the past 15 years the Division of Drug Discovery and Safety of the Leiden Academic Centre for Drug Research (LACDR) has established a high-throughput microscopy screening facility within the Cell Observatory, which includes 4 confocals, 1 spinning disk and dedicated robotics to perform phenotypic screens. The Cell Observatory is also on its way to become one of the first Dutch FAIR imaging core facilities. Key responsibilities As a Light Microscopy and Image Analysis Specialist you will be part of the Division of Drug Discovery and Safety and ensure the operation and regular maintenance of all light microscopes of the high-throughput microscopy facility. You will use your expertise and knowledge of experimental set-ups to create tailored imaging protocols to resolve complex imaging problems. You will be expected to respond to the demands of the users of the facility patiently and inventively. You will train, assist and supervise researchers with different levels of experience (from Bachelor's degree students to highly experienced scientists) and you will give them instructions where necessary and appropriate. Upon request, you will guide these users in sample preparation, assist with their image acquisition settings, and instruct them how to manage, analyse and organize their acquired data using the available software and data-management systems at the facility. You will also support the overall laboratory management of the Division of Drug Discovery and Safety. Selection criteria A University or Higher Professional Education+ (HBO+) degree in Science; Ample experience in the application of advanced light microscopy techniques (Confocal, Widefield, LightSheet, spinning disk, fluorescence, DIC); Experience with image and data analysis support and knowledge of software suites (ImageJ/Fiji, CellProfiller); Experience with systems administration (Windows Server) and data management (Omero) will be considered a plus; The ability to disseminate your knowledge to others in an effective way but also to supervise and guide newcomers from various backgrounds; A service mentality, and basic knowledge of simple quality control routines; A willingness to learn new techniques; The ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team; The ability to set priorities and directives; The ability to write technical manuals and make contributions to funding applications and research articles; The ability to communicate in English (fluently) and preferably also in Dutch (or the willingness to learn Dutch). Our organisation The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are committed to expand fundamental knowledge by curiosity and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future. For more information, see the website of the Faculty of Science. The research carried out at the Faculty of Science is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and fifteen master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and almost 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together. Terms and conditions A position with room for personal input, a pleasant working atmosphere in a creative environment with the possibility to work with the most modern equipment. In accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, initially we offer a one year term position with the possibility of renewal to a permanent position. The salary range is from € 2,329.- to € 4,012.- gross per month (fulltime, scale 7, 8 or 9, depending on education and experience). In addition, Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package. For example, there is an end-of-year bonus (8.3%), holiday allowance (8%), excellent training facilities, paid parental leave, sabbatical leave and the option of our individual choices model to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. For more information, see the website. Diversity Leiden University is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from members of underrepresented groups.  Information For any questions, you are welcome to contact Sylvia Le Dévédec. Telephone: +31 715274285 or email to s.e.ledevedec@lacdr.leidenuniv.nl. Applications Applications quoting the vacancy number, including a motivation letter and curriculum vitae, can be sent by e-mail to m.j.l.lugthart@lacdr.leidenuniv.nl attention of Marjolijn Lugthart 26 March 2021 at the latest. Acquisition is not appreciated.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Data optimaal benutten en daarmee het verschil maken voor onze klanten en de wereld om ons heen. Dat is wat je doet als Senior Data Scientist bij Info Support. Je optimaliseert bestaande data- en rapportage processen, ontwikkelt nieuwe tools, analyseert grote hoeveelheden (big) data, voorspelt en implementeert modellen en algoritmes en interpreteert resultaten. Alles met als doel om de klant vooruit te helpen. Onze klanten opereren in een dynamische omgeving, waarin ontwikkelingen elkaar in snel tempo opvolgen. Wij geloven dat Big Data & Algorithms grote krachten zijn achter vooruitgang. Samen met een team van data experts bouw jij aan een mooie en duurzame toekomst voor deze organisaties. Als Senior Data Scientist ben jij het eerste aanspreekpunt voor Data Science-gerelateerde vragen binnen onze DevOps teams. Zowel voor teamleden als voor de klant. Je start zelfstandig projecten op en draagt zorg voor het tijdig opleveren en in productie brengen van projecten. Je analyseert grote hoeveelheden (big) data. Je bedenkt, traint en implementeert voorspellende modellen en slimme algoritmes. Modellen die realtime interactie hebben met eindgebruikers zoals een “mijn omgeving”. Je interpreteert resultaten en adviseert de business. Naast je vakinhoudelijke inbreng neem je ook kansen waar in lopende Data & AI opdrachten bij klanten of binnen Info Support. Je zorgt ervoor dat zaken als Big Data, Machine Learning en Deep Learning tot leven komen en begrijpbaar worden voor alle betrokken stakeholders. In je functie krijg je alle vrijheid om met je collega’s te onderzoeken hoe de wereld er over een paar weken, maanden of jaren uit gaat zien. Samen ga je op zoek naar nieuwe wegen en originele oplossingen en laat je data vragen beantwoorden die nooit eerder zijn gesteld. Wat bied jij Info Support? Als Senior Data Scientist ben jij een frontrunner binnen je vakgebied. Communicatief ben je zeer vaardig. Je haalt energie uit kennisdeling, je inspireert en enthousiasmeert. Je hebt een grote passie voor alles wat data driven is en draagt het vakgebied uit binnen en buiten Info Support. Je ondersteunt een team van data specialisten (Data Engineers, Data Analysten etc.), maar voelt je ook comfortabel bij het ontwikkelen van software en het werken met CI/CD-pipelines. Kortom, een IT’er met een voorliefde voor data die nooit uitgeleerd is. Verder is vereist: een combinatie van enerzijds kennis van Data Science en Software Development en anderzijds de beheersing van didactische vaardigheden; kennis van de laatste ontwikkelingen op het vakgebied; ervaring met onder andere de programmeertalen Python, SQL, NoSQL, Java of C#; ervaring met AI methoden als Machine learning, Deep learning, statistische modellen; je neemt een voortrekkersrol richting onze klanten; je hebt niet alleen de verwachtingen van de klant helder, maar je hebt ook de risico’s in beeld; minimaal 5 jaar aantoonbare werkervaring als Data Scientist; solide ervaring in data analyse en rapportageomgevingen; je bent in staat om mensen te binden en op coachende wijze te sturen en je weet zelfsturing te bevorderen. Wat biedt Info Support jou? Uiteraard ontvang je een uitstekend arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket bestaande uit een marktconform salaris, een leaseauto, laptop, mobiel, maar ook deel je mee in de winst van de onderneming en krijg je een ruime onkostenvergoeding. Maar we bieden meer. Je krijgt een netwerk van, en gaat werken met, de beste vakgenoten binnen de Nederlandse IT. Zij werken in (blended) Agile teams bij gerenommeerde klanten. Over de projecten en klanten heen helpen zij elkaar via onze Technology Areas Software Architecture, Way of Working en Data/AI. Je houdt hierdoor altijd zicht op nog meer gave projecten bij onze andere klanten in de sectoren Finance, Industry, Agrifood & Culture, Mobility & Public en Healthcare. En je mag hiertussen wisselen als jij daar klaar voor bent. Als specialist in maatwerksoftware, Data/AI solutions, beheer en trainingen bieden wij jou een rijke carrière en bieden wij klanten solide en innovatieve oplossingen voor complexe en bedrijf kritische softwarevraagstukken. Als een van de weinige IT-consultancy bedrijven beschikt Info Support over een eigen inhouse kenniscentrum waar wordt voldaan aan jouw honger naar meer of andere kennis en vaardigheden. Kortom een werkgever waar veel aandacht is voor jouw persoonlijke en vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling als IT professional. Onlangs is Info Support uitgeroepen tot Top Employer Nederland. Over Info Support Info Support is specialist in maatwerksoftware, data/AI solutions, beheer en trainingen, actief in de sectoren finance, energie, agrifood, mobiliteit, overheid, pensioen, retail en zorg. Info Support heeft met kantoren in Veenendaal (NL) en Mechelen (BE) circa 500 medewerkers in dienst. Het bedrijf biedt solide en innovatieve oplossingen voor complexe en bedrijfkritische softwarevraagstukken. De werkwijze van Info Support kenmerkt zich door een aantal kernwaarden: soliditeit, integriteit, vakmanschap en passie. Onlangs is de organisatie voor de 23e keer op rij uitgeroepen tot Top Employer IT Nederland. Uiteraard beschikt Info Support over een inhouse kenniscentrum waar graag wordt voldaan aan jouw honger naar meer of andere kennis en vaardigheden. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Overuren uitbetaald Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Auto van de zaak Bedrijfsfeesten Bedrijfsfitness Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Extra vakantiedagen Gezondheidsprogramma Kerstpakket Levensverzekering Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Werk vanuit huis Winstdeling Zorgverzekering Werkschema: ma-vr Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

title: Azure Data Analytics Engineer
summary: Dit team van gepassioneerde data scientist vormt de spil in data analytics en oplossingen voor klanten die we, in combinatie met de overige diensten van de ICT…
description: Ben jij gepassioneerd door data en de mogelijkheden die het creëert? Ter uitbreiding van ons Data Intelligence en AI team zijn wij op zoek naar een Azure Data Analytics Engineer. Dit team van gepassioneerde data scientist vormt de spil in data analytics en oplossingen voor klanten die we, in combinatie met de overige diensten van de ICT Group, toepasbaar maken voor klanten.  Wat ga je doen? In een wereld waarin de organisaties om ons heen in snel tempo digitaal transformeren help jij, als Azure Data Analytics Engineer binnen ICT Group, onze klanten vooruit door je vast te bijten in hun datavraagstukken. Maar wat ga je allemaal doen voor de klant? De data waarmee je werkt zal niet vanzelf schoon zijn, of zelfs maar beschikbaar zijn. Een deel van je werk is het ontsluiten en opschonen van data (ophalen van data via API/cleaning/Azure DataFactory / Databricks, en opschonen op een slimme manier) Je gebruikt jouw ervaring met machine learning algoritmes om data science oplossingen te ontwikkelen die waarde toevoegen voor de klant; Met jouw kennis van Data Architecturen weet je data engineering oplossingen naar productie te brengen Zowel in het voorbereiden als uitvoeren van projecten werk je nauw samen met onze Architecten, Data Specialisten en Project Managers om de vraagstukken van de klant om te zetten in oplossingen die toegevoegde waarde leveren; Je neemt initiatieven, deelt kennis en ideeën en bent samen met collega’s bezig met het vooruit brengen van klanten op deze gebieden; Je neemt ons mee in de continue ontwikkelende wereld van Data, AI en ML;  Dit is wie wij zoeken: Je hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting Data Science, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Wiskunde, Econometrie, Bio informatica of Natuurkunde; Je bent analytisch, onderzoekend en communicatief sterk; Je bent bekend met data science technieken om data mee te kunnen analyseren en verbanden te kunnen vinden; Je hebt begrip van data architecturen Ook heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol; Ervaring met werken in projecten en begeleiden van junior data specialisten; Je hebt uitgebreide ervaring met Python; Je hebt hands on ervaring met een breed scala aan analyses, data, het testen, visualisatie (Power BI) en optimalisatie tools; Verder ben je bekend met de volgende technieken; Spark, DWH, PowerBI, SQL, en Microsoft Azure (voornamelijk Databricks en Azure DataFactory); Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Engels als Nederlands; Het meeste werk vindt plaats in en rond de Randstad;  Dit hebben we jou te bieden Goed salaris: je ontvangt een goed marktconform salaris 13e maand: elk jaar een extra maandloon 29 vakantiedagen: met de vrijheid om dagen bij of te verkopen Pensioenregeling: een goede regeling voor je oude dag Leaseauto: of een vergoeding voor je eigen auto Onkostenvergoeding: een netto bijdrage in werkgerelateerde kosten Opleidingen: houd je kennis op peil in onze ICT Academy Boekenbudget: koop een boek of hard- of software voor jezelf  Herken jij jezelf in deze vacature? Stuur dan je reactie via het online sollicitatieformulier of per mail naar hans.rademakers@ict.nl Heb je vragen, bel ons gerust op 088-9082000 en vraag naar Hans Rademakers.

title: Junior Business Analist Customer Promise Realization
summary: Vervolgens werk je technische requirements uit om jouw oplossing ook daadwerkelijk te laten bouwen met product owners, developers en data scientists!
description: Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij? Bol.com verandert retail om het dagelijks leven van 11 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten makkelijker te maken. Op die missie worden we vergezeld door 39.000 partners die klanten verrassen met unieke proposities. In totaal worden er nu zo’n 30 miljoen artikelen op ons retail tech platform aangeboden. Artikelen die allemaal snel en efficiënt hun weg naar de klant moeten vinden. Gegeven het stijgende ordervolume (Black Friday 2020: 700 bestellingen per minuut), dient de logistieke organisatie te worden opgeschaald en gerationaliseerd. Als Business Analist Customer Promise Realization lever je daar een directe bijdrage aan en zorg je ervoor dat de bestellingen in de logistieke keten verwerkt kunnen worden. Mega belangrijk omdat we niet willen dat de warehouses geen orders binnenkrijgen en de bestelde goederen niet (op tijd) bij de klant geleverd kunnen worden. De grootste uitdaging Open deur: Je werkt in het hart van bol.com: door de technische systemen gaan elke dag duizenden orders. Elke schakel die suboptimaal presteert, strooit zand in de logistieke motor. Zorgen dat we de klant een eerlijke belofte doen over wanneer het pakketje aankomt is een van onze uitdagingen. Continu monitoren we of we onze klantbelofte nakomen en of we onze beloftes moeten aanpassen. We bekijken hier ook of al onze IT systemen doen wat ze moeten doen of dat er iets misgaat. Daarnaast werk je innovaties uit die ons in staat stellen de capaciteit maximaal te (blijven) benutten. Wat je doet als Business Analist Customer Promise Realization Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de performance van de logistieke order keten. Dit betekent dat je continu dashboards monitort en signaleert indien er zaken misgaan. Als de systemen eruit liggen ga jij op onderzoek uit. Je betrekt verschillende collega’s, zodat de problemen snel verholpen zijn en de warehouses en bezorgpartners de orders kunnen ontvangen. Doordat je dagelijks met onze orderdata bezig bent, je kansen en (dreigende) knelpunten binnen het domein, dit is belangrijke input voor onze innovatie roadmap. Je werkt samen met collega’s aan innovaties. Hierbij werk je de probleemstelling uit, analyseer je oorzaken en brainstorm je over oplossingen. Vervolgens werk je technische requirements uit om jouw oplossing ook daadwerkelijk te laten bouwen met product owners, developers en data scientists! Als Business Analist Customer Promise Realization manage je in-house ontwikkelde IT systemen die de complexe order flow in goede banen leiden én pak je projecten op die capaciteitsambities elke dag dichterbij brengen. Werk met impact, want elke verbetering die je doorvoert draagt bij aan een betere klantervaring. Gelukkig gaat het niet vaak mis, maar als het mis gaat in deze keten is het alle hens aan dek. We zoeken iemand die het leuk vindt om uit te zoeken wat er aan de hand is en te zorgen dat de oorzaak van het issue zo snel mogelijk boven komt zodat we de juiste oplossing kunnen implementeren. Dit vraagt een stressbestendige persoonlijkheid die niet bang is om stakeholders van verschillende domeinen te benaderen om samen een probleem op te lossen. Tevens zijn we druk met innovatie: vanwege onze explosieve volumegroei moeten we kritisch kijken naar onze systemen en zorgen dat die mee kunnen groeien met de ambities. Bijvoorbeeld door diep de orderdata in te duiken en te analyseren en zo verbeterkansen te identificeren. Door samen met IT-ers de oplossingen uit te werken zorg je ervoor dat jouw innovatie ideeën ook daadwerkelijk gerealiseerd worden. Kortom: dit is een rol met een verscheidenheid aan taken. Daarom zoeken we iemand die het leuk vindt om te werken op het snijvlak tussen business en IT en zowel met IT-ers als met de operatie kan communiceren. Om als Business Analist Customer Promise Realization echt succesvol te zijn, dien je goed te kunnen samenwerken met anderen, want het oplossen van issues is vaak een multiple team effort. Je moet dus de juiste collega’s vinden én bij het onderwerp betrekken. Bovendien is het belangrijk dat je snel durft te beslissen, ook op basis van onvolledige informatie. Een mooie rol dus voor een startende Business Analist die enerzijds niet vies is van operationele modder en anderzijds de keten integraal kan overzien, doorgronden en innoveren. 3 redenen waarom dit (n)iets voor jou is Wel, als je een WO achtergrond combineert met bewezen analytische skills Wel, als jij je thuis voelt in hoog-volume dataomgevingen Wel, als je ernaar uitziet om te leren van ervaren Business Analisten Niet, als je puur projecten wilt leiden en vindt dat de IT-motor vanzelf moet draaien Niet, als je het lastig vindt collega’s mee te krijgen en te overtuigen Niet, als je pas een knoop doorhakt als wetenschappelijk is bewezen dat je keuze klopt Hier kom je terecht Bij hét online retail tech platform van Nederland en België. Een platform waar 11 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten kiezen uit meer dan 30 miljoen artikelen. En een platform dat zo’n 39.000 zakelijke partners helpt succesvol te ondernemen. Maar vooral een platform dat nooit ‘af’ is, want bol.com verandert retail al sinds 1999. En dat blijven we doen. Als het beter kan, maken we het beter! Samen met klanten, partners en zo’n 2.100 collega’s. Als Business Analist ben je onderdeel van het Order Flow team. Beiden bestaan uit 8 enthousiaste, hoogopgeleide collega’s. De setting is open, informeel, scherp op de inhoud, nuchter en innovatief. Bol.com gelooft in zelforganiserende teams, samen successen vieren en data-gedreven pionieren. Jij ook? Welkom in het team!  Wat je krijgt Wat je krijgt Wat je nog meer krijgt Een blauwe landing Nieuwe collega's krijgen bij bol.com een warm welkom, zodat jij je zo goed en snel mogelijk thuis voelt bij ons. Tijdens jouw introductieprogramma bol.com & ik, nemen we je helemaal mee in de bol.com wereld! Geld enzo.... Werken bij bol.com is uitdagend en daar zetten we uiteraard iets tegenover. Naast salaris, ontvang je ook een jaarlijkse prestatiegerichte bonus, vakantiegeld, 29 vakantiedagen, woon-en werkverkeer regelingen, aanvullende premievrije verzekeringen en meer. Jouw sollicitatieprocedure Je solliciteert We bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig en binnen 2 weken weet je of we je uitnodigen voor een gesprek. Eerste contact We bellen om het eerste gesprek in te plannen. Prangende vragen kun je dan al meteen stellen. In het ‘echt’ ontmoeten Dit eerste gesprek zien we als een kennismaking. We leren elkaar beter kennen en ontdekken of we goed bij elkaar passen. Het vervolggesprek Smaakt het naar meer? Dan gaan we in het tweede gesprek de inhoud in. Hiervoor vul je eerst een online assessment in met persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst, capaciteitentest en een case. Wij lichten de functie en het team toe. Wederzijdse liefde Twee gesprekken zijn vaak genoeg om een goed beeld te krijgen. En als onze liefde wederzijds is, dan begint jouw carrière bij bol.com. :) Nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Marlous Mooij Recruiter marlousmooij@bol.com

title: (contract) Statistician
summary:
Experience in the analysis of hyperspectral images and spectroscopic data would also be beneficial.
Proficient in Multivariate Statistical Process Control (MSPC…
description: Job Type Contract  Location Amsterdam  Area Netherlands  Sector Big Data & Analytics  Salary £440 - 530 per day  Start Date ASAP  Job Ref CSCNLSHAO  Description The Task: Templeton and Partners Limited is currently working with a large commercial client in Amsterdam, we are looking for an experienced Statistician/ Chemometrician for a long term project. As Chemometrician/Statistician, you’ll be leading wide-ranging statistical analysis of process data to help develop and deliver solutions for our downstream asset challenges, enabling insights that will ultimately improve the processes and drive performance. In practice, that means you’ll be part of a team designing statistical process control systems for fault detection and diagnosis and testing, as well as designing and implementing algorithms and methods. Alongside your technical expertise, you’ll also be calling on your natural people skills, confidently communicating business needs into data solutions, and presenting analytic results back into business language to a wide range of stakeholders, from scientists and engineers to industry managers in industry and academia. You’ll also need to be capable of managing multiple projects at the same time, and quickly learning new data analysis and chemometric techniques. Requirements We’re keen to hear from professionals with a strong background in Process Chemometrics and/or Applied Industrial Statistics, along with preferably a PhD in a relevant discipline, with some professional experience, or at least a Master’s degree with some additional further experience. Proficient in the use of chemometrics and multivariate statistical methods in non-linear/linear batch and continuous process data. Proficient in Multivariate Statistical Process Control (MSPC): process data visualization, modelling and monitoring. Experience in optimizing process conditions to maximize/minimize key process indicators or quality product properties using multivariate statistics and linear/non-linear optimization techniques. Knowledge of design of experiments, general linear modeling, statistical modeling, and/or time series modeling. An ability to work independently in MATLAB to implement, modify, adapt and apply MSPC methods to industrial data sets. Expertise in chemometrics software, such as PLS toolbox by Eigenvector. Proven industrial experience in applying MSPC to real process data in the form of current job or Post Doc experience. Experience in the analysis of hyperspectral images and spectroscopic data would also be beneficial.

title: Data Developer en Customer Success Consultant
summary:
Je beperkt je niet tot het opslaan, ophalen en doorstromen van de data, maar bouwt producten op basis van deze data.
Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau.
description: Omschrijving Als lid van het ‘Data Science en Services’ team lever jij samen met je collega’s een essentiële bijdrage aan het (door)ontwikkelen van het DATANEXT platform tot een van de leading ‘Next-Generation’ Customer Data Platformen, en daarbij horende webapplicaties en koppelingen. Je combineert complexe databases uit diverse interne en externe omgevingen en richt daarvoor de processen in. Je bent een data engineer die zich tevens bezig houdt met de business value van de data, en de concrete toepassingen voor de klant. Je beperkt je niet tot het opslaan, ophalen en doorstromen van de data, maar bouwt producten op basis van deze data. Bovendien pas je geavanceerde data analyse en datamining technieken toe om gestructureerde en ongestructureerde data om te zetten in inzichten in consumenten. Deze inzichten worden gebruikt om de (klant)processen verder te optimaliseren. Met behulp van het platform voorzie je alle relevante stakeholders van rapportages, inzichten, segmentaties en klantdata. Je neemt een adviserende rol in als de situatie daar om vraagt en je richt de processen in opdracht van de klant verder in aan de hand van het platform. Veder vul (en onderhoud) je samen met je collega’s de knowledge base met technische documentatie. Wat wordt er gevraagd Naast de profielschets hierboven wordt er verwacht dat je eigen initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid neemt en dat je breder kijkt dan alleen je eigen takenpakket. Het kantoor is open tijdens reguliere kantoortijden, maar het is mogelijk dat er in het weekend hoog urgente zaken binnen komen. Daarin wordt flexibiliteit verwacht. Het ambitie niveau ligt hoog, DATANEXT groeit graag door totdat ze een echte topspeler zijn op het gebied van ‘Big Data’, processen en Business Intelligence oplossingen. Ze zoeken daarom (aankomende) topspelers met dezelfde ambitie, die binnen hun vakgebied een actieve en ondernemende bijdrage leveren aan het succes van de DATANEXT Group. Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau Kennis van en ervaring met Big Data oplossingen en geavanceerde data mining tools Ruime ervaring met SQL Kennis van en ervaring met procesautomatisering. Ervaring met andere data analyse tools (zoals Tableau, Rapidminer, R en Python) is een pré. Pro-actief en ondernemend Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in spraak en geschrift Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie. Wat wordt er geboden DATANEXT is een groeiende, maar solide werkgever. De teams bestaan o.a. uit Data Scientists, AI/ML specialisten, en developers. Humor speelt een grote rol. Er is veel vrijheid en ze stimuleren en faciliteren ieder lid van het team om door te groeien. Het is een open en platte organisatie, waarin men elkaar respecteert, support én stimuleert. Ze hebben goeie koffie, verzorgen je lunch en zorgen voor vers fruit op de werkplek. Allemaal in een fijn kantoor in Groningen Zuid. Salarissen zijn marktconform en er is een uitstekende regeling voor een persoonlijke oudedagsvoorziening. Bedrijfsprofiel De DATANEXT Group bestaat uit een aantal labels, allen gebaseerd op haar eigen Customer Data Platform ‘DNX’. De uitingsvormen variëren in vorm en functie per klant, maar data staat altijd centraal, al dan niet gecombineerd met AI en Machine Learning. De verschillende labels richten zich o.a. op Customer Data, Marketing Automation, Quality Monitoring in klantcontact, AVG-ondersteuning en Lead Management. Om al deze data te kunnen verwerken is het van essentieel belang dat onze databases, datastromen en systemen goed worden ingericht en gemonitord. Ben jij de pro-actieve Data Engineer die dit gaat doen?  PLAY_GRND werkt voor deze vacature samen met DATANEXT. Heb je interesse? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button of neem gerust contact met ons op voor meer info!

title: Business Analyst
summary: You are part of a customer journey team which exists of a product owner, digital marketeers, developers, data engineers and scientists.
description: Share your passion for tech, innovation and performance! LeasePlan Digital are the digital enablers within LeasePlan, one of the world largest leasing organizations, active in 32 countries. What are you going to do? Analysing and modelling business processes (process flows) both As Isas well as To Be processes Based on the processes, help in capturing, translation and implementation of business needs (requirements Defining these requirements in a SMART way and track progress on delivery of the requirements Be a bridge between the business and supporting departments Assist in the creation of user stories and acceptance criteria Own the user stories in Jira What do you need to do the job? The confidence to speak up when something can be done better or smarter and the ability to accept compromises when necessary. Understand the current and future customer needs across various steps in the customer journey. A passion for turning data into valuable information. Ability to interact with technical resources and effectively communicate technical information and processes to relevant stakeholders. Working experience in integrations of backend with front end solutions. Knowledge of the process modeling method BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation) Working experience with Atlassian (Confluence, Jira), Slack and Gitlab. Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in business, information systems, marketing, computer science, or other relevant areas. You are: An energetic self-starter. Result driven. An excellent communicator and strong in international relationship management. Passionate and always looking for improvements. The team You are part of a customer journey team which exists of a product owner, digital marketeers, developers, data engineers and scientists. Working from Amsterdam this team is transforming the on-boarding of clients into a fully digital process. What LeasePlan does We keep people on the move. We do this in more 32 countries by obsessively focusing on how people get from A to B. And by developing and marketing the ultimate digital solution that enables an unlimited variety of driving and transport options. LeasePlan keeps people on the move. Giving them the freedom to go wherever they want. With any car, anytime, anywhere. That's only possible if we listen. And this is what drives us. What do we offer? A challenging job where you work on a product that is rolled out worldwide. Besides, it is an inspiring environment that is always in motion. Your workplace will be in a beautiful new office in Amsterdam and last but not least the opportunity to develop yourself in a growing international environment, with an appropriate salary and excellent secondary employment conditions.

title: Scientist Clinical Immunology
summary: The successful candidate is also responsible for instructing operators on the scientific fundamentals of the assays they are responsible for and to critically…
description: Leiden | Scientist Clinical Immunology| PhD | ELISA | Cell-based Assays | GCLP | Validation | 1041437  Your new role We are currently recruiting for a Scientist to join the Clinical Immunology team at Janssen Vaccines. The scientist will be responsible for designing and executing experiments for the development and validation of immunological assays to be used in the analysis of samples from clinical trials while also generating high-quality scientific reports to document his/her work. Alongside this, the responsible person will be liable to the long-term life cycle management of the methods he/she is the expert on, together with the key reagents, equipment and data analysis tools required for assay development. The Scientist is expected to maintain their technical flare by following relevant literature and knowledge in their relevant field and preform experiments on a regular basis to support assay development processes. The activities must be carried out according to GCLP quality requirements. The successful candidate is also responsible for instructing operators on the scientific fundamentals of the assays they are responsible for and to critically review data generated by them.  What you'll need to succeed Do you have a PhD in biological/medical sciences with a strong immunology or virology background?
