Do you have at least 3 years’ experience in a pharmaceutical/ biotech company? The successful candidate must have extensive hands on experience in the development to validation of serology or cell-based assays such as ELISA, Virus Neutralization Assays, ELISPOT, and Flow Cytometry. You must have excellent technical writing skills along with proven knowledge of procedures to establish comparability and bridging of critical reagents. If you have experience with Design of Experiment (DoE) it is considered a plus. Experience and knowledge of statistical tools such as SPSS and JMP is a must. Excellent communication in English is required. Experience in working under quality standards such as GCLP, GCP or GMP is a must.  Your new company Janssen Vaccines & Prevention, formerly Crucell, is dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health. Their teams focus on the discovery, development, manufacture and marketing of vaccines and antibodies to protect people worldwide from infectious diseases. In the Janssen organization, entrepreneurial people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points. To strengthen the team, Janssen is continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value.The Clinical Immunology department is responsible for the immunological evaluation of vaccine candidates in clinical trials. In close collaboration with the Biomarker group and clinical development group, the clinical immunology department executes the immuno strategies and ensures the development, and validation of the required immunological assays as well as clinical sample analysis and data reporting. Typical assays to determine the immunogenicity of vaccines are the antibody ELISA, T cell ELISpot, Intracellular Cytokine Staining, and virus neutralization assays. The clinical immunology department offers Janssen Vaccines with services in Scientific and operational excellence, with high standards of quality and compliance.  What you'll get in return Hays Detachering | This is a project that will start with a contract for 12 months through Hays. Extension to stay within the department is anticipated. At this position, you will get a competitive salary and your travel expenses are covered. Visa sponsorship cannot be provided.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #1041437

title: Coördinator biologische samples (focus celbiologie)
summary:
In deze rol communiceer je veel met collega's (oa scientists) van verschillende afdelingen.
Je zal in deze functie zelf geen analyses meer uitvoeren, enkel met…
description: Wat ga je doen? Deze vacature is in een belangrijk team binnen dit groeiende, internationale biotechnologische bedrijf. Deze afdeling zorgt namelijk voor de ontwikkeling van cellijnen die nodig zijn voor de rest van het bedrijf voor het uitvoeren van onderzoek. Jij bent in deze rol verantwoordelijk voor opslag, logistiek en bijbehorend papierwerk van cellijnen en celbanken. Dit wordt voor een deel in vloeibare stikstof gedaan. Je draagt zorg voor voorraadbeheer, bestelt nieuwe cellijnen indien nodig en zorgt zowel intern als extern voor verzending van gevraagde samples. Uiteraard draag je ook zorg alle bijbehorende documentatie en het up to date houden van de voorraden in het LIMS systeem. Zelf zal je niet op het laboratorium werkzaam zijn, maar wel een belangrijke rol spelen in de beschikbaarheid van cellijnen binnen het gehele bedrijf. Het is hiervoor van belang dat je zelf goede kennis hebt van celkweek en celbanken. In deze rol communiceer je veel met collega's (oa scientists) van verschillende afdelingen. Daarnaast schakel je ook met externe partijen en logistieke partners. Goede communicatieve vaardigheden zijn dan ook belangrijk. Engels is een vereiste, Nederlands is wel een pré. Wie zoeken wij voor Coördinator biologische samples (focus celbiologie)? Voor deze vacature zijn we op zoek naar iemand met de volgende achtergrond: Afgeronde HLO of MSc opleiding in de richting van life sciences of soortgelijk Ruime praktische stage of werkervaring met celkweek van verschillende zoogdiercellen Ervaring met logistieke processen is een pré Goede organisatorische vaardigheden en affiniteit met administratie Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in het Engels, bij voorkeur ook in het Nederlands Belangrijk is dat je bewust een stap buiten het laboratorium maakt. Je zal in deze functie zelf geen analyses meer uitvoeren, enkel met de data en de samples werken. Wat kun je verwachten van het bedrijf? Het betreft een vacature in een internationale biotech organisatie die zich heeft toegespitst op het ontwikkelen van therapieën voor verschillende ziektes. Dit bedrijf focust op onderzoek en ontwikkeling en is daarom op zoek naar mensen met goede kennis en een proactieve houding. De organisatie groeit hard en dit biedt ook mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling voor jou als medewerker. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Coördinator biologische samples (focus celbiologie) Vaste baan (startend met jaarcontract) Dienstverband van 40u/wk Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van ervaring. Range van €2500 - €3500 bruto per maand Over Science@Work Bij Science@Work komen mensen en wetenschap samen. Onze Talent Aqcuisition Experts zijn allen een gesprekpartner op niveau met een afgeronde laboratorium en science opleiding. Wij brengen talent en werkgevers samen voor vaste – en tijdelijke banen in geheel Nederland. Als gespecialiseerde divisie van een Nederlandse recruitment organisatie met 6 kantoren, hebben wij een groot bereik en nog grotere branche kennis. Science@Work staat gelijk aan kwaliteit en kennis. Waarin Science@Work zich verder onderscheidt zijn de nieuwste recruitment technologieën, bevlogen recruiters en aandacht voor mens en milieu. Zo werken wij sneller, efficiënter én groener. Science@Work werkt voor MLO, HLO en WO professionals in de life sciences, farmacie, voedingsmiddelen, biotechnologie en (petro)chemie in geheel Nederland. Wij bieden vaste en tijdelijke laboratorium en science banen binnen de microbiologie, chemie, analytische chemie, biochemie, sales, quality assurance, medical devices en biomedische laboratorium technologie.

title: Consultant
summary:
Ben je een data scientist met brede ervaring in het uitrollen van datagedreven oplossingen in productie?
Je ontwerpt complete machine learning/deep learning…
description: Omschrijving Wil jij onderdeel worden van een internationale, ambitieuze startup in Kunstmatige Intelligentie (AI) en ligt jouw focus op dingen gedaan krijgen? Ben je een data scientist met brede ervaring in het uitrollen van datagedreven oplossingen in productie? Dan bieden we je de kans te werken in een innovatieve start-up omgeving met veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid. Als consultant ga je end-to-end datagedreven AI-oplossingen bouwen voor onze nationale en internationale klanten. Verantwoordelijkheden: – Je werkt zelfstandig voor onze klanten aan end-to-end AI-oplossingen, in het bijzonder in het domein van computer vision; – Je ontwerpt complete machine learning/deep learning-pijplijnen voor grote hoeveelheden data (data voorbereiding, dataverwerking, training, evaluatie); – Je plaatst de modellen in productie; – Je werkt nauw samen met de klant om succesvolle oplossingen te ontwikkelen die het probleem van de klant oplost. Jouw sterke punten: – Je werkt graag gedurende de volledige levenscyclus van een product. Van de conceptfase naar het creëren en valideren van initiële concepten tot het leveren van eindproducten; – Je bent klant- en oplossingsgericht; – Je bent communicatief sterk; – Je hebt commercieel inzicht en identificeert nieuwe kansen en mogelijkheden bij de klant. Wat wordt er gevraagd Kwalificaties: – Minstens drie jaar ervaring in het verwerken van grote hoeveelheden data; – Werkervaring met Python is een must; – Werkervaring met één van de programmeertalen: Keras, Tensorflow, Sickit-learn, OpenCV, Sickit-image en/of Jupyter notebook; – Je bent in staat zelfstandig te werken; – Je hebt een passie voor het ontwikkelen van nieuwe modellen en oplossingen; – Je beheerst de Engelse taal goed, in woord en geschrift. Wenselijk: – Ervaring met GIS (projecties, shapefiles); – Ervaring met Computer Vision en Deep Learning; – Ervaring met dashboarding; – Ervaring met werken in de Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Karakter: – Je bent een zelfstarter, een probleemoplosser, en neemt verantwoordelijkheid; – Je bent proactief en neemt initiatief, maar weet ook wanneer iemand te raadplegen; – Je hebt een flexibele mentaliteit. Wat wordt er geboden We streven ernaar onze bestaande producten voortdurend te verbeteren en te werken aan het bouwen van nieuwe. We hebben de ambitie om snel te groeien. Dit geeft je de kans om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen en snel te groeien in je persoonlijke en professionele vaardigheden, evenals in de organisatie. Wij zijn een jong team met de drive om nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen, die Kunstmatige Intelligentie-oplossingen onmisbaar maken over de hele wereld! – Een interessante en dynamische functie; – In een informele en platte organisatie; – Een persoonlijke aanpak en opleidingsbudget; – Een competitief salaris; – 25 vakantiedagen op basis van fulltime; – Een pensioenplan; – Een vast dienstverband indien gewenst. Bedrijfsprofiel Kaios.ai is een startup in oplossingen voor Kunstmatige Intelligentie met nationale en internationale klanten. Kaios.ai is opgericht in 2018 en werkt vanuit Groningen. Kaios.ai gebruikt kunstmatige intelligentie (AI) om data te verrijken en processen te automatiseren. Het primaire doel is om asset management processen structureel te verbeteren middels automatisering en voorspellend vermogen. Omdat dit zorgt voor minder verspilling en meer preventiemogelijkheden, maar ook voor een hogere kwaliteit van onderhoud en meer controle hierover. Kaios.ai heeft een jong team van enthousiaste specialisten en we hebben de ambitie om snel te groeien. Met deze groei krijg je de kans je talenten volledig te ontwikkelen en de wereld van kunstmatige intelligentie te verkennen, en misschien wel te definiëren. PLAY_GRND werkt voor deze vacature samen met Kaios. Heb je interesse? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button of neem gerust contact met ons op voor meer info!

title: Project manager 'BIGPICTURE'
summary:
Are you interested in medical science, ICT, artificial intelligence, big data?
As member of the Bigpicture coordination team, you support the two coordinators,…
description: 3 years, with possible extension We are looking for a project manager who wants to be a part of our enthusiastic team and is looking for an opportunity to be part of a high-profile international project with an excellent network of academia, industry and healthcare professionals. Will you join our team?  For the IMI-funded project BIGPICTURE we are looking for a project manager to complement the coordination team at Radboudumc. As member of the Bigpicture coordination team, you support the two coordinators, the leading scientists of the AI work package and the work package on sustainability at Radboudumc. Also, you work in close collaboration with the communications officer and the project manager at Lygature, who is responsible for managing the project across the consortium.  You keep track of project progress, monitor deliverables and you facilitate and coordinate complex project tasks and organize meetings. You manage the budget and compile the periodic reports in liaison with the Radboudumc financial controller, using input from the whole consortium and Lygature. You also prepare amendments and manage contracts in collaboration with the Radboudumc Grant Support Office. This project offers a dynamic, multicultural environment where team collaboration is key to success in the highly competitive and multi-facetted field of AI in healthcare. We offer a parttime position (temporary contract for max 3 yrs) for 24 hours a week, flexible hours, and the possibility to work partly from home.  Upon commencement of employment we require a certificate of conduct (Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag, VOG) and there will be, depending on the type of job, a screening based on the provided cv. Radboud university medical center’s HR Department will apply for this certificate on your behalf.  Read more about the Radboudumc employment conditions and what our International Office can do for you when moving to the Netherlands. The department of Pathology of the Radboud University Medical Center plays an active role in the hospitals’ patient care, education and research. Pathologists work in sub-specialized teams, employing a fully digitized microscopical workflow.  The Computational Pathology Group is an integral part of the department and consists of some 25 researchers. They focus on development and validation of automated microscopical tissue analysis based on Artificial Intelligence. Application areas include diagnostics and prognostics of breast, prostate, lung and colon cancer, among others. The group is among the international front runners in the field, witnessed for instance by the highly successful grand challenges (CAMELYON, PANDA) which they organized. They collaborate closely with clinicians and industry worldwide.  Radboudumc Radboudumc in Nijmegen strives to be a leading developer of sustainable, innovative and affordable healthcare to improve the health and wellbeing of people and society in the Netherlands and beyond. This is the core of our mission: To have a significant impact on healthcare. To get a better picture of what this entails, check out our strategy.  Read more about what it means to work at Radboudumc and what our people have to say about it. You are an experienced project manager in academia and/or ICT sector in complex international research & innovation projects. You are knowledgeable and experienced in the field of financial and legal aspects of EU H2020 or IMI grant projects.  Furthermore: At least a bachelor's degree in biomedical or computer science or other relevant area. A pro-active, responsible and well-organized team player, who enjoys teamwork. An excellent communicator in English and Dutch, both in speaking and writing who can maintain harmonious cooperation in complex internal and external settings with various stakeholders. Able to shift between tasks and keep oversight on priorities. You know when to align with other internal and external stakeholders. Accurate and diligent, e.g. in compiling reports on budgets. Are you interested in medical science, ICT, artificial intelligence, big data? Have a meaningful contribution to advance artificial intelligence science in order to speed up the development of new drugs and improve pathology diagnosis of diseases like cancer? Then we would like to hear from you! All additional information about the vacancy can be obtained from Dr. Jeroen van der Laak, associate professor Pathology or Prof. Dr. Katrien Grünberg, professor in Pathology at bigpicture.pa@radboudumc.nl. Use the Apply button to submit your application.  Further information can be retrieved from the following links: https://www.radboudumc.nl/nieuws/2021/nieuwe-europese-samenwerking-met-innovative-medicine-initiative-wil-grootste-pathologie-databa https://www.radboudumc.nl/en/news-items/2021/a-new-consortium-of-the-eu-innovative-medicines-initiative-aims-to-establish-the-biggest-data  Please apply before 26 March. Recruitment agencies are asked not to respond to this job posting.

title: Software Developer
summary:
An international environment with experienced developers and data scientists who will assist you on every necessary point.
We want to meet you!
description: * WE ONLY ACCEPT APPLICATIONS FROM DEVELOPERS ALREADY RESIDING IN THE NETHERLANDS * Are you an experienced full stack developer who can run cloud implementations at our clients and develop new features? We want to meet you! About Us Crystalloids was founded in 2006 and consists of qualified data specialists that help organisations innovate and grow their business by building solutions in Google Cloud. We are an official Google Cloud partner since 2011. We believe that the foundation for a successful solution is based on three dimensions: the people, the processes and the technology. At Crystalloids we always take these three dimensions into account when we build solutions for our customers.  We gained a very respectable client portfolio over the years. Our clients operate in market segments like retail, media, telecom, finance and insurance and are based in the Netherlands and in other European countries: Rituals, ACSI, Body & Fit, CoolBlue, de Bijenkorf, HEMA, KNVB, Wolters Kluwer and others. What will you do as a software developer? Run Google Cloud Platform implementations at our clients. This implies the design, development, and roll-out of implementations. When it concerns new functionalities, these will be translated into new Google Cloud Platform features. Develop new features, which are relevant to a specific client or more of them To have the responsibility for maintenance of delivered implementations on a technical and functional level. The way to do this is by proactively monitor Google Cloud Platform implementation. When further in your career, as a Lead developer you will also: Define Google Cloud Platform architecture Define used standards, tooling, e.g. Execute quality control on deliverables Plan in bugs, features and other development activities, based on client’s priorities Report status to client Extend your skills in the Data Scientist area Knowledge and skills Programming languages: Java, Python, SQL Technical Skills Work with build environment (continues integration) Frontend development, taking into account the usability aspects Other skills: Analytical mindset Accurate way of working Eager to learn and enthusiastic Methodologies: Test-driven development Object orientation / modelling via UML Work in agile team according to Scrum methodology Scripting (Shell) Other requirements: Live in the Netherlands Strong English language skills are a must What we offer A competitive market-based salary with an interesting bonus- and pension scheme, 25 paid days off A laptop and travel expense allowance The possibility to work from one of our offices (Rotterdam or Amsterdam) and other "Spaces" locations across the Netherlands and join Spaces' events and workshops. An international environment with experienced developers and data scientists who will assist you on every necessary point. Software testing techniques and practices based on Agile software development methodology Gain more insights in and familiarity with cloud computing Experience in building on the Google Cloud Platform and with Google’s core infrastructure. Working in an agile team, according to scrum methodology The possibility to develop yourself through different courses.   Interested? Apply below or email us your CV and cover letter to jobs@crystalloids.com

title: Associate or Full professor: Omics-based natural product discovery
summary: Experience with ‘omics data analysis and integration, including metabolomic analysis through spectral networks and/or transcriptomic analysis through co…
description: Vacaturenr. 21-108 Functie-categorie Wetenschappelijke functies Omvang (fte) 1.0 Extern/intern Extern Locatie Leiden Geplaatst op 2 maart 2021 Sluitingsdatum 31 maart 2021  The Faculty of Science and the Institute of Biology Leiden are looking for an Associate or Full professor: Omics-based natural product discovery Key responsibilities The Institute of Biology Leiden (IBL) studies and teaches microbial, plant and animal sciences with a broad research scope from molecular and cellular levels to organismal and population levels. The IBL has a collaborative atmosphere that is fostered by strong expertise focused around four Research Themes: Bioactive Molecules, Host-Microbe Interactions, Development & Disease, and Evolution & Biodiversity. The overall leading principle of our research is harnessing biodiversity for health. The IBL is a growing institute and wishes to recruit three new group leaders who are, or will become, the future leaders in their research field. For this new position, the focus lies on the Research Themes Bioactive Molecules and Host-Microbe Interactions. In Microbial Sciences, we perform multidisciplinary research to understand the structure and function of microbes at all levels of biological organization, from small molecules and cellular structures at atomic resolution to multicellular communities. We investigate how microbes sense and respond to their environment and interact with other organisms, and harness Nature's Biodiversity to discover novel bioactive molecules and enzymes, which find application in the clinical trajectory and in biotechnology. We also study the role of microbes and microbial communities in protecting humans, plants and animals against diseases and pests. Genome sequencing has revealed a huge yet untapped potential of microbes for the production of bioactive compounds. Many of the biosynthetic gene clusters for natural products are poorly expressed under laboratory conditions, and to harness their full potential we need to understand the chemical-ecological cues that control their expression. We seek an associate or full professor with expertise in the bioinformatics and/or 'omics of natural product biosynthesis in microorganisms. The candidate is expected to develop an independent research line that is attractive for young undergraduate and postgraduate scientists, and support and inspire her/his research team to perform science at the highest level. The research line should address "harnessing microbial biodiversity for health": mining of microbial genomes for new bioactive natural products. The candidate will be expected to contribute to the BSc and MSc teaching programs of the IBL. Selection criteria A PhD in biological sciences or related field and at least several years of research experience as PI; Strong expertise in computational genomics and bioinformatics, and proven affinity with natural product chemistry and/or enzymology; Experience with ‘omics data analysis and integration, including metabolomic analysis through spectral networks and/or transcriptomic analysis through co-expression networks; Affinity with biochemistry and microbiology; A track record with high-quality publications evidencing a track record of collaboration and multidisciplinary; A broad international network of collaborations; Successful in raising research funds; Ability to foster an inspiring working environment for a research team, in which PhDs and postdocs feel supported and have the ability to thrive; Experience and affinity with teaching at BSc and/or MSc level; Energetic ‘out-of-the-box’ thinker with a clear view on a challenging research and education program; A networker who can readily engage in collaborations within and outside our institute; Experience and affinity with project and management tasks; Excellent command of the English language; A good command of the Dutch language, or prepared to learn the Dutch language. Our organisation The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are driven by curiosity to expand fundamental knowledge and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future. The research carried out at the faculty is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organized in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight BSc and twelve MSc programmes. The faculty has grown in recent years and now has more than 1,300 staff and almost 4,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together. The Institute of Biology Leiden (IBL) is an internationally oriented institute for biology research and education that is part of the Faculty of Science at Leiden University. Embedded within the institute are the Netherlands Center for Electron Nanoscopy (NeCEN) and the department Science Communication and Society. The IBL has strong links with the sister institutes in the Faculty of Sciences, with the Leiden University Medical Centre (LUMC) and the Naturalis Biodiversity Centre (NBC). Our aim is to perform top quality innovative fundamental and strategic research that contributes to solutions for global societal challenges such as the threat to biodiversity, antimicrobial resistance and preventing disease development in humans, animals and plants. We have a strong track record in collaboration with industry. Terms and conditions The successful candidate will be offered a position as principal investigator, at a level that depends on her/his track record. We offer a five- to six-year term position, with the possibility of a tenured position subsequently. The salary ranges from € 5.190,- to € 6.940,- (scale 13 or 14) for associate professors and € 6.405,- to € 8.371,- (scale 16) for full professors. Salaries and conditions are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development and sabbatical leave. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax reduction. For more information, see the website. Leiden University requires teaching staff to obtain the University Teaching Qualification (UTQ). If the successful applicant does not already possess this qualification or its equivalent, he/she must be willing to obtain this certificate within two years. Within two years, a Dutch language proficiency of minimally level B2 is required. Diversity Leiden University is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from members of underrepresented groups. The Faculty of Science strives for excellence in a caring institute. We wish to reflect society in all aspects, as we believe that this improves the dynamics in our organization. Therefore, we support and understand the need for a work/life/family balance and consequently varying working hours and places. We believe that doing good science is fun, and goes hand in hand with an ambitious yet friendly culture. In the Netherlands, parental leave is standard for 16 weeks. Child care is available at and near the Bio Science Park. For more information see the website. Information Inquiries about the position can be made to Gilles van Wezel, e-mail g.wezel@biology.leidenuniv.nl. phone +31-71-5274310. If you have any questions about the procedure, please contact the IBL Office, email jobs@biology.leidenuniv.nl. Applications Applications should be sent by email to the IBL office at jobs@biology.leidenuniv.nl. Please ensure that you upload the following additional documents quoting the vacancy number: A motivation letter; A description of research interests and experience; A full CV (including a list of publications, and the names and addresses of at least two persons who have agreed to be contacted for references). Only applications received no later than 31 March 2021 can be considered.

title: Business Intelligence Consultant
summary:
Uitvoering van (ad hoc) data-aanvragen en -analyses en vertaling van de uitkomsten hiervan in aanbevelingen;
Een afdeling waar we elkaar versterken en samen vol…
description: Functie Data vertalen naar inzichten die onze organisatie naar een hoger niveau brengen. Maakt dat je enthousiast? Lees dan verder! Bij Sligro Food Group zitten we volop in de transitie naar een datagedreven organisatie. Een hele interessante ontwikkeling die een belangrijke bijdrage zal leveren aan het realiseren van onze ambitieuze internationale groeidoelstellingen. In het kader van dit meerjarenprogramma hebben we begin vorig jaar alle functies op het gebied van Data & Analytics samengebracht in één afdeling Data & Analytics. Een afdeling waar we elkaar versterken en samen vol gaan voor het slagen van de digitale transitie. Binnen het Business Intelligence team wordt de brug geslagen tussen de verschillende technische disciplines van de afdeling en de business. Binnen dit team, hebben we nu een vacature voor een Business Intelligence Consultant Veghel, 31-38,75 uur per week Je wordt lid van een team dat naast vier BI consultants (jij wordt de vijfde) bestaat uit een Data Scientist en vier collega’s die zich bezig houden met Data Warehousing. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Business Intelligence. In deze functie lever je een bijdrage aan en ben je concreet betrokken bij de uitvoering van de datastrategie binnen Sligro Food Group. Daarbij signaleer je de behoeften en wensen vanuit de hele organisatie en vertaal je die naar concrete Business Analytics projecten. Vervolgens werk je ook aan de uitvoering van deze projecten. Concrete taken hierbij zijn onder meer: In kaart brengen van de wensen vanuit de business, waarbij jij ook meedenkt over hoe onze klanten en leveranciers met onze systemen zullen omgaan. Zo nodig begeleid je de business bij het op de juiste manier formuleren van hun informatiebehoefte; Het bouwen en opleveren van rapportages, die de business helpen om meer inzicht te krijgen, en de juiste keuzes te kunnen maken; Ondersteuning bij de afstemming, ontwikkeling en vastlegging van KPI definities; Uitvoering van (ad hoc) data-aanvragen en -analyses en vertaling van de uitkomsten hiervan in aanbevelingen; Je ondersteunt en traint de business bij het interpreteren en analyseren van relevante rapportages, dashboards en tooling met betrekking tot diverse projecten. Aan de ontwikkeling en inrichting hiervan heb je zelf bijgedragen. Lees hier meer over de afdeling Data & Analytics! Functie-eisen Gedreven analytisch persoon die communicatief sterk is Je begrijpt als geen ander het belang van data en zorgt dat je goed op de hoogte blijft van de ontwikkelingen binnen dit vakgebied. Daarnaast heb je de kwaliteiten om mensen binnen en buiten onze organisatie mee te krijgen in wat zich op dit vlak binnen Sligro Food Group afspeelt en de kansen die dit biedt. Je bent dan ook in staat om hierover in heldere taal te communiceren binnen alle lagen van onze organisatie. Daarnaast beschik je over de volgende kwaliteiten: Een afgeronde hbo- of universitaire opleiding op het gebied van informatiemanagement of bedrijfskunde; Minimaal drie jaar ervaring op het gebied van Business Analytics en Business Intelligence; Minimaal drie jaar ervaring met projectmanagement op dit vlak; Kennis van en ervaring met business intelligence en SQL tools; Kennis van en ervaring met SAC in combinatie met SAP BW en SAP datamodellen. Je weet wat er komt kijken bij het maken van functionele ontwerpen en kunt dit dan ook afstemmen met zowel het team als de business. Ruim baan voor je toekomst Het leuke van deze baan is dat je echt werkt op het snijvlak van de business en IT. Je komt te werken in een heel enthousiast team, dat samen wil bijdragen aan het succes van de transitie naar een echt digitale organisatie. Deze transitie zal een periode van drie jaar in beslag nemen, waarin veel veranderingen gaan plaatsvinden. Behoorlijk hectisch, maar als je daar van houdt, zit je bij ons prima op je plek. Het Data & Analytics team groeit, dat biedt ook kansen om je verder te ontwikkelen, zowel binnen als buiten het team. Daarnaast bieden we je: Een marktconform salaris; In eerste instantie een contract voor bepaalde tijd met de intentie dat om te zetten in een vast dienstverband; 25 vakantiedagen o.b.v. een fulltime (38,75 uur) dienstverband; Een goede pensioenregeling; Laptop en mobiele telefoon; Ruimte om je kennis en competenties verder te ontwikkelen via de Sligro Academy, ons online learning platform; En natuurlijk krijg je korting op je eigen aankopen bij Sligro. Contactinformatie Als je nog vragen hebt over deze vacature, neem dan contact op met Monique Wijnen, Recruiter, via mwijnen@sligro.nl. Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatiebutton bij deze vacature. Bedrijfsinformatie Sligro Food Group bestaat uit verschillende foodservicebedrijven. Samen met onze klanten hebben we één belangrijke passie: food. Om ervoor te zorgen dat iedereen zich daarop kan richten, worden alle bedrijven vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Veghel ondersteund. Zo kunnen de verschillende bedrijven zich regionaal richten op die passie. Op het hoofdkantoor werken we intensief samen. Dat uit zich in een professionele en efficiënte backoffice organisatie. We zijn trots op onze passie en gezond eigenwijs waar nodig. Kijk hier voor meer informatie over Sligro Food Group. Solliciteer

title: Category Management & Brand Growth CMI Director
summary:
CB Analytics Director and data scientist.
Understanding of digital data alongside more traditional Media & Equity KPIs is a plus.
description: COTY is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, hair color and styling, and skin and body care. COTY is the global leader in fragrance, number two in professional hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics. COTY’s products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.  ABOUT GLOBAL MARKETING, CONSUMER BEAUTY BRANDS  In Consumer Beauty, we are currently in process to drive turnaround and value creation on our most Iconic brands under the leadership of our incoming CEO Sue Y. Nabi. Our global marketing team in Amsterdam will drive Coty Consumer Beauty transformation and deliver a successful turnaround. This transformation effort includes re-centering our brand activity and innovation program on strong consumer centricity, establish a strong Global Category thought leadership and growth story leveraging emergent needs and trends, fixing base business restrainer to unlock our ability to invest into future growth. A once in a lifetime opportunity of which you could now be part of!  THE ROLE  As the Category Management & Brand Growth Director, you will re-establish strong practice and thought leadership around category growth, and how current and future demand spaces comes to life into our CB portfolio. You will provide insights on the effectiveness of our $ spent to drive mental and physical availability and ultimately top line growth. You will be an expert on Brand Health, identifying restrainer and working with the team to turn around and restart top growth. You will be familiar with both Media and Store opportunities and will be pivotal to define the right strategy to close existing gaps, de-risk brand building blocks and construct a balanced and robust category growth story for the markets. You will also help the team understand biggest restrainers to brand growth and how to optimize plans based on in market KPI for both physical and Mental availability. You will develop a strong expertise on Category Management, Brand spending effectiveness and KPIs predictive of in-market success. You will play a critical role in the transformation of CB by recognizing what works and which gaps need to be addressed, displaying a bias for action and positively influencing CB leaders to adjust plans that are not set up for success. You will play a pivotal role in instilling an inquisitive consumer-centric mindset in Consumer Beauty by driving MFT understanding of how Brand plan works through Media and in store to improve social content and improve effectiveness of $ spent.  Detailed Roles and Responsibilities: Be the go-to expert on category demand & portfolio strategy You understand category dynamics and triggers that drive brand choice and purchase. Drive clarity on future demand spaces and how these should come to life in our portfolio over time. Understand restrainer to base brand growth on our priority BMU Provide insight and data-based recommendations on how to best drive base brands productivity by fixing restrainers to mental / physical availability. Share best practices for reapplication. Build a strong and consistent Category Growth Story over time enable to team to understand how this translates this into strong Store / Shelf / Media activities. Balance scale with needed adaptations to specific contexts such as Media channels or store formats. Consolidate CB Category Management best practices . Providing strong consumer/shopper centricity to the team Support Yearly Strat Plans With Brand teams, the Analytic Director, Innovation S. Director ensure more robust SOP estimate with balanced building blocks grounded in the brand and market reality and expected projection Balanced demand sizing behind Brand plans ensure realistic assumptions around spending, distribution, shelf execution, Ensure incrementality accounts for borrowing. Collaborate closely with media team in defining sufficient / effective media spending vis a vis desired goals Leverage Media calculator, MMM, sufficiency tool to ensure budgets are balanced and realistic. Help team to understand cost of being dark. Digital Media effectiveness With Media Team/CMI Data scientists & external Partners (eg Google, Zenith…) understand best practices to drive improved conversion among different audiences within the varying path to purchase. Develop strong understanding on how to better leverage halo Leverage lessons learnt via MMMs, tracking and success stories to improve our understanding of Halo onto Base Brands  In this full-time role, you will provide Strategic Insights to drive global category management, Brand turn-around and portfolio growth. You will report into the Consumer Beauty Insights & Strategy VP and work hand in hand with the:  CB Global Brand team. Opex & Media Team CB Innovation transformation S. Director, CB Analytics Director and data scientist.  WHAT YOU’LL BRING  To be successful in this role, you will bring solid professional expertise in consumer and market insights, analytics expertise and a strong understanding and application marketing principles and how media works. We are looking for a proven ability to drive strategic insights into business decision making, preferably in a variety of Brands. Experience in Category Management at local/global level, Media planning, Brand plans are appreciated along side strong bias for action and ability to manage diverse stakeholders. Understanding of digital data alongside more traditional Media & Equity KPIs is a plus. You are constructive and collaborate strongly with MFT / vendors to deliver your work. You are able to see opportunities on how to improve current ways of working. You are curious and like to combine data from various sources to understand the full picture.  Key Requirements Bachelor’s Degree preferably in statistics, data science, marketing or business field with prior market research experience 8+ years agency or FMCG experience, preferably including health & wellness, beauty and / or luxury. Must have at least 5+ years client-side experience –understanding of Physical & mental availability drivers and how brand growth. Experience with Category management / category growth story – preferably local Strong understanding of a variety of channel dynamics and Store levers Proven ability to manage complex questions. Strong Commercial sense to and influence successfully & drive action from results. Essential to have a strong understanding of quant techniques and mindset. Knowledge and expertise around digital tools and analytics. Strong understanding of business KPI and translate reality into models with the appropriate support (analyst or vendor) Ability to leverage / integrate existing data sets or develop 80/20 estimates when information is not available Experience of managing budgets and working with suppliers to ensure actionable results, on time, best cost  Skills Thought leadership : You sense when a change in direction in business practices is needed. You set a vision of what can be achieved and have a bias for action. You create an environment where others feel committed to deliver and contribute fully. High level of maturity and Strong communication and presentation skills to interact and influence Senior stakeholders and multi-functional team. Problem-solving techniques ; curious, team player and leader; attention to detail / good project management. You know how to translate complex data into a key take outs with your analytical mindset. Project management : Organized and structured. You know how to bring multiple projects to a successful end in given timeframe. Agility & Passion to drive clarity : You don’t get easily stressed by a fluid environment, on the opposite, you get energized by the opportunity to drive clarity for the team, you are quick to adapt as new information becomes available.  WHAT WE OFFER  Competitive salary + company benefits This is a real opportunity to make an impact. You’ll get to work in a diverse environment with a team who are passionate about the work they do This is an exciting time to join Coty as we embed new ways of working and drive the company transformation.

title: PhD-position “Combined modeling and operando characterization of inhomogeneous battery processes”
summary: Coupling of experimental data with phase field modeling will result in an in-depth understanding of the distribution of the inhomogeneous redox activity for key…
description: PhD-position “Combined modeling and operando characterization of inhomogeneous battery processes” Solliciteer nu Job description This project targets a challenging knowledge gap in Li-ion batteries, the role of inhomogeneous redox reactions on the performance of Li-ion batteries. Inhomogeneous reactions refer to the uneven phase transformation and Li-ion distribution in battery electrode materials during operation, which can cause history effects that prevent optimal storage performance and reduce the cycle life of batteries. TU-Delft is uniquely positioned with expertise and capabilities to unravel the fundamental mechanisms that lead to inhomogeneous reactions, via operando measurements of Li battery electrodes. Coupling of experimental data with phase field modeling will result in an in-depth understanding of the distribution of the inhomogeneous redox activity for key electrode materials. This PhD position will focus on these inhomogeneous processes in Li-anode and cathode materials using operando Neutron Depth Profiling, NMR and XRD techniques, all directly accesible at the hosting institute, combined with phase field modeling, in collaboration with several researchers. Requirements We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic researcher with a background in physics or physical chemistry, with proven affinity for numerical simulations, large data handling and computational modeling of processes. The candidate should be interested in combinatorial research entailing both computational and experimental multi-technique and operando battery research, working in a small team of international researchers. The position is based at the Storage of Electrochemical Energy group of the Delft University of Technology, stationed at the Reactor Institute Delft. The techniques available here include several computational approaches, including DFT and phase field modeling of battery materials and diverse experimental techniques including, neutron scattering techniques, operando neutron depth profiling, operando X-ray diffraction and (operando) Nuclear Magnetic resonance, all playing an important role in the project. Very good written and spoken communication skills in English are required. Conditions of employment TU Delft offers PhD-candidates a 4-year contract, with an official go/no go progress assessment after one year. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2395 per month in the first year to € 3061 in the fourth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. For international applicants we offer the Coming to Delft Service and Partner Career Advice to assist you with your relocation. TU Delft (Delft University of Technology) Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context. At TU Delft we embrace diversity and aim to be as inclusive as possible (see our Code of Conduct). Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. Challenge. Change. Impact! Faculty Applied Sciences With more than 1,000 employees, including 135 pioneering principal investigators, as well as a population of about 3,400 passionate students, the Faculty of Applied Sciences is an inspiring scientific ecosystem. Focusing on key enabling technologies, such as quantum- and nanotechnology, photonics, biotechnology, synthetic biology and materials for energy storage and conversion, our faculty aims to provide solutions to important problems of the 21st century. To that end, we train students in broad Bachelor's and specialist Master's programmes with a strong research component. Our scientists conduct ground-breaking fundamental and applied research in the fields of Life and Health Science & Technology, Nanoscience, Chemical Engineering, Radiation Science & Technology, and Engineering Physics. We are also training the next generation of high school teachers and science communicators. Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Applied Sciences. Additional information The Storage of Electrochemical Energy group of the Radiation Science and Technology department focusses on fundamental processes in next generation batteries using experimental probes as neutron and X-ray scattering as well as solid state NMR and computational approaches including density functional theory calculations. The direct access to these facilities and collaborative atmosphere represents a stimulating environment for research and development. See https://www.tudelft.nl/en/faculty-of-applied-sciences/about-faculty/departments/radiation-science-technology/research/research-groups/storage-of-electrochemical-energy/ EnergyDelft Application procedure Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before March 31, 2021 via the application button and upload your motivation and CV. A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure. Applying for an exemption for specific research and educational areas is an obligatory part of the selection procedure for this vacancy. This exemption must be obtained from the Ministry of Education, Culture and Science (OCW) before an employment contract is agreed upon. Click here for more information. You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post. Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. FACULTEIT/DIENST: Faculteit Technische Natuurwetenschappen FUNCTIETYPE: Promotieplaatsen WETENSCHAPPELIJKE DISCIPLINE: Natuurwetenschappen UREN PER WEEK: 38 uur SALARIS € 2.395,00 - € 3.061,00 GEWENST OPLEIDINGSNIVEAU: WO VACATURENUMMER TUD00739 Terug naar lijst Stuur vacature naar een vriend Print deze pagina Solliciteer nu

title: iOS Developer
summary:
You will work with our back-end engineers and data scientists to implement new features in the app as they become available.
We get truly excited if you.
description: Felyx is expanding! The coming years we are facing hyper-growth in The Netherlands and the rest of Europe. Therefore, we are looking for an ambitious iOS Developer to make our iOS app the best it can be! As urbanization is rising and air quality is deteriorating, we feel the need to make our cities greener and healthier by offering a sustainable mobility solution. And being a fun way around town is, of course, a great bonus! At felyx, everybody is contributing to a cleaner city within their own expertise by making this swift door-to-door transportation the new status quo. We are working together as an ambitious team of entrepreneurs, creatives, operators and engineers, and are looking to grow as we scale the business throughout Europe.  Here's the challenge You will own the iOS app and build it out to provide a great customer experience for all of our users. Together with the rest of the development team, especially the Android part, you will come up with new data-driven ways to make felyx more successful and serve our customers better. Existing iOS development experience is a must for this position, but we also care about general engineering skills. Our ideal candidate has a few years of experience developing iOS apps. Striving to develop high-quality, maintainable software is important for us, as is being familiar with fundamental software engineering best practices to ensure the quality of our product. You will be part of our engineering team, which consists of 10 other team members. You will work with our back-end engineers and data scientists to implement new features in the app as they become available.  We get truly excited if you Have at least 3 years of experience in designing and building high quality iOS apps with user experience and maintainability in mind Have a deep understanding of Swift and the iOS devices landscape Are uncomfortable shipping code with a low test coverage! Have experience with various forms of automated testing (unit, functional, integration, UI tests) Are experienced integrating and working with REST or GraphQL APIs Know your way around Git, Xcode, CI & CD tools Have strong abstract reasoning skills and an agile and pragmatic mindset Have excellent communication skills and are fluent in English Are living in the Netherlands Bonus points if you Have experience creating mobile apps for other platforms (Android), professionally or as a hobby project Have experience in writing software for other parts of the stack, e.g. back-end or front-end Have a BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related field Have one or more apps currently published in the Apple App Store What's in it for me? An ambitious team of entrepreneurial colleagues with a shared passion for our mission. You will work in a transparent, fast-growing and inspirational environment in which you are able to take the lead over your own career and will get challenged on a daily basis! And next to that: 29 paid days off on fulltime base: 28 on the roll and a day off on your birthday! You will get free felyx minutes. We want to invest in your future: a good pension plan is therefore in place (1/3 employee, 2/3 employer). We offer 6 weeks of paternity leave with 100% salary for all (upcoming) dads. We take your development seriously and encourage you to grow with the company and within your role. Once we are able to go back to the office (hopefully soon!), we offer a tasty and healthy lunch. Last but not least: fun, freedom and trust! We're not scared to work our butts off, but this is only possible once we all experience joy in the work that we do every day.  We are very proud of the fact that we have been named by LinkedIn as a top start-up to work at for the second time in a row, together with many other prestigious awards we’ve received since our start in 2017. We are operational in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, The Hague, Groningen, Haarlem, Eindhoven, Den Bosch and Brussels and will be launching many more (European) cities in 2021. We have a strong focus on scaling up internationally.  At felyx we believe that the best workplace is one that represents the world we live in today. This means we believe that diversity in the broadest sense of the word connects us and drives us forward as a company. We believe that diversity goes hand in hand with different perspectives. It is these different perspectives that can help us become better and more innovative in finding solutions for our customers. And because we believe this can be achieved, we are looking for colleagues who are intrinsically motivated and bring the right experience. Gender, age, sexual orientation or origin will never be a factor and will never become one.  We understand you might not tick all the boxes above. The truth is, we don't either. If you feel up for the ride, we encourage you to apply now!

title: Global TM Optimisation Analytics Lead
summary: Able to have in dept discussions with data analysts and data scientists and also able to explain understandably to broader business audience.
description: Global TM Optimisation – Analytics Lead Within The Global KYC Transaction Monitoring (TM) Pillar we are looking for a an experienced Transaction Monitoring Optimisation Analytics Lead focused on advanced analytics solutions. A leader of a team and overall team-player, creative and solution-focused individual with a positive can-do mindset. As a Global Analytics Lead you will be based in Amsterdam on a 36 or 40 hour contract, and report hierarchically and functionally to Global TM Optimisation Lead. About the Global KYC Organization The Global Know Your Customer organization is a first line department providing the ING business and functions guidance with standardized solutions in the area of various KYC related regulations (process, control, and digital solutions, etc.) as well as support to realize operational excellence. The Global KYC Delivery Tribe is part of the Global KYC organization within ING COO. You will be involved into the development of solutions on socially relevant topics such as Anti-Money Laundering, Counter Terrorism Financing, Fraud, Sanctions and their global implementation across 40+ countries, affecting 36+ million ING customers. Through this we will be able to deliver our customers an optimal KYC experience whilst remaining compliant and in control of our risks and processes on a global scale. You will be in contact with market leading vendors and thought leaders in their respective domains. As such, you will be working with many colleagues from different disciplines, geographies and backgrounds. If you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Your role as Analytics Lead You will fulfil the position of Analytics Lead within the Global KYC TM Optimisation Pillar. In this role you manage a team of ca. 15 staff members supporting Risk UAT (Initial threshold setting), BackTesting and leading key advanced analytics initiatives related to our internal and regulatory committed programs, to ensure the optimal configuration of the TM global monitoring systems. These global systems monitor customer transactions for risk indicators of financial and economic crime. The initial threshold setting, tuning, testing and optimization of these systems is a regulatory requirement and requires statistical, investigative, program and operational disciplines to deliver. After go-live the monitoring system needs to be calibrated continuously based on statistical analysis conducted by the TM analytics team. As the TM Optimisation Analytics Lead, key elements of your role includes leadership and supporting the team to set optimise thresholds using statistical analytics and solutions to minimize false positives. The team develops and tests scenario’s to understand how changes of the parameters of the monitoring systems affect effectiveness and efficiency of the alert generation. A key part of your role is to be able to interpret and analyse data problems and address data quality and integrity. This is what you’ll do: Lead a team of data analysts to simulate the rule based systems and providing relevant events to be investigated by alert investigations team Prototype and validate additional controls to complement existing controls Analyse data to help improve thresholds and other control parameters that prevent false negatives to occur and to minimize false positives Investigate and propose additional segmentation to increase productive alerts Advise on how to improve TM processes and outcomes by using statistically sound methods Ensuring that data projects align with organizational goals Assess data quality (contextual sanity checks) and identify quality and integrity issues that affect alert generation and investigation Adhere to stringent quality assurance and documentation standards using version control and code repositories (e.g., Git, GitHub, Markdown) Responsible for the conception, planning, and prioritizing of data projects Utilizing data visualization tools to deliver insights to stakeholders How to Succeed: Academic degree / masters / Phd in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or related field. 10+ years combined in business intelligence, and data science projects and departments preferably in global financial services industry. Demonstrable success in stimulating data driven decision making. Working as a scrum master in software development projects and as a lead software developer. Experience in leading operational functions is a plus. Demonstrable experience in Leading by influence. Able to have in dept discussions with data analysts and data scientists and also able to explain understandably to broader business audience Experienced Python programmer and very familiar with modules pandas, sklearn, pyspark, numpy Strong knowledge of relational databases and optimizing query performance Strong knowledge of Apache Hadoop and Spark Strong knowledge of anomaly detection algorithms Strong knowledge of CI/CD and working with Git Experience with writing SQL statements Experience with statistical inference Experience in working with Linux systems and command line interface Fluent in English speaking and in writing. Have experience in working in a multi-national, complex organisations in a matrixed environment with a senior management / Program management view. Able to develop, implement and continuously improve data pipelines Accreditation for project management such as Agile, Prince2 or PMP a benefit. What we offer A salary tailored to your qualities and experience 24 vacation days with a 36 hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days Pension scheme 13th month salary Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary 8% Holiday payment Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best Progressive way of working according to the Agile method, so that new ideas come to life!

title: Technician Downstream Processing (DSP, GMP)
summary:
Manage and perform your own research, including reporting and presenting data within your research team;
Technician Downstream Processing (DSP, GMP).
description: Technician Downstream Processing (DSP, GMP) Location: Leiden, South Holland Contact: Nicol Heijtbrink Job type: Contract Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Pharmaceutical , Life Sciences, Biotechnology Contact email: nicol_heijtbrink@oxfordcorp.com For an innovative research oriented international company, we are looking for skilled professionals with experience in downstream processing (DSP), preferably in the context of vaccine development. Job Description Within this company we are looking for experienced technicians with a background in DSP. You will work in a multidisciplinary and dynamic environment on various projects such as the COVID-19 vaccine, polio vaccine and other vaccines. You will work with state-of the art technology with systems / techniques such as: ACTA, chromatography, UF/DF, etc under GMP guidelines. You will work hands-on in close collaboration with the USP and assays departments and play a significant role in tech transfer. Responsibilities Perform hands-on DSP experiments; Manage and perform your own research, including reporting and presenting data within your research team; DSP process development and tech transfer; You will get acquainted with new equipment and techniques and will also be responsible for writing SOP's and protocols; On a regular basis, you will present your results within the department; You will support and execute general maintenance lab tasks; Requirements BSc (HLO) or MSc degree in (analytical) chemistry, biotechnology, LST, or similar; Industrial experience in a GMP environment is an absolute must have; Experience with the purification of viruses and vaccines is highly advantageous; Experience with: ultrafiltration, diafiltration(UF/DF), chromatography (ACTA); Fluency in English, Dutch considered a plus; You work well with tight deadlines, can multitask like no other, and are both a team player and independent; A flexible project oriented mindset; Benefits Contract: start with a contract for one year, directly at the company, with outlook on a permanent position; Salary: €2500 - €3600 gross per month; Holidays: 25; Hours: Full time; Region: Leiden; Vacancy number: 16577  Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Frontend Developer
summary:
Onboarding flow for organizations to collect as much as data about their job requirements.
Onboarding flow for experts to collect as much as data about their…
description: About us: Worksuite is an AI-driven networking platform to connect vetted tech experts with eachother and with organizations. Organizations can source, select, screen & match experts to their requirements and experts are connected to a job that fits their skills. For our internal development team we are looking for a Frontend Developer with +3 year experience who can build frontend applications for our platform.  The Worksuite platform contains the following 4 main elements: Onboarding flow for experts to collect as much as data about their skills, experience and purpose Onboarding flow for organizations to collect as much as data about their job requirements A matchmaking portal where we select the top experts for the job, based on our AI algorithm An admin panel where our internal team manages all activities in the platform  What you will be doing: You will be a crucial part to improve our 4 main elements, optimizing our current user flows so they will be better designed around the tech niche that we are active in. Since we have already thousands lines of code since we started building this platform in september 2019, it is also time to build more dynamic code and improve our testing & monitoring, which should lead to a more efficient development process.  We are looking for a Frontend Developer with experience in the following technologies: Frontend: React.js GraphQL HTML CSS Cypress  You will have the following responsibilities: build frontend applications (mostly in relation with GraphQL) build end-to-end testing scripts create code structure so that our code is written more efficient  Frontend integrations to marketing related tools that we have: Triggers to Autopilot Data layers to Google Tag Manager & Google Analytics Integration to Hotjar Translation ENG/NL Dev support custom Google Optimize A/B testing The roles in our development team that you will be joining: Backend developer / Solution Architect Part time solution architect to give training about our infrastructure Frontend developer with focus on UX Product owner Data Scientist Marketing Automation expert You will be part of an energetic and ambitious young team in Amsterdam where you can fully release your potential. We believe we can grow Worksuite towards a scale-up and grow significantly. So far our journey has already been a great learning curve with high pleasure. What you really get: Market conform salary Freedom: work where you feel at your best MacBook pro + 2nd monitor screen Part of an energetic and ambitious team What's important to us: Culture is our number one core value. We believe that our team members should feel that they are motivated everyday, work towards a larger goal (your purpose) and that they continiously learn (we embrace the Lean Startup method). People are our number one asset: if our people perform at their best, the company performs at their best. That means we will do anything to facilitate a great workspace and work together towards your own larger goal. Who we are looking for: The following elements describe our team in the best way: Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Learning . We are looking for people who are entrepreneurial and are open to receive new (development) challenges every day. People who like to find what is the best solution by learning, learning and learning. That means that no challenges is too big for you and you are always curious for innovative approaches towards challenges.  3 years experience in frontend development (relevant to our stack)  2 years experience with testing, monitoring and deployment experience in building dynamic code that is scalable experience with building a platform is a pre

title: Data Engineer (38 uur)
summary:
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten, schalen, onderhouden en monitoren van data-integraties/data pipelines;
Kijk dan niet verder want wij zoeken jou!
description: Wil jij meebouwen aan de datagedreven strategie van een snelgroeiende e-commerce organisatie en retailer? Heb je een passie voor werken met data en wil je dit doen met de nieuwste technieken? Kijk dan niet verder want wij zoeken jou!  Als Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten, onderhouden en monitoren van data-integraties tussen verschillende bronnen zoals webshop, marketing automation software, ERP en warehouse systemen en ons centrale datawarehouse dat in Google BigQuery draait. Samen met je DevOps- en Data Science-collega’s ben je sparringpartner voor de business omtrent alle datavraagstukken. Taken Je zet een data-architectuur neer die klaar is voor de toekomst; Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten, schalen, onderhouden en monitoren van data-integraties/data pipelines; Je fungeert als sparringpartner voor de organisatie omtrent alle data vraagstukken; Je zorgt voor een betrouwbare en geoptimaliseerde dataflow vanuit allerlei bronnen naar het datawarehouse; Je werkt samen met andere Developers, Data Scientists en Data Analisten om My Jewellery nog meer datagedreven te maken. Je hebt een HBO- of WO-diploma in de richting van Informatica, Computer Science, of een andere relevante opleiding; Je hebt 3-5 jaar ervaring met data-integratie en data-warehouse architectuur; Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van databases en structuren; Je hebt ervaring met het inrichten en onderhouden van ETL-processen en data pipelines; Je hebt kennis van datamodellering en hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen; Je beheerst Python, andere programmeertalen zijn een pré; Je beheerst Airflow of hebt ervaring met een vergelijkbare tool; Je hebt kennis van Google Cloud Platform, overige cloud dataoplossingen zoals AWS en Azure zijn een pré. kennis van SQL, NOSQL, GraphQL etc. zijn een pré.  Functievereisten Je bent nieuwsgierig en wordt graag uitgedaagd door technische en functionele vraagstukken omtrent data. Je treedt gemakkelijk in contact met relevante business- en IT-collega’s om de databehoefte goed te begrijpen. Je voelt je verantwoordelijk voor de datakwaliteit en de veiligheid van de data. Op technisch gebied zijn je DevOps-collega’s je sparringpartners, samen met hen kijk je hoe je datastromen het juiste kunt inrichten binnen de huidige infrastructuur en houd je nieuwe technieken in de gaten om de huidige structuur te verbeteren. Je hebt een HBO- of WO-diploma in de richting van Informatica, Computer Science, of een andere relevante opleiding; Je hebt 3-5 jaar ervaring met data-integratie en data-warehouse architectuur; Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van databases en structuren; Je hebt ervaring met het inrichten en onderhouden van ETL-processen en data pipelines; Je hebt kennis van datamodellering en hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen; Je beheerst Python, andere programmeertalen zijn een pré; Je beheerst Airflow of hebt ervaring met een vergelijkbare tool; Je hebt kennis van Google Cloud Platform, overige cloud dataoplossingen zoals AWS en Azure zijn een pré. kennis van SQL, NOSQL, GraphQL etc. zijn een pré.  Wij bieden Werken in een zeer snelgroeiend jong- en dynamisch bedrijf; Werken met de nieuwste data-integratietechnieken en infrastructuur. We hebben geen legacy-systemen en zijn steeds opzoek naar de nieuwste technieken om ons doel te bereiken; Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng en initiatief, heb jij ideeën om de performance van de datastromen te verbeteren laat het zien in het team en we gaan het gebruiken; Een passend salaris met goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals pensioen, elke woensdag sporten met onze personal trainer en een héle leuke personeelskorting op al onze producten.  Interesse? Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Stuur dan een mail met jouw vraag naar Leonieke via leonieke.vroom@my-jewellery.com

title: Compliance & Security Manager
summary:
LOGEX is working with sensitive data every day.
Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in…
description: LOGEX is hiring Healthcare is one of the world’s fastest developing industries, and, like in other fields, there’s great potential to employ insights gained from (big) data and technology to improve quality and affordability. LOGEX delivers analytics solutions that enable data-driven decision making in every area of healthcare — from operations and finance, to clinical and patient outcomes. Through our mission of turning data into better healthcare, we empower and bring clarity to decisions that lead to improvements in healthcare costs and outcomes. The right people make this all possible. To further support our mission, LOGEX Group is currently looking to hire a Compliance & Security Manager.  DRIVEN BY DATA, POWERED BY PEOPLE Data is at the core of the solutions we offer, but people are at the heart of everything we do. Our team of over 300 international experts – managers, consultants, data scientists, analysts, and experts in technology, healthcare economics, medicine, mathematics and statistics – are values for building long-term, mutually fulfilling partnerships with all our customers.  THE CHALLENGE LOGEX is working with sensitive data every day. It is important to keep our systems up to date and secure as possible. As a Security and Compliance manager you will secure existing and new certifications for the LOGEX Group country organization. You will lead external audits and maintain contact with the relevant accreditation organizations. You will be part of a fun dynamic team, but it is important to know how to work independently and responsibly. You will track and delegate the required certification activities, for example internal audit or management review. In this role you will create, maintain or delegate required documentation such as policies, procedures and standards. You will expand or recreate risk assessment and cyber security frameworks and you will be the primary contact for compliance questions of clients. For this position it is important that you are available for traveling.  Experience You have a Msc degree in Informatics, Business Management, or something similar; 2 to 3 years experience in an audit or security position; International work experience is a pré; You have experience with ISO27001; You are pro-active and like to work independently; You have affinity with the healthcare industry; You are fluent in English. What we offer A competitive remuneration package; A challenging role in a fast growing, international company; An informal work environment with young and ambitious colleagues. Interested? We would like to tell you more about this exciting opportunity! You can apply by the below button and upload your motivation letter and CV. For more information or if you have any questions you can contact Dafna Elkabas via dafna.elkabas@logex.com Please send your application in English.

title: Technical Manager Fermentation Research infrastructure
summary:
Data handling will be organized in close cooperation with the data management team in Wageningen.
(iiii) the FAIR data platform (WUR Systems and Synthetic…
description: Functieomschrijving Together with Wageningen University and Research (WUR) and supported by a large national grant of 14 million euros, the department of Biotechnology of TU Delft is implementing a large-scale national research infrastructure for research on microbial communities entitled UNLOCK (www.m-unlock.nl). Unlock aims for integration of expertise on microbial communities using four complementary platforms: (i) Biodiscovery platform (WUR-Microbiology), (ii) Modular bioreactor platform (WUR-Environmental Technology), (iii) Parallel bioreactor platform (TUD Biotechnology) and (iiii) the FAIR data platform (WUR Systems and Synthetic biology). In Delft, a highly automated cultivation facility will be implemented, consisting of forty bioreactors and auxiliary analytical infrastructure for detailed functional analysis of microbial communities from various origins. The facility will be used by colleagues of the department of Biotechnology and will also be accessible to external users from academia and other (private) organizations. As Technical Manager you will take up both managerial as well as technical and research tasks. As such you will play a central role in setting up and coordinating a successful large scale fermentation research infrastructure. In this role you will work closely together and report to the TU Delft UNLOCK manager and the Wageningen colleagues in the consortium. The TU Delft UNLOCK team will also include technicians that provide technical and operational support and administrative support. Tasks include: Coordinating the embedding of the infrastructure in the Biotechnology department including the preparation of a tender for purchasing equipment, planning of the implementation, and preparing and managing the safety, financial and legal aspects in collaboration with the respective experts of TU Delft. Technical development of the infrastructure, including integration of equipment and organization of data collection, storage, processing protocols. Data handling will be organized in close cooperation with the data management team in Wageningen. Defining operating procedures for internal and external use of the facility in consultation with department management Testing the facility and conducting experiments in the facility in cooperation with other researchers of the BT department and students to develop experimental protocols and validate methods. This includes the organization of molecular analysis on biomass samples and data management in cooperation with the Wageningen partners in UNLOCK. Interacting with (potential) users of the facility and develop experimental plans and supervise experiments conducted in the Unlock infrastructure. Project planning and management of internal and external projects Serve as a partner in the overall Delft-Wageningen UNLOCK team. Functie-eisen The ideal candidate is a researcher who combines academic talents with technical, managerial, and organization skills. The ideal candidate: has a completed PhD degree in biotechnology, life science and technology, environmental engineering, chemical engineering, or equivalent, has strong technical skills and affinity with development of bioprocess infrastructure, preferably with microbial communities. has the ability to work in a team that aims for effective implementation and successful operation of the research infrastructure, has managerial skills, including project planning and management, stakeholder management, and administrative procedures, has excellent communication skills, enjoys networking and is active in the acquisition of internal and external projects, enjoys and has experience with supervising students, and aims for scientific output in conferences and scientific journals is enthusiastic, a strong communicator, and outgoing when searching for solutions for challenges that will arise in the process of the infrastructure development. speaks and writes English fluently and has excellent reporting skills. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities.
