Binnen Searchresult vinden we het belangrijk dat jij je binnen je vakgebied ontwikkelt. Je beheert zelfstandig accounts maar werkt ook mee aan implementaties en metingen van grotere accounts. Daarnaast neem je deel aan kennissessies & trainingen van je eigen kanaal en-/of andere disciplines.  Ons data team groeit. En dat is niet voor niks! Naast Google Cloud certified partner zijn we sinds september ook Looker partner. Dit maakt Adeptiv een van de weinige partijen in Nederland die alle Google disciplines in huis heeft. Groei jij met ons mee?!  Concreet houd jij je bezig met: Het uitvoeren van periodieke en ad hoc analyses in big data of website- en web statistieken Het vertalen van grote hoeveelheden data naar actie gerichte inzichten Het ondersteunen van klanten bij het stellen van relevante KPI`s en targets als basis voor groei. Het opzetten en onderhouden van dashboards om de data op een voor de klant aantrekkelijke manier te visualiseren; Het implementeren en beheren van geadviseerde metingen, datastromen & optimalisaties met behulp van Javascript, SQL, Python of andere programmeertalen; Het bedenken en optimaliseren van datastromen met behulp van cloud infrastructuren; Het begeleiden van implementaties van analysetools, zelfstandig of met een collega;   Dit levert het je op:  Een dienstverband van 32 tot 40 uur in de week en maar liefst 28 vakantiedagen per jaar. Een laptop, telefoon & deelname aan onze pensioenregeling. Een maandelijkse thuiswerkvergoeding, zolang (gedeeltelijk) thuiswerken aan de orde is. Een uitdagende functie in een omgeving waar eigen initiatief en nieuwe ideeën toegejuicht worden. Een werkplek waar veelvuldig van en met elkaar geleerd wordt, bijvoorbeeld in onze eigen Academy. Een ambitieus team binnen een informele organisatie. Legendarische uitjes en feestjes, Brabantse gezelligheid op de vrijdagmiddag borrel en deelname aan ons Vitaliteitsprogramma.  Dit breng je mee: Een Master in de richting van Marketing Analytics Enige ervaring binnen digital marketing, bijvoorbeeld tijdens een bijbaan of (meewerk)stage, is een grote pre. Enige kennis van Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager en online marketingkanalen. Kennis van Google cloud is een pre. Enige kennis van / affiniteit met HTML, CSS, Javascript en/of Python. Analytisch vermogen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden. Je bent klantgericht, nauwkeurig, proactief en zelfstandig.   Dit zijn wij: “We make brands grow”. Searchresult zorgt voor groei voor haar klanten door digitale aanwezigheid, conversie naar sales en het anticiperen op switchgedrag. Het laten groeien van merken en oogsten door performance, dát is wat wij doen. Meten is weten. Searchresult streeft naar transparantie in een niet-transparante omgeving. Daarom staat meetbaarheid voor onze opdrachtgevers in elke fase voorop. Ondanks dat data, technologie en innovatie cruciaal zijn, zullen wij nooit de sleutel tot ons succes vergeten. Onze medewerkers. Searchresult is technology based, human driven! Samen met Searchresult en Kernel is Yourzine onderdeel van Adeptiv  Meer weten? Neem contact op met Manon Berben, Recruiter. m.berben@adeptiv.nl / 0652819384

title: Senior Project Manager Digital ITSM
summary:
You are part of a customer Journey team which exists of digital marketeers, developers, data engineers, scientists and analysts.
What are you going to do?
description: To continue LeasePlan's success story in the fast-moving automotive industry, we are actively building our digital presence to create the "future of digital" in the mobility industry, and to achieve our vision of "any car, anywhere, anytime". To strengthen our team, we are looking for a Senior Project Manager responsible for managing the new ITSM solution to deliver the ITIL processes needed to deliver IT services throughout LeasePlan globally and responsible for the successful delivery of the project within defined time, quality and budget. Who are you? You are a self-starter with an optimistic, positive, pragmatic, can-do mindset You are used to solving problems yourself, and bringing solutions to management instead of problems You enjoy unburdening your stakeholders, whilst keeping them strongly aligned at the same time You are firmly in control, of financials, of planning, of risk mitigation, etc In a sometimes complex organization you know how to get things done For you results count as the only real measure of progress And you enjoy working with people, and leading your team with respect for the persons involved Self-confident, able to report directly to sponsors at senior level and communicate to steering committee. What are you going to do? Responsible for managing the new ITSM solution to deliver the ITIL processes needed to deliver IT services throughout LeasePlan globally and responsible for the successful delivery of the project within defined time, quality and budget. Define the project scope and ensure proper alignment with project stakeholders. Build and maintain the project plan, resource estimates, collaboration site, action, risk, decision and issue log and all the required project artifacts as per the Digital Delivery standards. Assesses and resolves project risks as they are encountered. Manage the project budget. Excellent "project pilot": drives and coaches the project`s resources. Constantly ensure planning and resources are well aligned. Reporting: ensure proper and accurate reporting to allow decision-making and project progress control. Report status on a weekly basis and facilitate regular project status meetings. Prepare and present robust steer co presentation. During the final stage of the project, ensure the solution is ready for operations and all processes are updated and relevant teams are trained. Provide project closure report including lessons learned with the project team. Accountable to the Programme Manager What do you need to do the job? Minimum 8 years as a project manager preferably on complex technical projects. Experience will include scope management, budget management, time management, risk management, change management, issue/conflict resolution, communication management, quality management, testing plans, training plans, team management. International experience with the ability to work in a diverse work environment across cultures and time-zones; available to travel. Structured way of working, results driven, proactive, self starter and able to be effective in a challenging environment. Pragmatic project manager with strong methodology (e.g. PMP) and analytical mind. Experience with IT infrastructure implementations and technical transformation. Able to re-use previous experience to anticipate and head off problems that can jeopardize the project. Strong stakeholder management skills. Strong team leadership skills, able to manage internal and external resources. Excellent facilitation, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Education / work level at University / HBO level The team You are part of a customer Journey team which exists of digital marketeers, developers, data engineers, scientists and analysts. Working from Amsterdam this team is transforming the onboarding of clients into a fully digital process. How is life at LeasePlan Digital? With around 1.7 Million cars in over 30 countries and more than 50 years of experience on a global scale, LeasePlan is the largest automobile leasing and fleet management company in the world. LeasePlan Digital, is there to create our ambition for a customer centric experience across all digital touch points, to deliver true value to our customers and in turn maximize long-term customer satisfaction. We offer a start-up atmosphere, incorporated in one of the world's leading fleet management companies. That means a working environment surrounded by like-minded innovators working together from their home offices using Microsoft Teams, Slack, Jira and other tools to get the job done together. Our working community is close, sharing work and personal related matters to stay connected. You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You'll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry. A pre-employment screening is part of the selection process. We are looking for somebody who is based in The Netherlands.

title: (Senior) Technician Antibody Discovery

You ensure efficient handover of data and materials to other teams in the organization.
As a (Senior) Technician Antibody discovery you are responsible hands-on…
description: Wat ga je doen As a (Senior) Technician Antibody discovery you are responsible hands-on laboratory execution, which involve technologies such as Hybridoma Generation and B-cell FACS sorting. You ensure efficient handover of data and materials to other teams in the organization. You are actively involved in the outsourcing and monitoring of activities taking place at CRO’s. You document and report the results in an organized and concise manner. You report to a Scientist Lead Generation, who is responsible for oversight of all Antibody Discovery projects. Wat vragen wij For the position of a (Senior) Technician Antibody discovery we are looking for a candidate with a Bachelor or Master degree in Cell or Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology or a related discipline.  Experienced in the field of Antibody Discovery, Hybridoma Generation, FACS analysis, and Protein Chemistry is an advantage. Experience in B cell sorting is crucial You have an affinity with technology, and you enjoy starting new projects. You are enthusiastic, open-minded, goal-oriented and have a ‘getting things done’ mentality. You recognize the importance of working according to a quality system, which includes adhering to procedures and detailed documentation of your work. You have strong communicational skills in English AND Dutch Wat hebben we te bieden Year contract at the company Salary indicaiton starting at 2550,- gross per month based on fulltime Fulltime position Day shift Waar ga je aan de slag This company in Utrecht is a biotech company specialised in antibody therapies to treat cancer. Wil je meer weten? Na Rae de Jong 088 00 211 23 narae@checkmark.nl Vacaturenummer: 6811

title: (Senior) Data Scientist
summary:
Knowledge and experience with data visualisation.
Guide and implement a continues data development flow.
Enable our customers with new data-driven solutions and…
description: For our new client, we are looking for an experienced Data Scientist! As a Data Scientist, you ensure that all the data streams work, and enable the customers for new Data-Driven solutions. Are you our hero in Machine Learning and AI solutions?  We are looking for you then! Let’s discuss the details: Company Overview: Our client is an integration specialist within the digital transformation of organizations based in Den Bosch. The company exists 10 years and therefore is an experienced player within the integration field. Currently, they have around 60 employees and a partnership with RedHat. They’ve started a new branch within the company completely focused on the Data Science field. Currently working with a team of 5 their main focus is on streaming integration, analytics and services on top of Kafka.  Tasks:As a Data Scientist, we want you to: Enable our customers with new data-driven solutions and insights Be responsible for designing ML/AI solutions Guide and implement a continues data development flow Process data into Machine Learning models in applications and reports Have an Engineering Culture mindset: you think in opportunities Your profile: Streaming techniques eg with Kafka, Spark, Flink You know your way around with the Cloud (Amazon, Google, Azure) Asking questions for the matter you don’t understand but would like to Extensive knowledge of Machine Learning / AI tools & frameworks like Tensor FlowSQL has no secrets for you Programming skills in e.g. Python, Java, Scala Knowledge and experience with data visualisation Their offer Nice salary with great benefits! A challenging job in a fun organisation Laptop and phone Lots of Data Support to keep learning and follow trainings and/or visit conferences Are you still interested? Apply now and show us why you are the (Senior) Data Engineer we are looking for!

title: Lead Scientist
summary: As a lead scientist you hold a key position in a large team of analytical scientists in a renowned and modern analytical laboratory, with many opportunities to…
description: Lead Scientist Location: Tilburg Contact: Pascal Lagendijk Job type: Permanent Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: (Petro)Chemistry Contact email: pascal_lagendijk@oxfordcorp.com As a lead scientist you hold a key position in a large team of analytical scientists in a renowned and modern analytical laboratory, with many opportunities to further develop in your field.  Job description  For our client we are looking for a specialist in Analytical Chemistry, who takes the lead in setting up studies for challenging research. In this position you will become the problem solver for the analytical team, and you will use your knowledge and skills when technical and scientific expertise is needed.  Responsibilities Is concerned with optimizing an efficient method development process. Together with colleagues, you assess the analytical approach to method development projects, interpret data and results and adjust strategies. Plays a proactive role in researching potential innovations, such as emerging technologies and methods, as well as new applications. You specialize in method development, validation and analysis of medicines, polymers, pesticides and other chemicals. Is familiar with many techniques: UPLC-MSMS, GC-MSMS, ICP-MS, GC and HP / UPLC. Profile An Academic Degree in Analytical Chemistry (MSc or PhD), Minimum of 5, ideally more than 10 years of work experience in a leading scientific role in industry or academia Extensive experience in developing analytical methods Recent scientific contributions in peer-reviewed journals and analytical symposia Clear, concise and to-the-point way of verbal communication in both Dutch and English Excellent scientific writing and presentation skills A critical attitude, customer-oriented, motivated and enthusiastic Terms of employment Contract; Directly employed by the client Competitive salary and benefits An open corporate culture and a pleasant, informal atmosphere Vacancy number: 16852 Imporatant note; Residence permit is required. Please do not apply if you do not have a residence permit to live and work in the Netherlands. Your application will not be processed Apply Now

title: Software Engineer
summary:
Preferably, experience in data/signal/image processing, e.g. in MATLAB or Python.
Your challenge will be making the very best of the following tasks and…
description: About the position Your challenge will be making the very best of the following tasks and activities: · Lead in role of further development of core competencies, optimization of key process steps in the sample preparation workflow, development of technical concepts, algorithms and applications software · Develop and execute protocols for appropriate testing, characterization and optimization of these processes and modules · In interactions with the application engineers, be the expert on key process steps and contribute core knowledge to optimize our sample preparation workflow for the customer specific sample. · Continuously stay updated and informed on new sample preparation approaches, and propose novel concepts based on obtained knowledge, literature review and customer interaction · Responsible for substantiating novel concepts based on proof-of-principle experiments and analytical/computation models. Subsequently, translate these results into requirements for product development. · Proper documentation of project deliverables is key Skills & experience · Master’s degree in physics or mechanical engineering and 7+ years of hands-on experience in high-tech R&D. · Advanced skills in process analysis and structured process optimization, in which you have proven to take a leading role and employ a collaborative multidisciplinary approach to meet project and organizational goals · Specific expertise in thermal engineering and/or fluid dynamics is desirable · Preferably, experience in data/signal/image processing, e.g. in MATLAB or Python. · Ideally experience with Finite Element Analysis (COMSOL preferred). · English is at a full professional proficiency level, both spoken and written. · Highly motivated team player, with creative, self-starting ‘can-do mentality’; customer focused, communicate effectively with internal and external network. · Perform work in a structured way, are organized, well-planned, disciplined and eager to keep learning. Our offer · A pivotal role at a fast-growing high-tech company with a global market · Opportunity to shape and steer career based on interests and values · Strong professional and personal development opportunities · To become a valued member of our multi-cultural and entrepreneurial team How to apply · Qualified candidates are invited to apply directly via email hr@cryosol-world and specify ‘Senior Development Engineer’ in the subject line · Please include your resume and motivational cover letter · There will be no response to acquisition activities of recruitment companies based on this advertisement Extra information: - Title: Software engineer - Ranking: Senior - Industry: High-Tech Systems - Market: Government, Pharma - Customer type: Universities Life Sciences Faculties, Scientific Institutes, corporate R&D departments - Customer persona: Professors, Senior Scientists, R&D directors - Geographical: Global: 30% North America, 30% Europe, 30% East Asia, 10% RoW - Summary of position: Leading the software development at CryoSol-World - Key skillset: Extensive experience in software development, leading role in software development projects. - Key deliverables: Technical implementation and execution of the software development roadmap, robust and maintainable software. - Department: Company-wide - Reporting to: CTO - Contract type: Full-time with flexibility options - Salary: Competitive base salary & company bonus - Location: Head office: Maastricht, The Netherlands/ Weert, The Netherlands - Travel requirements: Up to 20% Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent Experience: c++: 7 years (Preferred) Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: Embedded Software Engineer Health
summary: Develop firmware on a Cortex-M processor platform to support sensor data acquisition, signal processing, storing and wireless transmitting (BLE, WiFi, etc.)…
description: What you will do We need you as a Senior Embedded Software Engineer to be part of our interdisciplinary team to develop embedded software solutions for our Bathroom4Health projects that will enable next generation personalized health monitoring. You will drive innovation and come up with smart designs. You will work in close collaboration with other Software Engineers, Biomedical Researchers, Data Scientists and the hardware team. In this role you: Develop firmware on a Cortex-M processor platform to support sensor data acquisition, signal processing, storing and wireless transmitting (BLE, WiFi, etc.) using FreeRTOS. Develop low level drivers for the Cortex-M processor on-chip peripherals (I2C, SPI, UART, etc.). Develop and execute test cases for (self or third party developed) software in Python and C/C++. Test and integrate embedded software in prototypes or simulators (unit, functional, integration and regression testing). Support evaluation, (lab-based/trial) testing and troubleshooting of prototype systems. Support release process (testing of release candidates, code reviews, etc.). Interface with customers on definition of specification, interfaces, progress, and deliverables. Work according to medical device or similar functional safety regulations. Work closely with interdisciplinary team ensuring the end goal of the (prototype) system/application will be met as well. What we do for you We offer a challenging and international environment at the forefront of technology, in an international network of renowned industrial customers. This is your opportunity to bring new technologies to the market that will have an impact on tomorrow’s society.  OnePlanet is a new collaboration of 3 renowned and globally respected research institutes/universities. By joining the OnePlanet team, you will be part of a team of world changers; disruptive innovators and practical thinkers. Here, your ideas will have an impact on our future lives.  At the same time, Imec The Netherlands, as an employer of choice, offers you an attractive compensation and benefits package including a 100% employer paid pension plan and flexible working hours. Furthermore, imec-NL offers a wide range of training possibilities. Who you are BSc or MSc degree in computer science, technical informatics, embedded systems, electrical engineering or similar. 5+ years experience in embedded software development and architecture definition for resource constrained systems, preferably in the field of wireless sensors, low-power or health. Strong interest in the field of personalized health solutions. Advanced in coding for embedded software systems that are resource (power, memory, computation) constrained (must). Knowledge of ARM Cortex platforms and experience with embedded tools like GCC/GDB (plus). Excellent programming skills in C and C++ and experience with Python (must). Experience with Android/IOS (plus). Proficient in Object Oriented Analysis and Design methodology (use of UML). Proficient in source code version control systems (GIT). Experience in the field of testing (unit, functional, integration, regression testing) and continuous integration. You know how to operate a scope, a logic analyzer and can debug firmware and low level driver issues. Being able to read hardware schematics and understand functionality of the embedded system. Flexible team player who sees change as an opportunity to learn and grow. Hands-on attitude. Taking responsibility for the process from specification to implementation, testing and debugging, including communication and alignment with different stakeholders. Quick learner, able and interested in acquiring new skills and competences. Ability to be creative and think outside the box. Being able to work in an environment with changing or only partially defined requirements. Being able to work outside the field of your experience (e.g., not software related). Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken). Interested Are you interested in this position and do you want to learn more about it, then you can talk to Frank Wolfs, Talent Acquisition Lead. You can reach Frank via +31(0)6-50837563 or you can send an email to frank.wolfs.ext@imec.nl . You can also apply on our website by sending us your resume and motivational letter. Click on ‘apply’ to submit your application. You will then be redirected to e-recruiting.

title: Full Stack S/4 HANA Developer
summary: Met een internationaal team van UX-designers, data scientists en creativelingen werk je aan innovatieve end-to-end projecten om de blueprint van onze klanten…
description: De S/4 HANA developer van de toekomst kan zowel goed overweg in de backend als in de frontend. Als Full Stack Developer hou je je bezig met ABAP, ABAP on HANA en OData en… jouw innovatieve ideeën? Er wordt altijd gewerkt aan nieuwe innovatieve oplossingen Ervaring hierin is ook een must. Het zou een welkome aanvulling zijn als je ook ervaring hebt met Fiori configuratie, troubleshooting en development. Daarnaast is het van belang op de hoogte te zijn van nieuwe development frameworks, zoals bijv. RAP en CAP. Met jouw creativiteit krijg je de kans te bouwen aan toekomstbestendige software.   Jouw rol Je maakt deel uit van een ontwikkelteam met gedreven professionals. Samen met je team lever je een bijdrage aan het voortdurend verbeteren en opleveren van waardevolle software. Je zal worden ingezet op projecten bij toonaangevende klanten waar we S/4 HANA implementeren. Elk project is anders en het is jouw uitdaging om de behoefte van gebruikers om te zetten naar generieke en herbruikbare componenten. Je weet wanneer je moet ontwikkelen in de “core” en wanneer “side-by-side” de beste optie is. Je bent een ambassadeur van nieuwe ontwikkel technieken en zorgt ervoor dat we ontwikkelen conform de juiste standaarden. Naast het klantenwerk ga je aan de slag met innovatie. Er zijn verschillende initiatieven die als doel hebben om “Intelligent Technologies” te positioneren bij onze klanten. Denk daarbij bijvoorbeeld aan een jaarlijkse Innovation Challenge. We vinden het belangrijk dat je proactief bent en kennis deelt met je collega’s en zo ook de SAP Community.  Het team Onze collega’s van de servicegroep Technology helpen grote en kleine klanten met de strategische blueprint van IT-transformaties. Welk cloudplatform past het beste bij de situatie van klant X? Wat zijn de veiligheidsrisico’s van de IT-oplopssing van deze leverancier? Hoe implementeren we Agile werken binnen deze organisatie en hoe bouwen we vanuit design thinking workshops een nieuwe app? Gebaseerd op de roadmaps van de klant bouw je samen met een team van internationale professionals aan op maat gemaakte software en oplossingen, al dan niet in combinatie met het toepassen van slimme techniek zoals Robotics of Artificial Intelligence. In het blueprint proces zul je ook security defensie strategieën ontwikkelen, door het combineren van technologie en gebruikers gedrag. Samen slaan we een brug tussen de behoeftes van bedrijven en de nieuwste technologische innovaties. Met een internationaal team van UX-designers, data scientists en creativelingen werk je aan innovatieve end-to-end projecten om de blueprint van onze klanten naar een nóg hoger level te tillen.  Jouw achtergrond Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding met IT component Je kunt concepten vertalen naar functionele software en bent in staat abstract te denken S/4 HANA project ervaring Je hebt een proactieve werkhouding, bent leergierig, analytisch, collegiaal, flexibel, doelgericht en werkt gestructureerd Je communiceert duidelijk en hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse & Engelse taal, zowel woord als geschrift Bereid om te reizen (dit zal altijd in goed overleg plaatsvinden)  Ons aanbod Accenture is een geweldige plek om te werken en jezelf te ontwikkelen. Kies je voor Accenture, dan word je een schakel in een bedrijf op wereldniveau. Door de vele samenwerkingsverbanden en relaties met klanten zijn wij trots op onze levendige en diverse bedrijfscultuur. Wij staan voor een agile aanpak, end-to-end services en een realistische mindset. Wij willen de echte jij leren kenen en je verder helpen met je professionele en persoonlijke ontwikkeling, waar je interesse ook maar ligt. Je doorloopt gedurende je carrière bij ons meerdere leertrajecten (formeel en informeel) om je vaardigheden en expertise binnen je rol uit te breiden. Naast onze opportunistische wekomgeving en de meest uiteenlopende projecten, bieden wij jou ook nog het volgende: Een flexibele vervoersregeling die bij uw persoonlijke situatie past (elektrische auto of fiets, flexibel budget inclusief een NS-business kaart) Een onkostenvergoeding Korting op Accenture aandelen De mogelijkheid om 4 x 9 uur per week te werken   Geïnteresseerd? Ben jij klaar voor een carrière bij Accenture waarmee je jezelf kunt zijn en iets kan doen waar je echt van houdt? Meld je aan en maak het verschil. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Bibi Driehuizen via bibi.driehuizen@accenture.com.

title: Lead Front End Engineer
summary:
Ability to act as an informed leader and make data-driven decisions on behalf of Abcam.
The hub is a unique blend of a digital, start-up environment, within a…
description: Lead Front End Engineer - (AMS1011)  About Us When you join Abcam, you will have the opportunity to work with a purpose driven life sciences organisation undergoing an exceptionally exciting digital revolution. We are ambitious. We are digitally evolving and need exceptional talent to help us drive that journey. We will design, architect and develop the prototype into a product, make it manufacturable, listen to customers and turn it profitable. The hub is a unique blend of a digital, start-up environment, within a purpose-driven organisation, achieving our objective of serving life scientists to achieve their mission, faster. Our culture is our key differentiator. We believe in empowering individuals, with responsibility given at an early stage. The working environment is fun and fast-paced, collaborative and outcome focused, with a strong customer focus. In addition to competitive salaries, we can offer an attractive flexible benefits package which includes share options, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development. We all have clear goals to reach at Abcam, and we’re encouraged to be original in how we get there. No matter your role, be it a Credit Controller or a Lab Technician or Solution Architect, we know that tried-and-tested doesn’t always mean best. Dare to be different, dare to be ambitious, and you’ll help us change the game in our industry. In addition to competitive salaries, we can offer our multi-award-winning global share purchase plan, AbShare, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development. About the Role We are looking for a Lead Front End Engineer for our omnichannel platform, that brings a broad set of technical skills and product achievements, a development and customer focused mindset to solving problems, and bring news ideas and digital thinking into our global Architecture capability. Key responsibilities include: Lead and enable a team of engineers to deliver high-quality software Manage a line of talented engineers, help them plan their growth and set them up for success Work with team members and product and technology peers to design new world class digital products, platforms and customer experiences Collaborate cross-functionally to implement the digital products required to support our vision and digital strategy Develop our software engineering strategy, best practices, technology stack and architecture to drive quality, accuracy and agility Collaborate with members of the global Abcam team to implement and support aspiring strategic efforts, provide constructive feedback, and foster a collaborative environment of product and engineering excellence About You Significant Front End Software Engineering experience, with demonstrable technical expertise in system design Strong knowledge of the JavaScript programming language and its tooling ecosystem Experience in continuously delivering high-quality software using React, Angular or Vue Develop technical documentation, diagrams and templates and be rigorous in maintaining accuracy and relevancy of developed materials Experience developing and maintaining front-end CI/CD pipelines using systems such as GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Jenkins etcetera Experience in automated software testing, feeling comfortable writing functional and/or unit tests Willingness to work with your colleagues to develop best software engineering practices and share knowledge Ability to write technical documentation and develop diagrams for software solutions Experience working in collaboration with Product Managers, QA Engineers, Designers and other stakeholders Ability to act as an informed leader and make data-driven decisions on behalf of Abcam Be curious, audacious and not afraid to ask questions and challenge the way things are done today and own improvements to culture and process Inform, educate and develop team members and peers to grow expertise, develop alignment and encourage collaboration Able to present ideas and solutions concisely and in an engaging manner Passionate about enriching engineering culture and delivering engineering excellence Demonstrate agility, pick up new technologies and embrace change Bonus points (although not required) if you have one of the following… Strong React experience, familiarity with SSR, React Hooks and state management solutions Experience working with TypeScript Experience with Micro Frontends architecture Experience configuring bundlers such as Webpack, Parcel, Rollup etcetera Experience with GitLab CI Experience developing multi-environment, multi-market software at scale Our Tech Stack You are an engineer at heart, therefore let us share our ever-evolving technology stack with you. On the front end, we are developing multiple front-end applications following micro front-ends architecture, which allows our teams to grow and scale, delivering software rapidly with minimal friction. We use React with TypeScript and Styled Components. We use GitLab CI for our CI/CD pipelines. We consume back-end services using REST HTTP calls and GraphQL. Search engine visibility and asset optimization is important to us, so we implement SSR with Next.js. For the back end, we focus on developing resilient, highly-available, performant software with top class observability and fault tolerance. We are using Node.js to develop microservices and back-end application. We leverage technologies such as Docker, Serverless Framework and TypeScript. We serve back-end APIs internally, to our customers (B2C) and to our partners (B2B). We are using tools such as message queues, Kafka for event streaming, Amazon SNS, Postgres and more. Our infrastructure sits in Amazon Web Services. Supported by our wonderful Platform Team, we are able to deliver software on Kubernetes or in a serverless manner using Serverless Framework. Inclusion & Diversity Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. #LI-NL1  Primary Location NL-NL-Amsterdam Job Digital Organization Netherlands Schedule Regular Standard Job Type Full-time Travel No Job Posting Mar 15, 2021, 1:41:15 PM

title: Sr. Backend Engineer - Data Acquisition
summary:
Collaborating with a global team of backend engineers, data scientists and product managers to ensure a smooth running data operation.
Ok, a bit more about us.
description: As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will be responsible for maintaining and improving the systems that help App Annie collect data at scale for its Intelligence products. You will be in charge of managing wide variety of data sources, dealing with terabytes of data on a daily basis, and will play a key role in exploring opportunities for market data driven innovations at App Annie. What can you tell your friends? "I'm responsible for designing and maintaining large scale systems that collect data. Together with my team, we provide the foundation for App Annie's mobile market insights." How will you be doing this? Understanding end-to-end product delivery, from early idea to a maintainable and scalable product Collaborating with a global team of backend engineers, data scientists and product managers to ensure a smooth running data operation Partnering with product managers and data scientists to explore new ways to add value to our products Designing, specifying and driving improvements to our systems by always asking yourself: how can we do this simpler, faster and more efficient? Developing a sixth sense for technical debt, operational risk and data quality Estimating, planning and executing projects together with the team Documenting and sharing knowledge across the team and your fellow engineers around the globe What do you bring to the team? BS/MS in a Computer Science related field or equivalent experience 2-5 years of relevant work experience A team player attitude and solid communication skills Proficient in Python or one of the other programming languages: Java, C/C++ Experience with the AWS ecosystem (ECS and Kinesis is a plus) Experience with SQL and RDBMS Experience with Docker Experience in building and evolving RESTful API systems Experience with Apache Storm and Kafka is a big plus What do we offer? Competitive salary and perks Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Lots of responsibility + room for you to experiment and grow with the company An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations (Utrecht, Beijing, San Francisco & more!) Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Home Internet allowance to help cover a secure, stable internet connection WFH Equipment Allowance to ensure you have the best set up in your home office Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues Ok, a bit more about us App Annie is the industry's most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. The company created the mobile app data market and has been fueling world-class, mobile-first businesses since 2010. App Annie's mission is to power B2C companies' mobile transformation and enable clients to deliver winning consumer experiences. More than 1,000 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the gold standard to revolutionize their mobile business. The company is headquartered in San Francisco with 11 offices worldwide. PLEASE NOTE THAT WE WILL ONLY CONSIDER CANDIDATES LOCATED IN THE NETHERLANDS, UK OR GERMANY Yes, I want this job!

title: Back-End Developer
summary: In addition, you will use experimentation, backed by data analysis, to add product features and deliver the best user experience on the platform.
description: Catawiki's purpose is to enable people to discover and obtain special objects that help them fulfill their passions. In doing so, we add some color & make the world a more interesting place. Our Backend Engineering Story Our development team is responsible for stability, reliability, and versatility of Catawiki's platform. We are building new and exciting product features to craft an engaging platform, where our users can offer and discover special objects. At the same time, we are moving the platform towards a microservices architecture by gradually dismantling a Ruby on Rails monolith. Here's Nathalia, one of our Engineers: "I joined Catawiki looking for new challenges in my career and after 1 year I still feel that I am growing every day. Migrating to microservices can sound just like creating new APIs and databases, but every migration is different and brings new problems to be solved. I am proud of our achievements after every project, thanks to the brilliant people that we have in the company, the friendly environment, and the freedom to experiment and learn from it." So what's the job Here at Catawiki, you will make an impact by improving and delivering product innovations for the Catawiki platform. Along with other members of the Development team, you will build scalable microservices while measuring and monitoring system performance. In addition, you will use experimentation, backed by data analysis, to add product features and deliver the best user experience on the platform. How we roll - Our Stack As the biggest marketplace for special items, Catawiki operates in a market, which brings a lot of unusual challenges and opportunities. You will be developing, testing and scaling our microservices, written in Ruby and some of them in Go, to handle the high volume served by the platform every single day. We do this by using Infrastructure as Code principles, collaborative peer-reviews, delivering code to production multiple times a day, A/B testing every assumption, making mistakes, learning from them, and iterating quickly. You'll move in sync You will be part of a team focused on a particular domain within Catawiki and contribute your ideas and efforts to grow the business and innovate the product. Each team is usually composed of Frontend, Backend, and Mobile Developers together with a Product Owner, a UX Designer and a Data Scientist. A little about you It doesn't matter what stack you're used to working with, as long as you're motivated to learn new things, ship new features, and pursue new and interesting challenges. Our stack is mainly focused around Ruby, so if you are not experienced in it, it will be highly valued that you're passionate about learning new technologies. Next to this: You have experience in designing, developing and deploying backend services with a focus on high availability, low latency, and scalability. You have proven experience of collaborating closely with other engineers to become a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional team. You understand the value that you can add to the business, the product and the impact of your work on users. Diversity Catawiki is committed to building a diverse company and diverse teams. That includes everyone, no matter your age, ability, gender, race, religion or sexual orientation. We welcome applications from underserved and underrepresented communities. If you've got a story to tell, come and join us.  Covid-19 and hiring As we navigate through this pandemic together, we want to reassure you that keeping candidates and our employees safe is of paramount importance to us. That's why the entire recruitment process will take place remotely, using phone and video calls. For successful applicants who end up being hired, we always ensure a safe, engaging and (for the time-being) a remote onboarding experience. We also take care to make sure all of your equipment will be sent to you by courier, so you are ready for your first day. You can Click Here to read the Coronavirus company update from our CEO, Ravi Vora. The Catawiki Story A piece of the moon, a complete dinosaur skeleton, the Pope's hat, the world's smallest book - at Catawiki, we come across exceptional objects such as these every single day. As Europe's fastest growing online auction platform, our mission is to make special objects available to everyone. In fact, 14 million users are buying and selling on Catawiki every month. This means we are continually growing and always on the lookout for new talent. Born and raised in The Netherlands, we started in 2008 as a platform where collectors could manage their collections online. Yet, times change, ideas evolve, and in 2011 we hosted our first online auction and we haven't looked back since! We've now grown to 500 Catawikians working across 7 International offices and are proud to have maintained our start-up mentality. Here's what we can offer you A diverse and international team with over 40 different nationalities, located in the heart of Amsterdam and Assen with an easy-going atmosphere. The Catawiki Community gathers everyone together for everything from 'CataFooty' to International Food Festivals, Friday Drinks, Board Game Nights, Pub Quizzes and Boot Camps! And there's more! We also provide paid holidays, holiday allowance and a pension plan paid for by Catawiki. Interested? Apply directly with an English CV and cover letter by submitting your information at the bottom of this page. By submitting your application you agree to Catawiki's Applicant Privacy Policy

title: Laborant moleculaire- en microbiologie
summary:
Opzetten, uitvoeren en data interpretatie van PCR, DNA/RNA extracties en qPCR;
Voor deze afdeling zijn we op zoek naar een technician met veel kennis van…
description: Laborant moleculaire- en microbiologie Location: Delft Contact: Douwe Wieringa Job type: Permanent Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Life Sciences, Biotechnology, Contract Testing Labs Contact email: douwe.wieringa@oxfordcorp.com We zijn opzoek naar een technician met een pro-actieve houding, een nauwkeurige werkwijze en ruime ervaring moleculair biologische technieken. Functieomschrijving Onze opdrachtgever is gespecialiseerd in de veredeling, productie en verkoop van hybride groentezaden zoals tomaat, komkommer, paprika, meloen, aubergine, etc. Op het QC laboratorium worden voornamelijk testen gedaan op het gebied van zaadgezondheid door detectie van plantpathogenen. Het gaat hierbij voornamelijk om microbiologische testen (MLII) en molecular biologische testen (PCR). Voor deze afdeling zijn we op zoek naar een technician met veel kennis van moleculair biologische technieken (voornamelijk PCR en data interpretatie). Verantwoordelijkheden Opzetten, uitvoeren en data interpretatie van PCR, DNA/RNA extracties en qPCR; Troubleshooting; Meedenken aan verbeteringen in het proces; Rapportage in LIMS; Profiel Afgeronde MLO4/HLO opleiding in richting microbiologie, moleculaire biologie of planten biologie; (Kandidaten met een MSc zijn overgekwalificeerd voor de rol en worden niet in procedure genomen); Relevante ervaring met moleculair biologische (PCR) testen; Ervaring in een diagnostiek of QC omgeving is een pre; Affiniteit met computer & lab automation (Office 365, liquid handling, LIMS); Beschikking over eigen vervoer is aan te raden aangezien de locatie lastig te bereiken is met OV; Goede kennis van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Je bent praktisch ingesteld en assertief en bovenal een leuke collega; Arbeidsvoorwaarden Dienstverband: 1 jaar via Oxford Global Resources, verlenging niet uitgesloten Salarisindicatie: van 2200 Euro tot 2600 Euro per maand afhankelijk van opleidingsniveau en ervaring Werktijden: fulltime (38 uur) Regio: Delft Vacature nummer: 16998 Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025 Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Application deadline closed: Assistant Professor at the ID department
summary: The assistant professor should have strong data analytical and data visualization skills, expertise in designing prototypes in the field of vital life (and/or…
description: Organisatie Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e): Where innovation starts, and people matter! TU/e is a young university, founded in 1956 by industry, local government and academia. Today, this spirit of collaboration is still at the heart of the university community. We foster an open culture where everyone feels free to exchange ideas and take initiatives. TU/e offers academic education that is driven by fundamental and applied research. Our educational philosophy is based on personal attention and room for individual ambitions and talents. Our research meets the highest international standards of quality. We push the limits of science, which puts us at the forefront of rapidly emerging areas of research. Eindhoven University of Technology combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on mentality. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow. We understand things by making them and we make things by understanding them. Our campus is in the center of one of the most powerful technology hubs in the world: Brainport Eindhoven. Globally, we stand out when it comes to collaborating with advanced industries. Together with other institutions, we form a thriving ecosystem with one common aim – to improve quality of life through sustainable innovations. The TU/e puts emphasis on knowledge valorization: research results are translated into successful innovations and serve as a basis for creating new products, processes and enterprises. Department of Industrial Design (ID) is one of the nine departments of TU/e and has an internationally leading position because of its core commitment to research through design (RtD) and its strikingly original conceptual work. ID’s ambition is to be recognized as one of the top departments in the world that conduct exciting research in the intersection of Design, Technology and Human-Computer Interaction. In particular, the department aims to inspire and educate a new generation of design engineers who will be fluent in using AI/ML algorithms and Data. Building on its unique expertise and tradition in the design of interactive systems for the vital life of people, using data and connectivity in-context, with a strong emphasis on the aesthetics of interaction and underlying user experiences, we aim to develop leading expertise in the design of intelligent systems that address the vital life op people in everyday life). Data will play a crucial role both in understanding groups of users in real time and real-world context, and in developing an in-depth and overtime understanding of people in order to provide ultra-personalized service. This position is embedded in the Systemic Change research cluster. “The Systemic Change cluster focuses on designing innovations that have impact on systemic structures and groups of people, ultimately aiming to address largescale issues such as urban health, future mobility and sustainability.” Functie The Systemic Change cluster investigates technological interventions in the context of contemporary societal challenges, particularly with respect to vital life and social resilience. Our research emphasizes using the data-enabled approach with cross-disciplinary collaborations to develop methods, tools, platforms and living labs for addressing societal challenges and analyzing their effects on the socio-ecological system. Current qualities of the Systemic Change group: Reputation in research through design, user experiences, real-life data acquisition and representation, and interdisciplinary approaches Track-record in design conferences (CHI, DIS, TEI, …) and top-ranked journals Ambitious research facilities for making, realizing and testing prototypes in a real-life context Innovative and productive collaboration between research, industry and education To further strengthen these competences, the Systemic Change group is looking for a highly motivated and qualified academic with a strong affinity with the understanding of human behavior (related to an active and healthy lifestyle) through data, AI and Machine learning. We are looking for an aspiring assistant professor who will focus on (i) understanding peoples’ behavior and their contextual factors through advanced data analytics, such as AI/ML, and (ii) use the data to create fundamentally new value propositions and systemic design. The assistant professor should have strong data analytical and data visualization skills, expertise in designing prototypes in the field of vital life (and/or using them to collect data), and experience in working in interdisciplinary teams (social scientists, engineers, designers, …). Functie eisen A relevant PhD degree (industrial design, computer science/engineering or a comparable domain). Ability to conduct high quality academic research, demonstrated for instance by a relevantPhD thesis and/or publication(s). Experience with designing in the context of “vital life” In-depth knowledge, skills and experience of and inadvanced data analytics, such as AI/ML, Ability to teach, shown by experience or assistance in teaching and positive evaluations of these teaching efforts. Creative and dedicated to interdisciplinary collaboration. Good communication and leadership skills. Excellent proficiency (written and oral) in English. Experience in acquiring grants will strengthen your application. Aanbod A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university with the autonomy to develop your own research line and participate in the curriculum of the department. ATenure Trackof five years with the prospect of becoming Associate Professor. After a maximum of four years the tenure decision will be made. You will have free access to high-qualitytraining programsfor academic leadership, the university teaching qualification program, research and valorization competences, and a dedicated mentoring program to help you get to know the university and the Dutch (research) environment. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labor Agreement for Dutch Universities. Additionally, an annual holiday allowance of8% of the yearly salary, plus a year-end allowance of 8.3% of the annual salary; A broad package of fringe benefits, including an excellent technical infrastructure, moving expenses, and savings schemes. Family-friendly initiativesare in place, such as the Dual Career Opportunity program to support accompanying partners, an international spouse program, and excellent on-campus children day care and sports facilities. More information Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more? Please contact Prof. dr. Steven Vos,S.Vos@tue.nlor Prof. dr. ir. Aarnout BrombacherA.C.Brombacher@tue.nl. For information about the procedure or terms of employment, please contact mrs. Cecile Gijsbers,cgijsbers@tu/e.nl, tel. ++31651164692. Are you inspired to know more about working at TU/e? Please visitwww.tue.nl/jobs Inlichtingen We invite you to submit a complete application by using the ‘apply now’-button on this page.The application should include a: Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position. Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references. List of five self-selected ‘best publications’. Description of your scientific interests and plans (1-2 pages). Statement of your teaching goals and experience (1-2 pages). We look forward to your application and will screen it as soon as we have received it.Screening will continue until the position has been filled.

title: Business Analyst (RiskShield)
summary:
Being functionally strong and very analytical, data scientist/engineering affinity.
Are you the Business Analyst (RiskShield) who wants to prevent and detect…
description: Business Analyst (RiskShield) Are you the Business Analyst (RiskShield) who wants to prevent and detect all kinds of fraud within a worldwide operating bank? As a RiskShield IT Business Analyst, you will be in a world of compliance and you will be responsible for realising new – and keep on running current functionality in our RiskShield applications. You will work in a DevOps scrum team, making use of modern techniques, performing thorough analyses, together with colleagues in an Agile setting. Do you see yourself as the new Business Analyst (RiskShield)? Yes? Keep reading and contact us! Responsibilities Business Analyst (RiskShield) It will be your responsibility to be customer focussed, communicate well, deliver results, motivate and work problem in a solving way. A RiskShield specialist is able to do the development proces from analyses to design to RiskShield configuration and also helps out in testing and implementation. A RiskShield IT Business Analyst is also responsible for: Understanding end-users needs and are able to translate these to IT solutions Being functionally strong and very analytical, data scientist/engineering affinity Having an intrinsic drive to keep on developing yourself and develop new specialties You are the person who supports and helpes colleague DevOps (Scrum)-teammembers, with the run and change process of the RiskShield Linux application, develop and test RiskShield configurations. Requirements Business Analyst (RiskShield) The requirements of aBusiness Analyst (RiskShield) are that you must have experiences in or knowledge of: Agile / Scrum / DevOps way of working Data analyses and design Configurating (and testing) complex (market comform) Defining and describing User Stories, requirements analyses Compliance processes in a financial institute Being a teamplayer as you need to be flexible, curious, investigative and you’re not afraid to take ownership It would be an added value if you: Have coding and development experiences (e.g. Java, R, Python, yaml) Can work on a Linux OS and Oracle database Know Azure Devops tooling and pipelines Offer Business Analyst (RiskShield) On the basis of a 36-40 hour working week, the following offers can be expected: A gross monthly salary between €4.000 and €5.500 A thirteenth month and holiday pay An Employee Benefit Budget (8, to 10 % of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out A personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career Flexible working times and location-independent working 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5%

Bij GX software in Nijmegen maken wij organisaties digitaal succesvol. Technologie steeds meer je beste vriend. Content, data en personalisatie zijn bij uitstek onderwerpen waarbij GX zich als een vis in het water voelt. Dit doen we met een team van 100 specialisten voor ongeveer 150 verschillende klanten.  Het team:  Wij zijn dol op technologische puzzels. We bouwen voor elke marketinguitdaging een slimme oplossing, zodat jij je klanten de beste digitale ervaringen biedt! Binnen ons data team werk je samen met architecten, engineers en (marketing) consultants op locatie bij een van onze klanten of op het kantoor van GX in Nijmegen.  De Baan:  Als Data Engineer ondersteun je de klanten van GX bij het implementeren van online marketing systemen gericht op data. Naast het adviseren van klanten ondersteun je ook de business consultants en online marketeers. Je werkt voornamelijk met BlueConic. Als data Scientist is je focus het toepassen van marketing technologie binnen websites, mobiele apps, maar ook koppelingen met externe systemen, zoals Facebook, mail-providers, ERP en CRM systemen. Je krijgt veel vrijheid en voldoende kansen om je zelf te ontwikkelen tot bijvoorbeeld Software Architect.   Werkzaamheden:  Implementatie- en innovatietrajecten ter ondersteuning van de online marketeers; Integreren van marketing tools (BlueConic) in websites en mobiele apps; Ontwerpen, inrichten of bouwen van koppelingen met externe systemen; Wensen en vragen van klanten analyseren, zodat je advies kunt geven over de beste oplossing; Analyseren van data en implementeren van Jupyter Notebooks. Verder vinden wij het belangrijk dat je een open en enthousiast karakter hebt. Je hebt een flexibele en zelfstandige instelling. Tot slot beheers je de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed.  Verder vragen wij: Een afgeronde hbo of wo opleiding in de richting van Informatica, Data Science of een andere gerelateerde bètaopleiding; Minimaal een jaar relevante werkervaring op het gebied van online marketing technologieën; Ervaring in web technologie en je bent bekend met technologieën zoals HTTP, HTML, CSS; Ervaring in Javascript en/of Node.JS; Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van mobiele apps (Android en IOS) en met Jupyter Notebook (dit is een grote pré); Jouw keuze Als Data Scientist bij GX Software in Nijmegen mag je natuurlijk ook wat van ons verwachten. Wij bieden je de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden: Een uitdagende, afwisselende en zelfstandige functie in een ambitieuze organisatie met toffe klanten; Een salaris tussen de € 2.700,- en € 4.000,- afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en achtergrond; 29 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid om extra vakantiedagen te kopen; De mogelijkheid om parttime te werken (minimaal 32 uur per week); Een laptop, smartphone en een goede pensioenregeling; Een leaseauto of een NS Businesscard (bij meer dan 16.000 zakelijke kilometers); Vrijdagmiddagborrels, weekendjes weg, personeelsuitjes, sportactiviteiten en gezellige collega's waarmee je dit kunt delen; Op dit moment werken ze bij GX grotendeels thuis vanwege het coronavirus, ze faciliteren je hierin en zorgen ervoor dat het inwerkprogramma speciaal voor jou op maat wordt gemaakt, zodat jij een vliegende start bij GX kunt maken! Pak het moment Pak het moment Goed om te weten: een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag (VOG) is vereist. De kosten hiervan krijg je uiteraard vergoed.
